translation.en: E-Commerce Management System SRS January 2025 6 6. External Interface Requirements 6.1 User Interfaces The system will feature a responsive UI with the following requirements: • Easy-to-navigate product catalog. • User-friendly shopping cart. • Admin dashboard for managing products and orders. 6.2 Hardware Interfaces • The system will be hosted on cloud infrastructure (AWS, Google Cloud). • Users will access the system via modern web browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari). 6.3 Software Interfaces • The system will integrate with third-party APIs, including payment gateways (Pay- Pal, Stripe) and shipping services. 6.4 Communication Interfaces • HTTP/HTTPS will be used for communication between the client and server. • WebSockets may be used for real-time order status updates. Page 27

Bukatun Haɗin gwiwa na Waje 6.1 Mai amfani Tsarin  zai ƙunshi UI mai amsawa na <TECH> tare da waɗannan buƙatu: • Kasida mai sauƙin kewaya samfura. • Kekunan siyayya masu sauƙin amfani na Mai amfani. • Dashboard na Admin don sarrafa samfura da oda. 6.2 Haɗin gwiwa na Hardware • Tsarin  zai kasance a kan kayayyakin more rayuwa na girgije (AWS, Google Cloud). • Masu amfani za su sami damar shiga tsarin  ta hanyar masu binciken yanar gizo na zamani (Chrome, Firefox, Safari). 6.3 Haɗin gwiwa na Software • Tsarin  zai haɗu da APIs na wasu, gami da ƙofofin biyan kuɗi (Pay-Pal, Stripe) da ayyukan jigilar kaya. 6.4 Hanyoyin Sadarwa • Za a yi amfani da HTTP/HTTPS don sadarwa tsakanin abokin ciniki da sabar. • Ana iya amfani da WebSockets <TECH>don sabunta matsayin oda a ainihin lokaci. translation.en: Smruti R. Sarangi 382 2. If livelocks are not an issue, then we should try to minimize the time it will take to reach the destination. When there is no congestion, the least-time path is the shortest path. However, in the presence of congestion, alternative routes become more favorable. We can use the flow-control circuitry to get an idea of the average buffer usage/occupancy at the neighboring routers. Once we have this information, we can choose the next hop based on a combination of the following information: distance to the destination, number of free virtual channels in the next hop, and the rate of buffer usage for each virtual channel. We can also use a weighted sum of these quantities (appropriatelynormalized). Theindividualweightsneedtobedeterminedbyconductingexhaust- ive simulation studies. We can also use multi-hop information if we have it with us such as the congestion in local or remote neighborhoods. Note that it is not always necessary to maintain tables. It takes space to store the tables, and it also requires energy to access a given row and column in the table. In some cases, where simplicity is required, we can use a simple combinational circuit to compute the route that a packet needs to take. This is very easy to do with schemes such as X-Y routing or some simple turn based schemes. 8.4.3 Virtual Channel Allocation After computing the route, we need to start the process of sending the packet across the computed outgoing link. A given link or physical channel will have many VCs associated with it. There is a need to allocate a virtual channel to the packet. This process is known as VC allocation. Note that the problem of virtual channel allocation is not simple. It is possible that different packets, which have arrived via different physical channels could be vying for the same set of virtual channels. Thus, the prime goals of the VC allocator are as follows: • The VC allocation process should be fair. No request should be made to wait for an indefinite period. This will lead to starvation. • It should be done quickly in less than one cycle. TheVCallocatorcanbemodeledasablackbox. Ineverycycleittakesasetofrequests,andreturns thenumberoftheVCthatwasallottedtoeachrequest. Weshalllookatthegeneralproblemofresource allocation in Section 8.4.6. Hence, we are not discussing VC allocation separately. The design of the router as described till this point is shown in Figure 8.39. We are assuming two VCs per physical channel. In the first stage, we store the flit in the input buffers corresponding to the VC.Theninthenextstagewesendthedatatotheroutecomputationunitviaapipelineregister. After we have computed the route, we allocate a VC in the next cycle. We do not have a pipeline register at the end of this stage because we assume that the allotted VC is written to the head flit of the packet. 8.4.4 Switch Allocation Once we have allotted a virtual channel, the packet is ready to be transmitted via an outgoing link (physical channel). However, this is a complex process. Consider a representative example. Assume we have two VCs per physical channel. For the N, S, E, and W incoming channels we have a total of 8 VCs. In addition, we shall have 2 more buffer queues (same as VCs from our point of view) for local traffic. We thus have 10 input VCs. It is possible that all of these VCs have flits in them, which are waiting to be transmitted via outgoing links. In this case, we have 5 outgoing links: local, N, S, E, and W. Thus, the problem of resource allocation is as follows. We have 10 input channels and 5 output channels. To effect a packet transmission, we need to map an input to an output. Such a hardware structure is known as a switch. The 10×5 switch for our router is shown in Figure 8.40. Realize that it is possible that all 10 packets at the input VCs might want to pass through the same outgoingchannel. However,atanyonetime,onlyoneflitcanpassthroughanoutgoingchannel. Hence,
translation.ha: Smruti R. Sarangi 382 2. Idan makullan rayuwa ba matsala ba ce, to ya kamata mu  mu yi ƙoƙarin rage lokacin da za a ɗauka kafin mu isa inda za mu je. Idan babu cunkoso, hanyar da ba ta da lokaci mafi sauƙi ita ce hanya mafi guntu. Duk da haka, a gaban cunkoso, hanyoyin madadin suna zama mafi kyau. Za mu iya amfani da da'irar sarrafa kwarara don samun ra'ayin matsakaicin amfani da buffer/zama a cikin na'urorin sadarwa na maƙwabta. Da zarar mun sami wannan bayanin , za mu iya zaɓar tsalle na gaba bisa ga haɗin bayanan  masu zuwa: nisan zuwa inda za mu je, adadin tashoshin kama-da-wane kyauta a cikin tsalle na gaba, da ƙimar amfani da buffer ga kowane tashar kama-da-wane. Haka kuma za mu iya amfani da jimlar waɗannan adadi (wanda aka daidaita daidai). Ana buƙatar a ƙayyade nauyin mutum ta hanyar gudanar da nazarin kwaikwayon da ya ƙare. Haka kuma za mu iya amfani da bayanai > da yawa idan muna da su tare da mu kamar cunkoso a unguwannin gida ko na nesa. Lura cewa ba koyaushe ake buƙatar kula da tebura ba. Yana ɗaukar sarari don adana tebura, kuma yana buƙatar kuzari don isa ga layi da ginshiƙi da aka bayar a cikin teburin. A wasu lokuta, inda ake buƙatar sauƙi, za mu iya amfani da da'irar haɗin kai mai sauƙi don ƙididdige hanyar da fakiti ke buƙatar ɗauka. Wannan yana da sauƙin yi da tsare-tsare kamar hanyar X-Y ko wasu tsare-tsare masu sauƙi bisa juyawa. 8.4.3 Rarraba Tashoshin Yanar Gizo Bayan ƙididdige hanyar, muna buƙatar fara aiwatar da aika fakitin a cikin hanyar haɗin da aka ƙididdige. Haɗin da aka bayar ko tashar zahiri za ta sami VCs da yawa da ke da alaƙa da ita. Akwai buƙatar ware tashar kama-da-wane ga fakitin. Wannan tsari ana kiransa da rarraba VC. Lura cewa matsalar rarraba tashar kama-da-wane ba abu ne mai sauƙi ba. Yana yiwuwa fakiti daban-daban, waɗanda suka zo ta hanyoyi daban-daban na zahiri na iya fafatawa don saitin tashoshi iri ɗaya. Don haka, manyan manufofin mai rarraba VC sune kamar haka: • Tsarin rarraba VC <TECH>ya kamata ya kasance mai adalci. Bai kamata a yi buƙatar <TECH> ta jira na ɗan lokaci mara iyaka ba. Wannan zai haifar da yunwa. • Ya kamata a yi <TECH>cikin sauri cikin ƙasa da zagaye ɗaya. Ana iya yin samfurin VCallocator azaman akwatin baƙi. A cikin kowane zagaye yana ɗaukar tambayoyi akai-akai, kuma yana dawo da adadin VC ɗin da aka ba wa kowane buƙata. Za mu duba matsalar gabaɗaya ta rabon albarkatu a cikin Sashe na 8.4.6. Saboda haka, ba ma tattauna rabon VC daban. Tsarin na'urar sadarwa kamar yadda aka bayyana har zuwa wannan lokacin an nuna shi a Hoto na 8.39. Muna ɗaukar VC guda biyu a kowace tashar zahiri. A mataki na farko, muna adana flit a cikin ma'ajiyar shigarwa da ta dace da VC. Sannan a cikin matakin gaba muna aika bayanai zuwa ga rukunin lissafi ta hanyar rajistar pipeline. Bayan mun ƙididdige hanyar, muna ware VC a cikin zagaye na gaba. Ba mu da rajistar bututun mai a ƙarshen wannan matakin saboda muna ɗauka cewa an rubuta VC ɗin da aka keɓe ga babban fakitin. 8.4.4 Rarraba Canjawa Da zarar mun ware tashar kama-da-wane, fakitin ya shirya don a watsa shi ta hanyar hanyar haɗi mai fita (tashar zahiri). Duk da haka, wannan tsari ne mai rikitarwa. Yi la'akari da misali mai wakilci. A ɗauka cewa muna da VC guda biyu a kowace tashar zahiri. Ga tashoshin da ke shigowa na N, S, E, da W, muna da jimillar VC guda 8. Bugu da ƙari, muna da ƙarin layin buffer guda 2 (daidai da VCs daga ra'ayinmu) don zirga-zirgar gida. Don haka muna da VC guda 10 na shigarwa. Yana yiwuwa duk waɗannan VC suna da flits a cikinsu, waɗanda ke jiran a watsa su ta hanyar hanyoyin fita. A wannan yanayin, muna da hanyoyin fita guda 5: na gida, N, S, E, da W. Don haka, matsalar rarraba albarkatu ita ce kamar haka. Muna da tashoshin shigarwa guda 10 da tashoshin fitarwa guda 5. Don aiwatar da watsa fakiti, muna buƙatar tsara shigarwa zuwa fitarwa. Irin wannan tsarin kayan aiki ana kiransa da sauyawa. An nuna maɓallin 10×5 na na'urar sadarwa ta mu a Hoto na 8.40. Ka fahimci cewa yana yiwuwa dukkan fakiti 10 a cikin shigarwar VCs na iya son wucewa ta hanyar tashar fitarwa ɗaya. Duk da haka, a kowane lokaci, onlyoneflit zai iya wucewa ta hanyar fita. translation.en: Procure to pay business process Procure to Pay workflow manages the life-cycle of a procurement process. Due to its complexity and different roles involved it is convenient to split Procure to Pay down into two main sub-processes: 1. Requisition to Receipt process starts by the creation and management of purchase requisitions and corresponding purchase orders to the moment the warehouse staff receives the merchandise. 2. Supplier Invoice to Payment continues previous sub-process by registering the supplier invoices and closes it by paying supplier invoices. . 1.2.2 The research area capabilities and incapability’s Capabilities  User can view Annual budget report  User can create annual procurement plan  User will be able to see suppliers details  Opening community will be opened the bits.  Inventory control  User can view purchase order  Details related to Items which are going to be store  View and evaluate price details  Payment details can be viewed and modify related to purchased items  Predict the future transactions to the Admin The system will analyze the past data and predicts what sort of transactions will happen. The techniques of data mining will be used to analyze and to predict. After predicting, an e mail will be generated and will be sent to the admin .The content of the email, will help the management when taking decisions for the future. The management can decide what sort of items should they purchased, and what to not. Incapability’s  The system is not capable of identifying words of other languages other than Sinhala language. 2

translation.en: Smruti R. Sarangi 688 TCB Core Memory bus Caches Memory Memory encryption and decryption engine Figure 13.7: The TCB in a typical secure processor Secure Memory Architecture Theaimistosecurethemainmemoryandthememorybusbysuccessfullyavoidingsnooping(eavesdrop- ping), spoofing, splicing, and replay attacks. We assume that each memory controller has a dedicated unit called a Memory Encryption Engine (MEE) that implements all the security functionality. We need to ensure the ACIF properties. Let us consider them one by one in a different order. Firstconsiderconfidentiality, whichcansimplybeensuredbyencryptingallthedatathatissentonthe memorybus. Ifwealwaysencryptthesamedatawiththesamekey,thenthisisleakingsomeinformation to the adversary and is thus unwise. Hence, we need to use a succession of different encryption keys. Next, consider integrity. We need to store a hash of every line that we read from memory. For ensuring authentication,wecanencryptthehashwithasecretkey. AnencryptedhashisreferredtoasaMessage Authentication Code (MAC). Once the MEE decrypts the hash and compares it with the hash of the datablock,italsoimplicitlyverifiestheauthenticityproperty. Finally,forensuringfreshness,weneedto avoid replay attacks. This can happen if we encrypt the same block every time with a different key, and the key is stored within the TCB. If any old data is sent by the attacker, the MEE will try to decrypt it with the stored secret key and then verify its hash. The verification process will fail. Note that this paragraph is loaded with concepts, and is fairly difficult to understand for beginners. Hence, we would like to request the reader to read this paragraph several times, understand the ACIF properties, and go throughtheentiresectiononcryptographicattacks(Section13.2). Itwouldbeunwisetoproceedtothe rest of the text without meditating on this paragraph for quite some time. Counter Mode Encryption The key idea of our discussion up till now has been that we cannot encrypt the same piece of plaintext repeatedly with the same key. Even though the attacker cannot figure out the plaintext from the ciphertext, she can at least figure out that the same data is being used repeatedly. This behavior can be used to mount many successful attacks. Hence, every time we encrypt a block of plaintext, we need to use a different key. This makes our task very complicated because now we need to manage millions of keys. Instead of using so many different encryption keys, we can use counter mode encryption that uses different counters in a systematic fashion. The effect is the same as using different encryption keys (see Section 13.1.1). We use two counters: a 64-bit major counter, and a 6-bit minor counter. We store one major counter per physical page (frame), which is assumed to be 4 KB, and we store one minor counter per 64-byte block. A frame contains 64 blocks, and thus we need to store 64 minor counters for each major counter. We cache the counters in a dedicated on-chip cache called the counter cache that the MEE has access to. Each entry in this counter cache is indexed by the physical page id and the line size is 448 bits. These bits are divided as shown in Figure 13.8. We store a 64-bit major counter and 64 6-bit minor counters. At this point it is important to recapitulate the concepts in counter mode encryption. Recall that
translation.ha: Smruti R. Sarangi 688 TCB Core Memory bus Caches Memory Memory Ɓoyewa da injin decryption Hoto na 13.7: TCB a cikin wani tsari mai tsaro na yau da kullun Tsarin Ƙwaƙwalwa Mai Tsaro Tsarin Tsaro yana da nufin kare babban memory da memorybus ta hanyar guje wa ɓuya (sauraron bayanai), zamba, haɗawa, da sake kunnawa hare-hare. Muna ɗauka cewa kowane mai sarrafa ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya yana da na'urar da aka keɓe da ake kira Injin Ɓoye Ƙwaƙwalwa (MEE) wanda ke aiwatar da duk ayyukan tsaro. Muna buƙatar tabbatar da kaddarorin ACIF. Bari mu yi la'akari da su ɗaya bayan ɗaya a cikin tsari daban-daban. Da farko, yi la'akari da sirri, wanda za'a iya tabbatar da shi ta hanyar ɓoye duk bayanan da ke kan bas ɗin ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya. Idan koyaushe muna ɓoye bayanai iri ɗaya da maɓalli ɗaya, to wannan yana ba da wani bayani ga abokin gaba kuma don haka ba shi da hikima. Saboda haka, muna buƙatar amfani da jerin maɓallan ɓoyewa daban-daban. Na gaba, yi la'akari da aminci. Muna buƙatar adana hash na kowane layi da muke karantawa daga ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya. Don tabbatar da tantancewa, za mu iya ɓoye hash ɗin da ke ɓoye. An ɓoye hash ɗin zuwa ga Saƙon Tabbatar da Lambar (MAC). Da zarar MEE ta cire hash ɗin ta kwatanta shi da hash ɗin toshe bayanai, tana kuma tabbatar da sahihancin kadarorin. A ƙarshe, tabbatar da sabo, muna buƙatar guje wa sake maimaita hare-haren. Wannan na iya faruwa idan muka ɓoye toshe ɗaya a kowane lokaci da maɓalli daban, kuma an adana maɓallin a cikin TCB. Idan wani tsohon bayanan  ya aika da mai kai hari, MEE zai yi ƙoƙarin cire shi da maɓallin sirri da aka adana sannan ya tabbatar da hash ɗinsa. Tsarin tabbatarwa zai gaza. Lura cewa wannan sakin layi yana cike da ra'ayoyi, kuma yana da wahalar fahimta ga masu farawa. Saboda haka, muna so mu roƙi mai karatu ya karanta wannan sakin layi sau da yawa, ya fahimci halayen ACIF, kuma ya bi dukkan sassan akan hare-haren ɓoye bayanai (Sashe na 13.2). Ba zai yi kyau ba ya ci gaba zuwa sauran rubutun ba tare da yin bimbini a kan wannan sakin layi na tsawon lokaci ba. Ɓoye Bayanan Yanayin Mai Kariya Babban ra'ayin tattaunawarmu har zuwa yanzu shine cewa ba za mu iya ɓoye ɓangaren rubutu ɗaya akai-akai da maɓalli ɗaya ba. Ko da yake maharin ba zai iya gano rubutun da aka ɓoye daga rubutun ba, aƙalla za ta iya gano cewa ana amfani da wannan <TECH>bayanan akai-akai. Ana iya amfani da wannan ɗabi'a don ɗora hare-hare masu nasara da yawa. Saboda haka, duk lokacin da muka ɓoye wani toshe na rubutu mai sauƙi, muna buƙatar amfani da maɓalli daban-daban. Wannan yana sa aikinmu ya zama mai rikitarwa saboda yanzu muna buƙatar sarrafa miliyoyin maɓallai. Maimakon amfani da maɓallan ɓoye bayanai daban-daban, za mu iya amfani da ɓoye yanayin maimaitawa wanda ke amfani da ƙididdigewa daban-daban ta hanyar tsari. Tasirin iri ɗaya ne da amfani da maɓallan ɓoye bayanai daban-daban (duba Sashe na 13.1.1). Muna amfani da masu ƙidaya guda biyu: babban mai ƙidaya mai girman bit 64, da ƙaramin mai ƙidaya mai girman bit 6. Muna adana babban mai ƙidaya ɗaya a kowane shafi na zahiri (firam), wanda ake ɗauka shine 4 KB, kuma muna adana ƙaramin mai ƙidaya ɗaya a kowane toshe mai girman bit 64. Firam ɗin yana ɗauke da tubalan 64, don haka muna buƙatar adana ƙananan masu ƙidaya 64 ga kowane babban mai ƙidaya. Muna adana masu ƙidaya a cikin wani keɓaɓɓen cache akan guntu wanda ake kira cache na counter wanda MEE ke da damar shiga. Kowane shigarwa a cikin wannan cache na counter an yi masa alama ta hanyar ID na shafi na zahiri kuma girman layin shine rago 448. Waɗannan ragowa an raba su kamar yadda aka nuna a Hoto na 13.8. Muna adana babban mai ƙidaya mai girman bit 64 da ƙananan masu ƙidaya 64. A wannan lokacin yana da mahimmanci a sake maimaita ra'ayoyin a cikin ɓoye yanayin counter. Ku tuna cewa

translation.en: TutorFlow Part A: Project Scope and Requirements Section 1: Problem Statement 1.1.a. Problem & Need In the modern world where education is an extremely important aspect of numerous people’s lives, many students are finding it difficult to keep up with the pace of learning in different educational environments. This can be due to individual needs being often overlooked in conventional educational systems in elementary, high school or post secondary institutions such as college or university. There are several difficulties and issues including, but not limited to, overcrowded classrooms, lack of personalized attention, learning disabilities or special needs, technological disparities and mental health. How can these problems be alleviated? What are some possible solutions? Our system, TutorFlow, introduces an online tutoring platform to empower students by providing them with resources to learn at their own pace, with the help of highly qualified tutors. The idea is to give students a plethora of choices when it comes to fostering a learning environment personalized for them. This includes allowing them to pick tutors that align with their learning style, their personal budget, and other educational needs. The platform will provide students a learning environment that is accessible, affordable and high quality, alleviating their issues when it comes to learning. 1.1.b. List of Capabilities and Benefits (i) Capabilities: 1. Register and store user information. 2. Allow the tutors to share their teaching experience and qualifications on the platform for students’ reference. Also allow them to list which subjects they would want to tutor in and the prices for each session. 3. Register information about subjects that are available inside the platform. 4. Provide a search tool that will allow users to filter the subjects, prices, and ratings to students and tutors. 5. Incorporate a secure payment gateway for transactions by debit card, credit card, and Apple pay. 6. Provide a scheduling system for students to book tutoring sessions with available tutors in respective subjects. 7. Allow for users to video call for their tutoring sessions or watch a pre-recorded video taken by the tutor.
translation.ha: TutorFlow Sashe na A: Faɗin Aiki da Bukatu Sashe na 1: Bayanin Matsala 1.1.a. Matsala & Bukata A duniyar zamani inda ilimi muhimmin bangare ne na rayuwar mutane da yawa, ɗalibai da yawa suna samun wahalar ci gaba da saurin koyo a cikin yanayi daban-daban na ilimi. Wannan na iya faruwa ne saboda buƙatun mutum ɗaya galibi ana yin watsi da su a tsarin ilimi na yau da kullun a makarantun firamare, sakandare ko manyan makarantu kamar kwaleji ko jami'a. Akwai matsaloli da matsaloli da dama, ciki har da, amma ba'a iyakance ga, azuzuwan da suka cika cunkoso ba, rashin kulawa ta musamman, nakasassu na koyo ko buƙatu na musamman, bambance-bambancen fasaha da lafiyar kwakwalwa. Ta yaya za a iya rage waɗannan matsalolin? Waɗanne hanyoyi ne za a iya magance su? Tsarinmu na , TutorFlow, yana gabatar da dandamalin koyarwa ta kan layi don ƙarfafa ɗalibai ta hanyar samar musu da albarkatu don koyo a kan saurinsu, tare da taimakon masu koyarwa masu ƙwarewa sosai. Manufar ita ce a ba wa ɗalibai zaɓuɓɓuka da yawa idan ana maganar haɓaka yanayin koyo da aka keɓance musu. Wannan ya haɗa da ba su damar zaɓar masu koyarwa waɗanda suka dace da salon koyo, kasafin kuɗinsu na kansu, da sauran buƙatun ilimi. Dandalin zai samar wa ɗalibai yanayin koyo wanda ake iya samu, mai araha kuma mai inganci, wanda zai rage musu matsalolinsu idan ana maganar koyo. 1.1.b. Jerin Ƙarfi da Fa'idodi (i) Ƙarfi: 1. Yi rijista kuma adana mai amfani bayani. 2. Ba wa malamai damar raba ƙwarewar koyarwa da cancantarsu a kan dandamali don ambaton ɗalibai. Haka kuma ba su damar lissafa waɗanne darussa suke son koyarwa da kuma farashin kowane zaman. 3. Yi rijista bayani game da darussa da ake samu a cikin dandamali. 4. Samar da kayan aikin bincike wanda zai ba wa ɗalibai da malamai damar tace darussa, farashi, da ƙima. 5. Haɗa hanyar biyan kuɗi mai aminci don mu'amala ta katin zare kuɗi, katin kiredit, da Apple pay. 6. Samar da tsarin tsara tsarin ga ɗalibai don yin booking zaman koyarwa tare da malamai da ake da su a fannoni daban-daban. 7. Ba wa masu amfani damar yin kiran bidiyo don zaman koyarwa ko kallon bidiyon da malamin ya ɗauka a baya.

translation.en: Software R equirements Specification for Virtual Clinic Page 5 1.5 References The document refers to the following assignments submitted: ● Assignment 1-Lab Report-1 ● Assignment 2-Lab Report-2 1.6 S cope of the document This document details the Software Requirement Specifications for Virtual Clinic - An Integrated Care System. The main purpose of this document is to describe the features and behavior of a system. It includes a variety of elements that attempts to define the intended functionality required by the customer to satisfy their different users. In addition to specifying how the system should behave, the specification also defines at a high-level the main business processes that will be supported, what simplifying assumptions have been made and the design limitations and constraints. Each of these is described in more detail along with the Product Functions, User Classes, Operating Environment, All interfaces (User, Hardware, Software, Communication), System features and functional requirements and Non-functional requirements along with business rules. 1.7 D efinitions, acronyms, and abbreviations T able 1-Definition Term Full Description Admin Someone who controls and operates the entire system Doctor a person who is qualified to treat people who are ill Patient a person receiving or registered to receive medical treatment Chemist a shop where medicinal drugs are dispensed and sold, and in which toiletries and other medical goods can be purchased. Lab Lab is a place where tests are usually done on clinical specimens in order to obtain information about the health of a patient as pertaining to the diagnosis, treatment, and prevention of disease. DFD Data Flow Diagram EIS External Interface Specifications ERD Entity Relationship Diagram NITK National Institute of Technology, Surathkal, Karnataka National Institute of Technology, Surathkal, Karnataka 2018

translation.en: <Ride-hailing app> 3.2.5 <Communicate > Introduction: This is an essential function. Awslak application must support this functionality. Rationale: Facilitating communication between driver and customer depends on this function. The success of the product hinges in successful communicate. Inputs: Text, voice or photo messages. Description: The driver and customer shall be able to send text and voice messages as well as pictures. Sending photos and voice shall be allowed if and only if: - They agreed to access the camera, studio, and microphone. Outputs: For the driver: The message sent by the customer. For the customer: the message sent by the driver. 3.2.6 <Pay> Introduction: The important action that performed in the application is pay. The application must support this functionality. Rationale: the pay is very important in the application. The success of the product hinges on successful payment. inputs: Card number, PIN, ride requests. Description: The customer shall be able to pay in the application. The pay shall be allowed if and only if: The Card Number can be validated. The PIN is valid for the card. The funds in the card account exceeds the requested amount in the pay If pay is allowed, the requested order shall be executed. Outputs: Customer Receipt, ride requests. Persistent Changes: The purchase amount will be deducted from the customer account. Software Requirements Specification Page 11
translation.ha: <Haɗin Hailing App> 3.2.5 <Sadarwa > Gabatarwa: Wannan muhimmin aiki ne. Aikace-aikacen Awslak  dole ne ya goyi bayan wannan aikin. Dalili: Sauƙaƙa sadarwa tsakanin direba da abokin ciniki ya dogara da wannan aikin. Nasarar samfurin ta dogara ne akan nasarar sadarwa. Shigarwa: Saƙonnin rubutu, murya ko hoto. Bayani: Direba da abokin ciniki za su zasu iya aika saƙonnin rubutu da murya da hotuna. Aika hotuna da murya za a za a yarda da su idan kuma kawai idan: - Sun yarda su sami damar shiga kyamara, ɗakin studio, da makirufo. Fitowa: Ga direba: Saƙon da abokin ciniki ya aika. Ga abokin ciniki: saƙon da direba ya aika. 3.2.6 <Biya> Gabatarwa: Muhimmin aikin da aka yi a cikin aikace-aikacen  shine biya. Aikace-aikacen  dole ne ya goyi bayan wannan aikin. Dalili: albashi yana da matukar muhimmanci a cikin aikace-aikacen . Nasarar samfurin ta dogara ne akan nasarar biyan kuɗi. shigarwar: Lambar kati, PIN, buƙatun hawa. Bayani: Abokin ciniki zai zai iya biya a cikin aikace-aikacen . Za a ba da izinin biyan  idan kuma kawai idan: Za a iya tabbatar da Lambar Kati. PIN ɗin yana aiki ga katin. Kuɗin da ke cikin asusun katin sun wuce adadin da aka nema a cikin biyan. Idan an yarda da biyan kuɗi, za a aiwatar da umarnin da aka nema <TECH>. Fitowa: Rasidin Abokin Ciniki, buƙatun hawa. translation.en: 421 Smruti R. Sarangi 9.1.3 Amdahl’s Law Wehavenowtakenalookatexamplesforaddingasetofnnumbersinparallelusingboththeparadigms namely shared memory and message passing. We divided our program into two parts: a sequential part and a parallel part (refer to Figure 9.1). In the parallel part of the execution, each thread completed the work assigned to it and created a partial result. In the sequential part, the root or master or parent thread initialized all the variables and data structures and spawned all the child threads. After all the child threads completed (or joined), the parent thread aggregated the results produced by all the child threads. This process of aggregating results is also known as reduction. The process of initializing variables and reduction are both sequential. Let us now try to derive the speedup of a parallel program vis-a-vis its sequential counterpart. Let us consider a program that takes T units of time to execute. Let f be the fraction of time that it seq seq spends in its sequential part and 1−f be the fraction of time that it spends in its parallel part. The seq sequential part is unaffected by parallelism; however, the parallel part gets equally divided among the processors. If we consider a system of P processors, then the parallel part is expected to be sped up by a factor of P. Thus, the time (T ) that the parallel version of the program takes is equal to par (cid:18) (cid:19) 1−f T =T × f + seq (9.1) par seq seq P Alternatively, the speedup S is given by T 1 S = seq = (9.2) T par f seq + 1− P fseq Equation 9.2 is known as the Amdahl’s Law. It is a theoretical estimate (or rather the upper bound in most cases) of the speedup that we expect with additional parallelism. 45 40 35 30 25 20 15 10 5 0 0 50 100 150 200 )S( pudeepS 10% 5% 2% Number of processors (P) Figure 9.2: Speedup (S) vs number of processors (P)
translation.ha: 421 Smruti R. Sarangi 9.1.3 Dokar Amdahl Mun ɗauki misalai don ƙarawabersba tare da la'akari da duka paradigms ba wato ƙwaƙwalwar da aka raba da kuma aika saƙonni. Mun raba shirinmu zuwa sassa biyu: sashe mai jere da sashe mai layi ɗaya (duba Hoto na 9.1). A cikin ɓangaren layi ɗaya na aiwatarwa, kowane zare ya kammala aikin da aka ba shi kuma ya ƙirƙiri wani sakamako na ɓangare. A cikin ɓangaren layi ɗaya, tushen ko babban zaren ko iyaye ya fara dukkan masu canji da tsarin Bayanai kuma ya haifar da duk zaren yaro. Bayan an kammala dukkan zaren yaro (ko an haɗa), zaren iyaye ya tattara sakamakon da duk zaren yaro ya samar. Wannan tsari na tattara sakamako kuma ana kiransa raguwa. Tsarin fara masu canji da raguwa duka suna cikin jere. Bari mu yi ƙoƙarin samo saurin shirin layi ɗaya idan aka kwatanta da takwaransa mai jere. Bari mu yi la'akari da shirin da ke ɗaukar raka'o'in T na lokaci don aiwatarwa. Bari f ya zama ƙashi na lokacin da jerin seq ɗinsa ke kashewa a cikin ɓangarensa na jere kuma 1−f ya zama ƙashi na lokacin da yake kashewa a cikin ɓangarensa na jere. Sashen jerin seq ɗin ba ya shafar daidaituwa; duk da haka, ɓangaren layi ɗaya yana raba daidai tsakanin masu sarrafawa. Idan muka yi la'akari da tsarin <TECH> na masu sarrafawa na P, to ana sa ran ɓangaren layi ɗaya zai hanzarta ta hanyar factor na P. Don haka, lokacin (T) da sigar layi ɗaya ta shirin ke ɗauka daidai yake da par (cid:18) (cid:19) 1−f T =T × f + seq (9.1) par seq seq P A madadin haka, ana ba da speedup S ta T 1 S = seq = (9.2) T par f seq + 1− P fseq Equation 9.2 ana kiransa da Dokar Amdahl. Kiyasi ne na ka'ida (ko kuma a mafi yawan lokuta) na speedup ɗin da muke tsammani tare da ƙarin daidaituwa. 45 40 35 30 25 20 15 10 5 0 0 50 100 150 200 )S( pudeepS 10% 5% 2% Adadin masu sarrafawa (P) Hoto na 9.2: Sauri (S) vs adadin masu sarrafawa (P)

translation.en: 131 Smruti R. Sarangi size of the queue). Similarly, every time we dequeue an entry, we increment the head pointer (modulo the size of the queue). Let us create an abstract version of the problem. Let us consider an array v, which we shall use as a circular queue with a head and a tail pointer. Additionally, we have a size field that indicates the number of entries in the queue. If size = 0, then it means that the queue is empty, and no processing needs to be done. Let us proceed with the assumption that size(cid:54)=0. If head=tail, then it means that the queue has just one entry. If tail<head, then it means that the queue has wrapped around the end of the array. Here, we are not considering the possibility of overflows: more entries than the maximum size of the queue. Finally, note that we do not look at the head and tail pointers to decide whether a queue is empty or not, we simply look at the size field. Torecordtherelativeorderingofloadsandstores,weneedtocreateamechanism. Weshalldescribe the mechanism for loads in this section. There is an analogous mechanism for stores. For each load entry we record the value of the tail pointer of the store queue when the load instruction was entered into the load queue. Recording the tail pointer of the store queue will help us find all the stores that came after the load, and the stores that were in the pipeline present before it. Given an index j, we need to find all the entries that are either before it (towards head) or after it (towardstail). Theassumptionisofcoursethatj isavalidindexinthecircularqueue. Themosttrivial solution is to start at j and walk the array sequentially. This is a slow operation and is proportional to the size of the array in the average case. This is not acceptable. We need a parallel implementation. Let us first fix the format of the output. Since the load queue or store queue typically have less than 64 entries, we can use this fact to significantly speed up operations by using some extra space. Let the output be a bit vector, where the number of bits is equal to the number of entries in the relevant queue (array v). A bit is 1, if the entry satisfies the predicate (before or after), otherwise it is 0. To create an efficient hardware implementation, we can store these bit vectors in registers. Additionally, let us assume that we have the following bit vectors available in registers: valid and resvd. The valid register containsallthevalidbitsofentriesintherelevantqueue. Onsimilarlineswehavearesvdregisterthat contains one bit for each entry in the queue: 1 if the address is resolved and 0 if it is not. Let us now show an example of how to compute a bit vector that contains a 1 for all the valid queue entries that are before a given j. Let the total number of entries in v be N. Let us first create a small N-entry array, where for a given index i (starts from 0) we store its unary representation using N bits. For example, when N = 8, we store 00000111 for 3. Basically, for a given number i, we store an N-bit number where the least significant i digits are 1 and the rest are 0. If i = 17, we store a number whose least significant 17 bits are 1, and the remaining N −17 bits are 0. We can alternatively say that for each i we store 2i −1. Such small arrays that store the precomputed results of functions (unary representations in this case) are known as lookup tables. These are really fast. In this case, let us represent this lookup table operation by the function prec. First, consider the case where j ≥head (no wraparound). The bit vector representing the elements before j – represented as before(j) – is given as follows: before(j)=prec(head)∧prec(j) (4.1) This can also be viewed graphically. The first term captures all those entries that do not precede the head and the second term captures all those entries that precede entry number j. Note that in this diagram the least significant bit is the leftmost position and the most significant bit is the rightmost position (we go from left to right unlike the conventional way: right to left).
translation.ha: 131 Smruti R. Sarangi girman layin). Hakazalika, duk lokacin da muka cire layin shiga, muna ƙara alamar kai (modulo girman layin). Bari mu ƙirƙiri sigar matsalar da ba ta da cikakken bayani. Bari mu yi la'akari da jerin v, wanda za mu yi amfani da shi azaman layin zagaye mai kai da alamar wutsiya. Bugu da ƙari, muna da filin girma wanda ke nuna adadin shigarwar a cikin layin. Idan girman = 0, to yana nufin cewa layin babu komai, kuma babu buƙatar yin aiki. Bari mu ci gaba da zato cewa girman (cid:54) = 0. Idan kai = wutsiya, to yana nufin cewa layin yana da shigarwa ɗaya kawai. Idan kai <kai> wutsiya, to yana nufin cewa layin ya naɗe a ƙarshen jerin. A nan, ba ma la'akari da yiwuwar ambaliya: ƙarin shigarwa fiye da matsakaicin girman layin. A ƙarshe, lura cewa ba ma duba alamar kai da wutsiya don yanke shawara ko layin babu komai ko a'a, kawai muna duba filin girma. Don yin rikodin tsari mai alaƙa na kaya da shaguna, muna buƙatar ƙirƙirar tsari mai kama da juna. Za mu bayyana tsarin kaya a cikin wannan sashe. Akwai wata hanya makamanciyar ta ga shaguna. Ga kowane shigarwar kaya, muna rikodin ƙimar mai nuna wutsiya na layin shagon lokacin da aka shigar da umarnin kaya cikin layin kaya. Rikodin mai nuna wutsiya na layin shagon zai taimaka mana mu nemo duk shagunan da suka zo bayan kaya, da kuma shagunan da ke cikin bututun da ke gabansa. Idan aka ba da ma'aunin j, muna buƙatar nemo duk shigarwar da ke gabansa (zuwa ga kai) ko bayansa (zuwa wutsiya). Zato na hakika yana da ma'aunin tsari a cikin layin da'ira. Mafificin mafita shine farawa a j kuma a yi tafiya da jerin a jere. Wannan aiki ne mai jinkiri kuma yana daidai da girman jerin a cikin matsakaicin yanayi. Wannan ba abin karɓa bane. Muna buƙatar aiwatarwa iri ɗaya. Bari mu fara gyara tsarin fitarwa. Tunda layin kaya ko layin shago yawanci yana da ƙasa da shigarwa 64, za mu iya amfani da wannan gaskiyar don hanzarta ayyuka sosai ta amfani da wasu ƙarin sarari. Bari fitarwa ta zama bit vector, inda adadin bit ɗin ya yi daidai da adadin shigarwar a cikin layin da ya dace (jeri v). Dan kadan shine 1, idan shigarwar ta cika ka'idar (kafin ko bayan), in ba haka ba shine 0. Don ƙirƙirar ingantaccen aikin kayan aiki, za mu iya adana waɗannan bit vectors a cikin rajista. Bugu da ƙari, bari mu ɗauka cewa muna da waɗannan bit vectors da ke akwai a cikin rajista: inganci da resvd. Ingancin rajista ya ƙunshi allthevalidbitsofentryintherelevantqueue. Onsimilarlineswehavearesvdregister wanda ya ƙunshi bit ɗaya don kowane shigarwa a cikin layin: 1 idan an warware adireshin da 0 idan ba haka ba. Bari yanzu mu nuna misali na yadda ake ƙididdige bit vector wanda ya ƙunshi 1 don duk shigarwar layi masu inganci waɗanda ke gaban j da aka bayar. Bari jimillar adadin shigarwar da ke cikin v ta zama N. Bari mu fara ƙirƙiri ƙaramin jerin shigarwar N, inda ga wani fihirisa i (ya fara daga 0) muke adana wakilcin sa na unar ta amfani da bits na N. Misali, lokacin da N = 8, muna adana 00000111 don 3. Ainihin, ga wani lamba i, muna adana lambar N-bit inda mafi ƙarancin lambobi i sune 1 sauran kuma 0 ne. Idan i = 17, muna adana lamba wacce mafi ƙarancin rago 17 shine 1, sauran rago N −17 sune 0. Za mu iya cewa ga kowane i muna adana 2i −1. Irin waɗannan ƙananan jerin da ke adana sakamakon ayyuka da aka riga aka lissafa (wakiltar guda ɗaya a wannan yanayin) ana kiransu da teburin bincike. Waɗannan suna da sauri sosai. A wannan yanayin, bari mu wakilci wannan aikin teburin bincike ta hanyar aikin prec. Da farko, yi la'akari da yanayin inda j ≥head (babu wraparound). An bayar da siginar bit da ke wakiltar abubuwan da ke gaban j – wanda aka wakilta kamar yadda aka yi a baya (j) – kamar haka: before(j)=prec(head)∧prec(j) (4.1) Wannan kuma ana iya kallonsa ta hanyar zane. Kalma ta farko tana ɗaukar duk waɗannan shigarwar da ba su gabaci kan ba, kuma kalma ta biyu tana ɗaukar duk waɗannan shigarwar da suka gabaci lambar shigarwa j. Lura cewa a cikin wannan zane ƙaramin bit mai mahimmanci shine matsayi na hagu kuma mafi mahimmanci bit shine matsayi na dama (muna tafiya daga hagu zuwa dama ba kamar hanyar gargajiya ba: dama zuwa hagu).

Let us consider the integral form of this equation at the point (x(cid:48),y(cid:48)). p q (cid:90) (cid:90) T(x(cid:48),y(cid:48))= P(x,y)G(x(cid:48)−x,y(cid:48)−y).dxdy (11.22) x y This is precisely the convolution operation ((cid:63)), and we can thus simplify this equation to, T =P (cid:63)G (11.23) If we consider an infinitesimally small cell, the power source becomes the Dirac delta function δ(x). TheDiracdeltafunctionisdefinedforapointx ,andhasavalueof0elsewhere. Itsatisfiestheproperty 0 (cid:82) δ(x)dx = 1. The Green’s function thus becomes the temperature profile of the Dirac delta function, which is known as its impulse response. The Green’s function can be computed analytically or can be estimated by simulating the thermal profile of a very small power source using a traditional FEM or FDM based tool. Computing the temperature profile is as simple as computing a simple convolution operation using Equation 11.23. Most methods convert Equation 11.23 into the Fourier transform domain, where a convolution becomes a multiplication. This is a very fast operation as compared to finite difference based methods. Definition 97 The Green’s function is the impulse response of a power profile that is a Dirac delta function. The temperature profile is the power profile convolved with the Green’s function. Note that this approach has its limitations because it is applicable to cells that are not at the edges and corners. At the rim of the chip the heat does not dissipate through the side walls because they are considered to be adiabatic. Hence, there is a disproportionate temperature rise. Here, we use the method of images. If a power source is x units away from a side wall, then we add another power source of the same magnitude at the point −x, which is x units away from the side wall on the opposite side. Thisisknownasanimage source. Thetemperatureprofileisapproximatelyasuperpositionofboththe temperature fields. 11.3 Power Management 11.3.1 Managing Dynamic Power DVFS As discussed in Section 11.1.1, the relationship between voltage and frequency in modern processors is not linear. Most processors define a set of power states, where each state is a voltage and frequency pair. TheCPUcanmovebetweenthesestatesdependingupontheambienttemperature,BIOSsettings, and the power usage of the application. In most power efficient processors it is possible to run different cores in different power states. The only problem of doing so is that it becomes hard to send a message across voltage-frequency boundaries. We need a special circuit that shifts the level of the voltage, and synchronizes the transfer. Once this is done we can achieve a fine grain control of the voltage and

Aikin Diracdelta an ayyana shi don apointx ,kuma darajarsa ta wani wuri. Yana gamsar da kadarar 0 (cid:82) δ(x)dx = 1. Saboda haka aikin kore ya zama bayanin yanayin zafi na aikin delta na Dirac, wanda aka sani da martanin motsinsa. Ana iya ƙididdige aikin Green ta hanyar nazari ko kuma a iya kimanta shi ta hanyar kwaikwayon yanayin zafi na ƙaramin tushen wutar lantarki ta amfani da kayan aiki na gargajiya na FEM ko kayan aiki na DM na F. Ƙididdige yanayin zafi yana da sauƙi kamar ƙididdige aikin juyawa mai sauƙi ta amfani da Equation 11.23. Yawancin hanyoyi suna canza Equation 11.23 zuwa yankin canza Fourier, inda juyawa ya zama ninkawa. Wannan aiki ne mai sauri idan aka kwatanta da hanyoyin da suka dogara da bambance-bambance. Ma'ana 97 Aikin Green shine amsawar motsin rai na bayanin martaba na wutar lantarki wanda aikin Dirac delta ne. Bayanin zafin jiki shine bayanin martaba na wutar lantarki wanda aka haɗa tare da aikin Green. Lura cewa wannan hanyar tana da iyakokinta saboda yana aiki ga ƙwayoyin da ba sa a gefuna da kusurwoyi. A gefen guntu, zafi ba ya ɓacewa ta bangon gefe saboda ana ɗaukar su adiabatic. Saboda haka, akwai hauhawar zafin jiki mara daidaituwa. A nan, muna amfani da hanyar hotuna. Idan tushen wuta yana da raka'o'in x daga bangon gefe, to muna ƙara wani tushen wuta mai girma iri ɗaya a wurin −x, wanda shine raka'o'in x daga bangon gefe a gefe na biyu. Wannan sanannen tushen hoto ne. Yanayin zafin jiki yana da kusan matsayi mafi girma na filayen zafin biyu. 11.3 Gudanar da Wutar Lantarki 11.3.1 Gudanar da Ƙarfin Wutar Lantarki DVFS Kamar yadda aka tattauna a Sashe na 11.1.1, alaƙar da ke tsakanin ƙarfin lantarki da mita a cikin masu sarrafawa na zamani ba layi ɗaya ba ne. Yawancin masu sarrafawa suna ayyana saitin yanayin wutar lantarki, inda kowane yanayi shine haɗin wutar lantarki da mita. CPU zai iya motsawa tsakanin waɗannan yanayin dangane da yanayin zafi na yanayi, saitunan BIOS, da amfani da wutar lantarki na aikace-aikacen . A cikin yawancin masu sarrafawa masu inganci, yana yiwuwa a gudanar da tsakiya daban-daban a cikin yanayin wutar lantarki daban-daban. Matsalar kawai ta yin hakan ita ce yana da wuya a aika saƙo a kan iyakokin mitar wutar lantarki. translation.en: Student grading system Additionally, the student grading system can also help to promote accountability and transparency in the grading process. By providing a digital record of all grading-related activities, the system can help to identify and address any issues related to grading, such as discrepancies or errors in grading. This can help to build trust among stakeholders, such as students, instructors, and administrators, and promote a culture of continuous improvement in the grading process. Finally, the implementation of a student grading system can also help to future-proof the university's grading process, as it provides a scalable and adaptable solution that can evolve over time to meet changing needs and priorities. As new technologies and teaching methodologies emerge, the student grading system can be updated and expanded to incorporate these innovations, helping to ensure that Wachemo University remains at the forefront of educational excellence. In summary, the current manual grading system used by Wachemo University has several issues that need to be addressed. The implementation of a student grading system will provide several benefits to the university, including increased efficiency, improved accuracy, and standardization of grading. The SRS documentation will serve as a guide for the development team to design, develop, and test the system. 1.4 Objective of the student grading system 1.4.1 General objective of student grading system The general objective of the student grading system according to the Ethiopian curriculum for SRS documentation is to assess the academic performance of students in a fair and effective manner, taking into account the flexibility in teaching and learning methodologies and strategies. The grading system should provide a comprehensive evaluation of student learning on a continuous assessment basis through tests, assignments, presentations, and other activities. The grading system should also aim to ease the examination-related pressure from the students and assess the student's ability not only based on academic performance but also on other activities like internal assignments, classroom projects, and answering ability. The grading system should provide students with an idea about their weaknesses and strengths and help mold them to make studies less monotonous. The grading system should encourage flexibility in teaching and learning methodologies and strategies and require a shift in teachers' thinking to achieve this goal. The grading system should also support teachers in their daily practice through clear student goals and grading criteria and build capacity through adequate training. Finally, the grading system should be individualized and consider legal accommodations for students with an . IEP, and documentation of a grading accommodation must appear in her records In addition to the objectives mentioned, it is important to consider the role of technology in the implementation of a student grading system. Technology can be used to streamline the grading process, reduce errors, and provide real-time feedback to students. For example, online grading systems can
translation.ha: Tsarin tantance ɗalibai tsarin tantance ɗalibaiBugu da ƙari, tsarin tantance ɗalibai tsarin tantance ɗalibai shima zai iya taimakawa wajen haɓaka riƙon amana da gaskiya a tsarin tantance ɗalibai. Ta hanyar samar da rikodin na dijital na duk ayyukan da suka shafi tantance ɗalibai, tsarin na iya taimakawa wajen gano da magance duk wata matsala da ta shafi tantance ɗalibai, kamar rashin daidaito ko kurakurai a cikin tantance ɗalibai. Wannan zai iya taimakawa wajen gina aminci tsakanin masu ruwa da tsaki, kamar ɗalibai, malamai, da masu gudanarwa, da kuma haɓaka al'adar ci gaba da inganta tsarin tantance ɗalibai. A ƙarshe, aiwatar da tsarin tantance ɗalibai <TECH>tsarin tantance ɗalibai shima zai iya taimakawa wajen tabbatar da tsarin tantance ɗalibai na jami'a a nan gaba, domin yana samar da mafita mai sauye-sauye da daidaitawa wanda zai iya canzawa akan lokaci don biyan buƙatu da fifiko masu canzawa. Yayin da sabbin fasahohi da hanyoyin koyarwa suka bayyana, ana iya sabunta tsarin tantance ɗalibai tsarin tantance ɗalibai don haɗa waɗannan sabbin abubuwa, yana taimakawa wajen tabbatar da cewa Wachemo University ya kasance a sahun gaba a cikin ƙwarewar ilimi. A taƙaice, tsarin tantancewa na hannu na wanda jami'ar <TECH>Wachemo ke amfani da shi yana da matsaloli da dama da ya kamata a magance su. Aiwatar da tsarin tantancewa na ɗalibai na <TECH> zai samar da fa'idodi da dama ga jami'ar, gami da ƙara inganci, ingantaccen daidaito, da daidaita daidaiton maki. Takardun SRS za su zama jagora ga ƙungiyar ci gaba don tsara, haɓakawa, da gwada tsarin <TECH>. 1.4 Manufar tantancewa na ɗalibai na <TECH>tsarin kimantawa na ɗalibai na 1.4.1 Manufar tantancewa na ɗalibai na <TECH>tsarin tantancewa na ɗalibai na TECH> bisa ga manhajar Habasha don takardun SRS shine a tantance aikin <TECH>tsarin tantancewa na ɗalibai na ilimi ta hanyar adalci da inganci, la'akari da sassauci a cikin hanyoyin koyarwa da koyo da dabaru. Tsarin tantancewa na <TECH>tsarin <TECH>ya kamata ya samar da cikakken kimantawa na koyon ɗalibai akan ci gaba da kimantawa ta hanyar gwaje-gwaje, ayyuka, gabatarwa, da sauran ayyuka. Tsarin tantancewa na tsarin tantancewa ya kamata ya ya kuma yi nufin rage matsin lamba da ya shafi jarrabawa daga ɗalibai da kuma tantance ƙwarewar ɗalibi ba wai kawai bisa ga aikin ilimi na  ba, har ma da wasu ayyuka kamar ayyukan cikin gida, ayyukan aji, da iyawar amsawa. Tsarin tantancewa na <TECH>ya kamata ya samar wa ɗalibai ra'ayi game da rauninsu da ƙarfinsu da kuma taimaka musu wajen tsara su don rage yawan karatu. Tsarin tantancewa na ya kamata ya ƙarfafa sassauci a cikin hanyoyin koyarwa da koyo da dabaru kuma yana buƙatar sauyi a tunanin malamai don cimma wannan burin. Tsarin tantancewa na ya kamata ya kamata</TECH> ya goyi bayan malamai a cikin ayyukansu na yau da kullun ta hanyar bayyana manufofin ɗalibai da ƙa'idodin tantancewa da kuma gina iyawa ta hanyar horo mai kyau. A ƙarshe, tsarin tantancewa na ya kamataya kamata ya zama na musamman kuma la'akari da daidaitawar doka ga ɗaliban da ke da . IEP, da kuma takardun da suka shafi daidaita maki dole ne su bayyana a cikin bayananta. Baya ga manufofin da aka ambata, yana da mahimmanci a yi la'akari da rawar da fasaha ke takawa wajen aiwatar da tsarin tantance maki na ɗalibai <TECH>. Ana iya amfani da fasaha don sauƙaƙe tsarin tantance maki, rage kurakurai, da kuma samar da ra'ayoyi na ainihi ga ɗalibai. Misali, tsarin tantance maki na kan layi zai iya

translation.en: Software Requirement Specification 220 Risk Impact: The new member will not be familiar with the project. He could also have a conflicting opinion about the project and its capabilities or design decisions. Risk Probability: low Risk Severity: Negligible Actions to Be Taken: ● Have a meeting with the new member, and get him familiar with the project specifications. ● In case he comes up with a conflicting opinion about the project specifications, we will see if it is a small change then we will incorporate it to the project. If it requires a big shift, his proposition will be dropped. ● In case he comes up with a conflicting opinion about the project design, we will see if it is worth replacing the current one. Otherwise his proposition will be dropped. Risk ID: R08 Category: Technical Risk Description: Disagreement among the team members about a design decision. Risk Impact: Disagreement can drive the members to have a negative attitude towards the project Risk Probability: medium Risk Severity: Negligible Actions to Be Taken: ● Each member will present their idea upon the design decision under conflict. Then, the other members will vote if they are in favor of each idea. At the end, the idea with highest number of votes will be considered. If two or more ideas have the same number of votes, then one will be chosen randomly using any online randomization tool. Risk ID: R09 Category: Programmatic Risk Description: Existing member drops the course. Risk Impact: It will slow down the development time. Risk Probability: medium Risk Severity: Catastrophic Actions to Be Taken: ● All members will meet to discuss the case. The tasks of the former member will be distributed among the current members.

translation.en: 3.4.7 Facial recognition algorithms shall be executed locally on each photographer system using locally stored identification images (replicated from server). 3.4.8 When transfer bandwidth to/from the server is below a certain configurable threshold, subject images from photographers’ tethered systems shall be backed up to server and/or standalone NAS system. 3.4.9 When an internet connection is present, the database shall be replicated to a cloud backup server. 3.4.10 When an internet connection is present and tests indicate an upload speed of more than 2Mb/s, all subject images shall be uploaded to cloud backup server. 4 Verification Demonstration is a requirement that the system can demonstrate without external test equipment. ​ Test is a requirement that requires some external piece of test equipment (e.g. logic analyzer, ​ and/or volt meter). Analyze is a requirement that is met indirectly through a logical conclusion or mathematical ​ analysis of a result. For example, Algorithms for congestion: the designer may need to show that the requirement is met through the analysis of count and occupancy calculations in software or firmware. Inspection is the nondestructive examination of a product or system using one or more of the five ​ senses (visual, auditory, olfactory, tactile, taste). It may include simple physical manipulation and measurements. Requirement ID Verification Method 3.1.22 D 3.1.1 D 3.1.23 D 3.1.2 D 3.1.24 A

translation.en: Population Density, Distribuion and Growth in India MODULE - 9 Human resource 26.10 CAUSES OF MIGRATION development in India Migration is a result of an inter-play of a large number of factors. Generally factors affecting migration can be grouped in to two categories of Push and Pull factors. The push factors are responsible for making people move from their original place of living. The pull factors are responsible for attracting people to some particular areas. Unless both these factors are operating simultaneously, no migration of people can be possible. The push and pull factors include the economic, social Notes and political components. A brief description of these factors is given below.  Migration is the result of inter-play of a number of factors. These factors can be grouped as push and pull factors.  The push and pull factors can be economic, social and political in nature. (a) Economic Factor The people generally like to live in those areas where they can make their livelihood. Thus they would like to move away from areas of poor soils, less developed means of transport, low levels of industrialization and less job opportunities. These are the push factors. On the other hand, the areas offering good employment, better living standard attract large number of people. These are the pull factors. Thus all areas of fertile soil, deposits of minerals, better means of transportation and communication and higher levels of development of industries and urban areas provide more means of making a living. You might have observed that a large number of people move to the cities like Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata and Chennai from neighbouring and different parts of the country like Bihar, Orissa, Uttar Pradesh where opportunities are less. The most important factor for which they move is the expected improvement in their economic conditions. Many are attracted by an apparent glare of city life with all its modern comforts and attractions.  The important economic pull factors causing migration are fertile soils, availability of minerals, good means of transport and communication, high levels of industrialization and urbanization and more job opportunities.  The important economic push factors are poor soils, lack of developed means of transport and communication, low levels of industrialization and urbanization and lack of job opportunities. (b) Socio-Political Factor Man is a social being and he likes to live with his kith and kin. Generally the people having a common religion or language or social customs like to live together. On the other hand a person would like to migrate to some other place if he is living among the people belonging to some other culture or customs. Many people migrate to places of religious importance. Migration of people to places like Badrinath, Tirupati and Varanasi though generally temporary is due to religious factors. The impact of the social factors is more clearly seen in the concentration of people belonging to a particular community in one locality of urban area or in a particular GEOGRAPHY 255
translation.ha: Yawan Jama'a, Rarrabawa da Ci Gaba a Indiya MASU KYAU - 9 Albarkatun Dan Adam 26.10 DALILAN Ci gaban JIHA a Indiya Hijira sakamakon hulɗar abubuwa da yawa ne. Gabaɗaya abubuwan da ke shafar ƙaura za a iya haɗa su zuwa rukuni biyu na abubuwan da ke shafar JIHA da Ja. Abubuwan da ke haifar da JIHA su ne ke haifar da sa mutane su ƙaura daga wurin zama na asali. Abubuwan da ke haifar da JIHA suna da alhakin jawo hankalin mutane zuwa wasu yankuna na musamman. Sai dai idan waɗannan abubuwan biyu suna aiki a lokaci guda, babu wani ƙaura na mutane da zai yiwu. Abubuwan da ke haifar da JIHA sun haɗa da Bayanan tattalin arziki, zamantakewa da sassan siyasa. An ba da taƙaitaccen bayani game da waɗannan abubuwan a ƙasa.  Hijira sakamakon haɗakar abubuwa da yawa ne. Ana iya haɗa waɗannan abubuwan a matsayin abubuwan da ke haifar da JIHA da Ja.  Abubuwan da ke haifar da JIHA da Ja na iya zama na tattalin arziki, zamantakewa da siyasa. (a) Abubuwan da ke haifar da JIHA da Ja na iya zama na tattalin arziki, zamantakewa da siyasa. (a) Abubuwan da ke haifar da JIHA da Ja na tattalin arziki. Mutane gabaɗaya suna son zama a waɗannan yankunan da za su iya samun abin rayuwa. Don haka suna son ƙaura daga yankunan da ƙasa mara kyau take, hanyoyin sufuri marasa ci gaba, ƙarancin masana'antu da ƙarancin damar aiki. Waɗannan su ne abubuwan da ke haifar da koma baya. A gefe guda kuma, yankunan da ke ba da kyakkyawan aiki, ingantaccen rayuwa misali suna jan hankalin mutane da yawa. Waɗannan su ne abubuwan da ke jawo hankali. Don haka duk yankunan da ke da ƙasa mai albarka, ma'adanai, ingantattun hanyoyin sufuri da sadarwa da kuma manyan matakan ci gaban masana'antu da birane suna ba da ƙarin hanyoyin samun rayuwa. Wataƙila kun lura cewa adadi mai yawa na mutane suna ƙaura zuwa biranen kamar Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata da Chennai daga maƙwabta da sassa daban-daban na ƙasar kamar Bihar, Orissa, Uttar Pradesh inda damammaki ba su da yawa. Mafi mahimmancin abin da suke ƙaura shi ne ci gaban da ake tsammanin a yanayin tattalin arzikinsu. Mutane da yawa suna sha'awar ganin yanayin rayuwa a birane tare da duk abubuwan jin daɗi da abubuwan jan hankali na zamani.  Muhimman abubuwan da ke haifar da koma baya ga tattalin arziki da ke haifar da ƙaura sune ƙasa mai albarka, <TECH>samuwar ma'adanai, hanyoyin sufuri da sadarwa masu kyau, manyan matakan masana'antu da birane da ƙarin damar aiki.  Muhimman abubuwan da ke haifar da koma-baya ga tattalin arziki sune rashin kyawun ƙasa, rashin ingantattun hanyoyin sufuri da sadarwa, ƙarancin masana'antu da birane da kuma rashin damar aiki. (b) Muhimmin Yanayin Zamantakewa da Siyasa Mutum mutum ne mai zamantakewa kuma yana son zama tare da danginsa da danginsa. Gabaɗaya mutanen da ke da addini ɗaya ko harshe ko al'adun zamantakewa suna son zama tare. A gefe guda kuma mutum yana son yin ƙaura zuwa wani wuri idan yana zaune tare da mutanen da ke cikin wasu al'adu ko al'adu. Mutane da yawa suna ƙaura zuwa wuraren da suka shafi addini. Hijira mutane zuwa wurare kamar Badrinath, Tirupati da Varanasi kodayake galibi na ɗan lokaci ne saboda abubuwan addini. Tasirin abubuwan zamantakewa yana bayyana a fili a cikin yawan mutanen da ke cikin wata al'umma a wani yanki na birni ko a wani yanki na musamman na JIRGARAFI 255

translation.en: FoodSaver – Software Requirement Specifications cycles to determine its performance. Each database update cycle in the application takes less than 60 seconds to complete. Following the development, the application will be in the production phase for one month, during which time the performance of the app will be evaluated by testers by trying the features that typically slow down the speed. 3.2.2 Reliability The FoodSaver application will be tested in iterations to determine the pass and failure rate. The application's developers will have unit test cases to check the functionalities' pass and failure rates. There will also be a bi-weekly release of the features developed in that sprint, where manual testing is performed by the testers. If the failure rate of the test cases is relatively high, necessary changes will be implemented. In addition, the application code will be written in accordance with coding standards while keeping all object-oriented principles and design patterns in mind to increase reusability. 3.2.3 Availability Except for network outages, the FoodSaver application will be available 24 hours a day, seven days a week. The application will have less downtime. If a database update fails to commit, the database update process will undo all relevant changes. 3.2.4 Security All account-related information will be stored in a secure local database that is stored in the application's local memory. Private memory is the only way to access database information. According to the owner's privacy policy, this application will protect the privacy of their personal information. Passwords can only be viewed if the user so desires. 3.2.5 Maintainability The FoodSaver application will be continuously monitored by the technical team. Bugs reported by testers will be fixed parallelly by developers. Various tools will be used to track all the changes made. The application will be regularly maintained to reflect the developers' updates. The maintenance will be carried out after regular business hours. Documentation will be updated in case of any modifications. 3.2.6 Portability This application is only compatible with iOS devices. If the user purchases a new phone, the application can be installed from the App Store and will continue to function as before. 22
translation.ha: FoodSaver – Software Bukatar Bayani dalla-dalla yana zagayawa don tantance aikin sabunta. Kowace zagayowar bayanan bayanai sabuntawa a cikin aikace-aikacen  zai ɗauki ƙasa da daƙiƙa 60 kafin a kammala. Bayan haɓakawa, aikace-aikacen  zai kasance a cikin matakin samarwa na tsawon wata ɗaya, a lokacin za a kimanta aikin  na app ɗin ta hanyar gwada fasalulluka waɗanda galibi ke rage gudu. 3.2.2 Amincewa Za a gwada aikace-aikacen  na FoodSaver a cikin maimaitawa don tantance ƙimar wucewa da gazawar. Masu haɓaka aikace-aikacen  za su sami shari'o'in gwaji na raka'a don duba ƙimar wucewa da gazawar ayyuka. Haka kuma za a fitar da fasalulluka biyu a mako-mako na fasalin da aka haɓaka a cikin wannan tseren, inda masu gwaji ke yin gwajin hannu. Idan ƙimar gazawar shari'o'in gwaji ta yi yawa, za a aiwatar da canje-canje masu mahimmanci. Bugu da ƙari, za a rubuta lambar aikace-aikacen  bisa ga ƙa'idodin lambar sirri yayin da ake tunawa da duk ƙa'idodin da suka shafi abu da tsarin ƙira don ƙara yawan amfani. 3.2.3 Samuwa Banda katsewar hanyar sadarwa, aikace-aikacen FoodSaver  zai kasance a shirye awanni 24 a rana, kwana bakwai a mako. Aikace-aikacen  zai sami ƙarancin lokacin aiki. Idan sabuntawar   ya gaza aiwatarwa, tsarin  > sabuntawa zai gyara duk canje-canje masu dacewa. 3.2.4 Tsaro Duk bayanan  da suka shafi asusu za a adana su a cikin amintaccen rumbun adana bayanai na <TECH> na gida wanda aka adana a cikin ƙwaƙwalwar ajiyar  na gida. Ƙwaƙwalwar ajiyar sirri ita ce kawai hanyar samun damar <TECH>bayanan <TECH> . A bisa ga manufar sirrin mai shi na TECH, wannan aikace-aikacen  zai kare sirrin <TECH>na bayanan sirrin <TECH> na TECH>. Ana iya duba kalmomin shiga ne kawai idan mai amfani da <TECH> yana so. 3.2.5 <TECH>Tsarewa Ƙungiyar fasaha za ta ci gaba da sa ido kan aikace-aikacen FoodSaver . Masu haɓakawa za su gyara kurakurai da masu gwaji suka ruwaito a lokaci guda. Za a yi amfani da kayan aiki daban-daban don bin diddigin duk canje-canjen da aka yi. Za a ci gaba da kula da aikace-aikacen  don nuna sabuntawar masu haɓakawa. Za a gudanar da gyaran bayan lokutan aiki na yau da kullun. Za a sabunta takardu idan an yi wani gyare-gyare. 3.2.6 Sauyawa Wannan aikace-aikacen  yana dacewa ne kawai da na'urorin iOS. Idan mai amfani da  ya sayi sabuwar waya, ana iya shigar da aikace-aikacen  daga Shagon App kuma zai ci gaba da aiki kamar da. 22

translation.en: Sport Facility Booking System Kirtan Shah 3. Reliability and Availability  Ensuring that the system is reliable and available 24/7 is essential, as users may access the application at any time to make bookings. Any unexpected downtimes or system failures would negatively impact user trust and satisfaction.  While there are specific uptime requirements outlined, the design goal is to maximize reliability and availability, implementing redundancy and failover mechanisms to handle potential disruptions. 4. User-Friendly Interface  The system interface should prioritize ease of use, making it simple for users to navigate, search for facilities, apply filters, select time slots, and finalize bookings. The booking process should be intuitive and user-friendly, reducing the effort needed to accomplish tasks.  This goal emphasizes a streamlined design across both mobile and web applications to ensure accessibility for all users, regardless of their level of technical expertise. 5. Security and Data Privacy  Security is a critical design goal, given the need to protect user data and payment information. The system must use robust encryption and secure payment gateways to ensure data privacy and prevent unauthorized access.  While the system must comply with industry security standards, the goal is to exceed these requirements where possible, creating a secure environment that fosters user confidence in data protection and privacy. 6. Modularity and Maintainability  The system should be designed with modularity in mind, allowing individual components to be updated or replaced without affecting other areas of the system. This modular approach simplifies maintenance and allows for future enhancements.  For instance, if an update is made to the payment module or booking logic, it should not disrupt other functionalities. The design goal is to ensure that the system is maintainable and adaptable to evolving business needs. 47
translation.ha: Yin Rajista a Wurin Wasanni Tsarin Kirtan Shah 3. Amincewa da Samuwa  Tabbatar da cewa tsarin na da inganci kuma yana samuwa 24/7 yana da mahimmanci, domin masu amfani <TECH>na iya shiga aikace-aikacen  a kowane lokaci don yin rajista. Duk wani lokacin hutu da ba a zata ba ko gazawar tsarin  zai yi mummunan tasiri ga aminci da gamsuwa na mai amfani.  Duk da yake akwai takamaiman buƙatun lokacin aiki da aka tsara, manufar ƙira ita ce haɓaka Amincewa da Samuwa, aiwatar da hanyoyin sakewa da failure don magance katsewar da ka iya tasowa. 4. Amfani da Intanet Mai Amfani  Tsarin na <TECH>ya kamata ya ba da fifiko ga sauƙin amfani, yana sauƙaƙa wa masu amfani su kewaya, su nemi kayan aiki, su yi amfani da matattara, su zaɓi lokutan aiki, da kuma kammala yin rajista. Tsarin yin rajistar ya kamata ya zama mai sauƙin fahimta kuma mai sauƙin amfani , wanda ke rage ƙoƙarin da ake buƙata don cimma ayyuka.  Wannan burin yana jaddada tsari mai sauƙi a cikin aikace-aikacen wayar hannu da yanar gizo don tabbatar da samun dama ga duk masu amfani, ba tare da la'akari da matakin ƙwarewarsu ta fasaha ba. 5. <TECH>Tsaro da Bayani Sirrin  Tsaro muhimmin burin ƙira ne, idan aka yi la'akari da buƙatar kare mai amfani bayanai da biyan kuɗi bayanai. Tsarin  <TECH>dole ne ya yi amfani da ɓoyewa mai ƙarfi da ƙofofin biyan kuɗi masu aminci don tabbatar da bayanai sirrin da hana shiga ba tare da izini ba.  Yayin da tsarin  <TECH>dole ne ya bi ƙa'idodin tsaro</TECH> na masana'antu, manufar ita ce wuce waɗannan buƙatun inda zai yiwu, ƙirƙirar yanayi mai aminci wanda ke haɓaka amincewa da mai amfani ga kariyar bayanai da sirrin . 6. Daidaito da kuma Tsarewa  Ya kamata a tsara tsarin  tare da la'akari da tsarin daidaitawa, wanda ke ba da damar sabunta ko maye gurbin sassan daban-daban ba tare da shafar wasu sassan tsarin  ba. Wannan hanyar daidaitawa tana sauƙaƙa kulawa kuma tana ba da damar haɓakawa a nan gaba.  Misali, idan aka yi sabuntawa na <TECH> zuwa tsarin biyan kuɗi ko dabarun yin rajista, bai kamata  ya kawo cikas ga wasu ayyuka ba. Manufar ƙira ita ce tabbatar da cewa tsarin  yana da dorewa kuma yana daidaitawa ga buƙatun kasuwanci masu tasowa. 47

translation.en: Cybernetics Protector Version 1.0 1.0 Purpose The Cybernetics Protector is a online web application, Which managing secret agency's all things. And also connecting to our country's defense section and regular people. The secret intelligence agency has always using undercover agents, they solve specific type secrete and sensitive cases. And some time spying and finding criminals, and many more works... For this type difficult and critical woks make more distance between agency and their agent. But in this situation make sure, their communication always secure that most important. More then secret agency easily find agent location, they are easily connect each other. So, the this web application provide sefe and secure comunication chanel betwin agent and secrate agency. And agent tracing,managing secrate data,job application,type extra facility. 1.1 Scope • There are four basic users – Agent,Secret Intelligence Agency's chief, Ministry of Defence, Citizen. • All users have their own profile[citizen not including] in cybernetics protector system. • Providing secure communicate channel between Agent and Agency's chief. • Agency's chief can any time trace the Agent location. • Agents can view dynamic map, any time. • Agency's chief can manage the case detail and history logo. • Agent and Agency's chief can generate report. • Agent can view case detail and access the database and upload the data. • Ministry of Defence can securely send resources to Secret Intelligence Agency. Cyber Crunch L.D. College of Engineering, Ahmedabad page-2
translation.ha: Sigar Kare Cybernetics 1.0 1.0 Manufa Kare Cybernetics aikace-aikace ne na yanar gizo na , wanda ke kula da duk abubuwan da hukumar sirri ke yi. Kuma yana haɗuwa da sashin tsaro na ƙasarmu da mutanen yau da kullun. Hukumar leƙen asiri koyaushe tana amfani da jami'an ɓoye, suna magance takamaiman nau'ikan sirri da shari'o'in masu mahimmanci. Kuma wani lokacin leƙen asiri da gano masu laifi, da sauran ayyuka da yawa... Don wannan nau'in woks masu wahala da mahimmanci suna yin nisa tsakanin hukuma da wakilin su. Amma a wannan yanayin tabbatar da cewa, sadarwar su koyaushe tana tabbatar da hakan mafi mahimmanci. Fiye da hukumar sirri cikin sauƙi nemo wurin wakili, suna haɗuwa cikin sauƙi. Don haka, wannan aikace-aikacen yanar gizo na <TECH> yana ba da amintaccen wakili na sadarwa chanel betwin wakili da hukuma mai sirri. Kuma bin diddigin wakili, sarrafa sirrin bayanai, aiki aikace-aikacen, nau'in ƙarin kayan aiki. 1.1 Girman • Akwai masu amfani guda huɗu na asali - Wakili, Babban Jami'in Hukumar Leƙen asiri ta , Ma'aikatar Tsaro, Citizen. • Duk masu amfani suna da nasu bayanan martaba [ɗan ƙasa ba a haɗa shi ba] a cikin tsarin kariya ta yanar gizo . • Samar da hanyar sadarwa mai aminci tsakanin wakili da shugaban hukumar <TECH>. • Shugaban hukumar zai iya bin diddigin wurin da wakilin yake a kowane lokaci. • Wakilai za su iya duba taswirar mai canzawa, a kowane lokaci. • Shugaban hukumar zai iya sarrafa bayanan shari'ar da tambarin tarihi. • Shugaban wakili da shugaban hukumar zai iya samar da rahoton <TECH>. • Wakili zai iya duba bayanan shari'ar kuma ya sami damar shiga Bayanai sannan ya loda bayanan . • Ma'aikatar Tsaro za ta iya aika albarkatu cikin aminci zuwa Hukumar Leken Asiri ta Sirri. translation.en: Student grading system In addition, the system should be designed with a focus on interoperability. This means that the system should be designed to work seamlessly with other educational systems and processes, such as student information systems and learning management systems. This will help ensure that the system is aligned with the needs of the educational institution and that it can be easily integrated into the existing technology infrastructure. Finally, the system should be designed with a focus on testing and quality assurance. This means that the system should be thoroughly tested and debugged to ensure that it is functioning properly and free from errors. This will involve testing the system with a group of representative users and gathering feedback, as well as conducting regular maintenance and updates to ensure that the system remains up-to-date and effective. Overall, by considering the technical feasibility of the student grading system, it is possible to develop a system that is effective, efficient, and sustainable in the long term. This can help to promote student learning and achievement, support teacher and administrator decision-making, and ensure that the educational institution is meeting its goals and objectives. 1.8.3. Economic Feasibility Economic Feasibility for Student Grading System:  Economic feasibility is an important factor to consider when developing a student grading system. Here are some points to consider:  Cost of development: The cost of developing the student grading system should be considered, including the cost of hardware, software, and personnel.  Cost of implementation: The cost of implementing the student grading system should be considered, including the cost of training, support, and maintenance.  Return on investment: The return on investment for the student grading system should be considered, including the potential benefits to students, teachers, parents, and educational institutions.  Cost savings: The student grading system may result in cost savings for educational institutions by reducing the need for paper-based grading and reporting systems.  Revenue generation: The student grading system may generate revenue for educational institutions by providing value-added services such as analytics and reporting.  Cost-benefit analysis: A cost-benefit analysis should be conducted to determine the economic feasibility of the student grading system. This analysis should consider the costs and benefits of the system over its expected lifespan. Overall, the economic feasibility of the student grading system is essential to ensure that the system is cost-effective and provides a good return on investment. By considering these factors, it is possible to develop a student grading system that meets the needs of all stakeholders and
translation.ha: Tsarin tantance ɗalibai tsarinBugu da ƙari, ya kamata a tsara tsarin  tare da mai da hankali kan haɗin kai. Wannan yana nufin cewa ya kamata a tsara tsarin <TECH><TECH>> don yin aiki ba tare da wata matsala ba tare da sauran tsarin ilimi da tsare-tsare, kamar tsarin <TECH>bayanai na ɗalibai da tsarin gudanar da koyo. Wannan zai taimaka wajen tabbatar da cewa tsarin > ya dace da buƙatun cibiyar ilimi kuma za a iya haɗa shi cikin sauƙi cikin kayan aikin fasaha da ake da su. A ƙarshe, ya kamata a tsara tsarin <TECH><TECH><TECH> tare da mai da hankali kan gwaji da tabbatar da inganci. Wannan yana nufin cewa ya kamata a gwada tsarin <TECH><TECH><TECH>> sosai kuma a gyara shi don tabbatar da cewa yana aiki yadda ya kamata kuma ba tare da kurakurai ba. Wannan zai haɗa da gwada tsarin <TECH> tare da ƙungiyar masu amfani da wakilai da tattara ra'ayoyi, da kuma gudanar da gyare-gyare da sabuntawa akai-akai don tabbatar da cewa tsarin  ya kasance sabo kuma mai tasiri. Gabaɗaya, ta hanyar la'akari da yuwuwar fasaha ta tsarin tantance ɗalibai , yana yiwuwa a samar da tsarin  mai tasiri, inganci, kuma mai dorewa a cikin dogon lokaci. Wannan zai iya taimakawa wajen haɓaka koyo da cimma burin ɗalibai, tallafawa malami da mai gudanarwa <TECH> yanke shawara, da kuma tabbatar da cewa cibiyar ilimi tana cimma burinta da manufofinta. 1.8.3. Yiwuwar Tattalin Arziki Yiwuwar Tattalin Arziki ga Matsayin Ɗalibai  Tsarin:  Yiwuwar tattalin arziki muhimmin abu ne da za a yi la'akari da shi yayin haɓaka tsarin tantance ɗalibai . Ga wasu abubuwan da za a yi la'akari da su:  Kuɗin haɓakawa: Ya kamata a yi la'akari da kuɗin haɓaka tsarin tantance ɗalibai  , gami da kuɗin kayan aiki, software, da ma'aikata.  Kuɗin aiwatarwa: Ya kamata a yi la'akari da kuɗin aiwatar da tsarin tantance ɗalibai <TECH> <TECH>, gami da kuɗin horo, tallafi, da kulawa.  Ribar da aka samu daga saka hannun jari: Ya kamata a yi la'akari da ribar da aka samu daga saka hannun jari ga tsarin tantance dalibai <TECH>tsarin , gami da fa'idodin da za a iya samu ga ɗalibai, malamai, iyaye, da cibiyoyin ilimi.  Rage farashi: Tsarin tantance dalibai <TECH>tsarin na iya ya haifar da tanadin farashi ga cibiyoyin ilimi ta hanyar rage buƙatar tsarin tantancewa da bayar da rahoto bisa takarda.  Samar da kudaden shiga: Tsarin tantance dalibai tsarin tantance dalibai <TECH>na iya samar da kudaden shiga ga cibiyoyin ilimi ta hanyar samar da ayyukan da suka kara daraja kamar nazari da bayar da rahoto.  Binciken fa'idar farashi: Ya kamata a gudanar da nazarin fa'idar farashi da fa'ida don tantance yuwuwar tattalin arziki na tsarin tantance dalibai <TECH>tsarin tantance dalibai. Wannan binciken ya kamata yayi la'akari da farashi da fa'idodin tsarin tsarin tantance dalibai a tsawon rayuwar da ake tsammani. Gabaɗaya, yuwuwar tattalin arziki na tsarin tantance dalibai <TECH>tsarin tantance dalibai yana da mahimmanci don tabbatar da cewa tsarin <TECH> yana da inganci kuma yana ba da kyakkyawan riba akan saka hannun jari. Ta hanyar la'akari da waɗannan abubuwan, yana yiwuwa a samar da tsarin tantance ɗalibai <TECH>wanda zai dace da buƙatun dukkan masu ruwa da tsaki da kuma
