translation.en: Software Requirements Specification for Bug Tracking Page 13 System 4.2.2 Stimulus/Response Sequences 1. User selects a category and priority while reporting or editing a bug. 2. System assigns the selected category and priority to the bug. 3. Dashboard updates to reflect bugs sorted by category and priority. 4.2.3 Functional Requirements • REQ-1: Users must be able to assign categories to bugs during reporting or editing. • REQ-2: Priority levels must be pre-defined and consistent across the system. • REQ-3: Dashboard must support sorting and filtering based on category and pri- ority. 4.3 Bug Lifecycle Management 4.3.1 Description and Priority The system tracks the status of bugs through a lifecycle, including states like New, In Progress, Resolved, and Closed. • Priority: High • Rationale: Efficient tracking ensures bugs are addressed in a timely manner. 4.3.2 Stimulus/Response Sequences 1. User updates a bug’s status to ”In Progress” after starting work on it. 2. Tester changes the status to ”Resolved” after confirming the fix. 3. System archives bugs marked as ”Closed” for over 90 days. 4.3.3 Functional Requirements • REQ-1: Users must be able to update bug statuses. • REQ-2: The system must log status changes with timestamps and user details. • REQ-3: Closed bugs must be archived automatically after a specified period. 4.4 Notification and Alert System 4.4.1 Description and Priority This feature notifies users about updates, assignments, and deadlines related to bugs. Alerts are delivered via email and in-app notifications. • Priority: Medium • Rationale: Notifications improve team collaboration and ensure timely responses.

Mai amfani yana sabunta matsayin kwari zuwa "Ana Ci gaba" bayan fara aiki a kansa. 2. Mai gwadawa yana canza matsayin zuwa "An Warware" bayan ya tabbatar da gyara. 3. Tsarin yana adana kurakurai da aka yiwa alama da "An Rufe" na tsawon sama da kwanaki 90. 4.3.3 Bukatun Aiki • REQ-1: Masu amfani dole ne su iya sabunta yanayin kwari. • REQ-2: Dole ne yanayin rajistar Tsarin dole ne ya canza tare da tambarin lokaci da cikakkun bayanai na mai amfani . • REQ-3: Dole ne a adana kurakurai da aka rufe <TECH>dole nedole ne a adana su ta atomatik bayan wani takamaiman lokaci. 4.4 Sanarwa da Faɗaɗa Tsarin 4.4.1 Bayani da Fifiko Wannan fasalin yana sanar da masu amfani game da sabuntawa, ayyuka, da wa'adin ƙarshe da suka shafi kurakurai. Ana isar da faɗakarwa ta imel da sanarwar cikin-app. • Fifiko: Matsakaici • Dalili: Sanarwa tana inganta haɗin gwiwar ƙungiya da kuma tabbatar da amsoshi kan lokaci.

Earth Earth They prove most catastrophic and devastating when they cause fires and seismic sea waves. Such tidal waves are called Tsunamis. These waves may wash away coastal cities. Buildings and bridges collapse causing death of the thousands of people. Lines of transport, communication and of electric transmission get disrupted. The after effect of earthquake is spread of Notes Notes epidemics like cholera. (B) DISTRIBUTION OF EARTHQUAKES The occurrence of earthquake is a phenomenon of almost every part of the world. But, there are two well-defined belts where they occur more frequently. These belts are the Circum-Pacific belt and the Mid-world mountain belt. The first belt i.e., the Circum Pacific comprises the western coast of North and South America; Aleutian Islands and island groups along the eastern coasts of Asia such as Japan and Philippines. As it encircles the Pacific Ocean from end to end, it is named as such. The earthquakes in this belt are associated with the ring of mountains and volcanoes. It is estimated that about 68 percent of earthquakes of the world occur in this belt alone. The second belt-extend from Alps with their extension into Mediterranean the Caucasus and the Himalayan region and continues into Indonesia. About 21, percent of total earthquakes of the world originate in this belt. Remaining 11 percent occur in the other parts of the world.  Most of the earthquakes of the world occur in two belts namely the Circum Pacific and Mid world mountain belts. Fig. 4.9 Major Earthquake Belts GEOGRAPHY 75 GEOGRAPHY 75

Duniya Duniya Suna zama mafi bala'i da bala'i lokacin da suke haifar da gobara da raƙuman ruwa na teku. Irin waɗannan raƙuman ruwa ana kiransu Tranaamis. Waɗannan raƙuman ruwa na iya wanke biranen bakin teku. Gine-gine da gadoji suna rushewa wanda ke haifar da mutuwar dubban mutane. Layukan sufuri, sadarwa da watsa wutar lantarki suna lalacewa. Sakamakon girgizar ƙasa shine yaɗuwar Bayanan kula Bayanan kula Annoba kamar kwalara. (B) RABA GIRGIZAR KASA Faruwar girgizar ƙasa abu ne da ya zama ruwan dare a kusan kowace yanki na duniya. Amma, akwai bel guda biyu masu tsari inda suke faruwa akai-akai. Waɗannan bel ɗin sune bel ɗin Circum-Pacific da bel ɗin tsaunuka na Tsakiyar Duniya. Bel ɗin farko wato Circum Pacific ya ƙunshi gabar tekun yamma na Arewacin Amurka da Kudancin Amurka; Tsibiran Aleutian da ƙungiyoyin tsibirai a gabar tekun gabashin Asiya kamar Japan da Philippines. Yayin da yake kewaye Tekun Pacific daga ƙarshe zuwa ƙarshe, ana kiransa da haka. Girgizar ƙasa a cikin wannan bel ɗin tana da alaƙa da zoben duwatsu da aman wuta. An kiyasta cewa kusan kashi 68 cikin ɗari na girgizar ƙasa na duniya suna faruwa ne a cikin wannan bel ɗin kawai. Bel ɗin na biyu - yana fitowa daga Alps tare da faɗaɗa su zuwa Bahar Rum Caucasus da yankin Himalayan kuma yana ci gaba zuwa Indonesia. Kimanin kashi 21 cikin ɗari na jimillar girgizar ƙasa na duniya sun samo asali ne daga wannan bel ɗin. Sauran kashi 11 cikin ɗari suna faruwa ne a wasu sassan duniya.  Yawancin girgizar ƙasa a duniya suna faruwa ne a cikin bel biyu wato bel ɗin tsaunukan Circum Pacific da Mid world. translation.en: Software Requirements Specification for “Learn&Joy” Project 1. Introduction 1.1 Purpose This document has been prepared to specify the requirements of the "Learn&Joy" software project, which enables users to test themselves on the subjects they want and shows the results to the user. Users will be able to learn new information and check their old information thanks to the application. 1.2 Product Scope Learn&Joy is an online test application that helps users to measure their knowledge in the selected field. A test can include quiz questions(multiple selection/single selection) or True/False questions. The application will be for free. Users will need to create an account to use the application. Users should be able to see their scores for each test in a list. Admin will create the tests for different categories and users will select a category and a test to start the test. 1.3 Definitions, Acronyms, and Abbreviations L&J: Learn&Joy 1.4 References 1. "IEEE Guide for Software Requirements Specifications," in IEEE Std 830-1984, vol., no., pp.1-26, 10 Feb. 1984, doi: 10.1109/IEEESTD.1984.119205. 2. BRUSAW, C. T., ALRED, G. and OLIU, W., Handbook of Technical Writing, New York, St. Martin's Press, 1976. 1.5 Overview This SRS contains all requirements and constraints of L&J project. • Section 2 describes the general factors that affect the product and its requirements. • Section 3 contains all the details the software developer needs to create the software. • Section 4 defines technologies, infrastructure, performance, scalability, quality attributes, and other non-functional requirements. 2. General Description 2.1 Product Perspective L&J is a free mobile and web application where users test their knowledge and can be accessed from any device. User registration is required. doftdare company

translation.en: Sport Facility Booking System Kirtan Shah  The software must handle up to 10,000 registered users and process up to 500 transactions per hour through various payment modes. The fit criterion should be:  The product’s performance shall not degrade or exceed a response time of 2 seconds for 95% of user actions during peak hours.  The system shall ensure that up to 500 concurrent users can book, cancel, or modify bookings without any system crashes or severe delays.  Storage capacity shall accommodate facility data for up to 2 years without the need for additional manual data archiving procedures. 12 Dependability Requirements 12a Reliability Requirements For the Sports Facility Booking Management Application, reliability is critical to ensure smooth, uninterrupted operation for both facility managers and users. The reliability requirements will be quantified based on the maximum allowable downtime and failure rates, especially considering real-time booking and payment processes. This ensures that users can trust the application for booking sports venues without delays or errors. The app must be highly reliable to maintain user trust and meet operational expectations, especially since real-time bookings and payments are core functions. Ensuring reliability will prevent negative user experiences and optimize the performance of sports facilities. Setting appropriate expectations around failure and recovery also helps manage user expectations and contributes to better customer satisfaction. Reliability Requirements are:  The application shall have a maximum failure rate of once per month.  No booking, payment, or user data shall be lost or corrupted in the event of a failure.  The system should ensure that data is backed up and recoverable in case of system downtime or crashes.  The application must automatically recover from a failure, with users experiencing minimal service disruption.  Users will be notified of any downtime or failure, along with an estimated recovery time, and critical functions like ongoing bookings or payments will be prioritized for restoration. 33
translation.ha: Yin Rajista a Wurin Wasanni Tsarin Kirtan Shah  Manhajar dole ne ta ɗauki masu amfani har 10,000 da suka yi rijista kuma ta sarrafa har zuwa ma'amaloli 500 a kowace awa ta hanyoyi daban-daban na biyan kuɗi. Ka'idar dacewa ya kamata ta kasance:  Aikin   ba zai lalata ko wuce lokacin amsawa na <TECH> ba na daƙiƙa 2 don kashi 95% na ayyukan mai amfani a lokacin lokutan aiki.  Tsarin   zai ya tabbatar da cewa har zuwa masu amfani 500 a lokaci guda za su iya yin rajista, sokewa, ko gyara rajista ba tare da wani hatsarin tsarin ko jinkiri mai tsanani ba.  Ƙarfin ajiya  zai ya ɗauki kayan aiki Bayanai har zuwa shekaru 2 ba tare da buƙatar ƙarin hanyoyin adana bayanai na da hannu ba. Bukatun Dogara 12 12a <TECH>Amincewa Bukatun Gudanar da Rajistar Wurin Wasanni Aikace-aikacen, Amincewa yana da matuƙar muhimmanci don tabbatar da aiki mai sauƙi, ba tare da katsewa ba ga manajojin wurin da masu amfani. Za a ƙididdige buƙatun Amincewa bisa ga matsakaicin lokacin hutu da ƙimar gazawa da aka yarda, musamman idan aka yi la'akari da tsarin yin rajista da biyan kuɗi na ainihin lokaci. Wannan yana tabbatar da cewa masu amfani za su iya amincewa da aikace-aikacen  don yin rajistar wuraren wasanni ba tare da jinkiri ko kurakurai ba. Dole ne manhajar  ta kasance abin dogaro sosai don kiyaye amincin mai amfani da kuma biyan buƙatun aiki, musamman tunda rajistar lokaci da biyan kuɗi na ainihin lokaci sune manyan ayyuka. Tabbatar da Amincewa zai hana ƙwarewar mai amfani mara kyau da kuma inganta aikin  na wuraren wasanni. Saita tsammanin da ya dace game da gazawa da murmurewa kuma yana taimakawa wajen sarrafa tsammanin mai amfani kuma yana ba da gudummawa ga gamsuwar abokin ciniki mafi kyau. Abubuwan da ake buƙata na AMINCI sune:  Aikace-aikacen   zai sami matsakaicin adadin gazawar sau ɗaya a wata.  Ba za a rasa ko lalata bayanan <TECH>mai amfani  <TECH> ba idan ya gaza.  Tsarin <TECH> <TECH> yakamata ya tabbatar da cewa an adana bayanan  kuma za a iya dawo da su idan lokacin dakatarwar tsarin  ko faɗuwa ya faru.  Aikace-aikacen <TECH> dole ne ya murmure ta atomatik daga gazawar, tare da masu amfani suna fuskantar ƙarancin katsewar sabis.  Za a sanar da masu amfani game da duk wani lokacin dakatarwa ko gazawar, tare da kimanta lokacin dawowa, kuma za a ba da fifiko ga ayyuka masu mahimmanci kamar yin rajista akai-akai ko biyan kuɗi don gyarawa. 33

translation.en: Software Requirements Specification for Bug Tracking Page 20 System – Language preferences should be configurable per user. • Date, Time, and Currency Formatting: – All dates and times must follow the ISO 8601 standard by default but allow user-specific regional formats (e.g., DD/MM/YYYY or MM/DD/YYYY). • Character Encoding: – All text fields must support UTF-8 encoding to accommodate special charac- ters and scripts. 6.3 Legal and Regulatory Requirements The Bug Tracking System must comply with applicable laws and regulations to ensure its lawful use and operation. • Data Privacy: – The system must comply with GDPR, CCPA, or other applicable data pro- tection regulations. – User data must be encrypted both in transit and at rest. – Users must have the ability to request data deletion or anonymization as per regulatory requirements. • Accessibility Standards: – The system must conform to WCAG 2.1 AA accessibility standards to ensure usability for individuals with disabilities. • Audit and Compliance: – All system logs must be retained for a minimum of one year to meet compliance and audit requirements. – Regular penetration testing must be conducted to ensure security compliance. 6.4 Reuse Objectives To reduce development time and cost, the Bug Tracking System must incorporate reusable components wherever feasible. • Code Reusability: – Modular design principles must be employed to facilitate the reuse of compo- nents across different projects or modules. – Common utilities, such as authentication modules and database access layers, must be abstracted for reuse. • Open Source Libraries:

translation.en: Development of Mineral and Energy Resources MODULE - 8 Economic activities and Table 23.4 Production of Bauxite in India Infrastructural development in Year Production (in thousand tonnes) India 1951 68.1 1961 475.9 1971 1,517.1 1981 1,954.6 Notes 1991 4,977.0 2004-2005 11598.0 Source: India 2006: A Reference Annual p.570 Distribution Bauxite has a wide occurrence in the country. Major reserves occur in Jharkhand, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Chhatisgarh, Gujarat, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Goa and Uttar Pradesh. Jharkhand accounts for 13 percent of India’s total reserves and 37 percent of the country’s total production. The important deposits are located in Palamau, Ranchi and Lohardaga districts. Gujarat contributes 12 percent to the total production and equal percentage to the total reserves of the country. The deposits are found in the Bhavnagar, Junagadh and Amreli districts. Madhya Pradesh and Chhatisgarh accounts for 22 percent of the total reserves of the country and 25 percent of the total production. The three important bauxite ore regions in these states are Sarguja, Raigarh and Bilaspur districts in the Amarkantak Plateau; Maikala range in Bilaspur, Durg (bothe these regions are in Chhatisgarh), Mandla, Shahdole and Balaghat districts; and Katni district in Madhya Pradesh. Maharashtra accounts for a relatively small production of the country, 18 percent of the total, but possesses the second largest bauxite reserves consisting of 22 percent of the country’s total reserves. Bauxite occurs in Kolhapur, Raigarh, Thana, Satara and Ratnagiri districts. In Karnataka the reserves of bauxite occur in the north-western parts of Belgaum district. Huge deposits of bauxite have been discovered in the eastern ghats in Orissa and Andhra Pradesh, Salem, Nilgiri and Madurai district of Tamil Nadu, and Banda district of Uttar Pradesh also have workable deposits of bauxite. India exports bauxite to a number of countries. The leading importer of Indian bauxite is Italy, followed by the U.K., West Germany and Japan. GEOGRAPHY 171
translation.ha: Ci gaban Albarkatun Ma'adinai da Makamashi MASU KYAU - 8 Ayyukan tattalin arziki da Tebur 23.4 Samar da Bauxite a Indiya Ci gaban kayayyakin more rayuwa a cikin Noman Shekara (a cikin tan dubu) Indiya 1951 68.1 1961 475.9 1971 1,517.1 1981 1,954.6 Bayanan kula 1991 4,977.0 2004-2005 11598.0 Tushe: Indiya 2006: Bayani na Shekara shafi na 570 Rarraba Bauxite yana da faɗi a ƙasar. Manyan ajiyar kuɗi suna faruwa a Jharkhand, Maharashtra, Madhya Pradesh, Chhatisgarh, Gujarat, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Goa da Uttar Pradesh. Jharkhand ya kai kashi 13 cikin ɗari na jimlar ajiyar kuɗi na Indiya da kashi 37 cikin ɗari na jimlar samar da kayayyaki na ƙasar. Muhimman ajiyar kuɗi suna cikin gundumomin Palamau, Ranchi da Lohardaga. Gujarat tana ba da gudummawar kashi 12 cikin 100 ga jimillar samar da kayayyaki da kuma daidai da kashi ɗaya bisa 100 na jimillar ajiyar ƙasar. Ana samun ajiyar a gundumomin Bhavnagar, Junagadh da Amreli. Madhya Pradesh da Chhatisgarh suna da kashi 22 cikin 100 na jimillar ajiyar ƙasar da kuma kashi 25 cikin 100 na jimillar samar da kayayyaki. Manyan yankunan ma'adinan bauxite guda uku a waɗannan jihohin sune gundumomin Sarguja, Raigarh da Bilaspur a cikin Amarkantak Plateau; Maikala a cikin Bilaspur, Durg (duk waɗannan yankuna suna cikin Chhatisgarh), Mandla, Shahdole da Balaghat; da kuma gundumar Katni a Madhya Pradesh. Maharashtra tana da ƙarancin samar da kayayyaki a ƙasar, kashi 18 cikin 100 na jimillar, amma tana da mafi girman ajiyar bauxite na biyu wanda ya ƙunshi kashi 22 cikin 100 na jimillar ajiyar ƙasar. Bauxite yana faruwa ne a gundumomin Kolhapur, Raigarh, Thana, Satara da Ratnagiri. A Karnataka, ajiyar bauxite yana faruwa ne a yankunan arewa maso yamma na gundumar Belgaum. An gano ma'adanai masu yawa na bauxite a gabashin ghats a Orissa da Andhra Pradesh, Salem, Nilgiri da gundumar Madurai ta Tamil Nadu, kuma gundumar Banda ta Uttar Pradesh ita ma tana da ma'adanai masu aiki na bauxite. Indiya tana fitar da bauxite zuwa ƙasashe da dama. Babban mai shigo da bauxite na Indiya shine Italiya, sai kuma Burtaniya, Yammacin Jamus da Japan. GEOGRAPHY 171

translation.en: 199 Smruti R. Sarangi value of the loop index and the target addresses; hence, the compiler can easily analyze such loops and let the hardware know about the loop continuation and termination information. Traditional Branch Prediction Not all branches are that well behaved. We thus do need high per- formance branch predictors. Itanium has a large PAp branch predictor that can predict branches very well. Multi-way Branches Note that Itanium instructions are stored in 3-instruction bundles. Typically, compilers ensure that the last instruction in a bundle is a branch. This means that just in case it is mispredicted, the earlier instructions in the bundle are still on the correct path. However, this is not always possible. Just in case there are multiple branches within a bundle, we need a method to handle this situation. Note that in this case, if we consider a bundle as a whole, it is a multi-way branch statement. It has many possible targets depending on the behavior of the branches contained within it. Such a set of branches is also referred to as a multi-way branch. We need to predict the first taken branch within a bundle. This means that if a bundle has three instructions, we have four possible choices for the first instruction that succeeds the current bundle: default, target of the first instruction, target of the second instruction, or the target of the third instruction. Itanium uses a history based predictor for each bundle. This predicts the first instruction that is most likely a taken branch. Once we predict this instruction, we can get its target from the branch target cache. Itanium has other traditional modules such as the return address stack. They were already dis- cussed in Chapter 3. Loop Exit Prediction After we decode the instructions, we get to know of the opcodes of all the instructionsincludingthebrancheswithinabundle. AtthisstageItaniumusesaperfectloop-exit predictor, which can override earlier predictions. We need to initialize this predictor with the iteration count of the loop. The compiler marks the loop-branch (branch that takes us to the beginning of the loop) with a special instruction. The loop exit predictor keeps decrementing the loop count, every time we encounter this instruction. It can thus figure out the last iteration, and we can avoid mispredicting the last branch in a loop. This is not a very effective optimization for largeloops(largenumberofiterations). However,forsmallloops,thisisaverygoodoptimization; it avoids a lot of mispredictions. Thelaststageofthefetchunitalsohastheroleofprocessingsoftwareinitiatedprefetchinstructions. Itanium’s compiler plays a fairly aggressive role in prefetching instructions. 5.6.3 Instruction Dispersal Stage Afterfetchingallourinstructions,wekeeptheinstructionbundlesinthedecouplingbuffer. Havingsuch buffers reduces the mismatch between the rate of fetching instructions and the rate of executing them. Let us now look at instruction dispersal or instruction delivery – providing instructions to the exe- cution units. Our explicit aim was to avoid the use of schedulers. Hence, we need to find a way to avoid data and structural hazards without using expensive hardware such as an instruction window, wakeup, select and broadcast hardware. We disperse (synonym of dispatch in the current context) two bundles of instructions (6 instructions) at a time via the issue ports. The Itanium processor has 9 issue ports: 2 for memory, 2 for integer, 2 for floating point, and 3 for branch instructions. Within each bundle, we disperse the instructions from the earlier to the later. For dispersing instructions, we need to respect both data and control dependences. Let us elaborate on how these are handled. Data Hazards Ideally, the compiler should find three instructions that are absolutely independent and place them in a bundle. However, this is not always possible. In such cases, we do have the option of putting
translation.ha: 199 Smruti R. Darajar madaukai na madaukai da adireshin manufa; saboda haka, mai tarawa zai iya yin nazarin irin waɗannan madaukai cikin sauƙi kuma ya sanar da kayan aikin game da ci gaba da ƙarewa na madaukai bayani. Hasashen Reshe na Gargajiya Ba duk rassan suna da ɗabi'a mai kyau ba. Don haka muna buƙatar masu hasashen reshe mai aiki mai girma. Itanium yana da babban mai hasashen reshe na PAp wanda zai iya annabta rassan sosai. Rassa masu hanyoyi da yawa Lura cewa umarnin Itanium an adana su a cikin fakitin umarni 3. Yawanci, masu tarawa suna tabbatar da cewa umarni na ƙarshe a cikin fakiti reshe ne. Wannan yana nufin cewa idan ba a yi hasashensa ba daidai ba, umarnin da ya gabata a cikin fakitin har yanzu suna kan hanya madaidaiciya. Duk da haka, wannan ba koyaushe zai yiwu ba. Kawai idan akwai rassa da yawa a cikin fakiti, muna buƙatar hanyar magance wannan yanayin. Lura cewa a wannan yanayin, idan muka yi la'akari da fakiti gaba ɗaya, bayanin reshe ne mai hanyoyi da yawa. Yana da manufofi da yawa masu yiwuwa dangane da halayen rassan da ke cikin sa. Irin wannan saitin rassan kuma ana kiransa reshe mai hanyoyi da yawa. Muna buƙatar yin hasashen reshen farko da aka ɗauka a cikin wani tsari. Wannan yana nufin cewa idan wani tsari yana da umarni uku, muna da zaɓuɓɓuka huɗu masu yiwuwa don umarnin farko wanda ya maye gurbin tsarin na yanzu: tsoho, manufa ta umarnin farko, manufa ta umarni na biyu, ko manufar umarni na uku. Itanium yana amfani da hasashen tarihi bisa ga kowane tsari. Wannan yana annabta umarni na farko wanda wataƙila reshe ne da aka ɗauka. Da zarar mun annabta wannan umarni, za mu iya samun manufarsa daga ma'ajiyar manufa ta reshe. Itanium yana da wasu kayan aiki na gargajiya kamar tarin adireshin dawowa. An riga an tattauna su a Babi na 3. Hasashen Fita na Madaukai Bayan mun fassara umarnin, za mu san lambobin opcode na duk umarnin, gami da rassan da ke da bundle. AtthisstageItaniumusesaperfectloop-exit predictor, wanda zai iya shawo kan hasashen da ya gabata. Muna buƙatar fara wannan mai annabta tare da ƙidaya maimaita madauki. Mai tarawa yana nuna reshe na madauki (reshe wanda ke kai mu farkon madauki) tare da umarni na musamman. Mai hasashen fitowar madauki yana ci gaba da rage adadin madauki, duk lokacin da muka ci karo da wannan umarni. Don haka zai iya gano maimaitawa ta ƙarshe, kuma za mu iya guje wa yin kuskuren hasashen reshen ƙarshe a cikin madauki. Wannan ba ingantaccen haɓakawa bane ga manyan madauki (yawan madauki). Duk da haka, ga ƙananan madauki, wannan ingantaccen haɓakawa ne; yana guje wa yawan hasashe mara kyau. Mataki na ƙarshe na na'urar ɗaukowa kuma yana da matakin sarrafawa na software wanda aka fara amfani da shi kafin a fara amfani da shi. Mai tarawa na Itanium yana taka rawa sosai wajen ɗaukar umarni kafin a fara amfani da shi. 5.6.3 Matakin Watsawa na Umarni Bayan ɗaukar umarni, muna kiyaye tarin umarni a cikin ma'aunin haɗin kai. Samun irin waɗannan madauki yana rage rashin daidaito tsakanin ƙimar umarnin ɗaukowa da ƙimar aiwatar da su. Bari yanzu mu kalli watsawa ko isar da umarni - samar da umarni ga sassan aiwatarwa. Manufarmu a bayyane ita ce mu guji amfani da masu tsara jadawalin. Saboda haka, muna buƙatar nemo hanyar da za mu guji Bayanai da haɗarin tsarin ba tare da amfani da kayan aiki masu tsada kamar taga umarni, farkawa, zaɓi da watsa kayan aikin ba. Muna watsa (kama da aikawa a cikin mahallin da ake ciki) fakiti biyu na umarni (umarni 6) a lokaci guda ta hanyar tashoshin fitarwa. Mai sarrafa Itanium yana da tashoshin fitarwa 9: 2 don ƙwaƙwalwa, 2 don lamba, 2 don wurin iyo, da 3 don umarnin reshe. A cikin kowane fakiti, muna watsa umarnin daga baya zuwa na gaba. Don umarnin watsawa, muna buƙatar girmama Bayanai da kuma sarrafa dogaro. Bari mu yi bayani dalla-dalla kan yadda ake sarrafa waɗannan. BayaniHaɗari Mafi kyau, mai tarawa ya kamata ya nemo umarni uku waɗanda suke da cikakken 'yanci kuma ya sanya su a cikin fakiti. Duk da haka, wannan ba koyaushe zai yiwu ba. translation.en: The Pepper Telemarketing System is a new software system that replaces the current manual system for making telemarketing calls and managing the data that is used in the process. translation.en: The targeted software product is a Recommendation System. The system makes an extensive use of user data to come up with reasonable track predictions about user preferences and there are two main paradigms in this sense: Content-based and collaborative filtering. As a beginning, the scope of the system is scaled down to content-based filtering. Content based filtering is a technique that is used to recommend movies. Apart from providing recommendations the system also provides posters of the Movies along with Release Date, Budget, Revenue, Popularity, Similarity between selected Movie and an Overview as well. The System uses the concept of vectorization based on common features and uses Cosine Similarity with respect to each other vectors to determine the most similar movies. The system is aimed to have additional solutions for big data and sparse information. The Movies Dataset is taken from Kaggle. Kaggle allows users to collaborate with other users, find and publish datasets, use GPU integrated notebooks, and compete with other data scientists to solve data science challenges. The project limits the improvement of the recommendation system around these challenges and favors accuracy over performance while giving the final suggestions. As a milestone, the system should follow the methods to enhance accuracy, the performance enhancements are not included in the scope. The Recommender System will be a Web Service and the end users will be directly exposed to the suggestions made for them.
translation.ha: Samfurin software da aka yi niyya shine Shawarar Tsarin. Tsarin  yana amfani da bayanai na <TECH>mai amfani  sosai don fito da hasashen hanya mai ma'ana game da fifikon mai amfani kuma akwai manyan misalai guda biyu a wannan ma'anar: Tace bayanai na tushen abun ciki da haɗin gwiwa. A matsayin farko, an rage girman tsarin  zuwa tace bayanai na tushen abun ciki. Tace bayanai na tushen abun ciki wata dabara ce da ake amfani da ita don ba da shawarar fina-finai. Baya ga bayar da shawarwari tsarin  yana kuma ba da fosta na Fina-finai tare da Ranar Fitowa, Kasafin Kudi, Kudaden Shiga, Shahara, Kamanceceniya tsakanin Fina-finai da aka zaɓa da Bayani. Tsarin  yana amfani da manufar vectorization bisa ga fasaloli gama gari kuma yana amfani da Cosine Similarity dangane da juna vectors don tantance fina-finai mafi kama da juna. Tsarin  yana da nufin samun ƙarin mafita don manyan Bayanai da ƙananan bayanai. An ɗauko saitin bayanai na Fina-finai daga Kaggle. Kaggle yana bawa masu amfani damar yin aiki tare da sauran masu amfani, nemo da buga bayanan bayanai, amfani da litattafan rubutu na GPU da aka haɗa, da kuma yin gogayya da sauran masana kimiyya na Bayanai don magance ƙalubalen kimiyya na Bayanai. Aikin yana iyakance inganta tsarin shawarwarin Tsarin a kusa da waɗannan ƙalubalen kuma yana fifita daidaito fiye da function yayin da yake ba da shawarwari na ƙarshe. A matsayin wani muhimmin ci gaba, tsarin Tsarin  yakamata ya bi hanyoyin inganta daidaito, haɓaka aikin function ba a haɗa shi cikin ma'aunin ba. translation.en: Software Requirements Specification for Elysium Page 19 3.3.5 Use Case #5 Author - This use case was written by Maharajan J and Sankalp Mittal. Purpose - To pair individuals who are looking for playmates. Requirements Traceability - Many users might not have a partner to play the game with, so this feature allows them to find playmates and enjoy the game. Priority - The priority of this use case is medium as it is one of the additional features of this application and any problems in this use case will decrease the scope of this application. Preconditions - The selection of sport and the preferred timeslot(s) must be completed before the pair matching begins. Post conditions - The user can check after the booking period is over whether they have been allotted a pair and a court and will get the details of their partner and their allotted timeslot. Actors - The players who need a playmate will be the ones triggering this use case. Exceptions - If there are odd number of people looking for a pair one person will not be a part of any pair and will not be included in the slot allotment algorithm. Includes - Use Case #1

translation.en: Student grading system  Identify the stakeholders: Identify the stakeholders involved in the implementation and testing phase, including the project team, end-users, and any external stakeholders.  Allocate resources: Determine the resources needed for the implementation and testing phase, including personnel, equipment, and budget.  Develop a deployment plan: Develop a plan for deploying the system to the production environment, including the installation process, configuration of hardware and software components, and testing of the system.  Develop a testing plan: Develop a plan for testing the system, including the types of tests to be performed, the testing environment, and the criteria for success.  Develop a training plan: Develop a plan for training end-users on how to use the system effectively, including the training methods and materials.  Define metrics and monitoring: Define the metrics and monitoring processes that will be used to measure the success of the implementation and testing phase, including performance metrics and user feedback.  Develop a contingency plan: Develop a contingency plan for addressing any issues or problems that may arise during the implementation and testing phase. By developing a startup strategy for the implementation and testing phase of a student grading management system, you can ensure that the system is deployed successfully and that any issues are identified and addressed quickly, minimizing the impact on end-users. ------------Chapter 4--------- 4.1 Algorithm Design and Coding Here is an example of an algorithm design and coding for a simple task of calculating the average grade for a student based on inputted grades: Algorithm Design: Initialize a variable sum to 0 to hold the sum of grades. Initialize a variable count to 0 to keep track of the number of grades entered. Ask the user to input grades until they indicate they are done. For each grade entered, add it to the sum and increment count by 1. Calculate the average grade by dividing the sum by count.
translation.ha: Tsarin tantance ɗalibai tsarin  Gano masu ruwa da tsaki: Gano masu ruwa da tsaki da ke cikin matakin aiwatarwa da gwaji, gami da ƙungiyar aikin, masu amfani da ƙarshen, da duk wani mai ruwa da tsaki na waje.  Raba albarkatu: Tantance albarkatun da ake buƙata don matakin aiwatarwa da gwaji, gami da ma'aikata, kayan aiki, da kasafin kuɗi.  Ƙirƙirar tsarin tura sojoji: Ƙirƙiri shirin tura tsarin zuwa yanayin samarwa, gami da tsarin shigarwa, daidaitawar kayan aiki da software, da gwajin tsarin tsarin.  Ƙirƙiri tsarin gwaji: Ƙirƙiri tsarin gwada tsarin, gami da nau'ikan gwaje-gwajen da za a yi, yanayin gwaji, da kuma sharuɗɗan nasara.  Ƙirƙiri tsarin horarwa: Ƙirƙiri tsarin horar da masu amfani da ƙarshen sojoji kan yadda ake amfani da tsarin tsarin yadda ya kamata, gami da hanyoyin horo da kayan aiki.  Bayyana ma'auni da sa ido: Bayyana ma'auni da hanyoyin sa ido da za a yi amfani da su don auna nasarar matakin aiwatarwa da gwaji, gami da ma'aunin aiwatarwa da kuma ra'ayoyin masu amfani .  Samar da tsarin gaggawa: Samar da tsarin gaggawa don magance duk wata matsala ko matsaloli da <TECH>zasu iya tasowa a lokacin aiwatarwa da gwaji. translation.en: The online market is flooded with the availability of online stores including a third party involved either in the case of storage or in the case of delivery/distribution, which normally includes a huge amount of money being expensed in the both shipping and extra charges.So to overcome such concepts we have decided to make a customer to customer transaction based online system where the buyers and sellers make a reasonable discussion of the product involved to make a deal among themselves. With the partial fulfillment of the semester wise project, a need for the study of database and some designing was a must, and what better a way to study all those than to design a functional website. Current online websites involves a third party with the charges of shipping involving many extra charges which is completely reduced in our website, also reducing the over prince hike in the normal products.

translation.en: MODULE - 2 Major Landforms and their Economic Significance Changing face of the Earth  enumerate major types of plains and explain their influence on human life;  locate major mountains, plateaus and plains on the outline map of the world. Notes 7.1 MOUNTAINS Mountain, plateau and plain are broad by present day land features of the earth’s surface produced by the deformation of its crust. Among them, mountains are the most awe-inspiring landform. About 27% of the earth’s surface is covered by the mountains. Generally, they are uplifted portions of the earth’s surface which are much higher in contrast to the surrounding areas. But all uplifted or elevated areas are not mountains. In fact height and slope together give rise to a particular form of land which we identify as a landform. For example, the elevated portion in Tibet, which is about 4500 metres high above sea level, is called a plateau and not a mountain. It may also be remembered that the formation of a mountain range takes millions of years. During these years, the internal forces of the earth uplifting the land are fighting against erosion wearing it down. In order to form one Mt. Everest, internal forces must push up the land faster than the external forces constantly eroding it. Therefore, mountains are those uplifted portions of the earth’s surface which have steep slopes and small summit area rising more than thousand metres above the sea level. Mountains have the maximum difference of height between their high and low portions.  The uplifted portions of the earth’s surface with steep slopes and small summit area rising above 1000 metres and formed over a period of million of years are called mountains. 7.2 CLASSIFICATION OF MOUNTAINS On the basis of their mode of formation, the mountains have been classified as: (a) Fold Mountains (b) Block Mountains (c) Volcanic Mountains (d) Residual Mountains (a) Fold Mountains We have studied in the last lesson how folds are formed in the rock strata by the internal earth movements. Mountain range mainly consisting of uplifted folded sedimentary rocks are called fold mountains. When these rocks are subjected to horizontal compressional forces for millions of years, they get 122 GEOGRAPHY
translation.ha: MASU KYAU - 2 Manyan Filaye da Muhimmancinsu a Tattalin Arziki Canjin fuskar Duniya  lissafa manyan nau'ikan filaye kuma bayyana tasirinsu ga rayuwar ɗan adam;  gano manyan duwatsu, filayen tuddai da filayen a taswirar duniya. Bayani 7.1 DUTSE Dutse, filayen tuddai da filayen tuddai suna da faɗi ta hanyar fasalin ƙasa na yanzu na saman duniya wanda aka samar ta hanyar nakasar ɓawon burodi. Daga cikinsu, duwatsu sune mafi ban mamaki. Kimanin kashi 27% na saman duniya duwatsu ne suka rufe shi. Gabaɗaya, su ne sassan da aka ɗaga sama na saman duniya waɗanda suka fi girma idan aka kwatanta da yankunan da ke kewaye. Amma duk wuraren da aka ɗaga sama ko sama ba tsaunuka ba ne. A gaskiya ma tsayi da gangara tare suna haifar da wani nau'in ƙasa wanda muke gane shi a matsayin ƙasa. Misali, ana kiran ɓangaren da aka ɗaga sama a Tibet, wanda yake da tsayin mita 4500 sama da matakin teku, plateau ba dutse ba. Haka kuma ana iya tunawa da cewa samuwar tsaunuka yana ɗaukar miliyoyin shekaru. A cikin waɗannan shekarun, ƙarfin cikin ƙasa da ke ɗaga ƙasar yana yaƙi da zaizayar ƙasa da ke lalata ta. Domin samar da wani Dutsen Everest, ƙarfin cikin ƙasa dole ne ya tura ƙasar da sauri fiye da ƙarfin waje da ke lalata ta akai-akai. Saboda haka, duwatsu su ne waɗanda aka ɗaga saman duniya waɗanda ke da gangara mai tsayi da ƙaramin yanki na saman teku da ke tashi sama da mita dubu. Duwatsu suna da matsakaicin bambanci na tsayi tsakanin manyan da ƙananan sassansu.  Sassan da aka ɗaga na saman duniya tare da gangara mai tsayi da ƙaramin yanki na saman da ke tashi sama da mita 1000 kuma aka samar tsawon shekaru miliyan ana kiransu duwatsu. 7.2 RANGWAMEN DUTSE Dangane da yanayin samuwarsu, an rarraba duwatsun zuwa: (a) Duwatsu masu ninka (b) Duwatsu masu tubali (c) Duwatsu masu aman wuta (d) Duwatsu masu saura (a) Duwatsu masu ninka Mun yi nazari a darasin ƙarshe yadda ake samar da naɗe-naɗe a cikin sassan duwatsu ta hanyar motsin ƙasa na ciki. Tsarin tsaunuka galibi waɗanda suka ƙunshi duwatsu masu naɗe-naɗe masu tsayi ana kiransu duwatsu masu ninka. Idan waɗannan duwatsu suka fuskanci matsin lamba a kwance tsawon miliyoyin shekaru, suna samun 122 GEOGRAPHY

translation.en: Actor: Pilot of Sub-6. 1. Calculate distance of object from Sub-6 using received sonar data. 2. The detected objects show up on the Sub-6 sonar in the control panel and display the calculated distance from the Sub-6. 3. The Sub-6 software system analyzes the size of the object based on the received sonar data. 4. The Sub-6 software system determines that the object is a shark based on the size and changes the blip on sonar to an “X”. 5. The pilot of Sub-6 has determined if the shark is threatening to the herd/Sub-6. Outcome: The pilot of Sub-6 has successfully determined that there is a shark, whether the shark is a threat to the herd/Sub-6, based on information regarding the shark’s location, direction and speed. Product Use Case Name: Deploy Sting Trigger: Detected a shark and determined to be threat to herd Preconditions: Sub-6 is already moving in the water and has someone controlling the submarine, the pilot knows the location, direction and speed of the shark, Sting is loaded, camera is displaying to the screen, Combat Mode is turned on. Interested Stakeholders: Pilot of sub-6, Herman melville, vet med submarine, porpoise, whales, weapons manufacturer, security detecting company. Actor: Pilot of Sub-6. 1. The pilot of Sub-6 selects a shark (“X”) on the sonar display in the control panel. 2. The Sub-6 software system determines if the shark is in range for Sting based on location and speed of shark 3. The Sub-6 software system begins the Combat Mode target auto locking process. 4. The Sub-6 Combat Mode deploys the Sting 5. The Sub-6 Combat Mode retracts Sting 6. If all threats to the herd have been neutralized then combat mode is turned off. Outcome: The shark is no longer a threat to the herd/Sub-6, Sting is retracted, pilot has given radio report to Herman Melville. Combat mode Product Use Case Name: Display Status of Subsystems and Devices

translation.en: Chapter 2 2 Overall Descriptions 2.1 Product perspective There are many resources planning system all around the world. But many of them are in English language and implemented cost is very high. By using this application can do a better resource planning system relates to the student registration management in Sinhala language. System interfaces will be very familiar with users and it is very useful and by going through these can do better resource plan. This web application is a cloud base web application. So it is very useful to keep relation with other details which are related to Examination management such as registered student details. So user can easily access other relevant details also. 2.1.1 System interfaces To use web interface of Openbravo 3 any modern office system would work. Since Openbravo is a web application it can be used on any device that is capable of running current web browser. As with most web based applications, a faster CPU and more RAM makes the GUI snappier and more pleasant to use. Larger displays also make users more productive using wide grids, forms and multiple tabs. For the system interface it is essential to have some system interface such as  Operating System.  PostgreSQL server 9.5.x  Apache Tomcat 7  Ant server  Java development Kit (JDK) 2.1.2 User interfaces All interfaces are user friendly, very useful and easy to use. Personal sable Workspace and Widgets Enjoy an easily customizable portal-style home page from which users can directly access all recently visited windows and documents, and administer the available widgets. Widgets are user interface elements that can be either placed in any users' workspace tab or be part of a generated window. They can be used to display a wide range of different information ranging from static content, dynamic database data in list form, custom html content, or complete external URL's. May 2016 Sri Lanka Institute of Information Technology

translation.en: MODULE - 7 Our Resources Natural resources and thier develop- ment in India INTEXT QUESTIONS 19.2 1. How much area of India is under forests? ________________________________________________________ Notes 2. Name the state or Union Territory having the highest and the lowest propor- tional share of forest cover in the country. ________________________________________________________ 3. Name six types of vegetation found in India. ________________________________________________________ 4. How many species of animals are found in India? ________________________________________________________ 5. What are the shares of India in total buffalo and cattle population in the world? ________________________________________________________ 6. Name four types of fishing done in India. ________________________________________________________ 19.4 DISTRIBUTION OF ABIOTIC RESOURCES Land resources: India covers an area of 32,87,263 sq km. According to area size, it is the seventh largest country of the world after Russia, Canada, China, U.S.A., Brazil and Egypt. This vast size itself is the most important resource. About 30 per cent of area is covered by the mountains which are source of scenic beauty, perennial rivers, home of forests and wildlife. About 43 per cent of land area is plain which is highly suitable for agriculture. Remaining about 27 percent under plateaus is the store house of minerals and metals. Water resources: India is fortunate to have large water resources. Diversity in resources is the result of diversity in land forms in the form of glaciers, surface rivers and underground water, rains and oceans. The average annual rainfall is estimated at 117 cm. Rivers are major source of surface water in India. The Indus, the Ganga, the Brahamputra carry about 60 per cent of the total surface water. Replenishable groundwater potential in India is about 434 billion cubic metres. Today, over 70 per cent of the population uses ground water for its domestic needs and more than half of irrigation is obtained from this source. Mineral resources: India is very rich in mineral resources and has the potential to become an industrial power. It possesses large reserves of iron ore, extensive deposits of coal, mineral oil, rich deposits of bauxite and mica. Jharkhand, Orissa and Chhattisgarh possess large concentration of mineral deposits, accounting for nearly three–fourths of the country’s coal deposits. Other important minerals found in our country are iron ore, manganese, mica, bauxite and radioactive minerals. 78 GEOGRAPHY
translation.ha: MASU KYAU - 7 Albarkatunmu Albarkatun ƙasa da ci gaban su a Indiya TAMBAYOYIN JIN DAƊI 19.2 1. Nawa yanki na Indiya yake ƙarƙashin dazuzzuka? __________________________________________________ Bayani 2. Faɗi jihar ko Yankin Tarayyar da ke da mafi girma da mafi ƙarancin rabon kaso na kariyar dazuzzuka a ƙasar. __________________________________________________ 3. Faɗi nau'ikan ciyayi guda shida da ake samu a Indiya. __________________________________________________ 4. Nau'ikan dabbobi nawa ake samu a Indiya? __________________________________________________________________ 5. Menene hannun jarin Indiya a cikin jimillar yawan bauna da shanu a duniya? __________________________________________________________________ 6. Faɗi nau'ikan kamun kifi guda huɗu da ake yi a Indiya. __________________________________________________________________ 19.4 RARRABA ALBARKAR ABIOTIC Albarkatun ƙasa: Indiya ta mamaye yanki mai fadin murabba'in kilomita 32,87,263. Dangane da girman yanki, ita ce ƙasa ta bakwai mafi girma a duniya bayan Rasha, Kanada, China, Amurka, Brazil da Masar. Wannan babban girman kanta shine mafi mahimmanci. Kimanin kashi 30 cikin 100 na yankin yana cike da tsaunuka waɗanda suke tushen kyawawan wurare, koguna masu ɗorewa, gidan dazuzzuka da namun daji. Kimanin kashi 43 cikin 100 na faɗin ƙasa fili ne wanda ya dace da noma. Sauran kashi 27 cikin 100 a ƙarƙashin tuddai shine ma'ajiyar ma'adanai da ƙarfe. Albarkatun ruwa: Indiya tana da sa'a da samun manyan albarkatun ruwa. Bambancin albarkatu sakamakon bambancin yanayin ƙasa ne a cikin nau'in ƙanƙara, koguna na saman ruwa da ruwan ƙarƙashin ƙasa, ruwan sama da tekuna. Matsakaicin ruwan sama na shekara-shekara ana kiyasta shine 117 cm. Koguna sune babban tushen ruwan saman a Indiya. Indus, Ganga, da Brahamputra suna ɗauke da kusan kashi 60 cikin 100 na jimlar ruwan saman. Ikon ruwan ƙasa mai cikewa a Indiya shine kimanin mita 434 biliyan cubic. A yau, sama da kashi 70 cikin 100 na al'umma suna amfani da ruwan ƙasa don buƙatun gida kuma ana samun fiye da rabin ban ruwa daga wannan tushen. Albarkatun ma'adinai: Indiya tana da wadataccen albarkatun ma'adinai kuma tana da damar zama ƙarfin masana'antu. Tana da tarin ma'adanai masu yawa na ƙarfe, tarin ma'adanai na kwal, man ma'adinai, tarin ma'adanai masu yawa na bauxite da mica. Jharkhand, Orissa da Chhattisgarh suna da tarin ma'adanai masu yawa, wanda ya kai kusan kashi uku cikin huɗu na ma'adanai na kwal na ƙasar. Sauran muhimman ma'adanai da ake samu a ƙasarmu sune ma'adinan ƙarfe, manganese, mica, bauxite da ma'adanai masu rediyoaktif. 78 GEOGRAPHY

translation.en: MMH When organizing the document for an CLMS, it's essential to provide a logical sequence that allows readers to grasp the key information they need. Here's a suggested sequence for reading the document, starting with the overview sections and then proceeding through sections that are most pertinent to each reader type: o Introduction and Executive Summary: Begin with an introduction that provides an overview of the document's purpose, scope, and objectives. Follow it with an executive summary that highlights the key features and benefits of the CLMS. o General Overview: Provide a general overview of the CLMS, including its main functionalities, target audience, and the benefits it offers. This section can be useful for all reader types to get a high-level understanding of the CLMS. o Developers: a. Technical Architecture: Explain the technical architecture of the CLMS, including its components, database structure, and integrations with other systems. b. APIs and Integration: Describe the available APIs and integration options, including documentation on how to interact with the CLMS programmatically. c. Customization and Extension: Provide guidance on how developers can customize and extend the CLMS to meet specific requirements. o Project Managers: a. Project Timeline and Planning: Present a detailed project timeline, outlining the different stages, milestones, and dependencies involved in implementing the CLMS. b. Resource Allocation: Provide information on the resources required for successful CLMS implementation, including human resources, budget, and infrastructure needs. c. Deployment Strategies: Explain various deployment options and their implications, such as cloud-based hosting or on-premises installation. d. Risk Management: Discuss potential risks associated with CLMS implementation and strategies to mitigate them. o Marketing Staff: a. Key Features and Benefits: Highlight the CLMS's key features and the benefits it offers to potential users, emphasizing its unique selling points. b. Target Market Analysis: Provide insights into the target market for the CLMS, including industry trends, user demographics, and competitor analysis. c. Marketing Collateral: Include sample marketing collateral, such as brochures, presentations, or videos, to help marketing staff effectively promote the CLMS.
translation.ha: MMH Lokacin shirya takardar don LMS na C, yana da mahimmanci a samar da tsari mai ma'ana wanda zai ba masu karatu damar fahimtar mahimman bayanan C da suke buƙata. Ga jerin da aka ba da shawara don karanta takardar, farawa da sassan taƙaitaccen bayani sannan a ci gaba da sassan da suka fi dacewa da kowane nau'in mai karatu: o Gabatarwa da Takaitaccen Bayani na Zartarwa: Fara da gabatarwa wanda ke ba da taƙaitaccen bayani game da manufar takardar, iyakokinta, da manufofinta. Bi shi da taƙaitaccen bayani wanda ke nuna mahimman fasaloli da fa'idodin CLMS. o Bayani na Gabaɗaya: Bayar da taƙaitaccen bayani game da CLMS, gami da manyan ayyukanta, masu sauraro da aka yi niyya, da fa'idodin da take bayarwa. Wannan sashe na iya zama da amfani ga duk nau'ikan masu karatu don samun babban fahimtar CLMS. o Masu Haɓakawa: a. Tsarin Fasaha: Bayyana tsarin fasaha na CLMS, gami da abubuwan da ke cikinsa, tsarin Ma’ajiya ta bayanai, da haɗin kai da sauran tsarin. b. APIs da Haɗaka: Bayyana APIs da zaɓuɓɓukan haɗaka da ake da su, gami da takardu kan yadda ake hulɗa da CLMS ta hanyar shirye-shirye. c. Keɓancewa da Faɗaɗawa: Ba da jagora kan yadda masu haɓakawa za su iya keɓancewa da faɗaɗa CLMS don biyan takamaiman buƙatu. o Manajan Ayyuka: a. Jadawalin Aiki da Tsara Ayyuka: Gabatar da cikakken jadawalin aiki, yana bayyana matakai daban-daban, matakai, da abubuwan da suka dogara da su wajen aiwatar da CLMS. b. Rarraba Albarkatu: Ba da bayani kan albarkatun da ake buƙata don nasarar aiwatar da CLMS, gami da albarkatun ɗan adam, kasafin kuɗi, da buƙatun kayayyakin more rayuwa. c. Dabaru na Turawa: Bayyana zaɓuɓɓukan tura abubuwa daban-daban da tasirinsu, kamar shigar da girgije ko shigarwa a cikin gida. d. Gudanar da Hadari: Tattauna yiwuwar haɗarin da ke da alaƙa da aiwatar da CLMS da dabarun rage su. o Ma'aikatan Talla: a. Manyan Sifofi da Fa'idodi: Haskaka manyan fasalulluka na CLMS da fa'idodin da yake bayarwa ga masu amfani, yana jaddada mahimman abubuwan siyarwarsa. b. Binciken Kasuwar Manufa: Ba da haske game da kasuwar da ake nufi don CLMS, gami da yanayin masana'antu, alƙaluma na masu amfani da <TECH>, da nazarin masu fafatawa. c. Tallafin Talla: Haɗa samfurin tallan talla, kamar ƙasidu, gabatarwa, ko bidiyo, don taimakawa ma'aikatan tallan talla yadda ya kamata su tallata CLMS.

translation.en: Importance: High 4.2.4.4 When a user creates a room, their client will receive an “Update token” from the server. The server will accept room state change requests only if the update token is supplied. Importance: Low Dependencies: 4.2.4.1, 4.2.4.2 4.2.4.5 The server will allow any client to query a room’s state. Importance: High 4.2.4.6 Rooms that do not receive state updates for a configured period of time will be removed to save memory. Importance: Low 4.3 Non-Functional Requirements The VREF client must be responsive and function at a high framerate. Since the software will run on VR headsets and any framerate issues may exacerbate motion sickness in some individuals, this is an incredibly important requirement. The VREF server is expected to be easy to set up for technical faculty, and once set up, should have a reasonably high uptime to not disrupt any in-class demonstrations. The server should also be able to respond to a continuous stream of requests from a classroom’s worth of students. 11

translation.en: Software Requirements Specification for CV Maker Page 8 2.2 Non-Functional Requirements 2.2.1 Performance Requirements ❖ E-mail check in 3 seconds. ❖ User can download 5 certificates in the same time. ❖ User can download 5 pics in the same time. ❖ Maximum and minimum letter limits for introduction part. ❖ City, district, language options must be in letter order. ❖ First GSM code should reach the user in 10 seconds. (Will be agreed with a suitable OTP SMS company.) ❖ Notifications must be in 3 seconds. ❖ If internet connection is gone, application must be stop and warn the user. ❖ Max limit must be 600ms for all service response time. 2.2.2 Safety and Security Requirements ❖ Gsm number and security code for login: There is no registration; so, we earn time and do the entrance more secure. ❖ Mail control and confirm mail for continue. ❖ If there is another user's account online in the same time, system warns the user. ❖ With "Hashing system" users informations are protected by irreversible encryption. ❖ Using HTTPS instead of HTTP as data transfer protocol. ❖ CAPTCHA. 2.2.3 Software Quality Attributes ❖ Reliability: Login is done via personal handphone. Checking the e-mail address is it real? (the confirmation mail will come if it is true and continue the application) Final part; user agreement, and captcha test. Also, we use irreversible encryption. These functions are proof of reliability for our CV Maker App. ❖ Portable: The application will be accessible from anywhere in the world from the stores we have agreed with. ❖ Sustainable: Depending on the demands of the customer and the development of the technology. New updates can always be added and removed with regular maintenance. It allows creating new CVs on long years. ❖ Adaptable: Application is compatible with IOS and Android systems. Also, we have language support for all of the world. If the users will have high pleasures and there is a high demand, we can make it a website or develop company-specific versions too. ❖ Testability: Tested periodically with our test application, before and after application is installed an accessible in stores. If there is an error while the user using the application, it creates an error report and send us. So, we can fix the problem easily. (Like Google Firebase Analytics Error Report)
translation.ha: Bayanin Bukatun Software don CMai Yin V Shafi na 8 2.2 Bukatun da Ba Su Da Aiki 2.2.1 Aiki Bukatun ❖ Duba Imel cikin daƙiƙa 3. ❖ Mai amfani zai iya sauke takaddun shaida 5 a lokaci guda. ❖ Mai amfani zai iya sauke hotuna 5 a lokaci guda. ❖ Iyakan iyaka mafi girma da mafi ƙarancin haruffa don ɓangaren gabatarwa. ❖ Birni, gunduma, zaɓuɓɓukan harshe dole ne ya kasance cikin tsari na wasiƙa. ❖ Lambar GSM ta farko ya kamata ta isa ga mai amfani  cikin daƙiƙa 10. Duba adireshin imel ɗin shin gaskiya ne? (wasikar tabbatarwa za ta zo idan gaskiya ne kuma ta ci gaba da aikace-aikacen ) Kashi na ƙarshe; yarjejeniyar mai amfani , da gwajin captcha. Ana iya ƙara sabbin sabuntawa koyaushe tare da kulawa akai-akai. Yana ba da damar ƙirƙirar sabbin CVs tsawon shekaru. ❖ Mai daidaitawa: Aikace-aikacen ya dace da tsarin IOS da Android. Hakanan, muna da tallafin harshe ga duk duniya. Idan masu amfani za su sami babban jin daɗi kuma akwai babban buƙata, za mu iya sanya shi gidan yanar gizo ko haɓaka sigogin takamaiman kamfani suma. ❖ Gwaji: Ana gwadawa akai-akai tare da gwajinmu na Manhaja, kafin da kuma bayan an shigar da aikace-aikacen  wanda za a iya samu a shaguna. Idan akwai kuskure yayin da mai amfani da  ke amfani da aikace-aikacen , yana haifar da kuskuren Rahoto sannan ya aiko mana. Don haka, za mu iya gyara matsalar cikin sauƙi. translation.en: Software Requirements Specification for LIBRARY INFORMATION SYSTEM 20 - The user should select exactly one of (atleast) three available criteria -- ISBN, title, author -- from a drop-menu or any other widget. - Upon selecting the criterion, the user specifies the desired value or state of the book with respect to that criterion. - The user performs search by clicking on a button, when details all the relevant books are displayed in a nice and neat format. 4.2.3. Functional Requirements - Requirement ID : R01.F02.01 - Title : Limited Transparency - Description : Not all the details concerning a book might be of any interest to the user -- for example date the stock arrived and date of last issue. These details are not universally significant and are more important for the administrative tasks. So this information need not be displayed for any book, to both preserve transparency and avoid clutter. But the ISBN, title, author, language, rack number, number of copies available must obviously be displayed. - Priority : 5 - Requirement ID : R01.F02.02 - Title : Lenient Search - Description : The search should be mild and tolerant to certain incorrect or partially correct query inputs. In other words, in case of search by title, the LIS must not just look for exact matches from the catalogue but must perform a case-insensitive matching, along with substring matching. Use of regular expressions is encouraged. Similar should be the case with search by author but for search by ISBN however, this functionality is redundant because its value is unique for each book. - Priority : 8 4.3. CLERICAL JOBS 4.3.1. Description And Priority There are some activities or tasks the interfaces for which are only available to the clerks of the Library. One must be logged-in as a

Don haka ba sai an nuna wannan bayanin ba a cikin kowane littafi ba, domin kiyaye bayyananne da kuma guje wa tarin bayanai. Submit Assignments:  Description: Students can submit assignments electronically.  Actors: Student  Preconditions: Student is authenticated and has access to the grading system.  Postconditions: Assignments are submitted and saved.  Flow of Events: 1. Student selects the desired assignment. 2. Student uploads the assignment file. 3. Student submits the assignment. Provide Feedback:  Description: Teachers can provide feedback on student performance.  Actors: Teacher  Preconditions: Teacher is authenticated and has access to the grading system.  Postconditions: Feedback is saved and associated with the respective student.  Flow of Events: 1. Teacher selects the desired student. 2. Teacher provides written or verbal feedback on the student's performance. 3. Teacher saves the feedback. Generate Reports:  Description: The system generates comprehensive reports on student performance, class averages, and trends.  Actors: Teacher, Administrator  Preconditions: Data for generating reports is available.  Postconditions: Reports are generated and can be accessed or downloaded.  Flow of Events: 1. Teacher or administrator selects the desired report type or criteria. 2. The system retrieves the necessary data. 3. The system generates the report. 4. The report is displayed or downloaded. translation.en: 143 Smruti R. Sarangi Empty entries in the circular queue tail of the queue head of the queue Checkpoint Architectural registers Current Recovery state Physical registers mapping Figure 4.32: Checkpointing the RAT array with an SRAM-based implementation than B will be in the pipeline, and thus its checkpoint will also not be there. This result can also be deduced from the FIFO (first in first out) property of each queue. At this point to restore the checkpoint, we just need to discard the rest of the entries, which is very easytodo. Wesimplysettheheadpointerequaltothetailpointer–therestoftheentriesgetdiscarded on their own. This is how we can very easily restore a checkpoint. The shortcomings of this scheme are as follows: 1. Every entry of the rename table needs to be organized as a circular queue. 2. We need to take a checkpoint (create a copy of the latest entry in each row) on every branch instruction. This means that we need to copy 7 bits (assuming there are 128 physical registers) between the tail of the queue and the memory cells that store the current mapping. Checkpointing the RAT: CAM Array A major problem with the previous solution was that we needed to move 7 bits between locations for creatingacheckpoint. Secondly,ifthereareN entriesineachcircularqueue,weneed7N bitsofstorage ineach rowofthe SRAMarray. Can wereducethis further suchthatthe process ofcheckpoint creation becomes very easy? Let us design the rename table (RAT table) in another way. Instead of using an SRAM array, let us use a CAM array (see Chapter 7 and [Sarangi, 2015]). A CAM (content-addressable memory) as discussed in Section 4.3 can be addressed in two ways: by the row index, and by the content in each row. We can design the RAT table as a CAM as follows. The content is the architectural register and an additional bit that indicates if the mapping is valid or not. Let us consider a scenario with 16 architectural registers and 128 physical registers. Instead of a traditional 16-entry table, let us have an
translation.ha: 143 Smruti R. Sarangi Babu komai a cikin wutsiyar layin zagaye na kan layi na layin Checkpoint Rijistar gine-gine Yanayin Maidowa na Yanzu Taswirar rajistar jiki Hoto na 4.32: Duba jerin RAT tare da aiwatarwar AM ta hanyar SR fiye da B zai kasance a cikin bututun, don haka wurin bincikensa ma ba zai kasance a wurin ba. Hakanan ana iya cire wannan sakamakon daga kadarar FIFO (na farko a cikin na farko) na kowane layi. A wannan lokacin don dawo da wurin binciken, muna buƙatar kawai mu watsar da sauran shigarwar, wanda yake da sauƙin yi. Kawai saita maɓallin kai daidai gwargwado - sauran shigarwar za a jefar da su da kansu. Ta haka ne za mu iya dawo da wurin binciken cikin sauƙi. Kurakuran wannan tsarin sune kamar haka: 1. Kowane shigarwa na teburin sake suna yana buƙatar a tsara shi azaman layin zagaye. 2. Muna buƙatar ɗaukar wurin binciken (ƙirƙiri kwafin sabon shigarwa a kowane layi) akan kowane umarni na reshe. Wannan yana nufin muna buƙatar kwafi rago 7 (idan akwai rajista 128 na zahiri) tsakanin wutsiyar layin da ƙwayoyin ƙwaƙwalwar da ke adana taswirar yanzu. Duba RAT: Tsarin CAM Babbar matsala game da mafita ta baya ita ce muna buƙatar motsa rago 7 tsakanin wurare don ƙirƙirar wurin dubawa. Na biyu, idan akwai shigarwar a cikin kowane layin zagaye, akwai buƙatar rago 7N na ajiya a cikin kowane layi na tsarin SRAM. Shin za a iya ƙara wannan ta yadda tsarin ƙirƙirar wurin dubawa zai zama mai sauƙi? Bari mu tsara teburin sake suna (teburin RAT) ta wata hanya. Maimakon amfani da jerin SRAM, bari mu yi amfani da jerin CAM (duba Babi na 7 da [Sarangi, 2015]). Ana iya magance CAM (ƙwaƙwalwar da za a iya magance abun ciki) kamar yadda aka tattauna a Sashe na 4.3 ta hanyoyi biyu: ta hanyar ma'aunin layi, da kuma ta abubuwan da ke cikin kowane layi. Za mu iya tsara teburin RAT a matsayin CAM kamar haka. Abubuwan da ke ciki shine rajistar gine-gine da ƙarin bit wanda ke nuna ko taswirar tana da inganci ko a'a. Bari mu yi la'akari da wani yanayi mai rajistar gine-gine 16 da rajistar zahiri 128. Maimakon teburin shiga na gargajiya mai shafuka 16, bari mu sami

translation.en: Software Requirements Specification for E-Farm P a g e | 41 Table-08 UC-08: Authenticate Customer Use Case Authenticate Customer The goal of this use case is to authenticate the customer's identity to ensure secure Goal access to their account and personal information. Preconditions The customer must have created an account on the platform. Success end condition The customer successfully logs into their account using their login credentials. Failed end The customer is unable to log in due to incorrect login credentials or the platform condition experiences an error during the authentication process. Primary Actor Customer Secondary Actor Admin Trigger The customer clicks on the "Login" button and enters their login credentials. 1. The platform validates the customer's login credentials. 2. The platform grants access to the customer's account and personal information. Main Success 3. The customer is able to view their account information and access the platform's Flows features and services. 2a) The customer may choose to reset their password if they have forgotten their login Alternative Flow credentials. 1. The platform must use secure methods for storing and transmitting login credentials. 2. The platform must provide clear and accurate error messages in case of incorrect login credentials. Quality 3. The platform must provide real-time updates to the customer's account information. Requirements 4. The platform must ensure the confidentiality of the customer's personal information. Table-09 UC-09: Search Category Use Case Search Category The goal of this use case is to allow customers to search for products in specific Goal categories in the E-Fram System. The customer must have access to the platform and have basic knowledge of the Preconditions available product categories. Success end The customer is able to view a list of products within the selected category, filtered by condition their desired criteria (e.g. price, availability, etc.). Failed end The customer is unable to search for products due to technical issues or a lack of condition relevant products in the desired category. Primary Actor Customer Secondary Actor System Trigger The customer selects the "Category Search" option and selects the desired category. 1. The platform displays a list of subcategories within the selected category. Main Success 2. The customer selects a subcategory and the platform displays a list of relevant Flows products.
translation.ha: Bayanin Bukatun Software don E-Gona P a g e | 41 Tebur-08 UC-08: Tantance Shari'ar Amfani da Abokin Ciniki Tantance Manufar wannan shari'ar amfani ita ce tantance asalin abokin ciniki don tabbatar da amintaccen damar shiga asusunsa da bayanan sirri na . Sharuɗɗa Kafin Abokin Ciniki dole ne ya ƙirƙiri asusu a kan dandamali. Ƙarshen nasara sharaɗin Abokin ciniki ya yi nasarar shiga asusunsa ta amfani da takardun shaidar shiga na . Ƙarshen da ya gaza Abokin Ciniki ba zai iya shiga ba saboda kuskuren takardun shaidar shiga na <TECH> ko kuma dandamalin <TECH>sharaɗin ya fuskanci kuskure yayin tsarin tantancewa. Babban Jarumi Abokin Ciniki na Biyu Jarumi Admin Mai Farawa Abokin Ciniki yana danna maɓallin "Shiga" kuma yana shigar da takardun shaidar shiga na tantance. 1. Dandalin yana tabbatar da takardun shaidar shiga na abokin ciniki na . 2. Dandalin yana ba da damar shiga asusun abokin ciniki da bayanan sirri na <TECH>. Babban Nasara 3. Abokin ciniki zai iya duba bayanan asusunsa na <TECH> da kuma shiga cikin fasalulluka da ayyukan Flows na dandamali. 2a) Abokin ciniki na <TECH>zai iya ya zaɓi sake saita kalmar sirri ta  idan ya manta takardun shaidar shiga na  Alternative Flow. 1. Dandalin zai yi amfani da hanyoyin tsaro don adanawa da watsa bayanan shiga na <TECH>. 2. Dandalin <TECH>zai yi ya samar da sakonnin kuskure bayyanannu da daidai idan takardun shaidar shiga na  ba daidai ba ne. Inganci 3. Dandalin <TECH>zai yi ya samar da sabuntawa na ainihin lokaci ga bayanan  na asusun abokin ciniki. Bukatu 4. Dandalin <TECH>zai yi ya tabbatar da sirrin bayanan sirri na abokin ciniki na . Tebur-09 UC-09: Nau'in Bincike Nau'in Binciken Amfani da Shari'a Manufar wannan yanayin amfani shine don ba wa abokan ciniki damar neman samfura a cikin takamaiman rukunan Manufa a cikin Tsarin E-Fram Tsarin. Abokin ciniki dole ne ya sami damar shiga dandamali kuma yana da ilimin asali game da rukunan samfuran da ake da su na Prejudices. Ƙarshen Nasara Abokin ciniki zai iya duba jerin samfuran a cikin rukunin da aka zaɓa, wanda aka tace ta hanyar yanayin sharuɗɗan da ake so (misali farashi, samuwa, da sauransu). Ƙarshen da ya gaza Abokin ciniki ba zai iya neman samfura ba saboda matsalolin fasaha ko rashin samfuran da suka dace na yanayin a cikin rukunin da ake so. Babban ɗan wasan kwaikwayo Abokin ciniki na biyu Ɗan wasan kwaikwayo Tsarin Mai jawo Abokin ciniki zai zaɓi zaɓin "Binciken Rukunin" kuma ya zaɓi rukunin da ake so. 1. Dandalin yana nuna jerin ƙananan rukunoni a cikin rukunin da aka zaɓa. Babban Nasara 2. Abokin ciniki zai zaɓi ƙaramin rukuni kuma dandamali yana nuna jerin samfuran da suka dace na Flows.

translation.en: Software Requirements Specification for Bug Tracking Page 5 System 1.4 Product Scope The Bug Tracking System is a software application designed to help organizations effi- ciently manage the lifecycle of software bugs. Its primary goals include: • Bug Reporting: Enable users to report issues with detailed information such as severity, category, and reproducibility. • Status Tracking: Allow users to monitor the progress of reported bugs and their resolution. • Notification Management: Automatically notify relevant stakeholders of bug updates and status changes. • User Roles and Access Control: Provide role-based access to ensure secure and appropriate use of the system. The system is intended to integrate seamlessly with popular development tools (e.g., Git, Jenkins) and is compatible with multiple environments (e.g., web-based interfaces). Its implementation will contribute to improved software quality, reduced time-to-market, and enhanced team collaboration. 1.5 References The following references were used in the preparation of this document: • IEEE Recommended Practice for Software Requirements Specifications (IEEE Std 830-1998). • Existing Bug Tracking Systems for reference, such as JIRA, Bugzilla, and Redmine. • Organizational guidelines for software development and quality assurance. • API and documentation of integration tools like Git and Jenkins.
translation.ha: Bayanin Bukatun Software don Bin Diddigin Kwaro Shafi na 5 Tsarin 1.4 Iyakar Samfura Bibiyar Kwaro Tsarin manhaja ce ta  wacce aka tsara don taimakawa ƙungiyoyi wajen sarrafa zagayowar rayuwar kwaroron software yadda ya kamata. Manyan manufofinta sun haɗa da: • Rahoton Kwaro: Ba wa masu amfani damar bayar da rahoton tare da cikakkun bayanai na  kamar tsananin, rukuni, da sake samarwa. • Bin Diddigin Matsayi: Ba wa masu amfani damar sa ido kan ci gaban kwaroron da aka ruwaito da kuma warware su. • Gudanar da Sanarwa: Sanar da masu ruwa da tsaki game da sabuntawar kwaro da canje-canjen matsayi ta atomatik. • Ayyukan Mai amfani da Kula da Shiga: Ba da damar shiga bisa ga rawar da za a taka don tabbatar da amfani da tsarin  mai aminci da dacewa. Tsarin <TECH> an yi shi ne don haɗawa ba tare da matsala ba tare da kayan aikin haɓakawa na shahara (misali, Git, Jenkins) kuma yana dacewa da yanayi da yawa (misali, hanyoyin haɗin yanar gizo). Aiwatar da shi zai ba da gudummawa ga ingantaccen ingancin software, rage lokaci zuwa kasuwa, da haɓaka haɗin gwiwar ƙungiya. 1.5 Nassoshi An yi amfani da waɗannan nassoshi wajen shirya wannan takarda: • Shawarar IEEE don Takaddun Shawarwari na Bukatun Software (IEEE Std 830-1998). • Tsarin Bin Diddigin Kwaro da ke akwai don tunani, kamar JIRA, Bugzilla, da kuma Redma'adinai. • Jagororin ƙungiya don haɓaka software da tabbatar da inganci. • API da takardun kayan aikin haɗin gwiwa kamar Git da Jenkins.

translation.en: 367 Smruti R. Sarangi wait), which represents a deadlock. The converse is also true; if there is a deadlock then the circular wait between the channels will be visible in the CDG as a cycle. Having multiple virtual channels does not fix the issue. Let us consider the same example with two virtual channels per physical channel. In this case, let us number the virtual channels corresponding to each physical channel with the subscripts 0 and 1 respectively. Even if a packet is allowed a choice between the virtual channels, then also we can have a deadlock (see Figure 8.28). We simply need to consider two sets of packets flowing along the same route, and with the same set of dependences as we have seen before. In this case, both the sets of packets will not be able to progress due to the lack of virtual channels. We shall thus have a deadlock regardless of the number of virtual channels. 11 41 1 1 11 41 0 0 21 31 1 1 21 31 0 0 Figure 8.28: Deadlocks in an NoC with 2 virtual channels Turn Graph The channel dependence graph (CDG) is the classical tool that is used to detect deadlocks. We just need to check for cycles. However, it is not very useful beyond this. This is because the information about the orientation (or direction) of the channel is lost. Let us thus create another theoretical tool – a turn graph abbreviated as TG. We create a TG from the original topology of the NoC and a subset of the CDG. In the CDG, let us consider a path C that may contain cycles as well. C is an ordered set of channels (C ,...C ), where channel C is dependent on channel C : the end node of channel C has to be the 1 n i i+1 i starting node of channel C . The TG allows us to visualize the cycles in C better in terms of the i+1 orientation of the channels that make the cycle. To define the TG, let us first define G, which is a graph that represents the topology of the network. This graph has nodes (representing the routers) and directed edges (channels). The orientation of the edges is the same as that in the actual NoC. For example, the graph for a 2D mesh is a rectangular grid ofnodesconnectedviaedges. IfanedgegoesfromnorthtosouthintheactualNoC,thenitsorientation in G is the same. TheTGforC isasub-graphofG thatcontainsallthechannelsinC andnootherchannel. Addition- ally, we insert a new node called the channel node in the middle of each edge or channel. This means that if there is an edge from node A to node B in the original graph G, then in the TG we have an edge from A to the channel node C and then an edge from C to B. AB AB Before looking at an example, let us appreciate the key insights that were used to construct the TG. The first insight is that the turn graph captures the orientation of a channel in the actual NoC. The second insight is that for channels C and C in C, where C depends on channel C , there is a path i i+1 i i+1
translation.ha: 367 Smruti R. Sarangi jira), wanda ke wakiltar rashin nasara. Tattaunawar gaskiya ce; idan akwai rashin nasara to jira mai zagaye tsakanin tashoshi zai bayyana a cikin CDG a matsayin zagayowar. Samun tashoshi masu kama-da-wane da yawa ba ya magance matsalar. Bari mu yi la'akari da misali ɗaya da tashoshi masu kama-da-wane guda biyu a kowace tashar zahiri. A wannan yanayin, bari mu ƙidaya tashoshin kama-da-wane da suka dace da kowace tashar zahiri tare da biyan kuɗi 0 da 1 bi da bi. Ko da an ba da izinin fakiti zaɓi tsakanin tashoshin kama-da-wane, to za mu iya samun rashin nasara (duba Hoto na 8.28). Kawai muna buƙatar la'akari da saitin fakiti guda biyu da ke gudana a kan hanya ɗaya, kuma tare da saitin dogaro iri ɗaya kamar yadda muka gani a baya. A wannan yanayin, saitin fakiti biyu ba za su iya ci gaba ba saboda rashin tashoshin kama-da-wane. Don haka za mu sami rashin nasara ba tare da la'akari da adadin tashoshin kama-da-wane ba. 11 41 1 1 11 41 0 0 21 31 1 1 21 31 0 0 Hoto na 8.28: Makullan da ba a iya tantancewa ba a cikin NoC tare da tashoshi biyu na kama-da-wane Juya Jadawalin dogaro da tashar (CDG) shine kayan aikin gargajiya da ake amfani da shi don gano makullan da ba a iya tantancewa ba. Kawai muna buƙatar duba zagayowar. Duk da haka, ba shi da amfani sosai fiye da wannan. Wannan saboda bayani game da yanayin (ko alkibla) na tashar ya ɓace. Bari mu ƙirƙirar wani kayan aikin ka'ida - jadawalin juyawa wanda aka taƙaita shi azaman TG. Mun ƙirƙirar wani TG daga asalin yanayin NoC da kuma wani ɓangare na CDG. A cikin CDG, bari mu yi la'akari da hanyar C wacce na iya ta ƙunshi makullan da ba a iya tantancewa ba. C tsari ne na tashoshi (C,...C), inda tashar C ta dogara da tashar C: ƙarshen tashar C dole ne ya zama 1 n i i+1 i farkon tashar C. TG yana ba mu damar hango zagayowar a cikin C da kyau dangane da yanayin i+1 na tashoshin da ke yin zagayowar. Don ayyana TG, bari mu fara ayyana G, wanda shine jadawali wanda ke wakiltar yanayin hanyar sadarwa. Wannan jadawali yana da nodes (wakiltar na'urori masu amfani da hanyoyin sadarwa) da gefuna da aka shirya (tashoshi). Tsarin gefuna iri ɗaya ne da wanda ke cikin ainihin NoC. Misali, jadawali don raga na 2D grid ne mai kusurwa huɗu na nodes da aka haɗa viaedge. Idan edge ya fito daga arewa zuwa kudu a zahiri NoC, yanayin a cikin G iri ɗaya ne. TGforC shine sub-graphofG wanda ya ƙunshi dukkan tashoshi a cikin C da kuma wani tashar. Bugu da ƙari, mun saka sabon node da ake kira node tashar a tsakiyar kowane gefe ko tashar. Wannan yana nufin cewa idan akwai gefe daga lamba A zuwa lamba B a cikin jadawalin asali na G, to a cikin TG muna da gefe daga A zuwa lamba C sannan gefe daga C zuwa B. AB AB Kafin mu duba misali, bari mu yaba da mahimman bayanai da aka yi amfani da su don gina TG. Fahimtar farko ita ce jadawalin juyawa yana kama yanayin tashar a cikin ainihin NoC. Fahimtar ta biyu ita ce ga tashoshi C da C a cikin C, inda C ya dogara da tashar C, akwai hanya i i+1 i i+1
