translation.en: 499 Smruti R. Sarangi variable and y is a synch variable, and the while loop exits in the first iteration. This piece of code basically transfers the value of x from thread T1 to thread T2. This execution seems to be correct. Until the value of y has not been read to be 1 by T2, it will keep looping. Once it reads y =1, it has to read t1=x=1. This is correct execution on an SC machine. In fact all executions will yield the same output, which is correct. So what is wrong in the execution witness shown in Figure 9.57(b) and what is correct in the execution witness shown in Figure 9.57(d)? Look closely. Consider only regular variables: x in both cases. The answer is that between two conflicting accesses in Figure 9.57(b), there is a path that has no synchronization order (so) edges. For example, between the instructions (b) and (d) (both Wx1), we only have a path with a ws edge. Now, focus on the execution witness shown in Figure 9.57(d). The path from Wx1 to Rx1 has an so edge. This is the crux of the definition of concurrent accesses. Consider two accesses to the same regular variable in the execution witness. If there is no path between them with an so edge, they are said to be concurrent. Let us now define a data race with the concepts we have just learned. Definition 84 Consider two accesses to the same regular variable across threads. If there is no path between them in the execution witness with an so edge, they are said to be concurrent. Whenever we have a pair of such conflicting and concurrent accesses, we refer to this situation as a data race. Letusappreciatethedefinition. Wewantthatatleastonepathshouldexistwithansoedgebetween conflicting accesses to the same variable, and this edge should be across threads. When we had such an edge, we saw that the execution was correct, and the lack of such an edge led to an incorrect execution. Can we generalize this? When there is a path with an so edge, it means that synchronization instructions of the program are involved in enforcing a dependence between two conflicting accesses to the same variable. It will allow us to regulate conflicting accesses. Of course, here we need to differentiate between regular and synchronization variables. We do allow concurrent and conflicting accesses to synchronization variables: we assume that they are always updated in a sequentially consistent fashion. However, when it comes to regular variables, if we want the program to be free of data races, then if there is an rf, fr, or ws edge between any two operations on regular variables in the execution witness across threads, there has to be another alternative path between them that has so edges. This would mean that the operations are ordered by other instructions; they are not concurrent. Does SC Imply Data-Race-Freedom? Let us look at the examples shown in Figure 9.58. We observe in Figure 9.58 that for the same code, we can have many sequential executions on an SC machine. The first execution (Figure 9.58(a)) is free of data races because there is a happens-before relationship between Rx0 and Wx1 with an so edge; however, the second execution has a data race because there is no happens-before ordering between the accesses Wx1 and Rx1 with an so edge. Now from our point of view, this code has a concurrency bug because it is possible to have an execution that has a data race. Hence, SC does not guarantee data-race-freedom. Does Data-Race-Freedom Imply SC? Let us ask the reverse question now. Assume an execution does not have any data races. Is it in SC? Let us look at a few theorems.
translation.ha: 499 Smruti R. Maɓallin Sarangi da y maɓallin synch ne, kuma madaurin while yana fita a farkon maimaitawa. Wannan yanki na lambar yana canja wurin ƙimar x daga zaren T1 zuwa zaren T2. Wannan aiwatarwa da alama daidai ne. Har sai ƙimar y ba a karanta ta ba ta zama 1 ta T2, zai ci gaba da madauki. Da zarar ta karanta y =1, dole ne ta karanta  t1=x=1. Wannan aiwatarwa ce daidai akan injin SC. A zahiri duk aiwatarwa za su samar da fitarwa iri ɗaya, wanda yake daidai. To mene ne ba daidai ba a cikin shaidar aiwatarwa da aka nuna a Hoto na 9.57(b) da kuma menene daidai a cikin shaidar aiwatarwa da aka nuna a Hoto na 9.57(d)? Duba da kyau. Yi la'akari da masu canji na yau da kullun kawai: x a cikin duka shari'o'in. Amsar ita ce tsakanin hanyoyin shiga guda biyu masu karo da juna a Hoto na 9.57(b), akwai hanyar da ba ta da tsarin daidaitawa (don haka) gefuna. Misali, tsakanin umarnin (b) da (d) (dukansu Wx1), muna da hanya ce kawai mai gefen ws. Yanzu, mayar da hankali kan shaidar aiwatarwa da aka nuna a Hoto na 9.57(d). Hanya daga Wx1 zuwa Rx1 tana da gefen haka. Wannan shine ma'anar hanyoyin shiga lokaci guda. Yi la'akari da hanyoyin shiga lokaci guda guda biyu zuwa ga canjin yau da kullun iri ɗaya a cikin shaidar aiwatarwa. Idan babu wata hanya a tsakaninsu da gefen haka, ana cewa suna da alaƙa. Bari mu ayyana tseren Bayanai tare da ra'ayoyin da muka koya yanzu. Ma'ana 84 Yi la'akari da hanyoyin shiga guda biyu zuwa ga canjin yau da kullun iri ɗaya a cikin zaren. Idan babu wata hanya a tsakaninsu a cikin shaidar aiwatarwa da gefen haka, ana cewa suna da alaƙa. Duk lokacin da muke da hanyoyin shiga guda biyu masu karo da juna da kuma masu lokaci guda, muna kiran wannan yanayin da tseren Bayanai. Bari mu yaba da ma'anar. Muna son hanyar dutse ta kasance tare da gefen tsakanin hanyoyin shiga masu karo da juna zuwa canjin iri ɗaya, kuma wannan gefen ya kamata ya kasance a kan zaren. Lokacin da muka sami irin wannan gefen, mun ga cewa aiwatarwar daidai ce, kuma rashin irin wannan gefen ya haifar da aiwatarwa ba daidai ba. Za mu iya faɗaɗa wannan? Idan akwai hanya mai gefen haka, yana nufin cewa umarnin daidaitawa na shirin yana da hannu wajen aiwatar da dogaro tsakanin hanyoyin shiga guda biyu masu karo da juna zuwa ga canjin iri ɗaya. Zai ba mu damar daidaita hanyoyin shiga masu karo da juna. Tabbas, a nan muna buƙatar bambance tsakanin masu canji na yau da kullun da masu daidaitawa. Muna ba da damar samun damar shiga lokaci guda da masu karo da juna ga masu canji na daidaitawa: muna ɗauka cewa koyaushe ana sabunta su ta hanyar da ta dace. Koyaya, idan ana maganar masu canji na yau da kullun, idan muna son shirin ya kasance ba tare da tseren Bayanai ba, to idan akwai gefen rf, fr, ko ws tsakanin kowane aiki biyu akan masu canji na yau da kullun a cikin shaidar aiwatarwa a kan zaren, dole ne a sami wata hanyar madadin tsakanin su wacce ke da gefuna haka. Wannan yana nufin cewa ayyukan an tsara su ta wasu umarni; ba su da juna. Shin SC Yana Nufin Bayani-Race-Freedom? Bari mu kalli misalan da aka nuna a Hoto na 9.58. Mun lura a Hoto na 9.58 cewa ga wannan lambar, za mu iya samun aiwatarwa da yawa a jere akan na'urar SC. Aiwatarwa ta farko (Hoto na 9.58(a)) ba ta da tseren Bayanai saboda akwai alaƙar da ke faruwa tsakanin Rx0 da Wx1 tare da gefen haka; duk da haka, aiwatarwa ta biyu tana da tseren Bayanai saboda babu wani tsari da ke faruwa tsakanin hanyoyin shiga Wx1 da Rx1 tare da gefen haka. Yanzu daga ra'ayinmu, wannan lambar tana da matsala mai daidaitawa saboda yana yiwuwa a sami aiwatarwa wanda ke da tseren Bayanai. Saboda haka, SC ba ya ba da garantin Bayanai-race-freedom. Shin Bayanai-Race-Freedom yana nufin SC? Bari mu yi tambayar da ta juye yanzu. A ɗauka cewa aiwatarwa ba ta da tseren Bayanai. Shin tana cikin SC? Bari mu kalli wasu ka'idoji.

translation.en: SoftwareRequirements Specification for <ExeC> Page4 1 Introduction 1.1 Product Scope The purpose of the web app is to ease and streamline the elections held by the Election Commission of IIT-K. The app will help digitalize the process by automating the different stages in an election. This application will feature user validation and login, candidate registration, information regarding the prospective candidates such as contact information, proposers, seconders, manifestos, etc. The app will also facilitate anonymous communication and reporting during the elections. The aim is to help the general body members get to know their candidates better and aid them in making an informed choice. The app will also help the Election Commission by including a common portal for reporting, tracking, and dealing with penalties. 1.2 Intended Audience and Document Overview This document is intended for everyone involved in the development process including but not limited to the course instructor, our TA, our team and the team that would conduct the beta-testing of our application. The intended audience of the finished product is everybody involved in the elections conducted at IITK, from roles ranging from EC, GBM, Candidate to the general public audience who wishes to scrutinize the candidates. Section 1: This has some basic information that would be useful in reading the SRS such as document conventions, abbreviations, etc. The reader may choose to skip the section if they are familiar with some basic terminology. In any case, this section will serve as a useful collection of information to clarify any confusion that may occur while reading the document. Section 2: This section offers a bird’s eye view of the software system and its functionalities, assumptions and dependencies. This will be a useful read for those seeking to familiarize themselves with the system at a quick glance. A reader is encouraged to read this part as it provides a good basis for understanding the next section of the SRS. Section 3: This section contains detailed information about the software and explains the functions in detail through the use of multiple diagrams. This is essential for end-users, clients and developers as it will serve as a guide in the development process and also an instruction manual for end-users. Section 4: Important non functional requirements are expounded here. This is of special importance to the developers of the software.
translation.ha: Bukatun Software Bayani Kan <ExeC> Shafi na 4 1 Gabatarwa 1.1 Faɗin Samfura Manufar manhajar yanar gizo ita ce sauƙaƙe da kuma daidaita zaɓen da Hukumar Zaɓe ta IIT-K ta gudanar. Manhajar za ta kuma taimaka wa Hukumar Zaɓe ta hanyar haɗa hanyar sadarwa ta gama gari don bayar da rahoto, bin diddigi, da kuma magance hukunci. 1.2 Masu Sauraro da Bayani Kan Takardu Wannan takarda an yi ta ne ga duk wanda ke da hannu a cikin tsarin haɓakawa, gami da amma ba'a iyakance ga malamin kwas ɗin ba, TA ɗinmu, ƙungiyarmu da ƙungiyar da za ta gudanar da gwajin beta na aikace-aikacenmu na . Sashe na 1: Wannan yana da wasu bayanai na asali na  waɗanda za su yi amfani wajen karanta SRS kamar takaddun yarjejeniya, taƙaitattun kalmomi, da sauransu. Notes  Move to the safe shelter built for this purpose, or leave the area on the advice of some authoritative government agency. When the storm strikes.  Stay in the house and take shelter in the stronger portion of your house.  Listen to the radio and follow instructions.  Open windows of the safe portion of the house if the roof begins to lift.  Find shelter if you are in open at the hitting time of the cyclone.  Do not go out of your house or to a beach during or lay down along an elevated footpath in open field the storm. translation.en: 207 Smruti R. Sarangi Predicationissometimesaverygoodmechanism,andcandowonderstotheperformance,particularly for cases that we have looked at. However, note that there are costs associated with this mechanism as well. It increases the number of instructions that need to be fetched, decoded, renamed, and issued. This decreases the effective throughput because a lot of these instructions might potentially be on the wrong path. Furthermore, we need a mechanism of generating and keeping track of predicates. This requires good compiler support. 5.6.6 Support for Aggressive Speculation InSection5.1,weintroducedthenotionofaggressiveloadspeculationinOOOprocessors. Recallthatwe executed load instructions much before we were aware of their addresses and dependences. We claimed that if we could design accurate predictors, this approach would lead to large performance gains, and indeed this is so in most cases. Let us try to create a similar mechanism for EPIC processors. Itanium has the notion of load boosting. Here, a load and a subset of its forward slice (dependent instructions) can be placed (boosted) at a point that is much before their actual position in the code; this is done by the compiler. This will increase the number of instructions between the load and the instructions that use its value. This means that even if the load misses in the L1 cache, and we need to go to the L2 cache or beyond, most of this delay will get hidden. By the time we encounter the use of the load, its value will mostly likely be in the L1 cache. Thismechanismcanveryeffectivelyreducethestallsassociatedwithareadmiss. However,thereare several correctness issues. Assume that the load instruction encounters an exception. Maybe it accesses an illegal address. To maintain the notion of precise exceptions we need to remember this, and flag the exception only when we reach the original position of the load in the code. Second, there might be stores between the original position of the load and the hoisted position that have the same address. In this case we will have a RAW dependence violation. Thus, we need to keep a record of all the stores between the two positions, and check for an address match. If we find such a match, the latest such store needs to forward its value to the load. ThesummaryofthisentirediscussionisthatsinceItaniumdoesnothaveaload-storequeue,andifwe arestilldesirousofperformingloaddependencespeculation,thenweneedtoimplementthefunctionality of the LSQ using a combined software-hardware technique. Let us elaborate. Itanium defines a hardware structure called an Advanced Load Address Table (ALAT). It contains the addresses of all the loads that have been boosted. EPIC processors such as Itanium need to define two instructions for loads: one for a normal load and one for a boosted load. Whenever the hardware encounters an instruction for a boosted load, it enters the load address into the ALAT. Subsequently, each store checks the entries of the ALAT for a match. If there is a match, then we can infer that there is a dependence violation. Thus, we mark the ALAT entry as invalid. At the original point of the load in the code, Itanium embeds a load check (ld.c) instruction. This checks the validity of the load in the ALAT. If the load is still valid, then it means that the speculation was successful, and nothing needs to be done. However, if the load is invalid, then we need to get the data from the latest store with a matching address. We thus need to reissue the load. This is exactly whatisdone. Insuchcases,thechancesofgettingthestoredataintheL1cacheitselfisveryhighgiven the recency of the update. If the load had encountered an exception, then that also can be recorded in the ALAT, and the exception can be handled when the load check instruction is issued.
translation.ha: 207 Smruti R. Sarangi Prediction wani lokacin yana da kyau sosai, kuma yana iya yiabin mamaki game da aikin, musamman ga shari'o'in da muka duba. Duk da haka, lura cewa akwai kuɗaɗen da ke da alaƙa da wannan tsarin. Yana ƙara yawan umarnin da ake buƙatar a kawo, a fassara su, a sake musu suna, sannan a bayar. Wannan yana rage ingancin aiki saboda yawancin waɗannan umarnin na iya kasancewa a kan hanya mara kyau. Bugu da ƙari, muna buƙatar hanyar samar da da kuma bin diddigin hasashen. Wannan yana buƙatar kyakkyawan tallafin mai tarawa. 5.6.6 Tallafi ga Hasashe Mai Tashin Hankali A Sashe na 5.1, an gabatar da ra'ayin hasashe mai tashin Hankali a cikin masu sarrafawa na OO. Recallthatmun aiwatar da umarnin kaya tun kafin mu san adiresoshinsu da dogaro da su. Mun yi iƙirarin cewa idan za mu iya tsara ingantattun masu hasashen, wannan hanyar za ta haifar da manyan nasarorin aikin, kuma hakika haka ne a mafi yawan lokuta. Bari mu yi ƙoƙarin ƙirƙirar irin wannan tsari ga masu sarrafa EPIC. Itanium yana da ra'ayin ƙara nauyi. A nan, ana iya sanya kaya da wani ɓangare na ɓangaren gaba (umarnin da suka dogara) a wani wuri da ya fi matsayinsu na ainihi a cikin lambar; wannan mai tarawa ne ke yin sa. Wannan zai ƙara yawan umarni tsakanin kaya da umarnin da ke amfani da ƙimarsa. Wannan yana nufin cewa ko da nauyin ya ɓace a cikin cache na L1, kuma muna buƙatar zuwa cache na L2 ko sama da haka, yawancin wannan jinkiri zai ɓoye. Lokacin da muka haɗu da amfani da kayan, ƙimarsa galibi za ta kasance a cikin cache na L1. Wannan hanyar na iya rage tasirin da ke da alaƙa da karanta kurakurai. Duk da haka, akwai matsaloli da yawa na daidaito. A ɗauka cewa umarnin kaya ya haɗu da wani keɓancewa. Wataƙila yana samun damar adireshin da ba bisa ƙa'ida ba. Don kiyaye ra'ayin keɓancewa na musamman muna buƙatar tuna wannan, kuma mu yi alama da keɓancewa kawai lokacin da muka isa matsayin asali na kayan a cikin lambar. Na biyu, akwai yiwuwar akwai shaguna tsakanin matsayin asali na kayan aiki da matsayin da aka ɗaga waɗanda ke da adireshin iri ɗaya. A wannan yanayin za mu sami keta haƙƙin dogaro na RAW. Don haka, muna buƙatar adana bayanan  na duk shagunan da ke tsakanin matsayi biyu, kuma mu duba daidaiton adireshi. Idan muka sami irin wannan daidaito, sabon shagon yana buƙatar tura ƙimarsa zuwa ga kayan aiki. Takaitaccen tattaunawar gabaɗaya shine tunda Itanium ba shi da layin ajiya, kuma idan har yanzu muna son yin dogaro da kaya, to muna buƙatar aiwatar da aikin LSQ ta amfani da dabarar software-hardware. Bari mu yi bayani dalla-dalla. Itanium ya bayyana tsarin kayan aiki da ake kira Advanced Load Address Tebur (ALAT). Ya ƙunshi adiresoshin duk kayan aikin da aka haɓaka. Masu sarrafawa na EPIC kamar Itanium suna buƙatar ayyana umarni biyu don kaya: ɗaya don kaya na yau da kullun da ɗaya don kaya mai haɓakawa. Duk lokacin da kayan aikin suka haɗu da umarni don kaya mai haɓakawa, yana shigar da adireshin kaya cikin ALAT. Bayan haka, kowane shago yana duba shigarwar ALAT don daidaitawa. Idan akwai daidaitawa, to za mu iya yanke cewa akwai keta haƙƙin dogaro. Don haka, muna sanya shigarwar ALAT a matsayin mara inganci. A farkon wurin lodin a cikin lambar, Itanium yana saka umarnin duba kaya (ld.c). Wannan yana duba ingancin kaya a cikin ALAT. Idan nauyin har yanzu yana da inganci, to yana nufin cewa hasashen ya yi nasara, kuma babu abin da ake buƙata a yi. Koyaya, idan nauyin bai da inganci, to muna buƙatar samun bayanan  daga sabon shagon tare da adireshin da ya dace. Don haka muna buƙatar sake fitar da kaya. Wannan shine ainihin abin da aka yi. A irin waɗannan yanayi, damar samun bayanan ajiya a cikin L1cacheitself yana da girma sosai idan aka yi la'akari da sabunta . Idan nauyin ya ci karo da banda, to ana iya yin rikodin hakan a cikin ALAT, kuma ana iya magance banda lokacin da aka bayar da umarnin duba kaya.

translation.en: Sport Facility Booking System Kirtan Shah 17 Proposed Software Architecture 17a Overview For the Sports Facility Booking Management System, the most appropriate architecture style is a Layered Architecture. This design style offers a structured approach to organizing components, making it easier to manage, test, and scale. The layered structure separates responsibilities into distinct layers, allowing changes in one layer without impacting others, which is beneficial for a mobile application focused on real-time booking, payment processing, and user management. The motivation for choosing a layered architecture is to create a well-organized and maintainable application that supports scalability, security, and efficient data flow. Since the application involves user interactions, real-time updates, secure payment processing, and facility management, a layered approach ensures these functionalities are isolated in separate, manageable layers. This architecture style aligns well with our mobile-only approach, enabling efficient data access and easy updates as the system evolves.  Scalability: The layered structure allows each layer to be scaled independently as needed, optimizing resource usage without affecting the entire application.  Modularity and Maintainability: Layered architecture divides the application into self-contained layers (e.g., presentation, application logic, and data), making it easier to maintain and update components individually.  Separation of Concerns: Each layer has distinct responsibilities, ensuring that business logic, data access, and user interface concerns remain isolated, improving code quality and reducing errors.  Security: Sensitive data handling and access control are centralized in the relevant layers (e.g., data and service layers), simplifying the implementation of security protocols and regulatory compliance.  Reliability: The separation between layers allows the system to handle failures more gracefully. For instance, issues in the presentation layer do not affect data handling or business logic directly. 51
translation.ha: Yin Rajistar Kayan Wasanni Tsarin Kirtan Shah 17 Tsarin Manhaja Mai Shawarwari 17a Bayani Ga Gudanar da Rajistar Kayan Wasanni Tsarin, salon gine-gine mafi dacewa shine Tsarin Gine-gine Mai Layi. Wannan salon zane yana ba da tsarin tsari don tsara abubuwan da ke ciki, yana sauƙaƙa gudanarwa, gwadawa, da sikelin. Tsarin mai layi yana raba nauyi zuwa matakai daban-daban, yana ba da damar canje-canje a cikin layi ɗaya ba tare da shafar wasu ba, wanda ke da amfani ga aikace-aikacen ta hannu wanda ke mai da hankali kan yin rajistar lokaci-lokaci, sarrafa biyan kuɗi, da kuma gudanar da ta amfani. Dalilin zaɓar tsarin mai layi shine don ƙirƙirar aikace-aikacen mai kyau kuma mai dorewa wanda ke tallafawa <TECH>babban iko, tsaro, da ingantaccen kwararar bayanai. Tunda aikace-aikacen ta amfani ya ƙunshi hulɗar mai amfani, sabuntawa na lokaci-lokaci, sarrafa biyan kuɗi mai aminci, da gudanar da kayan aiki, hanyar mai layi tana tabbatar da cewa an ware waɗannan ayyukan a cikin layuka daban-daban, masu sarrafawa. Wannan salon gine-gine ya dace da tsarin wayar hannu kawai, yana ba da damar samun damar bayanai masu inganci da sabuntawa cikin sauƙi yayin da tsarin  ke tasowa.  <TECH>Ƙarfin Sauyawa: Tsarin da aka yi wa layi yana ba da damar auna kowane layi daban-daban kamar yadda ake buƙata, yana inganta amfani da albarkatu ba tare da shafar dukkan aikace-aikacen  ba.  Daidaito da Kiyayewa: Tsarin da aka yi wa layi yana raba aikace-aikacen  zuwa layuka masu zaman kansu (misali, gabatarwa, dabaru na aikace-aikacen, da bayanai na ), yana sauƙaƙa kulawa da sabunta abubuwan  kowannensu.  Raba Damuwa: Kowane layi yana da ayyuka daban-daban, yana tabbatar da cewa dabarun kasuwanci, damar <TECH>bayanai, da damuwar mai amfani sun kasance a ware, suna inganta ingancin lambar kuma suna rage kurakurai.  Tsaro: Kula da bayanai masu hankali da kuma sarrafa damar shiga  suna tsakiya a cikin layukan da suka dace (misali, <TECH>data da layukan sabis), suna sauƙaƙa aiwatar da ka'idojin tsaro da bin ƙa'idojin Tsaro.  AMINCI: Raba tsakanin layukan yana bawa tsarin TK> damar magance kurakurai cikin kyau. Misali, matsalolin da ke cikin layin gabatarwa ba sa shafar sarrafa bayanai <TECH>data ko dabarun kasuwanci kai tsaye. 51

translation.en: Sport Facility Booking System Kirtan Shah  The focus will be on ensuring high availability, where the system is continuously operational and service interruptions are minimal.  Assess the cost implications of achieving high reliability (99.9% uptime) and how that aligns with the expectations of users and facility managers.  Redundant systems and backups should be in place, especially for crucial modules like booking and payment, to mitigate the impact of system failures. 12b Availability Requirements This section ensures that the Sports Facility Booking Management Application operates reliably, supporting uninterrupted access for both facility managers and users, while also specifying fail-safe measures for unforeseen events. The availability of the Sports Facility Booking Management Application is crucial for delivering a seamless user experience. Since users will rely on the system to book and manage sports facilities in real-time, it must be highly available with minimal downtime. Availability is calculated as a fraction of total time the system is operational, considering the mean time between failures (MTBF), mean time to recovery (MTTR), and scheduled maintenance periods. The application's availability is key to user satisfaction and operational efficiency, especially for facility managers and sports enthusiasts who require access to bookings at any time. Availability ensures that even if the system encounters failures, downtime is minimized, and users can depend on the application being accessible when needed.  The application shall achieve 99.9% availability.  The system shall be available for use 24 hours per day, 365 days per year, except during scheduled maintenance.  In case of a failure, the system must be restored within a maximum downtime of 30 minutes.  Routine maintenance will be scheduled during off-peak hours, preferably from 12:00 AM to 4:00 AM, to reduce the impact on users.  Users must be notified at least 48 hours in advance of any scheduled maintenance or planned downtime.  The need for 99.9% availability requires thorough planning of redundancy measures and ensuring that failures do not lead to prolonged downtime. 34
translation.ha: Yin Rajistar Gidajen Wasanni Tsarin Kirtan Shah  Za a mayar da hankali kan tabbatar da samuwar  mai yawa, inda tsarin  yake ci gaba da aiki kuma katsewar sabis ba ta da yawa.  Kimanta tasirin farashi na cimma babban aminci na <TECH> (99.9% na aiki) da kuma yadda hakan ya dace da tsammanin masu amfani da manajojin wurare.  Ya kamata tsarin da madadin <TECH> su kasance a wurin, musamman ga mahimman kayayyaki kamar yin booking da biyan kuɗi, don rage tasirin gazawar tsarin <TECH>. Bukatun <TECH> Samuwa Wannan sashe yana tabbatar da cewa Gudanar da Rajistar Gidajen Wasanni Manhaja yana aiki da aminci, yana tallafawa samun damar shiga ba tare da katsewa ba ga manajojin wurare da masu amfani, yayin da kuma ƙayyade matakan aminci ga abubuwan da ba a zata ba. Samuwar Tsarin Gudanar da Rajistar Gidajen Wasanni <TECH>Application yana da mahimmanci don samar da ƙwarewar mai amfani mara matsala. Tunda masu amfani za su dogara da tsarin  don yin rajista da kuma kula da wuraren wasanni a ainihin lokaci, dole ne  ya kasance yana samuwa sosai tare da ƙarancin lokacin hutu. Ana ƙididdige  Samuwa a matsayin ƙaramin ɓangare na jimlar lokacin da tsarin  ke aiki, idan aka yi la'akari da matsakaicin lokacin da ke tsakanin gazawa (MTBF), matsakaicin lokacin dawowa (MTTR), da lokutan gyara da aka tsara.  samuwa na aikace-aikacen  shine mabuɗin gamsuwa da ingancin aikin <TECH> mai amfani, musamman ga manajojin wurare da masu sha'awar wasanni waɗanda ke buƙatar samun damar yin rajista a kowane lokaci.  Samuwa yana tabbatar da cewa ko da tsarin  ya gamu da gazawa, ana rage lokacin hutu, kuma masu amfani za su iya dogara da aikace-aikacen  da ake samu lokacin da ake buƙata.  Aikace-aikacen   zai sami kashi 99.9% <TECH> samuwa.  Tsarin  <TECH> zai kasance yana samuwa don amfani awanni 24 a rana, kwanaki 365 a shekara, sai dai lokacin gyara da aka tsara.  Idan aka samu matsala, dole ne a dawo da tsarin <TECH> <TECH> <TECH> a cikin matsakaicin lokacin dakatarwa na mintuna 30.  Za a tsara gyaran da aka saba yi a lokutan da ba a cika aiki ba, zai fi kyau daga ƙarfe 12:00 na safe zuwa ƙarfe 4:00 na safe, don rage tasirin da masu amfani za su yi.  Dole ne a sanar da masu amfani <TECH> aƙalla awanni 48 kafin duk wani gyara da aka tsara ko lokacin dakatarwa da aka tsara.  Bukatar samun kashi 99.9% na <TECH> <TECH> yana buƙatar cikakken tsari na matakan dakatarwa da kuma tabbatar da cewa gazawar ba ta haifar da tsawaita lokacin dakatarwa ba. 34

translation.en: 659 Smruti R. Sarangi Components of Process Variation We can divide the components of process variation into three parts: die to die, intra-die systematic and intra-die random variation. They are modeled as additive components. Let ∆P denote the deviation in a given parameter such as the threshold voltage due to process variation. Then we have, ∆P =∆P +∆P =∆P +∆P +∆P (12.7) D2D WID D2D rand sys The first component is a constant additive component for a given die; hence, most of the model- ing effort is focused on the intra-die systematic and random variation. They are modeled as normal distributions. Systematic Variation To model systematic variation, we divide the entire chip into a two-dimensional grid. Each point has an x-coordinate and a y-coordinate. Furthermore, we assume that the following parameters have a systematic variation component: the threshold voltage (V ) and the effective channel length (L ). th eff For the case of systematic variation we assume that V and L are linearly related. The Varius th eff model further assumes that the relative variation in L is half of the variation in V . However, this eff th is a technology dependent effect and might change in future technologies. Given that the systematic variation in these quantities is linearly related we can first compute a systematic variation map that stores the deviation with respect to the mean for each grid cell. Let the mean threshold voltage be V th0 and the computed deviation for a grid cell be d. The threshold voltage at the grid cell is given by V =V +d×V (12.8) th th0 th0 We typically model the dimensionless quantity d using a two-dimensional multi-variate normal dis- tribution. The formula for such a normal distribution is as follows. Let us consider a k-element vector X that contains the values of the deviation for each grid cell. Its probability density function is given by the following equation: (cid:18) (cid:19) 1 1 pdf(X)= exp − (X−µ)TΣ−1(X−µ) (12.9) (cid:112) (2π)k |Σ| 2 Here,µisavectorthatcontainsthemeanvalueforeachgridcell. Wecanassumethatallitselements have a value equal to 0. The covariance matrix Σ is of special interest to us because it represents the covarianceofthedeviationsacrosstwogridcells. Thesystematicvariationisdependentonitsstructure. Lastly, the symbol |Σ| refers to the determinant of the Σ matrix. We make two simplifying assumptions. The first is that the covariance is isotropic (does not depend upon the direction), and second assumption is that it only depends on the Euclidean distance between the grid cells. With these assumptions, we can simplify the modeling as follows. We first note that the covariance is related to the correlation as follows for two random variables U and V. Σ(U,V) ρ(U,V)= (12.10) σ σ U V Here ρ is the correlation matrix, Σ is the covariance matrix, σ is the standard deviation of random U variableU,andσ isthestandarddeviationofrandomvariableV. LetU andV representthedeviations V at grid cells u and v respectively. If we assume that the standard deviations are the same (equal to σ), which is normally the case, then we have the following formula. Σ(U,V)=σ2ρ(U,V) (12.11) σ2 is the variance, which is assumed to be a constant. It is a measure of the systematic variation and will be denoted henceforth as σ . The other important takeaway from this equation is that the sys

Sarangi Abubuwan da ke cikin Bambancin Tsarin Za mu iya raba sassan bambancin tsari zuwa sassa uku: die to die, intra-die systematic variation da intra-die intra-die bazuwar bambancin. An tsara su azaman abubuwan ƙari. Bari ∆P ya nuna karkacewa a cikin wani siga kamar ƙarfin wutar lantarki babban tech saboda bambancin tsari. Sannan muna da, ∆P =∆P +∆P +∆P (12.7) D2D WID D2D rand sys Na farko partion ƙari ne na dindindin partion don wani mutu da aka bayar; saboda haka, yawancin ƙoƙarin yin ƙira yana mai da hankali kan bambancin tsari na ciki-die da bazuwar. Ana yin su azaman rarrabawa na yau da kullun. Bambancin Tsarin Don yin samfurin bambancin tsari, muna raba dukkan guntu zuwa grid mai girma biyu. Kowane batu yana da haɗin x da haɗin y. Bugu da ƙari, muna ɗauka cewa waɗannan sigogi suna da bambancin tsari sashi: ƙarfin babban_sashi (V) da kuma tsawon tashar tasiri (L). th eff. Ga yanayin bambancin tsari, muna ɗauka cewa V da L suna da alaƙa a layi. Tsarin Varius th eff ya ƙara ɗauka cewa bambancin da ke cikin L shine rabin bambancin a cikin V. Duk da haka, wannan eff th tasiri ne da ya dogara da fasaha kuma yana iya canzawa a cikin fasahar gaba. Ganin cewa bambancin tsari a cikin waɗannan adadi yana da alaƙa a layi, da farko za mu iya ƙididdige taswirar bambancin tsari wanda ke adana karkacewar dangane da matsakaicin kowace ƙwayar grid. Bari matsakaicin ƙarfin babban_sashi ya zama V th0 kuma karkacewar da aka ƙididdige don ƙwayar grid ya zama d. Ana ba da ƙarfin babban_sashi a ƙwayar grid ta hanyar V =V +d×V (12.8) th th0 th0. Yawanci muna yin ƙirar adadi mara girma d ta amfani da rarrabawa na al'ada mai girma biyu mai yawa. Tsarin irin wannan rarrabawa na yau da kullun shine kamar haka. Bari mu yi la'akari da vector na k-element X wanda ya ƙunshi ƙimar karkacewar kowace ƙwayar grid. Aikin yawan yuwuwar sa an bayar da shi ta hanyar lissafi mai zuwa: (cid:18) (cid:19) 1 1 pdf(X)= exp − (X−µ)TΣ−1(X−µ) (12.9) (cid:112) (2π)k |Σ| 2 A nan, µisavector wanda ya ƙunshi matsakaicin ƙimar foreach gridcell. Za mu iya ɗauka cewa dukkan abubuwan suna da ƙima daidai da 0. Matrix na covariance Σ yana da matuƙar sha'awa a gare mu saboda yana wakiltar daidaituwar karkacewar a tsakanin ƙwayoyin grid guda biyu. Bambancin tsarin yana dogara ne akan tsarinsa. A ƙarshe, alamar |Σ| tana nufin mai ƙayyade matrix Σ. Muna yin zato guda biyu masu sauƙi. Na farko shine cewa bambancin yana da isotropic (bai dogara da alkibla ba), kuma zato na biyu shine cewa ya dogara ne kawai da nisan Euclidean tsakanin ƙwayoyin grid. Tare da waɗannan zato, za mu iya sauƙaƙe ƙirar kamar haka. Da farko mun lura cewa bambancin yana da alaƙa da haɗin kai kamar haka ga masu canji guda biyu bazuwar U da V. Σ(U,V) ρ(U,V)= (12.10) σ σ U V A nan ρ shine matrix na haɗin kai, Σ shine matrix na bambancin, σ shine bambancin daidaitacce na canjin U bazuwar U, kuma σ shine canjin misali na canjin V. LetU da V suna wakiltar karkacewa V a ƙwayoyin grid u da v bi da bi. Idan muka ɗauka cewa karkacewar daidaitacce iri ɗaya ne (daidai yake da σ), wanda yawanci haka lamarin yake, to muna da dabara mai zuwa. Σ(U,V)=σ2ρ(U,V) (12.11) σ2 shine bambancin, wanda ake ɗauka a matsayin mai dorewa. Ma'auni ne na bambancin tsari kuma daga yanzu za a nuna shi a matsayin σ. Wani muhimmin abin da za a ɗauka daga wannan lissafi shine cewa tsarin

Sarangi 354 P R M P R M P R M K K K + L/B - 1 spoH P Probe flit Probe Message flits Acknowledgement flit Response R flit M flit M Message flit M M Cycles Figure 8.13: Space-time diagram for circuit switching. K = 3 cycles, L = 2 flits, B = 1 flit/cycle. Assume each packet contains a single flit. The y-axis is the hop count (measured from the source). In addition, freezing a route in advance is not always a good idea. It is possible that there might be many more messages that might want to use parts of the route. They will not be able to traverse the route till it is released. Now that we have discussed the negative aspects of the protocol, let us briefly enumerate its ad- vantages. Any circuit switching protocol is always very simple, and works well in a scenario with less contention. They can also be implemented and verified easily. To understand the performance advant- ages, let us consider the latency once again. We had computed it to be 3K +L/B−1 cycles. If L/B is significantly greater than K, we can assume that the net latency is equal to L/B cycles. This means thatifweneedtosendaverylongmessage,theadditionaltimingoverheadoftheprobepacket,andthe acknowledgement appear to be negligible. Since we have reserved the full path, the entire message can be sent without any subsequent delays. One more advantage of this system is that we can use routers with very few buffers that are just needed to hold in-transit regular flits and probe/acknowledgement flits. In fact, such schemes can also be used with bufferless router designs. Once a path is set up, we do not need any long term packet storage structures in the routers. The routers just need to read data from the input ports, and write the data out at the relevant output ports. They need not buffer the data beyond the flits that are either not fully read or fully written. This will make our routers smaller, and more power efficient. Toconclude,circuitswitchingissimple,straightforward,yetisnotefficient. Itissuitedforscenarios that have less contention in the network and very long message lengths. 8.2.4 Packet Based Flow Control: Store and Forward (SAF) Instead of doing flow control at the level of messages, let us do it at the level of packets. As we shall see, this will give us far more flexibility in scheduling the reservation of resources, and will increase the net message transfer bandwidth among nodes in a chip. In this case, we do not reserve a full path for a message. Instead, we transmit individual packets separately. Therearedifferentmechanismsforchoosingthepath(route)thateachpacketwilltake. This canbedoneeitherstaticallyordynamically. WeshallstudyroutingmechanismsindetailinSection8.3. However,forallofthesemechanisms,weneedtoensurethatwehaveenoughresourcesintermsofbuffer space along the way. We do not ever want to lose a flit because we were not able to transmit it to the neighboring node. We assume that each router has several flit buffers. To store an entire packet, we need multiple flit buffers – one per each constituent flit. This is shown in Figure 8.14, where we show two nodes A and B, and a channel from A to B. Every channel has an associated set of flit buffers at its destination. The A → B channel has 4 dedicated

K = zagaye 3, L = ƙwaƙƙwalwa 2, B = ƙwaƙƙwalwa 1/zagaye. A ɗauka cewa kowane fakiti ya ƙunshi juyawa ɗaya. Axis y shine adadin ƙwaƙƙwalwa (wanda aka auna daga tushe). Bugu da ƙari, daskarewa hanya a gaba ba koyaushe kyakkyawan ra'ayi bane. Yana yiwuwa akwai ƙarin saƙonni da yawa waɗanda za su iya son amfani da sassan hanyar. Ba za su iya ratsa hanyar ba har sai an sake ta. Yanzu da muka tattauna ɓangarorin rashin kyau na yarjejeniyar, bari mu taƙaita fa'idodinta a taƙaice. Duk wani tsarin sauya da'ira koyaushe yana da sauƙi, kuma yana aiki da kyau a cikin yanayi mai ƙarancin jayayya. Haka kuma ana iya aiwatar da su kuma a tabbatar da su cikin sauƙi. Domin fahimtar fa'idodin aikin, bari mu sake la'akari da latency na . Mun ƙididdige shi zuwa zagayowar 3K +L/B−1. Idan L/B ya fi K girma sosai, za mu iya ɗauka cewa latency na <TECH>daidai yake da zagayowar L/B. Wannan yana nufin cewa idan akwai buƙatar aika saƙo mai tsawo, lokaci mai tsawo akan fakitin bincike, kuma amincewa ba ta da yawa. Tunda mun ajiye cikakken hanyar, ana iya aika saƙon gaba ɗaya ba tare da wani jinkiri ba. Wani fa'ida na wannan tsarin <TECH> shine cewa za mu iya amfani da na'urorin sadarwa masu ƙarancin ma'ajiyar bayanai waɗanda kawai ake buƙata don riƙe ma'ajiyar bayanai ta yau da kullun a cikin sufuri da ma'ajiyar bayanai/tabbatarwa. A zahiri, irin waɗannan tsare-tsaren kuma ana iya amfani da su tare da ƙirar na'urar sadarwa mara buffer. Da zarar an saita hanya, ba ma buƙatar wani tsarin ajiya na dogon lokaci a cikin na'urorin sadarwa. Masu amfani da na'urorin sadarwa kawai suna buƙatar karanta Bayanai daga tashoshin shigarwa, sannan su rubuta Bayanai a tashoshin fitarwa masu dacewa. Ba sa buƙatar adana Bayanai fiye da filts waɗanda ko dai ba su karanta sosai ba</TECH> ko kuma an rubuta su gaba ɗaya. Wannan zai sa na'urorin sadarwa namu su ƙanƙanta, kuma su fi inganci. A ƙarshe, sauyawar da'irori abu ne mai sauƙi, kai tsaye, amma ba shi da inganci. Ya dace da yanayi waɗanda ba su da jayayya sosai a cikin hanyar sadarwa da tsawon saƙonni masu tsawo. 8.2.4 Kula da Guduwar Fakiti: Ajiye da Gabatarwa (SAF) Maimakon yin sarrafa kwarara a matakin saƙonni, bari mu yi shi a matakin fakiti. Kamar yadda muke gani, wannan zai ba mu ƙarin sassauci wajen tsara ajiyar albarkatu, kuma zai ƙara canja wurin saƙon yanar gizo bandwidth tsakanin nodes a cikin guntu. A wannan yanayin, ba ma ajiye cikakken hanya don saƙo. Madadin haka, muna aika fakiti daban-daban daban. Akwai hanyoyi daban-daban don zaɓar hanyar (hanyar) da kowanne fakiti zai ɗauka. Wannan za a iya ɗauka ko dai ta hanyar tsari ko ta hanyar aiki. Za mu yi nazarin hanyoyin hanya dalla-dalla a Sashe na 8.3. Duk da haka, ga duk waɗannan hanyoyin, muna buƙatar tabbatar da cewa muna da isassun albarkatu dangane da sararin buffer a hanya. Ba ma son rasa flit saboda ba mu sami damar aika shi zuwa maƙwabcin kulli ba. Muna ɗauka cewa kowane na'ura mai ba da hanya tsakanin hanyoyin sadarwa yana da buffers da yawa. Don adana fakiti gaba ɗaya, muna buƙatar buffers da yawa - ɗaya ga kowane flit. An nuna wannan a Hoto na 8.14, inda muka nuna nodes biyu A da B, da kuma tashar daga A zuwa B. Kowane tasha yana da saitin buffers masu alaƙa a inda yake. Tashar A → B tana da 4 da aka keɓe

What name is given to the rock material carried away by a river? _______________________________________________________ 3. Name the four ways in which river erosion takes place. Name the areas where deposition takes place. _______________________________________________________ 5.2 DEVELOPMENT OF A RIVER VALLEY The erosional and depositional land features produced and modified by the action of running water may be better understood if we note the stages through which a stream passes from its source to its mouth. The source of a river may lie in a mountainous region and the mouth may meet the sea or lake. The whole path followed by a river is called its course or its valley. The course of a river is divided into three sections: (i) The upper course or the stage of youth (ii) The middle course or the stage of maturity (iii) The lower course or the stage of old age. (See Fig. 5.2)  Upper, middle and lower are the three courses into which a river valley is divided. (i) THE UPPER COURSE The upper or mountain course begins from source of the river in hilly or moun- tainous areas. The river tumbles down the steep slopes and as a result its velocity 82 GEOGRAPHY

Tushen kogin na iya yana cikin yankin tsaunuka kuma bakin na iya ya haɗu da teku ko tafki. Duk hanyar da kogi ke bi ana kiranta hanyarsa ko kwarinsa. Hanyar kogi an raba ta zuwa sassa uku: (i) Hanya ta sama ko matakin matasa (ii) Hanya ta tsakiya ko matakin balaga (iii) Hanya ta ƙasa ko matakin tsufa. translation.en: Software Requirements Specification for VIRS Page 3 2.3 User Classes and Characteristics Police officers are the major users of this system, and they use their devices constantly. On the other hand system managers who use the system as frequent as the officers and they mainly use the system to maintain it and make sure nothing is wrong with the system. Police officers don’t need to be experts and know exactly how the system is working but the system managers need to know how operations are taking place and how different situations are controlled. With their handheld devices police officers will be able to do the following: • Record Fines • Record Car Accidents • Car Card Inquiry • License Inquiry System managers will be able to do the following while logged in: • Check system stats • Check records to look for potential errors and security issues • Enter primitive traffic documents into databases 2.4 Operating Environment The software must be totally compatible with the police officers’ handheld devices and be able to take advantage of the device’s features such as internet and GPS connections. This software runs on a customized operating system which has been developed for officers’ handheld devices and is powered by a version 5 Linux kernel. The system is also can be accessed through a website as a web application, both of which allow access to the officers and system managers and provides relevant reports and functions. 2.5 Design and Implementation Constraints The software is constrained by the performance of processing power of the servers, database design, and DBMS software. Since the number of I/O requests are pretty high, an efficient way of doing the CRUD (Create, Read, Update, and Delete) operation is necessary. Since this is a national project, databases should be able to store a very large amount of data. Servers should be capable of storing several petabytes of data and fetching the desired data should be as fast as possible. The Internet connection is also a constraint for the application. Since the application fetches data from the database over the Internet, it is crucial that there is an Internet connection for the application to function. 2.6 User Documentation An online help system containing tutorials will be provided for police officers to show how to use the system correctly and efficiently.
translation.ha: Bayanin Bukatun Software don VIRS Shafi na 3 2.3 Mai amfani Darussa da Halaye Jami'an 'yan sanda su ne manyan masu amfani da wannan tsarin , kuma suna amfani da na'urorinsu koyaushe. A gefe guda kuma, manajojin tsarin  wadanda ke amfani da tsarin <TECH> akai-akai kamar jami'ai kuma galibi suna amfani da tsarin  don kula da shi da kuma tabbatar da cewa babu wani abu da ke damun tsarin . Jami'an 'yan sanda ba sa bukatar zama kwararru kuma sun san ainihin yadda tsarin  ke aiki amma manajojin tsarin  suna bukatar sanin yadda ake gudanar da ayyuka da kuma yadda ake sarrafa yanayi daban-daban. Da na'urorin hannu, jami'an 'yan sanda za su iya yin waɗannan abubuwa: • Rikodi Tarar kuɗi • Rikodi Hatsarin Mota • Binciken Katin Mota • Binciken Lasisi Tsarin manajojin za su iya yin waɗannan abubuwa yayin da suke shiga: • Duba ƙididdigar tsarin • Duba bayanan don neman kurakurai masu yuwuwa da matsalolin tsaro • Shigar da takaddun zirga-zirga na asali a cikin bayanan bayanai 2.4 Muhalli na Aiki: Dole ne software ɗin  ya kasance cikakke mai dacewa da na'urorin hannu na jami'an 'yan sanda kuma ya sami damar amfani da fasalulluka na na'urar kamar haɗin intanet da GPS. Wannan software yana aiki akan tsarin aiki na musamman na <TECH> wanda aka haɓaka don na'urorin hannu na jami'ai kuma yana aiki da kernel na Linux na sigar 5. Hakanan ana iya samun damar <TECH>tsarin ta gidan yanar gizo azaman aikace-aikacen yanar gizo na , duka biyun suna ba da damar shiga ga jami'ai da manajojin tsarin  kuma suna ba da rahotanni da ayyuka masu dacewa. 2.5 Takamaiman Tsarawa da Aiwatarwa Manhajar tana da iyaka saboda ƙarfin sarrafa sabar <TECH>, ƙirar rumbun adana bayanai, da kuma manhajar DBMS. Tunda yawan buƙatun I/O suna da yawa, hanya mai inganci ta yin aikin CRUD (Ƙirƙiri, Karanta, Sabuntawa, da Share) ya zama dole. Tunda wannan aiki ne na ƙasa, ya kamata rumbun adana bayanai su sami damar adana adadi mai yawa na <TECH>bayanai. Ya kamata sabobin su sami damar adana bayanai da yawa na <TECH>bayanai da kuma ɗaukar bayanan wanda ake so <TECH>ya kamatasu kasance cikin sauri gwargwadon iko. Haɗin intanet kuma yana da iyaka don aikace-aikacen <TECH>. Tunda aikace-aikacen  yana ɗaukar Bayanai daga rumbun adana bayanai na  ta Intanet, yana da mahimmanci a sami haɗin Intanet don aikace-aikacen  ya yi aiki. 2.6 Mai amfani Takardu Za a samar da taimakon kan layi na tsarin wanda ke ɗauke da koyaswa ga jami'an 'yan sanda don nuna yadda ake amfani da tsarin <TECH> daidai da inganci.

translation.en: Book Request: • Input: Request for NSC books by the member. • Output: If the member's request is accepted by the NSC then books will be provided otherwise apology message will be displayed. • Description: If member requests for some special book via API call to the system then that request will be transferred to the NSC by NatSColl. The response will be displayed as output. 3.6 Non-Functional Requirement: • Availability Requirement: The system should be available all the time to the user. • Efficiency Requirement: Mean Time to Repair - even if the system fails it will recover quickly. • Accuracy: It will precisely provide real-time information about members data and library, taking into consideration various concurrency issues. • Hardware Constraints: The system requires a database to store data related to the library and its members. The database should have backup capabilities. • Privacy Requirments: No one without registered users cannot enter-into the website. Every user has its own personalised view in the system. 9
translation.ha: Buƙatar Littafi: • Shigarwa: Buƙatar littattafan NSC daga memba. • Fitowa: Idan buƙatar memba ta NSC ta karɓi buƙatar memba, to za a ba da littattafai idan ba haka ba, za a nuna saƙon neman afuwa. • Bayani: Idan memba ya nemi wani littafi na musamman ta hanyar kiran API zuwa tsarin  to za a tura wannan buƙatar zuwa NSC ta NatSColl. Za a nuna amsar a matsayin fitarwa. 3.6 Ba-<TECH>Buƙatar <TECH>Aiki</TECH>: • Samuwa Buƙatar: Ya kamata tsarin  ya kasance a koyaushe ga mai amfani da <TECH>. • Inganci Buƙatar: Matsakaicin Lokaci don Gyara - koda tsarin  ya gaza, zai murmure da sauri. • Daidaito: Zai samar da bayanai na ainihin lokaci bayanai game da membobi bayanai da ɗakin karatu, tare da la'akari da matsaloli daban-daban na daidaito. • Takaddun Kayan Aiki: Tsarin  yana buƙatar <TECH>bayanai don ajiye <TECH>bayanai</TECH> da suka shafi ɗakin karatu da membobinsa. Ya kamata bayanai  ya kasance yana da damar madadin bayanai. • Bukatun <TECH>Sirri: Babu wanda ba shi da masu amfani da aka yi wa rijista ba zai iya shiga gidan yanar gizon ba. Kowane mai amfani yana da nasa ra'ayi na musamman a cikin tsarin <TECH>. 9

translation.en: Smruti R. Sarangi 690 chunk. TheIVisgeneratedwhentheenclaveiscreated. Thiswillensurethattwochunkswiththesame contents are encrypted differently. Finally, for computing the MAC we can use one of the known hashing algorithms, and the same AES hardware with counters for encrypting it. This method of computing the MAC is known as the Carter-Wegman construction [Wegman and Carter, 1981]. Read Operation Every time we have a miss in the last level cache (LLC) we need to send a request to main memory. We read the 64-byte data block, and its associated 64-bit MAC using two separate memory requests. This process takes a long time – typically 100-300 cycles. During this time we use the counter mode decryption algorithm to compute the OTP. The key innovation here is that the latency of this entire operation,computingtheOTP,getshiddenintheshadowoftheLLCmiss. Thedecryptionoperationis thus not on the critical path. Once we get the encrypted data and its MAC, we decrypt them using the computed OTP. We can either wait to compute and verify the hash, or we can speculatively send the data to the LLC. Note that whenever we detect an ACIF violation, it is a catastrophic event, and we need to shut the processor down. Hence, there is no harm in sending the data to the LLC and verifying the hash at the same time. If there is no integrity violation (hashes match) then there is no problem, and if the hashes do not match then also sending the data early to the LLC does not matter because we shall lose all the erroneous volatile state by turning off the processor. Since we verify the MAC, we can detect spoofing attacks – attacker cannot send arbitrary data. The block address is a part of the OTP; we can thus detect splicing attacks – attacker cannot replace the contents of memory locations (A,B) (data, MAC) with the contents of memory locations (C,D). Finally, since we use different counters each time we write a block to main memory, the attacker cannot mount a replay attack. Evict Operation Whenever, we evict a modified block from the LLC and write it to main memory, we need to encrypt it. This is done as follows. We first increment the minor counter in the counter cache; this creates a new encrypted version of the block. This will ensure that every time a block is written to memory it gets a new OTP (same effect as changing the encryption key). We can increase randomness further by initializing each major counter to a random value. The minor counters can still be initialized to 0. Corner Cases What happens if a minor counter overflows? This means it reaches 26−1 (63). We would not like to reuse counter values – this enlarges the attack surface. Thus, we can reset all the minor counters to 0, andincrementthemajorcounter. Themajorcounteris64-bitslong,andinpracticewillneveroverflow. This further implies that we need to read all the blocks in the page that are there in main memory, re-encrypt them with the new pair of counters, and write them back. This is an expensive operation. Fortunately, it is rather infrequent. Important Point 21 The important point to note here is that if all the counters are stored correctly, then the system provides all ACIF guarantees, or the system stops because an ACIF violation is detected. Using counters and MACs prevents eavesdropping, spoofing, splicing, and replay attacks. The reader needs to convince herself of this fact. Integrity Verification: Merkle Tree Classical Approach Our entire architecture’s security only depends on the integrity of the counters. As long as they are
translation.ha: Smruti R. Sarangi 690 part. An samar da IV lokacin da aka ƙirƙiri. Wannan zai tabbatar da cewa an ɓoye sassa biyu tare da abubuwan da ke ciki daban. A ƙarshe, don ƙididdige MAC za mu iya amfani da ɗaya daga cikin sanannun algorithms na hashing, da kuma kayan aikin AES iri ɗaya tare da masu ƙididdigewa don ɓoye shi. Wannan hanyar ƙididdige MAC ana kiranta da ginin Carter-Wegman [Wegman da Carter, 1981]. Karanta Aiki Duk lokacin da muka sami kuskure a cikin cache na matakin ƙarshe (LLC) muna buƙatar aika buƙata zuwa babban ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya. Muna karanta toshe bayanai na  byte 64, da MAC mai bit 64 da ke da alaƙa ta amfani da buƙatun ƙwaƙwalwa guda biyu daban-daban. Wannan tsari yana ɗaukar lokaci mai tsawo - yawanci zagaye 100-300. A wannan lokacin muna amfani da algorithm na decryption yanayin counter don ƙididdige OTP. Babban abin kirkire-kirkire a nan shi ne cewa <TECH>latency na wannan aikin gaba ɗaya, na kwamfuta, yana da matsala a cikin inuwar theLLC. Saboda haka, aikin decryption ba ya kan hanya mai mahimmanci. Da zarar mun sami bayanan  da aka ɓoye da MAC ɗinsa, za mu cire su ta amfani da OTP da aka ƙirƙiro. Za mu iya jira mu ƙirƙiro da tabbatar da hash ɗin, ko kuma mu iya aika bayanan <TECH> zuwa LLC cikin hasashe. Lura cewa duk lokacin da muka gano keta ACIF, babban lamari ne, kuma muna buƙatar rufe na'urar sarrafawa. Saboda haka, babu laifi a aika bayanan  zuwa LLC da kuma tabbatar da hash ɗin a lokaci guda. Idan babu keta mutunci (hashes match) to babu matsala, kuma idan hashes ɗin ba su dace ba to aika bayanan  da wuri zuwa LLC ba shi da mahimmanci saboda za mu rasa duk yanayin da ba daidai ba ta hanyar kashe na'urar sarrafawa. Tunda mun tabbatar da MAC, za mu iya gano hare-haren bogi - mai kai hari ba zai iya aika bayanan bazuwar ba. Adireshin toshe wani ɓangare ne na OTP; don haka za mu iya gano hare-haren haɗaka - mai kai hari ba zai iya maye gurbin abubuwan da ke cikin wuraren ƙwaƙwalwa ba (A,B) (<TECH>data, MAC) tare da abubuwan da ke cikin wuraren ƙwaƙwalwa (C,D). A ƙarshe, tunda muna amfani da ƙididdiga daban-daban duk lokacin da muka rubuta toshe zuwa babban ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya, mai kai hari ba zai iya ɗora harin sake kunnawa ba. Aikin Korar Duk lokacin da muka fitar da toshe da aka gyara daga LLC kuma muka rubuta shi zuwa babban ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya, muna buƙatar ɓoye shi. Ana yin wannan kamar haka. Da farko muna ƙara ƙaramin counter a cikin cache na counter; wannan yana ƙirƙirar sabon sigar ɓoye na toshe. Wannan zai tabbatar da cewa duk lokacin da aka rubuta toshe zuwa ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya yana samun sabon OTP (daidai da canza maɓallin ɓoyewa). Za mu iya ƙara bazuwar ta hanyar fara kowane babban counter zuwa ƙimar bazuwar. Har yanzu ana iya fara ƙananan counters zuwa 0. Lamura na Kusurwa Me zai faru idan ƙaramin counter ya cika? Wannan yana nufin ya kai 26−1 (63). Ba za mu so mu sake amfani da ƙimar maimaitawa ba - wannan yana faɗaɗa saman harin. Don haka, za mu iya sake saita duk ƙananan ƙididdigewa zuwa 0, kuma ƙara babban ƙididdigewa. Babban ƙididdigewa yana da tsayin bit 64, kuma a aikace ba zai taɓa wuce gona da iri ba. Wannan yana ƙara nuna cewa muna buƙatar karanta duk tubalan da ke cikin shafin da ke cikin babban ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya, sake ɓoye su da sabbin ƙididdigewa, sannan a sake rubuta su. Wannan aiki ne mai tsada. Abin farin ciki, ba kasafai yake faruwa ba. Muhimmin batu na 21 Muhimmin batu da za a lura a nan shi ne cewa idan an adana duk ƙididdigewa daidai, to tsarin  yana ba da duk garantin ACIF, ko kuma tsarin  yana tsayawa saboda an gano keta ACIF. Amfani da ƙididdigewa da MACs yana hana sata, zamba, haɗawa, da sake maimaita hare-hare. Mai karatu yana buƙatar shawo kan kansa game da wannan gaskiyar. Tabbatar da Gaskiya: Hanyar Gargajiya ta Merkle Tsarin Tsaron  na gine-ginenmu ya dogara ne kawai akan amincin ƙididdigewa. Muddin dai suna

translation.en: Biosphere MODULE - 5 The domain of Life This is happening due to certain recent human activities which have injected certain on the Earth chemicals in the stratosphere which consume ozone and reduce its concentration. Depletion is mainly caused by chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs), halons, methyl chloroform and carbon tetrachlorides. These chemical substances are mainly either chlorine or bromine which can reach the stratosphere and catalytically break down ozone into oxygen. CFCs are odourless, non-flamable, non-corosive and nontoxic. Notes For this reason, scientist originally believed CFCs could not possibly have any effect on the environment. That is why it is widely used in refrigeration and air conditioning, in foam and plastic manufacturing and in aerosol sprays. Not only is the ozone layer thinning, in some places it has temporarily disappeared. A hole in the layer has developed over Antarctic since 1979 and that hole has persisted for a longer and longer time every year. In 1988, an ozone hole was found over the Arctic for the first time and it too has lasted longer and longer each year since then. Can we prevent this disaster? It needs certain actions both at individual as well as governmental level. Since the last two decades, certain actions have been initiated at global level. Among these Montreal Protocol of 1987 and London Conference of 1992 are important. In both these conferences it was decided that the developed countries would totally ban CFC production by 2000 and the developing countries by 2010AD. Even if it is sincerely followed and strictly implemented by all the 150 countries including India, who are signatory to Montreal Protocol even then the chlorofluorocarbon and chlorine shall continue their influance for another 100 years. Therefore, all over the world research efforts are continuing for development of substitutes of CFC as coolants for refrigerators and air conditioners. (c) Acid Rain The term ‘acid rain’ refers to the deposition of wet or dry acidic materials from the atmosphere on the earth’s surface. Although most conspicuously associated with rainfall, the pollutants may fall on the earth’s surface either in the form of snow, sleet, hail or fog or in the dry form of gases or particulate matter. Sulphuric acid and nitric acid is considered as the principal agents responsible for acid rain. But the major culprit are human beings. Smokes emitted from the industries is the major source of sulphur dioxide whereas smokes emitted from the motor vehicle is the major source of nitrogen oxide. These emissions mixed with atmospheric moisture form the sulphuric acid and nitric acids which, sooner or later precipitate on earth in various form. Acidity is measured on a pH scale based on the relative concentration of hydrogen ions. The scale ranges from 0 to 14, where the lower end represents extreme acidity and the upper end extreme alkalinity. (see diagram). As stated earlier acid rain is associated with various forms of precipitation. It we look at rainfall in clean and dust free air, a pH value varies between 5.6 to 6.0, which is slightly acidic in nature. Whenever or wherever the pH value is below 5.6, then the damage becomes noticeable. GEOGRAPHY 261
translation.ha: MASU KYAUTAR BIYA - 5 Fannin Rayuwa Wannan yana faruwa ne saboda wasu ayyukan ɗan adam na baya-bayan nan waɗanda suka yi allurar wasu sinadarai a Duniya a cikin stratosphere waɗanda ke cinye ozone kuma suna rage yawansa. Ragewar galibi yana faruwa ne sakamakon chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs), halons, methyl chloroform da carbon tetrachloride. Waɗannan sinadarai galibi chlorine ne ko bromine waɗanda zasu iya isa stratosphere kuma su karya ozone zuwa iskar oxygen ta hanyar catalytic. CFCs ba su da ƙamshi, ba sa ƙonewa, ba sa lalata kuma ba sa guba. Bayani Saboda wannan dalili, masanin kimiyya da farko ya yi imanin cewa CFCs ba zai iya yin wani tasiri ga muhalli ba. Shi ya sa ake amfani da shi sosai a cikin firiji da kwandishan, a cikin kera kumfa da filastik da kuma a cikin feshi na aerosol. Ba wai kawai yana rage girman ozone ba, a wasu wurare ya ɓace na ɗan lokaci. Rami a cikin Layer ya bunƙasa a kan Antarctic tun 1979 kuma wannan ramin ya daɗe na tsawon lokaci kowace shekara. A shekarar 1988, an gano wani ramin ozone a saman yankin Arctic a karon farko kuma ya daɗe yana daɗewa kowace shekara tun daga lokacin. Za mu iya hana wannan bala'in? Yana buƙatar wasu ayyuka a matakin mutum ɗaya da na gwamnati. Tun daga shekaru ashirin da suka gabata, an fara wasu ayyuka a matakin duniya. Daga cikin waɗannan yarjejeniyar "TECH" ta Montreal ta 1987 da kuma taron "TECH" na London ta 1992 suna da mahimmanci. A cikin waɗannan tarukan biyu, an yanke shawarar cewa ƙasashen da suka ci gaba za su haramta samar da CFC gaba ɗaya nan da shekarar 2000 da kuma ƙasashe masu tasowa nan da shekarar 2010AD. Ko da kuwa an bi shi da gaske kuma an aiwatar da shi sosai daga dukkan ƙasashe 150, ciki har da Indiya, waɗanda suka rattaba hannu kan yarjejeniyar "TECH" ta Montreal ta TECH" ko da chlorofluorocarbon da chlorine ta TECH za su ci gaba da tasiri na tsawon shekaru 100. Saboda haka, a duk faɗin duniya, ana ci gaba da ƙoƙarin bincike don haɓaka madadin CFC a matsayin masu sanyaya iska don firiji da kwandishan. (c) Ruwan Sama Mai Tsami Kalmar 'ruwan sama mai tsami' tana nufin ajiye kayan acid masu danshi ko busasshe daga sararin samaniya a saman duniya. Duk da cewa an fi danganta su da ruwan sama, gurɓatattun abubuwa <TECH>na iya faɗuwa a saman duniya ko dai a cikin siffar dusar ƙanƙara, ƙanƙara, ƙanƙara ko hazo ko kuma a cikin busasshen iskar gas ko ƙwayoyin cuta. Ana ɗaukar sinadarin Sulphuric da nitric acid a matsayin manyan abubuwan da ke haifar da ruwan sama mai tsami. Amma babban abin da ke haifar da hakan mutane ne. Hayakin da ake fitarwa daga masana'antu shine babban tushen sulfur dioxide yayin da hayakin da ake fitarwa daga abin hawa shine babban tushen nitrogen oxide. Waɗannan hayakin da aka gauraya da danshi na yanayi suna samar da sinadarin sulfuric da nitric acid waɗanda, ba da daɗewa ba ko ba da daɗewa ba suna faɗuwa a duniya a cikin nau'i daban-daban. Ana auna sinadarin acid a kan sikelin pH bisa ga yawan sinadarin hydrogen ions. Ma'aunin yana tsakanin 0 zuwa 14, inda ƙasan ƙarshen ke wakiltar matsanancin acid da kuma babban alkalinity na sama. (duba zane). Kamar yadda aka ambata a baya ruwan acid yana da alaƙa da nau'ikan ruwan sama daban-daban. Idan muka duba ruwan sama a cikin iska mai tsabta da kuma mara ƙura, ƙimar pH ta bambanta tsakanin 5.6 zuwa 6.0, wanda yake ɗan ɗan acidic a yanayi. Duk lokacin ko duk inda ƙimar pH ta kasance ƙasa da 5.6, to lalacewar za ta bayyana. GEOGRAPHY 261

translation.en: 609 Smruti R. Sarangi the overall CPU power budget. The important point to understand is that even though the leakage cur- rent and the resultant leakage power in a given transistor are at least an order of magnitude lower than the dynamic power, they become significant when we consider the cumulative sum across the billions of transistors. Additionally, note that a rather small fraction of transistors is active or switching its state at a given point of time. The total number of transistors is actually an order of magnitude more. If we take both of these effects into account, the leakage power becomes disproportionately important. Itisimportanttomentionthattounderstandtherestofthediscussioninthissection,itisnecessary to go through Section 7.3.3, and also understand the basic structure of a transistor. For the latter, interested readers can refer to a standard text on digital electronics [Taub and Schilling, 1977]. 11.1.1 Dynamic Power The Notion of Voltage Transitions As we discussed in Section 7.3.3, a lot of circuits in modern processors including memories can be approximated as RC networks. Every circuit element can be replaced with an equivalent RC model and the subsequent calculations are reasonably accurate – at least to get a broad estimate and get an idea oftheoveralltrends. ConsiderapairoftwoinvertersinseriesasshowninFigure11.1. Thegatesofthe two transistors in inverter I have an associated gate capacitance. These capacitors need to be charged 2 if we need to set the voltage at the gates of I to a logical 1. If they were at a logical 0, then current 2 needs to flow via the PMOS transistor (T ) of inverter I to charge these capacitors. Whenever there 1 1 is a current flow in a circuit, it leads to power dissipation across the resistive elements. Even though we cannot see any resistor in the circuit diagram of Figure 11.1, however the equivalent circuit of these transistors has resistive elements (described in detail in Section 7.3.3). In general, whenever there is a current flow across any device (transistor or capacitor), we shall encounter an associated resistance. We observe a resultant power dissipation – I2R loss. I 1 I 2 T T 1 3 Input Output T T 2 4 Figure 11.1: Circuit with two inverters in series We can make a generalized observation here. Whenever there is a current flow in a circuit to effect a transition in the voltage level (logical 0 → 1, or 1 → 0), there is some amount of dynamic power dissipationbecauseofthepassageofcurrentthroughresistiveelementsinthecircuitsandinthedevices themselves. Hence, to compute the dynamic power dissipation of a circuit, we need to locate all the voltage transitions in a cycle, compute the current flow required to effect the transitions, and then compute the sum of the resistive (I2R) losses throughout the circuit. translation.ha: 609 Smruti R. Sarangi jimlar kasafin kuɗin wutar lantarki na CPU. Muhimmin abin da za a fahimta shi ne, duk da cewa yanzu na zubar da ruwa da kuma ƙarfin zubar da ruwa da ke fitowa a cikin wani transistor ya kasance aƙalla tsari na girma fiye da ƙarfin motsi, suna da mahimmanci idan muka yi la'akari da jimlar tarin a cikin biliyoyin transistor. Bugu da ƙari, lura cewa ƙaramin ƙaramin juzu'i na transistor yana aiki ko canza yanayinsa a wani lokaci da aka ƙayyade. Jimlar adadin transistor a zahiri tsari ne na girma. Idan muka yi la'akari da waɗannan tasirin guda biyu, ƙarfin zubar da ruwa ya zama mahimmanci ba daidai ba. Yana da mahimmanci a ambaci cewa don fahimtar sauran tattaunawar a cikin wannan sashe, yana da mahimmanci a duba Sashe na 7.3.3, kuma a fahimci tsarin asali na transistor. Ga na ƙarshe, masu karatu masu sha'awar za su iya komawa ga rubutu na daidaitacce akan na'urorin lantarki na dijital [Taub da Schilling, 1977]. 11.1.1 Ƙarfin Canji Mai Sauƙi Ma'anar Canjin Wutar Lantarki Kamar yadda muka tattauna a Sashe na 7.3.3, ana iya kimanta da'irori da yawa a cikin na'urori masu sarrafawa na zamani, gami da abubuwan tunawa, a matsayin hanyoyin sadarwa na RC. Ana iya maye gurbin kowane ɓangaren da'ira da samfurin RC daidai kuma lissafin da ke biyo baya daidai ne - aƙalla don samun kimantawa mai faɗi da kuma samun ra'ayin yanayin gabaɗaya. Yi la'akari da na'urori biyu masu canzawa cikin jerin da aka nuna a Hoto na 11.1. Na'urorin transistors guda biyu a cikin inverter Ina da ƙarfin ƙofar da ke da alaƙa. Waɗannan na'urorin capacitors suna buƙatar a caje su 2 idan muna buƙatar saita ƙarfin lantarki a ƙofofin I zuwa na ma'ana 1. Idan suna a ma'ana 0, to na'urar 2 tana buƙatar gudana ta hanyar transistor na PMOS (T) na inverter I don cajin waɗannan na'urorin capacitors. Duk lokacin da akwai 1 1 akwai kwararar wutar lantarki a cikin da'ira, yana haifar da wargajewar wutar lantarki a kan abubuwan da ke da juriya. Ko da yake ba za mu iya ganin wani resistor a cikin zane na da'irar Hoto na 11.1 ba, duk da haka da'irar da ta yi daidai da waɗannan transistor ɗin tana da abubuwan resistor (an bayyana dalla-dalla a cikin Sashe na 7.3.3). Gabaɗaya, duk lokacin da akwai kwararar wuta a kan kowace na'ura (transistor ko capacitor), za mu za muci karo da juriya mai alaƙa. Mun lura da raguwar wutar lantarki sakamakon - asarar I2R. I 1 I 2 T T 1 3 Fitowar Shigarwa T T 2 4 Hoto na 11.1: Da'ira tare da inverters guda biyu a jere Za mu iya yin lura gabaɗaya a nan. Duk lokacin da akwai kwararar wuta a cikin da'ira don aiwatar da sauyi a matakin ƙarfin lantarki (ma'ana 0 → 1, ko 1 → 0), akwai ɗan raguwar wutar lantarki mai ƙarfi saboda wucewar abubuwan resistive a cikin da'irori da na'urori da kansu. Saboda haka, domin ƙididdige wargajewar wutar lantarki mai ƙarfi na da'ira, muna buƙatar gano duk canjin wutar lantarki a cikin da'ira, ƙididdige kwararar wutar lantarki da ake buƙata don yin tasiri ga sauye-sauyen, sannan mu ƙididdige jimlar asarar da aka samu ta hanyar juriya (I2R) a cikin da'irar. translation.en: CHART: LINK: Attached link contains excel file of Gantt chart. my.sharepoint.com/:x:/g/personal/sparsh_wabhale2020_vitstudent_ac_in/EZcgF0Ovn9pEgC ZNV12Gjs8BVK7E4dTDIOl30yDwrjW05Q 2.4 Operating Environment This is a system which will require the operating environment of a client and server GUI. The software is expected to run in an interactive based environment where the system will run on the basis of interaction with user. The software is required to run, maintain and process a real environment to manage database of the college. The centralized database is used to store the information. The users only within the college are allowed to access the software. The software is expected to run majorly on Windows. The software will further be upgraded to operate on various other operating systems. The software would process data from a centralized database of the college to different departments or branches. The centralized data will be maintained, updated and secured by the administrator. The software will be installed in all the systems of the college and will be connected to the centralized database to access data through LAN (Local area network). This way the data can be accessed by various departments based on user interaction. Page | 16

translation.en: 13 Secure Processor Architectures Up till now we have assumed that all the components that we use are trustworthy. Of course, they can develop faults, and they can fail; however, they will not deliberately introduce faults, or leak sensitive datatounauthorizedoutsiders. Sadly,theseassumptionsarenotvalidintoday’scomplexworld. Modern computingsystemshavetobedesignedtobeimmunetovariouskindsofattacks. Otherwise,itispossible that sensitive data such as passwords and credit card numbers can be stolen and used by malicious adversaries. Hence, gradually security is becoming an important criterion for designing processors and computing systems in general. Inthischapter,weshallprimarilylookattwoimportantaspectsofsecuritynamelyconfidentialityand integrity. The former ensures that data is encrypted and is not visible to outsiders. The latter ensures thatitisnotpossibletomaliciouslychangethecontentsofdataorinstructions,andremainundetected. First,weshalldiscussthecryptographicprimitivesthatarenecessarytoenforcetheseproperties. Then, we shall design architectures that use basic cryptographic hardware and protect different aspects of the processor and the memory system. Definition 100 Confidentiality Data is encrypted, and the original data cannot be inferred from the encrypted data. Integrity The data has not been tampered with. 13.1 Data Encryption Given a piece of text known as the plaintext, the aim is to encrypt it to an encrypted form. The resultingtextisknownastheciphertext,whichtypicallyhasthesamesizeastheoriginalplaintext. Any algorithm that encrypts datais known asan encryption algorithm. Ingeneral, the algorithmis not kept hidden, instead we protect the key, which is a small 128-256 bit number that determines the result of 671

Saboda haka, a hankali <TECH>tsaro yana zama muhimmin ma'auni don tsara na'urori masu sarrafawa da tsarin kwamfuta gabaɗaya. Na biyun yana tabbatar da cewa ba zai yiwu a canza abubuwan da ke cikin bayanai ko umarni ba, kuma a ci gaba da gano su. Da farko, za mu tattauna batun tsarin sirri na asali wanda ake buƙata don tilasta waɗannan kadarorin. translation.en: Smruti R. Sarangi 120 are able to find a lot of independent instructions between cycles 4 and 9, then there is no problem: our pipeline will always be full of instructions. However, this need not be the case all the time. Sometimes we might not find enough independent instructions. In this case, the pipeline will not have any work to do, and our performance will dip. In fact the situation is far worse than a simple in-order pipeline where for such execution sequences we would not have stalled. Clearly, we are not getting any benefit out of an OOO pipeline. To ensure that we are able to get some gains out of an OOO pipeline we need to ensure that such instructions with a RAW dependence can execute in consecutive cycles. This will at least ensure that we are doing as well as an in-order pipeline. The additional benefits of OOO pipelines will accrue when we find enough independent instructions to fill up the rest of the issue slots. Nevertheless, waiting for 5 cycles to issue a consumer instruction seems to be a very bad idea. Let us aim for 1 cycle, which is the minimum (same as an in-order pipeline). Letusthussummarizeournewfoundobjective. ItistoexecuteinstructionswithaRAWdependence in consecutive cycles. Let us only confine our attention to regular arithmetic instructions, and keep memory instructions out of this discussion for the time being. Such an execution paradigm, known as back-to-back execution, is very beneficial and will guarantee us some degree of minimum performance, even in programs with very little instruction level parallelism (ILP) (see Definition 8). Toensureback-to-backexecution,weneedtotakeaverydeeplookatthreeactionsnamelybroadcast, wakeup, and select. If a producer instruction wakes up in cycle i, then the consumer instruction has to wake up in cycle i+1. Before getting overly concerned with the exact mechanism, let us start drawing some diagrams to explain the process. We shall then add some meat to the bones by working on the mechanism. At the moment, this is what we need to ensure: i i + 1 producer wakeup wakeup consumer Now, given the fact that we need to perform a select operation, after an instruction wakes up, we have two options. Assume that we have slightly optimized our wakeup and select procedures such that they fit in a single cycle. In this case, the instruction can get selected in the same cycle. Assume it does get selected. We thus have arrived at the following pipeline diagram. i i + 1 wakeup producer select consumer wakeup
translation.ha: Smruti R. Sarangi 120 na iya samun umarni masu zaman kansu da yawa tsakanin zagaye na 4 da 9, to babu matsala: bututun mu zai kasance cike da umarni koyaushe. Duk da haka, wannan ba lallai bane ya zama haka a kowane lokaci. Wani lokaci ba za mu iya samun isassun umarni masu zaman kansu ba. A wannan yanayin, bututun ba zai sami wani aiki da za mu yi ba, kuma aikinmu na TECH zai ragu. A gaskiya ma lamarin ya fi muni fiye da bututun mai sauƙi wanda ba za mu tsaya ba don irin waɗannan jerin aiwatarwa. A bayyane yake, ba mu samun wata fa'ida daga bututun OOO ba. Don tabbatar da cewa mun sami wasu fa'idodi daga bututun OOO muna buƙatar tabbatar da cewa irin waɗannan umarnin tare da dogaro da RAW na iya aiki a cikin zagaye a jere. Wannan zai tabbatar da cewa muna aiki da bututun mai tsari. Ƙarin fa'idodin bututun OOO za su taru lokacin da muka sami isassun umarni masu zaman kansu don cike sauran ramukan matsala. Duk da haka, jiran zagaye 5 don fitar da umarnin mabukaci ya zama mummunan ra'ayi. Bari mu yi nufin zagaye 1, wanda shine mafi ƙaranci (daidai da bututun da ke cikin tsari). Bari mu taƙaita sabon manufarmu. Aiwatar da umarni tare da dogaro da RAW a cikin zagayen jere. Bari mu takaita hankalinmu ga umarnin lissafi na yau da kullun, kuma mu bar umarnin ƙwaƙwalwa a cikin wannan tattaunawar a yanzu. Irin wannan tsarin aiwatarwa, wanda aka sani da aiwatarwa baya-baya, yana da matukar amfani kuma zai tabbatar mana da wani matakin ƙaramin aikin , koda a cikin shirye-shirye waɗanda ba su da ƙarancin daidaituwar matakin koyarwa (ILP) (duba Ma'anar 8). Aiwatarwa baya-zuwa-baya, muna buƙatar ɗaukar zurfin kallo a ayyuka uku wato watsawa, farkawa, da zaɓi. Idan umarnin mai samarwa ya farka a cikin zagaye i, to umarnin mai amfani dole ne ya farka a cikin zagaye i+1. Kafin mu damu da ainihin tsarin, bari mu fara zana wasu zane-zane don bayyana tsarin. Za mu za mu sannan mu ƙara nama a cikin ƙasusuwa ta hanyar yin aiki akan tsarin. A halin yanzu, wannan shine abin da muke buƙatar tabbatarwa: i i + 1 mai samar da farkawa mai farkawa Yanzu, idan aka yi la'akari da cewa muna buƙatar yin wani aiki na musamman, bayan umarni ya farka, muna da zaɓuɓɓuka biyu. A ɗauka cewa mun ɗan inganta farkawa da zaɓar hanyoyin da za su dace da zagayowar guda ɗaya. A wannan yanayin, ana iya zaɓar umarnin a cikin zagayowar iri ɗaya. A ɗauka cewa an zaɓe shi. Don haka mun isa ga zane mai zuwa na bututun. i i + 1 mai samar da farkawa mai zaɓar farkawa mai amfani

translation.en: MODULE - 2 Major Landforms and their Economic Significance Changing face of the Earth The great alluvial plain of northern India has been formed by the rivers Ganga, Sutlej and the Brahmaputra. (e) Natural Political Frontiers The mountain ranges do act as natural political frontiers between Notes countries and protect them from invasions to some extent. The Himalaya have formed a political frontier between India and China. (f) Effect on Climate Mountainous areas have lower temperatures. They serve as climatic divide between two adjoining regions. The Himalaya for example form a barrier to the movement of cold winds from Central Asia towards the Indian subcontinent. They also force the South West Monsoons to ascend and cause rainfall on their southern slopes. (g) Tourist Centres The pleasant climate and the beautiful scenery of the mountains have led to their development as centres of tourist attraction. The tourist and hotel industries get an additional encouragement in such regions. Shimla, Nainital, Mussorie and Srinagar are some of the important hill stations of India which attract tourists all over the world. INTEXT QUESTIONS 7.1 1. Name the three major landforms found on the earth’s surface. (i)_______________ (ii)_________________ iii) _______________ 2. Answer in brief (a) From which rock type have the fold mountains been formed? ____________________________________________________ (b) By which forces are the fold mountains formed? ____________________________________________________ (c) Name the four important hill stations of India. (i) _______________________ (ii)_____________________ (iii) ______________________ (iv) _____________________ 3. Write the type of mountain in the brackets: (a) The Black forest ( ) (b) The Nilgiris ( ) (c) The Fuji Yama ( ) (d) The Andes ( ) 126 GEOGRAPHY
