translation.en: Earth’s Interior and Its Material MODULE - 2 Changing face of the (c) Disintegration of rocks without any change in their chemical composi- Earth tion ___________________________________________________ Notes CHEMICAL WEATHERING Chemical change in the rocks through formation of new compounds or formation of new substances is called chemical weathering. Chemical processes include oxi- dation, hydrolysis, and acid solution.  Decomposition of rocks by chemical processes with the help of water and atmospheric gases is called chemical weathering. Chamical weathering involves four major processes: (a) Oxidation This is the process in which atmospheric oxygen reacts with the rock to produce oxides. The process is called oxidation. Greatest impact of this process is observed on ferrous minerals. Oxygen present in humid air reacts with iron grains in the rocks to form a yellow or red oxide of iron. This is called rusting of the iron. Rust decomposes rocks completely with passage of time. (b) Carbonation This is the process by which various types of carbonates are formed. Some of these carbonates are soluble in water. For example, when rain water con- taining carbon dioxide passes through pervious limestone rocks, the rock joints enlarge due to the action of carbonic acid. The joints enlarge in size and lime is removed in solution. This type of breakdown of rocks is called carbonation. (c) Hydration This is the process by which water is absorbed by the minerals of the rock. Due to the absorption of water by the rock, its volume increases and the grains lose their shape. Feldspar, for example, is changed into kaolin through hydration. Kaolin on Vindhyan Hills near Jabalpur has been formed in this manner. (d) Solution This is the process in which some of the minerals get dissolved in water. They are therefore removed in solution. Rock salt and gypsum are removed by this process.  Chemical weathering involves the process of oxidation, carbonation, hy- dration-and solution. GEOGRAPHY 29
translation.ha: Ciki na Duniya da Kayanta - 2 Canza fuska na (c) Rushewar duwatsu ba tare da wani canji a cikin sinadaransu ba - Tsarin Duniya _____________________________________ Bayanan kula da YANAYIN SINADARI Canjin sinadarai a cikin duwatsu ta hanyar samar da sabbin mahadi ko samar da sabbin abubuwa ana kiransa da yanayin sinadarai. Tsarin sinadarai sun haɗa da iskar oxygen, hydrolysis, da kuma maganin acid.  Rushewar duwatsu ta hanyar hanyoyin sinadarai tare da taimakon ruwa da iskar gas na yanayi ana kiransa yanayin sinadarai. Tsarin yanayi na Chamical ya ƙunshi manyan matakai guda huɗu: (a) Iskar oxygen Wannan shine tsarin da iskar oxygen ta yanayi ke amsawa da dutsen don samar da iskar oxygen. Ana kiran wannan tsari iskar oxygen. Babban tasirin wannan tsari ana lura da shi akan ma'adanai masu ƙarfe. Iskar oxygen da ke cikin iska mai danshi tana amsawa da ƙwayoyin ƙarfe a cikin duwatsu don samar da iskar oxygen mai launin rawaya ko ja. Wannan ana kiransa tsatsa ta ƙarfe. Tsatsa tana lalata duwatsu gaba ɗaya bayan lokaci. (b) Iskar carbon Wannan shine tsarin da ake samar da nau'ikan carbonates daban-daban. Wasu daga cikin waɗannan carbonates suna narkewa a cikin ruwa. Misali, lokacin da ruwan sama mai dauke da carbon dioxide ya ratsa ta cikin duwatsun dutse na baya, gidajen duwatsun suna girma saboda aikin carbonic acid. Hadin gwiwar suna girma a girma kuma ana cire lemun tsami a cikin ruwan. Wannan nau'in rushewar duwatsu ana kiransa carbonation. (c) Ruwan Sha Wannan shine tsarin da ma'adanai na dutsen ke sha ruwa. Saboda shan ruwa ta dutsen, girmansa yana ƙaruwa kuma hatsi suna rasa siffarsu. Misali, ana canza Feldspar zuwa kaolin ta hanyar ruwa. An samar da Kaolin akan Tuddan Vindhyan kusa da Jabalpur ta wannan hanyar. (d) Maganin Wannan shine tsarin da wasu ma'adanai ke narkarwa a cikin ruwa. Saboda haka ana cire su a cikin ruwan sha. Ana cire gishirin dutse da gypsum ta wannan hanyar.  Ruwan shaye-shaye ya ƙunshi tsarin oxidation, carbonation, hydration-da mafita. GEOGRAPHY 29

translation.en: Software RequirementsSpecificationforStudentAssistant Page1 1. Introduction 1.1 Purpose The purpose of this Software Requirements Specification (SRS) document is to outline the requirements and specifications for the Student Assistant, which is the result of our final year project. This SRS document pertains to Version 1.0. It comprehensively defines the scope of the Student Assistant, encompassing all features and functionalities developed as part of our project. The SRS details the requirements for the entire system, including its constituent subsystems, ensuring a clear understanding of the project's objectives and functionality. The Student Assistant aims to address the diverse needs of university students and faculty by providing a unified and intelligent platform for academic and financial management. This SRS serves as a critical reference point for all stakeholders involved in the development, ensuring that the final product aligns with the specified requirements and user expectations. 1.2 Document Conventions Font: The entire document is written in a legible, serif font such as Times New Roman, with a standard font size (14pt) for the main text, 16pt for Heading 2 and 18pt for the Heading 1 for readability. Table of content is in 11pt font size. Highlighting: Important terms, titles, and emphasis may be highlighted using bold text. Section Numbering: Sections and subsections are numbered hierarchically, with each level represented by a number (e.g., 1, 1.1, 1.2, 2, 2.1, 2.1.1, and so on). This numbering aids in document navigation and cross-referencing.
translation.ha: Bukatun SoftwareBayani ga Mataimakin Ɗalibi Shafi na 1 1. Gabatarwa 1.1 Manufa Manufar wannan takardar Bayani ga Bukatun Software (SRS) ita ce bayyana buƙatu da ƙayyadaddun bayanai ga Mataimakin Ɗalibi, wanda shine sakamakon aikinmu na shekara ta ƙarshe. Wannan takardar SRS ta shafi Sigar 1.0. Ta bayyana cikakken girman Mataimakin Ɗalibi, wanda ya ƙunshi dukkan fasaloli da ayyuka da aka haɓaka a matsayin wani ɓangare na aikinmu. SRS ta bayyana buƙatun tsarin  gaba ɗaya, gami da ƙananan tsarin da ke cikinta, tana tabbatar da fahimtar manufofin aikin da ayyukansa. Mataimakin Ɗalibi yana da nufin magance buƙatu daban-daban na ɗaliban jami'a da malamai ta hanyar samar da dandamali mai haɗin kai da wayo don gudanar da ilimi da kuɗi. Wannan SRS tana aiki a matsayin muhimmin wurin tunani ga duk masu ruwa da tsaki da ke da hannu a cikin ci gaban, yana tabbatar da cewa samfurin ƙarshe ya dace da ƙayyadadden buƙatun da tsammanin mai amfani <TECH>. 1.2 Takardun Yarjejeniyar Haruffa: An rubuta dukkan takardar a cikin rubutun serif mai iya karantawa kamar <TECH>Times New Roman, tare da girman rubutun daidaitacce (14pt) don babban rubutu, 16pt don kanun 2 da 18pt don kanun 1 don iya karantawa. Teburin abun ciki yana cikin girman font 11pt. Haskakawa: Kalmomi masu mahimmanci, taken, da girmamawa <TECH>za a iya haskakawa ta amfani da rubutu mai kauri. Lambobin Sashe: Sashe da ƙananan sassa ana ƙidaya su ta hanyar jere, tare da kowane matakin da lamba ke wakilta (misali, 1, 1.1, 1.2, 2, 2.1, 2.1.1, da sauransu). Wannan lambobi suna taimakawa wajen kewaya takardu da kuma yin nuni ga juna.

translation.en: 83 Smruti R. Sarangi Let us thus create a stack of function call entries in hardware and refer to it as the return address stack (RAS). Each entry stores the return address (instruction immediately succeeding the function call) corresponding to the function call. Whenever, we encounter a call instruction, we insert its return address into the RAS. In our example, the state of the stack after calling the function foobarbar is as shown in Figure 3.19. foobarbar foobar foo Figure 3.19: Function call stack Now, when we encounter a return instruction, all that we need to do is just pop the stack. Since we return from instructions in a strictly reverse order, this simple strategy will always work. For our example, when we fetch the return instruction for the function foobarbar, we can just pop the topmost entry from the RAS stack, and use it. The topmost entry contains the return address for this function. Specifically, the algorithm is as follows. Given the PC, if we predict that the instruction is a return instruction, then all that we need to do is use the element at the top of the RAS stack as the branch target of the return instruction. After decoding the instruction, if we find that the instruction was genuinely a return instruction, we can then pop the stack and remove the entry. Using the RAS stack for return instructions is a far more accurate method of predicting branch targets than the BTB, primarily, because we do not suffer from destructive interference. However, this strategy does have its limitations. The first is that like the BTB the RAS has a finite size. It is possible thatwemightfindthesizeoftheRAStobeinsufficientespeciallyifwehaveachainofrecursivefunction calls. In spite of these issues, the RAS stack is regarded as one of the most accurate methods of predicting the return address in modern processors. To increase its accuracy, researchers have proposed modifica- tions to take care of recursive function calls, and furthermore it is possible to move a part of the RAS to memory if there is an overflow. 3.5 The Decode Stage The process of instruction decoding is essential to most processors. The decode unit accepts an instruc- tionencodedinabinaryformat,expandsitsuchthatallthefieldsarereadable,andareeasilyaccessible to all the units that process the instruction. Specifically, the roles of the decode unit (also see [Sarangi, 2015]) are as follows: 1. Expand all the immediate values embedded in the instruction to full 32 or 64-bit numbers. 2. Extract the branch offset (offset from the current PC), and expand it to a 32/64-bit field. Some- times the decode unit is also used to compute the branch target by adding the current PC to the offset.
translation.ha: 83 Smruti R. Sarangi Bari mu ƙirƙira tarin shigarwar kiran aiki a cikin kayan aiki kuma mu kira shi da tarin adireshin dawowa (RAS). Kowane shigarwa yana adana adireshin dawowa (umarni nan take wanda ya maye gurbin kiran aiki) wanda ya dace da kiran aiki. Duk lokacin da muka ci karo da umarnin kira, muna saka adireshin dawowarsa cikin RAS. A cikin misalinmu, yanayin tarin bayan kiran aikin foobarbar kamar yadda aka nuna a Hoto na 3.19. foobarbar foobar foo Hoto na 3.19: Tsarin kiran aiki Yanzu, idan muka ci karo da umarnin dawowa, abin da kawai muke buƙatar yi shine kawai danna tarin. Tunda mun dawo daga umarni a cikin tsari mai tsauri, wannan dabarar mai sauƙi koyaushe zata yi aiki. Ga misalinmu, lokacin da muka samo umarnin dawowa don aikin foobarbar, za mu iya kawai danna shigarwar mafi girma daga tarin RAS, mu yi amfani da shi. Shigarwar mafi girma ta ƙunshi adireshin dawowa don wannan aikin. Musamman, algorithm ɗin kamar haka ne. Idan aka yi la'akari da PC, idan muka yi hasashen cewa umarnin umarni ne na dawowa, to abin da kawai za mu yi shi ne amfani da abin da ke saman tarin RAS a matsayin maƙasudin reshe na umarnin dawowa. Bayan gano umarnin, idan muka ga cewa umarnin da gaske umarni ne na dawowa, to za mu iya cire tarin mu cire shigarwar. Amfani da tarin RAS don umarnin dawowa hanya ce mafi daidaito ta annabta maƙasudin reshe fiye da BTB, musamman, saboda ba mu fuskantar tsangwama mai lalata. Duk da haka, wannan dabarar tana da iyakokinta. Na farko shine kamar BTB, RAS yana da iyakataccen girma. Yana yiwuwa a sami girman RASTO bai isa ba musamman idan muna da kiran aiki na juyawa. Duk da waɗannan matsalolin, ana ɗaukar tarin RAS a matsayin ɗaya daga cikin hanyoyin da suka fi dacewa don annabta adireshin dawowa a cikin masu sarrafawa na zamani. Don ƙara daidaitonsa, masu bincike sun ba da shawarar gyare-gyare don magance kiran aiki mai maimaitawa, kuma haka nan yana yiwuwa a motsa wani ɓangare na RAS zuwa ƙwaƙwalwa idan akwai cikas. 3.5 Matakin Fahimtar Bayanai Tsarin fahimtar bayanai na umarni yana da mahimmanci ga yawancin masu sarrafawa. Sashen fahimtar bayanai yana karɓar tsari mai tsari na fahimtar bayanai, yana faɗaɗa duk filayen ana iya karantawa, kuma ana iya samunsa cikin sauƙi ga duk sassan da ke sarrafa umarnin. Musamman, ayyukan sashin fahimtar bayanai (duba [Sarangi, 2015]) sune kamar haka: 1. Faɗaɗa duk ƙimar nan take da aka saka a cikin umarnin zuwa cikakkun lambobi 32 ko 64-bit. 2. Cire fahimtar bayanai na reshe (kashewa daga PC na yanzu), kuma faɗaɗa shi zuwa filin bit 32/64. Wani lokaci ana amfani da sashin fahimtar bayanai don ƙididdige maƙasudin reshe ta hanyar ƙara PC na yanzu zuwa fahimtar bayanai.

translation.en: The activity diagram for Sustainableshop Blueprint: Organic Farmingillustrates the dynamic aspects of the system by capturing the workflow of various activities and actions performed by different user roles. This diagram provides a visual representation of the sequence of actions, decisions, and interactions between the four primary user roles: Admin, Producer (Farmer), Sales Person (Wholesaler/Retailer), and Consumer. The activity diagram helps in understanding the overall process flow, the roles involved, and the sequence of operations that need to be performed to achieve specific objectives.

Wannan zane yana ba da wakilci na gani na jerin ayyuka, yanke shawara, da hulɗa tsakanin manyan ayyukan mai amfani guda huɗu: Admin, Mai Shiryawa (Manomi), Mai Talla (Duniyamai siyarwa/mai siyarwa), da Mai Amfani. Tsarin aikin yana taimakawa wajen fahimtar tsarin gabaɗaya, rawar da ake takawa, da kuma jerin ayyukan da ake buƙatar aiwatarwa don cimma takamaiman manufofi.

translation.en: MODULE - 7 Our Resources Natural resources and thier develop- natural resources there. Since, these countries are lagging behind in terms of ad- ment in India vanced technology. 19.6 EXTENT OF RESOURCE UTILISATION IN INDIA The natural resources have played a significant role in the socio-economic devel- opment of our country. India is the second largest agricultural giant in the world Notes today. It is because India has varied climatic conditions and an endless growing seasons to grow different crops. India’s large mineral wealth has enabled India to be industrially developed. In recent decades, in our desire not only to feed the fastly growing population but also to accelerate economic well being to vast Indian populatin, exploitation of resources has increased phenomenally. This has led to environmental and ecologi- cal imbalances as resources were used on un-sustainable basis. Production of resources has been motivated by the maximisation of output and profit maximiza- tion rather than the optimixation of net social benefits. The precious resource of land is the under the threat of degradation because of soil erosion, deforestation, overgrazing and careless management of forests . Unscientific farming practices like Jhuming in north-east India and an excessive use of chemical fertilizers and pesticides coupled wih over irrigation result in loss of soil nutrients, water logging and salinity. Under pressure from rapid population growth the available resources of water are being exploited and depleted at a fast rate. Due to lack of technology only 37 per cent of total annual flow of Indian rivers and equal proportion of the available ground water resource is available for use. After independence, the fisheries Industry, particularly the marine sector, has wit- nessed a massive transformation from a traditional and subsistonce type enter- prise to market driven multicrore industry. Currently, India exports nearly 55 cat- egories of marine products to South Asian, European countries and U.S.A.  To satisfy their material and spiritual needs humans have been using the resources from the time immurial and this process is called ‘resource utilisation’.  Precious resource of land is under the threat of degradation because of soil erosion, deforestation and overgrazing. INTEXT QUESTIONS 19.4 1. What do you understand by resource utilization? ________________________________________________________ 80 GEOGRAPHY
translation.ha: MASU KAYAYYAKI - 7 Albarkatunmu Albarkatun ƙasa da ci gaban su - albarkatun ƙasa a can. Tunda, waɗannan ƙasashe suna baya a fannin ci gaba a Indiya ta hanyar fasahar da aka yi amfani da ita. 19.6 YADDA AKE AMFANI DA ALBARKAR AIKI A INDIA Albarkatun ƙasa sun taka muhimmiyar rawa a ci gaban zamantakewa da tattalin arziki na ƙasarmu. Indiya ita ce ta biyu mafi girma a fannin noma a duniya. Lura a yau. Wannan ya faru ne saboda Indiya tana da yanayi daban-daban na yanayi da kuma lokutan girma marasa iyaka don noman amfanin gona daban-daban. Babban arzikin ma'adinai na Indiya ya ba Indiya damar ci gaba a masana'antu. A cikin 'yan shekarun nan, a cikin sha'awarmu ba wai kawai don ciyar da al'umma mai saurin girma ba har ma da hanzarta tattalin arziki zuwa ga yawan jama'ar Indiya, amfani da albarkatu ya ƙaru sosai. Wannan ya haifar da rashin daidaito a muhalli da muhalli yayin da ake amfani da albarkatu ba bisa ƙa'ida ba. Samar da albarkatu ya samo asali ne daga haɓaka yawan fitarwa da riba maimakon inganta fa'idodin zamantakewa. Albarkatun ƙasa masu tamani suna fuskantar barazanar lalacewa saboda zaizayar ƙasa, sare dazuzzuka, kiwo fiye da kima da kuma kula da dazuzzuka ba tare da kulawa ba. Ayyukan noma marasa kimiyya kamar Jhuming a arewa maso gabashin Indiya da yawan amfani da takin zamani da magungunan kashe kwari tare da yawan ban ruwa suna haifar da asarar abubuwan gina jiki na ƙasa, sare ruwa da gishiri. A ƙarƙashin matsin lamba daga saurin karuwar yawan jama'a, ana amfani da albarkatun ruwa da ake da su kuma suna ƙarewa cikin sauri. Saboda rashin fasaha, kashi 37 cikin 100 na jimillar kwararar kogunan <TECH> na Indiya a kowace shekara da kuma daidai gwargwado na albarkatun ruwan ƙasa da ake da su ana iya amfani da su. Bayan samun 'yancin kai, masana'antar kamun kifi, musamman ɓangaren ruwa, ta shaida babban sauyi daga kamfani na gargajiya da na rayuwa zuwa masana'antar da ke da kasuwa mai yawa. A halin yanzu, Indiya tana fitar da kusan nau'ikan kayayyakin ruwa 55 zuwa ƙasashen Kudancin Asiya, Turai da Amurka.  Don biyan buƙatunsu na kayan aiki da na ruhaniya, mutane suna amfani da albarkatun tun lokacin da aka kafa kuma ana kiran wannan tsari 'amfani da albarkatu'.  Albarkatun ƙasa masu daraja suna fuskantar barazanar lalacewa saboda zaizayar ƙasa, sare dazuzzuka da kuma yawan kiwo. TAMBAYOYIN BAYANI 19.4 1. Me ka fahimta ta hanyar amfani da albarkatu? _____________________________________________________________ 80 GIDAN JIRGIN KASA

translation.en: Sport Facility Booking System Kirtan Shah  Use case name: Cancel Booking Participating actors: Individual Users Flow of events: 1. The user views their upcoming bookings. 2. The user selects the booking they wish to cancel. 3. The application prompts the user for confirmation before proceeding. 4. Upon confirmation, the booking is cancelled, and a confirmation notification is sent to the user. Entry condition: The user has an existing booking that they wish to cancel. Exit condition: The booking is successfully cancelled, and the user receives confirmation.  Use case name: View Booking History Participating actors: Individual Users Flow of events: 1. The user logs into their account and navigates to the booking history section. 2. The application displays the user's previous and upcoming bookings with details such as date, time, and facility information. Entry condition: The user has successfully logged into their account. Exit condition: The user can view the history of their bookings.  Use case name: Manage Facility Information Participating actors: Facility Managers Flow of events: 1. The facility manager logs into their account and navigates to the facility management section. 2. The manager edits details such as facility description, available amenities, pricing, or time slots for booking. 3. The application updates the facility information in real time. Entry condition: The facility manager is logged in with the necessary privileges. Exit condition: The facility information is successfully updated and saved in the system.  Use case name: Request Support Participating actors: Individual Users Flow of events: 25

translation.en: Payroll Management System 1. Introduction 1.1 Purpose The purpose of this document is to develop a payroll management system which replaces the old system and pay the employees their salaries and keep track of their performance, this document is intended for designers. 1.2 Scope The new system shall allow employees to record timecard information electronically and automatically generate paychecks, The system will allow employees to submit timecards, enter purchase orders and create various reports, The system will ensure that employees are paid based on their categorization. 1.3 Definitions, Acronyms, and Abbreviations • Payroll Administrator: The person responsible for maintaining employees and employee information in the system. • Employee: A person who works for PayNow. • Bank System: Any bank to which deposit transactions are sent. • System Clock: The system clock which automatically runs the payroll at the appropriate times. • Pay Period: The amount of time over which an employee is paid. • Paycheck: A record of how much an employee was paid during a specified Pay Period. • Payment Method: How the employee is paid, either direct deposit, or pick-up. • Timecard: A record of hours worked by the employee during a specified pay period. • Purchase Order: A record of a sale made by an employee. • Salaried Employee: An employee that receives a salary. • Performance Employee: An employee that receives a salary plus commissions. 1.4 References The IEEE Guide to Software Requirements Specification (ANSI/IEEE Std. 830-1984). The SRS templates of Dr. Orest Pilskalns (WSU, Vancouver) and Jack Hagemeister (WSU, Pullman) have also been used as guides in developing this template for the SWE 312 course. 7 | P age

translation.en: MODULE - 4 Insolation and Temperature The domain of Air on the Earth rate of temperature decrease upward in the troposphere is about 60C per km, extending to the tropopause. This vertical gradient of temperature is commonly referred to as the standard atmosphere or normal lapse rate, but is varies with height, season, latitude and other factors. Indeed the actual lapse rate of temperature does not always show a decrease with altitude. Notes (c) Inversion of Temperature Long winter night, clear sky, dry air and absence of winds leads to quick radiation of heat from the earth’s surface, as well as from the lower layers of the atmosphere. This results in the cooling of the air near the earth’s surface. The upper layers which lose their heat not so quickly are comparatively warm. Hence the normal condition in which temperature decreases with increasing height, is reversed. The cooler air is nearer the earth and the warmer air is aloft. In other words, temperature increases with increasing height temporarily or locally. This phenomena is termed as inversion of temperature. Sometimes the cold and dense air remains near the surface for number of days. So the phenomenon of inversion of temperature is also seen for days together. The phenomenon of inversion of temperature is especially observed in intermontane valleys. During winters the mountain slopes cool very rapidly due to the quick radiation of heat. The air resting above them also becomes cold and its density increases. Hence, it moves down the slopes and settles down in the valleys. This air pushes the comparatively warmer air of valleys upwards and leads to the phenomenon of inversion of temperature. Sometimes the temperature falls below freezing point in the valleys leading even to the occurance of frost. In contrast, the higher slopes remain comparatively warmer. That is why mulberry planters of the Suwa Basin of Japan and the apple growers of Himachal Pardesh avoid the lower slopes of the mountains to escape winters frost. If you have been to any hill station you would have seen that most of the holiday resorts and the houses of affluent persons are built on the upper slopes.  Temperature usually decreases with increasing altitude.  The normal lapse rate is 60C per 1000m metres ascend.  The phenomenon in which temperature increases with increasing altitude temporarily and locally under certain conditions is known as inversion of temperature. translation.ha: MASU KAYAYYAKI - 4 ƊAUKAR DA ZAFI DA ZAFI Yankin iska a duniya na raguwar zafin jiki a cikin troposphere yana da kusan 60C a kowace kilomita, yana kaiwa ga tropopause. Wannan yanayin zafin jiki a tsaye ana kiransa da yanayin Ka’ida ko kuma yanayin lapse na yau da kullun, amma yana bambanta da tsayi, yanayi, latitude da sauran abubuwa. Hakika ainihin ƙimar lapse na zafin jiki ba koyaushe yana nuna raguwa tare da tsayi ba. Lura (c) Juyawar Zafi Tsawon dare na hunturu, sararin samaniya mai haske, busasshiyar iska da rashin iska yana haifar da saurin hasken zafi daga saman duniya, da kuma daga ƙananan yadudduka na sararin samaniya. Wannan yana haifar da sanyaya iska kusa da saman duniya. Manyan yadudduka waɗanda ba su da sauri suna da ɗumi. Don haka yanayin <TECH> na yau da kullun wanda zafin jiki ke raguwa tare da ƙaruwar tsayi, yana juyawa. Iska mai sanyi tana kusa da ƙasa kuma iska mai ɗumi tana sama. A wata ma'anar, zafin jiki yana ƙaruwa tare da ƙaruwar tsayi na ɗan lokaci ko na gida. Ana kiran wannan abin mamaki da juyewar zafin jiki. Wani lokaci iska mai sanyi da iska mai kauri tana nan kusa da saman tsawon kwanaki. Don haka ana ganin lamarin juyewar zafin jiki na tsawon kwanaki tare. Ana ganin lamarin juyewar zafin jiki musamman a kwarurukan da ke tsakanin tsaunuka. A lokacin hunturu, gangaren tsaunuka suna sanyi da sauri saboda saurin hasken zafi. Iskar da ke samansu ma tana yin sanyi kuma yawanta yana ƙaruwa. Saboda haka, tana motsawa ƙasa da gangaren ta zauna a kwaruruka. Wannan iska tana tura iska mai dumi ta kwaruruka sama kuma tana haifar da yanayin juyewar zafin jiki. Wani lokaci zafin jiki yana faɗuwa ƙasa da wurin daskarewa a kwaruruka har ma yana haifar da sanyi. Sabanin haka, manyan gangaren suna ci gaba da zama mafi zafi. Shi ya sa masu shuka mulberry na Suwa Basin na Japan da masu noman apple na Himachal Pardesh ke guje wa ƙananan gangaren duwatsu don guje wa sanyin hunturu. Idan kun kasance a kowace tashar tudu, da kun ga cewa yawancin wuraren hutu da gidajen masu arziki an gina su ne a kan tsaunukan sama.  Zafin jiki yawanci yana raguwa tare da ƙaruwar tsayi.  Matsakaicin raguwar gudu shine 60C a kowace mita 1000m.  Abin da ke faruwa lokacin da zafin jiki ke ƙaruwa tare da ƙaruwar tsayi na ɗan lokaci da kuma a cikin gida a ƙarƙashin wasu yanayi ana kiransa da juyewar zafin jiki. translation.en: Smruti R. Sarangi 256 “spatially local” should occupy a non-trivial fraction of the interval under consideration. A related concept is the notion of the working set. It is defined as the set of memory addresses that a program accesses repeatedly in a short time interval. Here again, the definition of short is on the same lines as the definition for spatial locality – there is a degree of subjectivity. This subjectivity can be reduced if we realize that program execution can typically be divided into phases: in each phase a program executes the same piece of code and accesses the same region of data over and over again, and then moves to another region of the code – the next phase begins. We typically have spatial locality for accesses within a phase, and the set of addresses accessed repeatedly in a phase comprise the working set at that point of time. Definition 38 We can divide program execution into phases, where each phase has a distinct pattern in terms of instruction and data accesses. Within a phase, we typically access data that is proximate in terms of memory addresses – this is known as spatial locality. The set of addresses accessed repeatedly in a phase comprises the working set of the program at that point of time. Temporal Locality Let us consider a program with loops once again. There are some variables and regions of memory that we tend to access frequently in a small interval of time. For example, in a loop we access the loop variables frequently, and also we execute the instructions in the loop in every iteration. Even while walking through an array we access the base register of the array on every access. Such patterns, where wekeepaccessingthesamememorylocationsoverandoveragainisreferredtoastemporallocality. Note that temporal locality has been found to be a general property in most programs. Temporal locality is observedwhileaccessinginstructionsordata. Infact,wecanseetemporallocalityinalmostallmemory and storage structures inside the chip. Mostschemesincomputerarchitecturearedesignedtomakeuseoftemporallocality. Forexample,a branch predictor uses this fact to keep a small table of saturating counters. The expectation is that the hitrate(probabilityoffindinganentry)inthistablewillbehigh;thisisguaranteedbytemporallocality. The branch target buffer operates on a similar principle. Even predictors such as value predictors or dependence predictors rely on the same phenomenon. Had we not had temporal locality, most of our architectural structures would have never come into being. In the case of the memory system as well, we shall explicitly rely on temporal locality in our memory access patterns. Definition 39 Temporal locality refers to an access pattern where we repeatedly access the same locations over and over again in a small interval of time. 7.1.2 Notion of a Cache We now know that a typical memory access stream has both temporal locality and spatial locality. We also know that we cannot afford large memories. What do we do? We can take inspiration from registers, and create a structure that can be conceptually thought of as a larger register file. This structure can keep the data corresponding to the most frequently accessed memory addresses close to the processor. It will also be small, fast, and power efficient. Since we have temporal locality, we can expect to find most of our data in this structure. Let us call such a structure
translation.ha: Smruti R. Sarangi 256 "na gida a sarari" ya kamata ya mamaye wani ɓangare na tazara da ake la'akari da shi. Wani ra'ayi mai alaƙa shine ra'ayin saitin aiki. An bayyana shi azaman saitin ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya yana magance wanda shiri ke shiga akai-akai a cikin ɗan gajeren lokaci. A nan kuma, ma'anar gajere yana kan layi ɗaya da ma'anar wurin sarari - akwai matakin yanayin tunani. Ana iya rage wannan yanayin tunani idan muka fahimci cewa aiwatar da shirin yawanci ana iya raba shi zuwa matakai: a kowane mataki shiri yana aiwatar da yanki ɗaya na lambar kuma yana shiga yankin bayanai akai-akai, sannan ya koma wani yanki na lambar - mataki na gaba yana farawa. Yawanci muna da wurin sarari don shiga cikin wani mataki, kuma saitin adiresoshin da ake samu akai-akai a cikin wani mataki sun ƙunshi saitin aiki a wannan lokacin. Ma'ana 38 Za mu iya raba aiwatar da shirin zuwa matakai, inda kowane mataki yana da tsari daban-daban dangane da koyarwa da kuma damar bayanai. A cikin wani lokaci, yawanci muna samun damar shiga bayanai wanda yake kusa da adiresoshin ƙwaƙwalwa - wannan ana kiransa da wurin sarari. Saitin adiresoshin da ake samu akai-akai a cikin wani lokaci ya ƙunshi saitin aiki na shirin a wannan lokacin. Wuri na Wuri Bari mu sake la'akari da shiri mai madaukai. Akwai wasu masu canji da yankuna na ƙwaƙwalwa waɗanda muke yawan samun dama akai-akai a cikin ɗan gajeren lokaci. Misali, a cikin madauki muna samun damar masu canjin madauki akai-akai, kuma muna aiwatar da umarnin a cikin madauki a kowane maimaitawa. Ko da yayin tafiya ta cikin jeri muna samun damar yin rijistar tushe na jeri akan kowane damar shiga. Irin waɗannan alamu, inda muke ci gaba da samun damar shiga wuri ɗaya na lokaci-lokaci kuma akai-akai ana nufin zuwa wurin lokaci-lokaci. Lura cewa an gano wurin lokaci a matsayin babban kadara a yawancin shirye-shirye. Ana lura da wurin lokaci yayin samun umarni ko bayanai. A zahiri, za mu iya ganin wurin lokaci-lokaci kusan duk ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya da tsarin ajiya a cikin guntu. Yawancin tsare-tsare a cikin tsarin kwamfuta an tsara su don yin amfani da wurin lokaci-lokaci. Misali, mai hasashen reshe yana amfani da wannan gaskiyar don ajiye ƙaramin tebur na ƙididdigewa mai cikewa. Ana sa ran cewa ƙimar hit (yiwuwar kashe kuɗi) a cikin wannan tebur zai kasance mai girma; wannan an tabbatar da shi ta hanyar yanayin ɗan lokaci. Ma'ajiyar manufa ta reshe tana aiki akan irin wannan ƙa'ida. Har ma masu hasashen kamar masu hasashen ƙima ko masu hasashen dogaro sun dogara da wannan lamari. Da ba mu da wurin ɗan lokaci, yawancin gine-ginen gine-ginenmu ba za su taɓa kasancewa ba. A yanayin tsarin ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya , mu za mu dogara kai tsaye akan wurin ɗan lokaci a cikin tsarin damar ƙwaƙwalwarmu. Ma'ana 39 Wurin ɗan lokaci yana nufin tsarin shiga inda muke yawan samun damar shiga wurare iri ɗaya akai-akai a cikin ɗan gajeren lokaci. 7.1.2 Ra'ayin Cache Yanzu mun san cewa kwararar damar ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya ta yau da kullun tana da wurin ɗan lokaci da wurin sarari. Mun kuma san cewa ba za mu iya biyan manyan abubuwan tunawa ba. Me muke yi? Za mu iya ɗaukar wahayi daga rajista, kuma mu ƙirƙiri</TECH> tsari wanda za a iya ɗauka a matsayin babban fayil ɗin rajista. Wannan tsari zai iya kiyaye bayanan  daidai da adiresoshin ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya da aka fi samun dama kusa da na'urar sarrafawa. Hakanan zai zama ƙarami, sauri, kuma mai inganci. Tunda muna da wurin zama na ɗan lokaci, za mu iya tsammanin samun mafi yawan bayanan  ɗinmu a cikin wannan tsari. Bari mu kira irin wannan tsari

translation.en: MMH 2.3 Design and Implementation Constraints Security and Privacy: Given the sensitive nature of educational data, the CLMS must prioritize security and privacy. It should implement robust authentication mechanisms, data encryption, secure connections, and access controls to protect user information and prevent unauthorized access. Database technology: The CLMS should be developed using the PHP MyAdmin database and query will be written as per the technology of the database system. Programming language: The CLMS should be developed using the latest version of PHP and JavaScript. Compatibility: The CLMS needs to be compatible with various operating systems, browsers, and devices to ensure broad accessibility for users. It should be designed and tested to work seamlessly across different platforms. Scalability: The CLMS should be designed to handle a large number of concurrent users and be capable of scaling up as the user base grows. The system architecture should support scalability without compromising performance or user experience. Performance: The CLMS should be designed to deliver a responsive and smooth user experience. It should be optimized for quick loading times, efficient data retrieval, and minimal downtime. Performance testing and optimization techniques should be employed during development. Usability and User Experience: The CLMS should prioritize a user-friendly interface and intuitive navigation. It should be designed to accommodate users of varying technical skills and provide clear instructions and guidance throughout the platform. Localization: The CLMS need to support Bangla and English language and other language for international deployment.
translation.ha: MMH 2.3 Tsarin Tsarawa da Aiwatarwa Tsaro da Sirrin: Ganin yanayin ilimin Bayanai mai mahimmanci, CLMS dole ne ya ba da fifiko ga tsaro da sirrin. Ya kamata  ya aiwatar da ingantattun hanyoyin tantancewa, ɓoye bayanan <TECH>data, haɗin haɗi mai tsaro, da kuma sarrafa damar shiga don kare bayanan mai amfani  da hana shiga ba tare da izini ba. Fasahar <TECH>Bayanan Bayanai: Ya kamata a haɓaka CLMS ta amfani da <TECH>PHP MyAdmin bayanan Bayanai kuma za a rubuta tambayar kamar yadda fasahar bayanan Bayanai tsarin. Harshen Shirye-shirye: Ya kamata a haɓaka CLMS ta amfani da sabon sigar P<TECH>HP da JavaScript. Dacewa: CLMS yana buƙatar ya dace da tsarin aiki daban-daban, masu bincike, da na'urori don tabbatar da samun dama ga masu amfani. Ya kamata a tsara shi kuma a gwada shi don yin aiki ba tare da wata matsala ba a dandamali daban-daban. Ƙarfin Sauyawa: Ya kamata a tsara CLMS  don sarrafa adadi mai yawa na masu amfani a lokaci guda kuma ya sami damar haɓaka yayin da tushen <TECH>mai amfani ke ƙaruwa. Tsarin  ya kamata ya goyi bayan ƙarfin Sauyawa ba tare da yin illa ga ƙwarewar ko mai amfani ba. Aiki: Ya kamata a tsara CLMS  don isar da ƙwarewar <TECH>mai amfani mai amsawa da santsi. Ya kamata a inganta  don lokutan lodawa cikin sauri, dawo da bayanai <TECH>mai inganci, da ƙarancin lokacin hutu. Ya kamata a yi amfani da dabarun gwaji da inganta <TECH> <TECH> a lokacin haɓakawa. Kwarewa a <TECH>Amfani da Mai Amfani: CLMS ya kamata ya ba da fifiko ga hanyar sadarwa mai sauƙin amfani da mai amfani da kuma kewayawa mai sauƙin fahimta. Ya kamata <TECH>ya kasance an tsara shi don ya dace da masu amfani da ƙwarewar fasaha daban-daban da kuma samar da umarni da jagora bayyanannu a duk faɗin dandamalin. Wuri: CLMS tana buƙatar tallafawa harshen Bangla da Turanci da sauran harsuna don tura su zuwa ƙasashen waje.

translation.en: The report is divided into several sections, including the project scope, introduction, purpose, methodology, findings, and recommendations. The project scope outlines the key areas covered in the report, while the introduction provides a background to E-Farm and the agriculture industry. The purpose of the report is to evaluate the effectiveness of E-Farm's services and identify potential areas for improvement. The methodology outlines the research methods used to gather information for the report, while the findings section provides an analysis of the results of the research. The recommendations section provides practical and actionable recommendations for how E-Farm can improve its services.

translation.en: Help Guide Wireless Speaker SRS-XG300 About the indicators CHARGE indicator (orange) Turns off The speaker has completed charging. Lights up The speaker is being charged. Flashes slowly The built-in battery is running at 20% or less and needs to be charged. Flashes 3 times and If the CHARGE indicator flashes 3 times and turns off when you turn on the speaker, the built- turns off in battery is empty and needs to be charged. Note While the speaker is turned on, it charges the built-in battery as long as the speaker is connected to an AC outlet by the AC adaptor or by the USB cable*. Depending on the usage of the speaker, however, it may take a long time before charging completes. It is recommended that you turn off the speaker before battery charging. * The type and the number of supplied accessories differ depending on your countries/regions. If the ambient temperature is extremely low or high, the speaker will stop charging the built-in battery for safety reasons. It may also stop charging if charging continues for a long period of time. If such an event occurs, bring the temperature up or down to an operating temperature between 5 °C and 35 °C (41 °F and 95 °F), disconnect/reconnect the AC adaptor or the USB cable from/to the speaker, and then let the speaker charge the built-in battery once again. (power) indicator Turns off The speaker is turned off. Lights up The speaker is turned on. (green) Lights up The speaker is turned off. The speaker is set to the BLUETOOTH standby mode. (orange) 73
translation.ha: Jagorar Taimako Lasifikar Mara waya SRS-XG300 Game da Alamu Alamar CHARGE (orange) Yana kashe lasifikar ta gama caji. Yana haskaka lasifikar Ana caji lasifikar. Yana walƙiya a hankali Batirin da aka gina a ciki yana aiki da kashi 20% ko ƙasa da haka kuma yana buƙatar caji. Yana walƙiya sau 3 kuma Idan alamar CHARGE tana walƙiya sau 3 kuma tana kashewa lokacin da ka kunna lasifikar, batirin da aka gina a ciki babu komai kuma yana buƙatar caji. Lura Yayin da aka kunna lasifikar, yana cajin batirin da aka gina a ciki matuƙar lasifikar tana da haɗin wutar AC ta hanyar adaftar AC ko ta kebul na USB*. Dangane da amfani da lasifikar, duk da haka, na iya ɗaukar lokaci mai tsawo kafin caji ya ƙare. Ana ba da shawarar ka kashe lasifikar kafin caji batir. * Nau'in da adadin kayan haɗin da aka bayar sun bambanta dangane da ƙasashenku/yankunanku. Idan zafin yanayi ya yi ƙasa ko sama sosai, lasifikar za ta daina cajin batirin da aka gina a ciki saboda dalilai na aminci. Hakanan <TECH>na iya dakatar da caji idan caji ya ci gaba na tsawon lokaci. Idan irin wannan lamari ya faru, kawo zafin jiki sama ko ƙasa zuwa zafin aiki tsakanin 5 °C da 35 °C (41 °F da 95 °F), cire/sake haɗa adaftar AC ko kebul na USB daga/zuwa lasifikar, sannan a bar lasifikar ta sake cajin batirin da aka gina a ciki. translation.en: MODULE - 10A Local Area Planning Local Area Planning A brief discussion on need based planning is given below: A. Water Harvesting and Management These areas reveal scientific and judicious use of water. from remote cold desert of Leh to hot desert of Thar; from Patha area of central India to far south in Kerala Notes and Tamilnadu, water management techniques have completely changed the lives and landscape in these areas. (Recent examples of Arvari in Rajasthan and Tikaria in Patha area of central India are the initiatives of local people for managing water resources of the area). Traditional water harvesting and management methods are also found in every part of India. B. Protection and Promotion of Forests Plants and animals need protection and promotion for keeping the ecological and biological balance in a locality. People have been partly protecting plants and animals due to religion and partly due to prevailing customs and traditions. Sacred groves are protected due to age old practice and ritual. They signify the judicious use of natural resources in the long term interest of the community. Plants like Pipal, Neem, Tulsi, Beri are sacred in Hindu tradition while Dates, Oak, Bargad are sacred in Islamic, Christian and Buddhist traditions respectively. Depending upon the ecological canditions in different areas, plants are protected. Such as coconut and casurina in coastal areas, Dates and Beri in desert areas and orchards in hill areas are part of the regional practices towards protection and promotion. There is also a similar tradition of protecting sacred animals like cow, goats and sheep, camels, snake and so on. C. Tribal Communities and Protection of Wild Life Tribal communities and wild life both are faced with the problems of survival and development in the face of deforestation. Forest dwellers have protected wildlife, for example Ban Gujars of Rajaji National Park (Uttarnchal), Abujhmars of Bastar and Todas of Nilgiri Hills are known for their skill in wild life protection. However, some of these forest dwellers are now evicted and rehabititated in areas where they have no access to forests. This has happened in Nagarhole National Park in Karnataka and Rajaji National Park in Uttaranchal. Involvement of tribal people and protection of their forest rights has now succeeded in using better methods of wild life protection. D. Power to People : Local Level Environment Management Environmental management at the local level is giving power to the people to manage their natural resources. Even after spending large sums on development and welfare activities, India could not perform too well intackling environmental management. It is, therefore, widely felt that local affairs should to be managed by 16 GEOGRAPHY
translation.ha: MASU KYAU - Tsarin Yanki na 10A Tsarin Yanki Tsarin Yanki na Yanki An bayar da taƙaitaccen bayani kan tsare-tsare bisa ga buƙata a ƙasa: A. Girbi da Gudanar da Ruwa Waɗannan yankuna sun nuna amfani da ruwa ta hanyar kimiyya da adalci. daga hamadar Leh mai sanyi mai nisa zuwa hamada mai zafi ta Thar; daga yankin Patha na tsakiyar Indiya zuwa kudu mai nisa a Kerala Notes da Tamilnadu, dabarun sarrafa ruwa sun canza rayuwa da yanayin ƙasa gaba ɗaya a waɗannan yankuna. (Misalan Arvari na baya-bayan nan a Rajasthan da Tikaria a yankin Patha na tsakiyar Indiya sune shirye-shiryen mutanen yankin don sarrafa albarkatun ruwa na yankin). Hakanan ana samun hanyoyin tattara ruwa na gargajiya da sarrafa su a kowane yanki na Indiya. B. Kariya da Haɓaka Dazuzzuka Shuke-shuke da dabbobi suna buƙatar kariya da haɓakawa don kiyaye daidaiton muhalli da halittu a cikin wani yanki. Mutane suna kare tsire-tsire da dabbobi wani ɓangare saboda addini kuma wani ɓangare saboda al'adu da al'adu da suka daɗe. Ana kare gonaki masu tsarki saboda tsoffin ayyuka da al'adu. Suna nuna amfani da albarkatun ƙasa da kyau don amfanin al'umma na dogon lokaci. Shuke-shuke kamar Pipal, Neem, Tulsi, Beri suna da tsarki a al'adar Hindu ta Tech, yayin da Dabino, Oak, Bargad suna da tsarki a al'adun Musulunci na Tech, Kirista na Tech da kuma Buddha na Tech. Dangane da yanayin muhalli a yankuna daban-daban, ana kare tsire-tsire. Kamar kwakwa da casurina a yankunan bakin teku, Dabino da Beri a yankunan hamada da gonakin 'ya'yan itace a yankunan tuddai suna cikin ayyukan yanki na kariya da haɓaka. Akwai kuma irin wannan al'ada ta kare dabbobi masu tsarki kamar shanu, awaki da tumaki, raƙuma, maciji da sauransu. C. Al'ummomin Kabila da Kare Rayuwar Daji Al'ummomin ƙabilu da namun daji duka suna fuskantar matsalolin rayuwa da ci gaba yayin da ake sare dazuzzuka. Mazauna dajin sun kare namun daji, misali Ban Gujars na Rajaji National Park (Uttarchal), Abujhmars na Bastar da Todas na Tuddan Nilgiri an san su da ƙwarewarsu a fannin kare rayuwar daji. Duk da haka, wasu daga cikin waɗannan mazauna dajin yanzu an kore su kuma an gyara su a yankunan da ba su da damar shiga dazuzzuka. Wannan ya faru a Nagarhole National Park da ke Karnataka da Rajaji National Park da ke Uttaranchal. Shigar da mutanen ƙabila da kare haƙƙinsu na dazuzzuka yanzu ya yi nasarar amfani da ingantattun hanyoyin kare rayukan namun daji. D. Iko ga Mutane: Gudanar da Muhalli Matakin Gida Gudanar da muhalli a matakin gida yana ba wa mutane iko don sarrafa albarkatun ƙasa. Ko da bayan kashe kuɗi mai yawa kan ayyukan ci gaba da jin daɗin jama'a, Indiya ba ta iya yin aiki sosai wajen kula da muhalli ba. Saboda haka, ana jin cewa ya kamata a gudanar da harkokin gida <TECH> ta hanyar 16 GEOGRAPHY

translation.en: MODULE - 4 Atmosphere Composition and Structure The domain of Air on the Earth (iii) This is the most important layer of the atmosphere because all kinds of weather changes take place only in this layer. Due to these changes development of living world take place on the earth. The air never remains static in this layer. Therefore this layer is called changing sphere or troposphere. (iv) The environmental temperature decreases with increasing height of Notes atmosphere. It decreases at the rate of 10C at the height of 165 metre. This is called Normal lapse rate. (v) The upper limit of the troposphere is called tropopause. This is a transitional zone. In this zone characteristics of both the troposphere and ionosphere are found. (b) STRATOSPHERE (i) This layer is above the troposphere. (ii) This layer is spread upto the height of 50 kms from the Earth’s surface. Its average extent 40 kms. (iii) The temperature remains almost the same in the lower part of this layer upto the height of 20 kms. After this the temperature increases slowly with the increase in the height. The temperature increases due to the presence of ozone gas in the upper part of this layer. (iv) Weather related incidents do not take place in this layer. The air blows horizontally here. Therefore this layer is considered ideal for flying of aircrafts. (c) MESOSPHERE (i) It is the third layer of the atmosphere spreading over stratosphere. (ii) It spreads upto the height of 80 kms. from the surface of the earth. It’s extent is 30 kms. (iii) Temperature goes on decreasing and drops upto – 1000C. (iv) ‘Meteors’ or falling stars occur in this layer. (d) IONOSPHERE (i) This is the fourth layer of the atmosphere. It is located above the mesosphere. (ii) This layer spreads upto the height of 400 kms. from the surface of the earth. The width of this layer is about 300 kms. (iii) The temperature starts increasing again with increasing height in this layer. (iv) Electrically charged currents flows in the air in this sphere. Radio waves are reflected back on the earth from this sphere and due to this radio broadcasting has become possible. (e) EXOSPHERE (i) This is the last layer of the atmosphere located above ionosphere and extends to beyond 400 km above the earth. (ii) Gases are very sparse in this sphere due to the lack of gravitational force. Therefore, the density of air is very less here. 168 GEOGRAPHY
translation.ha: MASU KYAU - 4 Tsarin Yanayi da Tsarin Yankin Iska a Duniya (iii) Wannan shine mafi mahimmancin Layer na yanayi saboda duk nau'ikan canje-canjen yanayi suna faruwa ne kawai a cikin wannan Layer. Saboda waɗannan canje-canje, ci gaban duniyar rayuwa yana faruwa a duniya. Iska ba ta taɓa tsayawa a cikin wannan Layer ba. Saboda haka ana kiran wannan Layer ɗin da canjin sphere ko troposphere. (iv) Zafin muhalli yana raguwa tare da ƙaruwar tsayin Bayanan kula da yanayi. Yana raguwa a ƙimar 10C a tsayin mita 165. Wannan ana kiransa ƙimar lapse na yau da kullun. (v) Iyakar sama ta troposphere ana kiranta tropopause. Wannan yanki ne na canji. A cikin wannan yanki, an sami halayen troposphere da ionosphere. (b) STRATOSPHERE (i) Wannan Layer yana sama da troposphere. (ii) Wannan Layer yana yaɗuwa har zuwa tsayin kilomita 50 daga saman Duniya. Matsakaicin girmansa kilomita 40 ne. (iii) Zafin jiki ya kasance kusan iri ɗaya a cikin ƙasan wannan Layer har zuwa tsayin kilomita 20. Bayan haka, zafin jiki yana ƙaruwa a hankali tare da ƙaruwar tsayi. Zafin jiki yana ƙaruwa saboda kasancewar iskar ozone a saman wannan Layer. (iv) Abubuwan da suka shafi yanayi ba sa faruwa a wannan Layer. Iska tana busawa a kwance a nan. Saboda haka ana ɗaukar wannan Layer ɗin a matsayin mafi dacewa don tashi da jiragen sama. (c) MESOSPHERE (i) Ita ce Layer na uku na sararin samaniya da ke yaɗuwa a kan stratosphere. (ii) Tana bazuwa har zuwa tsayin kilomita 80 daga saman duniya. Tsawonta shine kilomita 30. (iii) Zafin jiki yana ci gaba da raguwa kuma yana raguwa har zuwa - 1000C. (iv) Taurari 'Meteors' ko faɗuwa suna faruwa a wannan Layer. (d) IONOSPHERE (i) Wannan shine Layer na huɗu na sararin samaniya. Yana saman mesosphere. (ii) Wannan Layer ya bazu har zuwa tsayin kilomita 400 daga saman duniya. Faɗin wannan Layer ɗin kusan kilomita 300 ne. (iii) Zafin jiki yana fara ƙaruwa kuma tare da ƙaruwar tsayi a cikin wannan Layer. (iv) Ruwan da ke ɗauke da wutar lantarki yana gudana a cikin iska a cikin wannan sararin samaniya. Raƙuman rediyo suna komawa baya a duniya daga wannan sararin samaniya kuma saboda wannan watsa shirye-shiryen rediyo ya zama mai yiwuwa. (e) EXOSPHERE (i) Wannan shine Layer na ƙarshe na sararin samaniya wanda ke saman ionosphere kuma ya kai sama da kilomita 400 sama da duniya. (ii) Iskar gas ba ta da yawa a cikin wannan sararin samaniya saboda rashin ƙarfin nauyi. Saboda haka, yawan iskar ya ragu sosai a nan. 168 GEOGRAPHY

translation.en: For buyers, AmanPay eliminates the complexities of shared expenses by providing an intuitive split payment system. This feature ensures that splitting costs with friends, family, or colleagues is straightforward and hassle-free, removing the need for manual calculations and follow-ups. Additionally, AmanPay’s cross-platform compatibility enables seamless transactions across various payment services, enhancing financial flexibility and connectivity.
translation.ha: Ga masu siye, AmanPay yana kawar da sarkakiyar kuɗaɗen da aka raba ta hanyar samar da tsarin biyan kuɗi mai sauƙin fahimta . Wannan fasalin yana tabbatar da cewa raba kuɗi tare da abokai, dangi, ko abokan aiki abu ne mai sauƙi kuma ba tare da wata matsala ba, yana kawar da buƙatar lissafin hannu da bin diddigi. Bugu da ƙari, jituwa tsakanin dandamali na <TECH>AmanPay yana ba da damar ma'amaloli marasa matsala a cikin ayyukan biyan kuɗi daban-daban, yana haɓaka sassauci da haɗin kai na kuɗi.

They ddeevveellooppmmeenntt iinn IInnddiiaa are built and maintained by the Central Government. Their total length is 65,500 km. Although the national highways comprise only about 2 percent of the total length of surfaced roads in India, they carry about 40% of goods and passenger traffic. There are 219 national highways in the country. Some of them are very important as they carry the bulk of road traffic. National Highway No.7 is the longest (2683 Notes km) of all, linking Varanasi in the north with Kanya Kumari in the south. The state highways are built and maintained by the State Governments. The District and village roads are looked after by the local bodies with some financial assistance coming from the states. translation.en: B Tejas Architectural Simulator B.1 Overview For proposing and evaluating architectural features, designers and researchers typically use an architec- turalsimulator. Itisalargesoftwareprogramthatsimulatesallthefeaturesofaprocessorincludingthe memorysystem,on-chipnetwork,andoff-chipDRAM.Wecanthinkofitasavirtual processorthatcan runafullprogramincludinganoperatingsystemandtheprogramsrunningonit. Alongwithproviding overall execution statistics such as the total number of simulated cycles, cache miss rates, energy, and power consumption values, we can also use architectural simulators to implement new protocols and processor designs. We can accurately assess their advantages and overheads. Note that in this case, the main task is to just simulate the overheads in terms of time and power while ensuring that the program running on the processor executes correctly. Correctness of the program is not being verified here. As compared to implementing novel features in a hardware description language, using an archi- tectural simulator is much faster. Its simulation speed is typically 100 times more, does not require sophisticated software or FPGA boards, and can also be easily parallelized. There are four types of commonly used architectural simulation methods. Cycle-accurate Simulation Such simulators are typically tightly coupled with the real hardware. They model latencies exactly. It is expected that the time a program will take to run on an architectural simulator will be the same as the corresponding hardware implementation (in terms of simulated execution cycles). Such simulators are typically very slow, and we also need access to a hardware implementation to calibrate the simulator. Cycle-approximate Simulation Simulatorsinthiscategoryarenotcoupledwithaspecifichardware implementation. Theyassumeapieceofgenerichardwareandprovidenumbersthatareinternally consistent. They are much faster and are the most popular as of today. Sampled Simulation In this case, we do not simulate all the instructions. We separate the actual execution of the instructions from the simulation. We execute all the instructions; however, we only simulate small sequences of dynamic instructions. These sequences are periodically extracted from the running program. The final simulation results are obtained by extrapolating the results obtained by considering the size of the sequences and the total number of dynamic instructions in the program. 743
translation.ha: B Tejas Tsarin Zane-zane na B.1 Bayani Don gabatar da fasalulluka na gine-gine, masu zane-zane da masu bincike galibi suna amfani da na'urar kwaikwayo ta gine-gine. Yana da babban shirin software wanda ke kwaikwayon fasalin sofa processor gami da tsarin ƙwaƙwalwa, hanyar sadarwa ta kan guntu, da kuma kashe-guntu DRAM. Za mu iya tunanin na'urar sarrafawa ta sa ido wacce za ta iya gudanar da cikakken shirin gami da tsarin aiki da shirye-shiryen da ke gudana. Tare da samar da ƙididdigar aiwatarwa gabaɗaya kamar jimlar adadin zagayowar kwaikwayo, ƙimar ɓacewar cache, kuzari, da ƙimar amfani da wutar lantarki, haka nan za mu iya amfani da na'urorin kwaikwayo na gine-gine don aiwatar da sabbin yarjejeniyoyi da ƙirar masu sarrafawa. Za mu iya tantance fa'idodin su da kuma kuɗin da suka kashe daidai. Lura cewa a wannan yanayin, babban aikin shine kawai kwaikwayon na'urorin da suka kashe dangane da lokaci da ƙarfi yayin da muke tabbatar da cewa shirin da ke gudana akan na'urar sarrafawa yana aiki daidai. Ba a tabbatar da daidaiton shirin a nan ba. Idan aka kwatanta da aiwatar da sabbin fasalulluka a cikin yaren bayanin kayan aiki, amfani da na'urar kwaikwayo ta gine-gine ya fi sauri. Saurin kwaikwayonsa yawanci ya fi sau 100, baya buƙatar software mai inganci ko allon PGA na zamani, kuma ana iya daidaita shi cikin sauƙi. Akwai nau'ikan hanyoyin kwaikwayon gine-gine guda huɗu da ake amfani da su akai-akai. Kwaikwayon Daidaito na Zagaye Irin waɗannan na'urorin kwaikwayo galibi ana haɗa su da kayan aikin gaske. Suna yin kwaikwayon latencies daidai. Ana sa ran lokacin da shirin zai ɗauka don gudana akan na'urar kwaikwayo ta gine-gine zai kasance iri ɗaya da aiwatar da kayan aikin da suka dace (idan aka kwatanta da zagayowar aiwatarwa da aka kwaikwayi). Irin waɗannan na'urorin kwaikwayo yawanci suna da jinkiri sosai, kuma muna buƙatar samun damar yin amfani da kayan aikin don daidaita na'urar kwaikwayo. Kwaikwayon Kwaikwayo na Zagaye a cikin wannan rukuni ba a haɗa su da takamaiman aiwatar da kayan aikin ba. Suna ɗaukar wani yanki na kayan aikin gargajiya kuma suna samar da lambobi waɗanda suke daidai da juna. Suna da sauri sosai kuma sune mafi shahara kamar na yau. Kwaikwayon Samfura A wannan yanayin, ba ma kwaikwayon duk umarnin. Muna raba ainihin aiwatar da umarnin daga kwaikwayon. Muna aiwatar da duk umarnin; duk da haka, muna kwaikwayon ƙananan jerin umarni masu ƙarfi kawai. Ana fitar da waɗannan jerin lokaci-lokaci daga shirin gudu. Ana samun sakamakon kwaikwayo na ƙarshe ta hanyar fitar da sakamakon da aka samu ta hanyar la'akari da girman jerin da jimlar adadin umarnin da ke cikin shirin. 743

translation.en: Dynamic Surface of the Earth MODULE - 2 Changing face of the Earth INTEXT QUESTIONS 3.2 1. Fill in the blanks:- a. Alfred Wegener termed the supercontinent as ____________. Notes b. Premordial ocean was known as ______________. c. Pangaea was broken into two ____________ in the north and _________ in the south. d. North and South America drifted towards ___________. e. Tethys sea emerged between ____________ and ___________ by filling up of the water of ___________. 2. Name three evidences of continental drift put forwarded by Wegener - a. ____________________________________________________ b. ____________________________________________________ c. ____________________________________________________ 3. Name two evidences of continental drift, but not mentioned by Wegener a. ____________________________________________________ b. ____________________________________________________ 3.3 PLATE TECTONICS The uppermost outer solid and rigid layer of the earth is called crust. Its thickness varies considerably. It is as little as 5 km thick beneath the oceans at some places but under some mountain ranges it extends upto a depth of 70 km. Below the crust denser rocks are found, known as mantle crust. This upper part of mantle upto an average depth of 100 km from the surface is solid. This solid mantle plus upper crust form a comparatively rigid block termed as lithosphere. Mantle is partially molten between 100 to 250 km depth. This zone is said to be asthenosphere, also known as Mohr discontinuity, a simplification of Mohorovicic, the name of the seismologist who discovered it. All these things you have already read in the previous lesson. The lithosphere is broken into several blocks. These blocks are known as plates, which are moving over asthenosphere. There are seven major plates. (Figure 3.7) GEOGRAPHY 53
translation.ha: Tsarin Duniya Mai Sauyi - 2 Canjin Fuskar Duniya TAMBAYOYIN JARIDA 3.2 1. Cika guraben da ke ƙasa:- a. Alfred Wegener ya kira babban nahiyar a matsayin ___________. Bayani b. An san teku na farko da ______________. c. An raba Pangea zuwa ___________ guda biyu a arewa da ___________ a kudu. d. Arewacin da Kudancin Amurka sun yi yawo zuwa ___________. e. Tetes ya fito tsakanin ___________ da ___________ ta hanyar cike ruwan ___________. 2. Faɗi shaidu uku na yawo na nahiyar da Wegener ya gabatar - a. ______________________________________________________ b. ____________________________________________________ c. ____________________________________________________ 3. Faɗi shaidu biyu na yawo na nahiyar, amma Wegener bai ambata ba a. ____________________________________________________ b. ____________________________________________________ 3.3 FARASHIN TEKTONICS Layin ƙasa mai ƙarfi da tauri na sama ana kiransa ɓawon burodi. Kaurinsa ya bambanta sosai. Kaurinsa bai wuce kilomita 5 a ƙarƙashin tekuna a wasu wurare ba, amma a ƙarƙashin wasu tsaunuka, yana kaiwa zurfin kilomita 70. A ƙarƙashin ɓawon akwai duwatsu masu kauri, waɗanda aka sani da ɓawon mantle. Wannan ɓangaren sama na mantle har zuwa matsakaicin zurfin kilomita 100 daga saman yana da ƙarfi. Wannan mantle mai ƙarfi da ɓawon sama suna samar da tubali mai tauri wanda ake kira lithosphere. Mantle ɗin yana narkewa kaɗan tsakanin zurfin kilomita 100 zuwa 250. Ana cewa wannan yanki shine asthenosphere, wanda kuma aka sani da Mohr discontinuity, wani sauƙaƙawa na Mohorovicic, sunan masanin girgizar ƙasa wanda ya gano shi. Duk waɗannan abubuwan da kuka riga kuka karanta a darasin da ya gabata. Lithosphere ɗin ya kasu kashi da yawa. Waɗannan tubalan ana kiransu faranti, waɗanda ke motsawa akan asthenosphere. Akwai manyan faranti bakwai. (Hoto na 3.7) GIDAN JIKI 53

translation.en: MODULE - 1 Nature of Geography as a discipline The study of Geography as a discipline Human geography has a number of sub-branches. (i) Anthropogeography : It largely deals with racial phenomena in their spatial context. (ii) Cultural geography : It focusses on the origin, components and impact of Notes human culturs, both material and non-material. (iii) Economic geeography : It refers to the study of the location and distribution of economic activities at the local, regional, national and world scale. Economic geography can be studied under the following heads : Resource geography. Agricultural geography, Industrial and transport geography. (iv) Political geography : It is the study of political phenomena in their spatial context. Main focus remains for creation and transformation of political and administrative region. (v) Historical geography : Spatial and temporal trends of geographical phenomena are studied in Historical geography. (vi) Social geography : It is the analysis of social phenomena in space. Poverty, health, education, livelihood are some important fields of study in social geography. (vi) Population geography : It is the study of various dimensions of population like its population distribution density, composition, ferrility, mortality, migration etc. (viii) Settlement geography : It is the study of Rural/Urban settlements, their size, distribution, functions, heirach, and off various other parameters of settlement system. (C) Regional geography : Aspects such as delineation of regions, their geographical characteristics and processes of change constitute regional geography. INTEXT QUESTION 1.3 1. What are the two branches of geography ? (i)__________________________(ii)__________________________ 2. Name the two techniques of geographical study ? (i)__________________________(ii)__________________________ 3. What is Anthropogegraphy ? ________________________________________________________ 10 GEOGRAPHY
translation.ha: MASU KAYAYYAKI - 1 Yanayin <FASAHA>Ƙasa</FASAHA> a matsayin fanni Nazarin ilimin ƙasa a matsayin fanni ilimin ƙasa na ɗan adam yana da ƙananan rassansa da dama. (i) Ilimin ƙasa: Yana magana ne game da abubuwan da suka faru na ƙabilanci a cikin mahallinsu na sarari. (ii) Ilimin ƙasa na al'adu: Yana mai da hankali kan asali, abubuwan da suka shafi da tasirin Bayanan kula da al'adun ɗan adam, duka na abu da na abu. (iii) Ilimin ƙasa na tattalin arziki: Yana nufin nazarin wuri da rarraba ayyukan tattalin arziki a matakin gida, yanki, ƙasa da duniya. Ana iya nazarin ilimin ƙasa na tattalin arziki a ƙarƙashin waɗannan ka'idoji: Labarin ƙasa na albarkatu. Labarin ƙasa na noma, Labarin ƙasa na masana'antu da sufuri. (iv) Labarin ƙasa na siyasa: Nazarin abubuwan da suka faru na siyasa ne a cikin mahallinsu na sarari. Babban abin da aka fi mayar da hankali a kai shi ne ƙirƙirar da canza yankin siyasa da gudanarwa. (v) Labarin ƙasa na tarihi: Ana nazarin yanayin yanayi da na lokaci na abubuwan da suka faru na ƙasa a cikin Labarin ƙasa na Tarihi. (vi) Labarin ƙasa na zamantakewa: Nazarin abubuwan da suka faru na zamantakewa ne a sararin samaniya. Talauci, lafiya, ilimi, rayuwa wasu muhimman fannoni ne na karatu a fannin ƙasa na zamantakewa. (vi) Yanayin ƙasa na yawan jama'a: Nazarin fannoni daban-daban na yawan jama'a ne kamar yawan rarrabawar jama'a, abun da ke ciki, yawan haihuwa, mace-mace, ƙaura da sauransu. (viii) Yanayin ƙasa na matsuguni: Nazarin ne na matsugunan karkara/birni, girmansu, rarrabawarsu, ayyukansu, gado, da sauran sigogi daban-daban na tsarin matsuguni <TECH>. (C) Yanayin ƙasa na yanki: Abubuwa kamar ƙayyade yankuna, halayensu na ƙasa da hanyoyin canji sun ƙunshi yanayin ƙasa na yanki. TAMBAYAR JAN HANKALI 1.3 1. Menene rassan ƙasa guda biyu? translation.en: Software RequirementsSpecificationforStudentAssistant Page39 The timetable shall accurately display the updated class information and any schedule changes. 4.7 Delete Class/Exam 4.7.1 Description and Priority Description: The "Delete Class/Exam" feature allows users to remove classes or academic activities(e.g., Exams) from their timetable when they are no longer relevant or required. Users can select the class/exam they wish to delete and confirm the removal, keeping their schedule up-to-date. Priority: Medium 4.7.2 Stimulus/Response Sequences Stimulus/Response Sequence 1: Deleting a Class/Exam Stimulus: The user selects the "Delete Icon" option for a specific class/Exam within their timetable and confirms the deletion. Response: The system removes the class/Exam from the user's timetable, adjusting the schedule accordingly. Stimulus/Response Sequence 2: Confirmation Prompt Stimulus: The user initiates the deletion process. Response: The system displays a confirmation prompt to ensure that the user intends to delete the selected class or Exam. 4.7.3 Functional Requirements DC-1: Class or Exam Deletion

translation.en: Software Requirements Specification for Pharmaceutical System Page 56 categorization method. It is crucial for pharmacies to adhere to the safety measures required for certain medications in order to ensure their safe state when handed to a patient [42]. The procedures done to properly store medication are as follows: 1. Store medication/other resources in their appropriate areas based on organization system (labels, expiration dates, names, etc) [40, 42, 44] 2. Guarantee all safety measures and guidelines are upheld when storing medication (ex. certain medication requiring to be stored in cold environments) [42] Although it does not have a specific point in time in which it is executed like the previous sections, medication will inevitably expire or have to be returned. And regardless of when this is to happen, it is necessary to understand the proper handling of medication when it needs to be disposed of/removed. As, the main purpose of handling these issues in a proper manner is to prevent the distribution of these expired/compromised medications to patients [42, 44]. These medications could put the life of the patient at risk as well as lead to large legal and financial issues in the future. To prevent these medications from reaching the patient the pharmacy must record the expiration dates of all the medications present and actively verify that none of the medications has expired [42, 44]. And using inventory management software to verify this is useful, it does not hurt to manually verify each and every one. When the medicine does expire, it must be disposed of as soon as possible for safety. However, one must also adhere to medication disposal regulations because simply throwing it in the trash can may not be the safest option for all medication [42]. When it comes to incorrect or damaged medication/items, one must return them to their supplier/distributor and adjust product ordering practices accordingly. And after each disposal/return, the pharmacy must record each instance as well as adjust inventory stock records. To fulfill these requirements successfully the pharmacy must: 1. Actively verify that the medication stocked as not expired, typically via a software system [41, 42, 44] 2. Dispose of any expired medications according to safety guidelines [42] 3. Return incorrect/damaged/tampered with medication to supplier/distributor 4. Record any changes in inventory levels due to expiration or other factors [40, 42, 44] Inventory Management & Tracking The general standard in regards to an inventory management system is to just have one in the pharmacy, thus classifying it as a functional requirement for a pharmacy to operate properly. That method of which to implement it is up to the pharmacists, classifying it as a nonfunctional requirement. This also applies to the medication tracking system, with its inclusion being an industry standard but its specific implementation changing from pharmacy to pharmacy. However, there is a general formula to both; That being that medication is typically sorted by name, type, and safety regulations. And the tracking system uses extensive documentation and barcodes to track medication. Order Placing
translation.ha: Bayanin Bukatun Software ga Magungunaceutical Tsarin Shafi na 56 hanyar rarrabawa. Yana da mahimmanci ga shagunan magani su bi matakan aminci da ake buƙata don wasu magunguna domin tabbatar da lafiyarsu lokacin da aka miƙa wa majiyyaci [42]. Hanyoyin da ake bi don adana magunguna yadda ya kamata sune kamar haka: 1. Ajiye magunguna/wasu albarkatu a wuraren da suka dace bisa ga tsarin  (lakabi, kwanakin ƙarewa, sunaye, da sauransu) [40, 42, 44] 2. Tabbatar da cewa an bi dukkan matakan tsaro da jagororin lokacin adana magunguna (misali wasu magunguna da ake buƙatar adanawa a cikin yanayin sanyi) [42] Kodayake ba shi da takamaiman lokacin da ake aiwatar da shi kamar sassan da suka gabata, magani ba makawa zai ƙare ko kuma dole ne a dawo da shi. Kuma ba tare da la'akari da lokacin da hakan zai faru ba, ya zama dole a fahimci yadda ake sarrafa magani lokacin da ake buƙatar zubar da shi/cire shi. Kamar yadda, babban manufar magance waɗannan matsalolin ta hanyar da ta dace ita ce hana rarraba waɗannan magungunan da suka ƙare/masu rauni ga marasa lafiya [42, 44]. Waɗannan magunguna na iya sanya rayuwar majiyyaci cikin haɗari da kuma haifar da manyan matsalolin shari'a da na kuɗi a nan gaba. Don hana waɗannan magunguna isa ga majiyyaci kantin magani dole ne rubuta kwanakin ƙarewar duk magungunan da ke akwai kuma tabbatar da cewa babu ɗayan magungunan da suka ƙare [42, 44]. Kuma amfani da software na sarrafa kaya don tabbatar da wannan yana da amfani, ba ya cutar da tabbatar da kowane ɗayan da hannu. Lokacin da maganin ya ƙare, dole ne a zubar da dole neda wuri-wuri don aminci. Duk da haka, dole ne mutum ya bi ƙa'idodin zubar da magunguna saboda kawai jefa shi cikin shara ba zai iya zama zaɓi mafi aminci ga duk magunguna ba [42]. Idan ana maganar magunguna/abubuwan da ba daidai ba ko suka lalace, dole ne mutum <TECH>ya mayar da su ga mai samar da su/mai rarrabawa kuma ya daidaita ayyukan yin odar samfura daidai gwargwado. Kuma bayan kowace zubarwa/dawowa, kantin magani dole ne ya rikodi a kowane lokaci sannan ya daidaita bayanan hannun jari. Domin cika waɗannan buƙatu cikin nasara, kantin magani dole ne ya</TECH>rikodi</TECH>: 1. A tabbatar da cewa maganin da aka ajiye bai ƙare ba, yawanci ta hanyar tsarin software na  [41, 42, 44] 2. A zubar da duk wani magani da ya ƙare bisa ga ka'idojin aminci [42] 3. A mayar da magani mara kyau/wanda ya lalace/wanda aka tauye wa mai bayarwa/mai rarrabawa 4. <TECH>rikodi duk wani canji a matakan kaya saboda ƙarewa ko wasu dalilai [40, 42, 44] Gudanar da Kayayyaki & Bin diddigin Kayayyaki Babban ma'aunin rikodi dangane da tsarin sarrafa kaya na rikodi shine kawai a sami ɗaya a cikin kantin magani, don haka a rarraba shi a matsayin buƙatar <TECH>aiki</TECH> don kantin magani ya yi aiki yadda ya kamata. Wannan hanyar da za a aiwatar da ita ta dogara ne akan masu harhada magunguna, suna rarraba ta a matsayin abin da ba ya aiki na buƙatar. Wannan kuma ya shafi tsarin bin diddigin magunguna na <TECH>, tare da haɗa shi a matsayin ma'aunin <TECH> na masana'antu amma takamaiman aiwatarwarsa yana canzawa daga kantin magani zuwa kantin magani. Duk da haka, akwai wata dabara ta gabaɗaya ga duka biyun; Kasancewar yawanci ana rarraba magunguna ta hanyar suna, nau'i, da ƙa'idojin aminci. Kuma tsarin bin diddigin <TECH> yana amfani da takardu masu yawa da barcodes don bin diddigin magani. Sanya Oda

translation.en: Smruti R. Sarangi 160 hitormissinthecache. Theproblemhereisthatitisnotpossibletoensureback-to-backexecution(see Section 4.2.4) of a load instruction, and a subsequent instruction that uses the value read by the load. Instead, once we get the status from the cache (might take 1-2 cycles), we send a wakeup signal to the consumer instructions in the instruction window. This is an inefficient process because this ensures that instructions consuming the result of load instructions are ready to be executed after a delay of several cycles. Instead, if we assume that every load instruction hits in the L1 cache, we might do much better. This is because most programs have a L1 hit rate of roughly 85-90% or more. This means that most of the time, our loads have a deterministic latency, and thus we can wake up instructions such that they are ready just in time to consume the value read by the load (via the bypass network), and continue execution. Wecanthereforesignificantlyreducethedelaybetweenissuingaloadinstructionandissuing the instructions that consume its value. ThisisshowninFigure5.4. ForthepipelineshowninFigure5.4, wehavebeenabletosave2cycles, in other words, we have been able to execute the consumer instruction 2 cycles early. wakeup read from compute access reg. file write select the reg.file memory memory broadcast address wakeup read from execute consumer the reg.file select wakeup read from compute access reg. file write the reg.file memory memory select address broadcast wakeup read from execute consumer the reg.file select Figure 5.4: Load latency speculation As of today, load latency speculation is a standard feature in almost all high performance OOO processors, particularly, in caches with multi-cycle hit times. We can gain a lot of performance by issuing consumer instructions early – before we determine if the load has had a hit or miss in the cache. What about the remaining instructions (roughly 10%) that miss in the L1 cache? If we speculate on the latency of loads, we end up issuing dependent instructions before ascertaining if the load has hit in the L1 cache or not. Since these instructions are issued, they will try to pick up a value from the bypass network or the register file, and proceed. If the load has not completed, these instructions will pick up junk values and continue in the pipeline. There is a need to dynamically cancel these instructions, and reissuethemoncethecorrectvalueisreadbytheloadinstructionfromthememorysystem. Inthiscase, the load instruction will read its value from the lower levels of the memory system – L2 and beyond. This requires a replay mechanism (will be discussed in Section 5.2). Before that, let us discuss methods to optimize load latency speculation, and also discuss other forms of speculation in this space.
translation.ha: Smruti R. Sarangi 160 hitormissinthecache. Matsalar a nanba ta yiwuwa a tabbatar da aiwatarwa ta baya-zuwa-baya (duba Sashe na 4.2.4) na umarnin kaya, da kuma umarni na gaba wanda ke amfani da ƙimar karanta ta hanyar kaya. Madadin haka, da zarar mun sami matsayin daga cache (zai iya ɗaukar zagaye 1-2), muna aika siginar farkawa zuwa ga umarnin mabukaci a cikin taga umarni. Wannan tsari ne mara inganci saboda wannan yana tabbatar da cewa umarnin da ke cinye sakamakon umarnin kaya a shirye don aiwatarwa bayan jinkiri na zagaye da yawa. Madadin haka, idan muka ɗauka cewa kowane umarnin kaya ya faɗi a cikin cache na L1, za mu iya yin mafi kyau. Wannan saboda yawancin shirye-shirye suna da ƙimar bugun L1 na kusan 85-90% ko fiye. Wannan yana nufin cewa mafi yawan lokuta, kayanmu suna da latency na na zamani, don haka za mu iya farkar da umarni ta yadda za su kasance a shirye a kan lokaci don cinye ƙimar karanta ta hanyar kaya (ta hanyar hanyar sadarwa ta hanyar wucewa), kuma mu ci gaba da aiwatarwa. Saboda haka za mu iya rage jinkirin tsakanin gabatarwa da umarni da bayar da umarnin da ke cinye ƙimarsa. Wannan shine nunin a Hoto na 5.4. Don nunin bututu a Hoto na 5.4, mun sami damar adana zagayowar 2, a wata ma'anar, mun sami damar aiwatar da umarnin mai amfani da zagayowar 2 da wuri. farkawa karanta daga rikodin damar shiga reg. fayil rubuta zaɓi adireshin watsawa na ƙwaƙwalwar ajiyar fayil na reg.file farkawa karanta daga aiwatar da mai amfani da reg.file zaɓi farkawa karanta daga lissafin damar shiga reg. fayil rubuta reg.file memory memory select address broadcast up Karanta from execute consumer reg.file select Hoto na 5.4: Load latency hasashe Kamar yadda yake a yau, load latency hasashe siffa ce ta daidai a kusan dukkan manyan masu sarrafa OOO na aikin, musamman, a cikin cache tare da lokutan bugawa da yawa. Za mu iya samun aiki mai yawa na aikin ta hanyar bayar da umarnin mabukaci da wuri - kafin mu tantance ko nauyin ya sami bugu ko kuskure a cikin cache. Yaya game da sauran umarnin (kusan 10%) waɗanda suka ɓace a cikin cache na L1? Idan muka yi hasashe game da latency na lodi, muna ƙarewa muna bayar da umarni masu dogaro kafin mu tabbatar ko nauyin ya faɗi a cikin cache na L1 ko a'a. Tunda an bayar da waɗannan umarnin, za su yi ƙoƙarin ɗaukar ƙima daga hanyar sadarwa ta bypass ko fayil ɗin rajista, kuma su ci gaba. Idan nauyin bai kammala ba, waɗannan umarnin za su ɗauki ƙimar sharar gida kuma su ci gaba a cikin bututun. Akwai buƙatar soke waɗannan umarni cikin sauƙi, sannan a sake fitar da su ta hanyar da ta dace, darajar da aka karanta ta hanyar umarnin lodi daga tsarin memory. A wannan yanayin, umarnin lodi zai karanta ƙimarsa daga ƙananan matakan tsarin ƙwaƙwalwar  - L2 da ƙari. Wannan yana buƙatar tsarin sake kunnawa (za a tattauna a Sashe na 5.2). Kafin haka, bari mu tattauna hanyoyin inganta hasashe na <TECH>latency, da kuma tattauna wasu nau'ikan hasashe a wannan wuri.
