translation.en: Smruti R. Sarangi 248 6.5.2 Further Reading Readers should start with the CUDA programming language. The most authentic CUDA programming resourcesareavailableonNVIDIA’swebsite[NVIDIA,2018]. Readerscanadditionallyconsultthebook byRobFarber[Farber, 2011]ondevelopingGPUapplications. InadditiontoCUDA,interestedreaders can also learn OpenCL if they wish to program AMD GPUs. The book by Kaeli et al. [Kaeli et al., 2015] is a good starting point. For the architecture of GPUs, the starting point is NVIDIA’s documentation for their architectures: Tesla [Lindholm et al., 2008], Fermi [Wittenbrink et al., 2011], Kepler [Corporation, 2014b], Max- well [GTX, 2014], Pascal [Corporation, 2014a], and Volta [NVIDIA Inc., 2017]. To conduct research in thisareausersneedasoftwarebasedGPUsimulator. SomepopularsimulatorsareGPUTejas[Malhotra et al., 2014], and GPGPU-Sim [Bakhoda et al., 2009]. GPUWattch [Leng et al., 2013] is a power model that can be plugged into the GPGPU-Sim simulator. Programming GPUs is increasingly getting easier. TheTheano[Bergstraetal.,2010]projectproposesaPythonbasedframeworktoruncodeontheGPU. ForstudyingGPUsfurtherwecanwritespecializedmicro-benchmarkstounderstandtheirperformance characteristics using the approach proposed by Wong et al. [Wong et al., 2010], or we can use Hong et al.’s analytical models [Hong and Kim, 2009]. Exercises Ex. 1 — What is a better idea: have more threads per block and less blocks per grid or have less threads per block and more blocks per grid? Assume that the total number of threads is the same. Ex. 2 — Write CUDA code to implement the following algorithms: 1.Matrix multiplication. 2.Matrix multiplication using the Tensor Processing Units of the NVIDIA Turing GPU. 3.Solution of the Fourier heat equation. 4.Sorting 10 million numbers. 5.Find edges in an image. Ex. 3 — How does a GPU core handle WAW and WAR hazards? Ex. 4 — What are the pros and cons of having a large register file in the context of a CPU and a GPU? Ex. 5 — Theoretically analyze the computation time of a matrix multiplication operation on a GPU and a CPU. Ex. 6 — What is the syncthreads() instruction in CUDA? When is it useful? Ex. 7 — Can we replace the register file of a GPU with a block of shared memory? Explain you answer. Ex. 8 — How do we detect and handle bank conflicts while accessing the first level cache in a GPU? * Ex. 9 — Describe the architectural mechanism for SIMT execution with per-thread state.
translation.ha: Smruti R. Sarangi 248 6.5.2 Ƙarin Karatu Masu Karatu ya kamata su fara da harshen shirye-shiryen CUDA. Mafi kyawun ingantattun albarkatun shirye-shiryen CUDA suna samuwa akan gidan yanar gizon NVIDIA[NVIDIA,2018]. Masu karatu za su iya duba littafin ta RobFarber[Farber, 2011] akan haɓaka aikace-aikacen GPU. Baya ga CUDA, masu karatu masu sha'awar kuma za su iya koyon BuɗeCL idan suna son shirya GPUs na AMD. Littafin Kaeli et al. [Kaeli et al., 2015] kyakkyawan wuri ne na farawa. Ga tsarin gine-ginen GPU, wurin farawa shine takardun NVIDIA don gine-ginen su: Tesla [Lindholm et al., 2008], Fermi [Wittenbrink et al., 2011], Kepler [Corporation, 2014b], Max- well [GTX, 2014], Pascal [Corporation, 2014a], da Volta [NVIDIA Inc., 2017]. Don gudanar da bincike a wannan yankiersneedasoftwarebasedGPUsimulator. Wasu shahararrun masu kwaikwayon kwamfuta sune GPUejas[Malzafira da sauransu, 2014], da GPGPU-Sim [Bakhoda da sauransu, 2009]. GPUWatch [Leng et al., 2013] samfurin wutar lantarki ne wanda za'a iya haɗawa da na'urar kwaikwayo ta GPGPU-Sim. Shirye-shiryen GPUs yana ƙara samun sauƙi. Tsarin Theano[BergstraTECH>etal.,2010]proposesa Tsarin aiki na tushen Pythontoruncode akanGPU. Don nazarin GPUs gaba zamu iya rubuta ƙananan benchmarks na musamman don fahimtar halayen aikinsu ta amfani da hanyar da Wong et al suka gabatar. [Wong et al., 2010], ko kuma za mu iya amfani da samfuran nazarin Hong et al. [Hong da Kim, 2009]. Darussa Misali na 1 — Menene mafi kyawun ra'ayi: samun ƙarin zare a kowace toshe da ƙarancin tubalan a kowace grid ko kuma samun ƙarancin zare a kowace toshe da ƙarin tubalan a kowace grid? A ɗauka cewa jimlar adadin zare iri ɗaya ne. Misali na 2 — Rubuta lambar CUDA don aiwatar da waɗannan algorithms: 1. Yawan Matrix. 2. Yawan Matrix ta amfani da Raka'o'in Sarrafa Tensor na NVIDIA Turing GPU. 3. Maganin lissafin zafi na Fourier. 4. Rarraba lambobi miliyan 10. 5. Nemo gefuna a cikin hoto. Misali na 3 — Ta yaya babban GPU ke magance haɗarin WAW da WAR? Misali na 4 — Menene fa'idodi da rashin amfani na samun babban fayil ɗin rajista a cikin mahallin CPU da GPU? Misali na 5 — A ka'ida, ana nazarin lokacin lissafi na aikin ninka matrix akan GPU da CPU. Misali. 6 — Menene umarnin synchreads() a cikin CUDA? Yaushe yake da amfani? Misali 7 — Za mu iya maye gurbin fayil ɗin rajista na GPU da toshewar ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya da aka raba? Bayyana amsar ku. Misali 8 — Ta yaya za mu gano da kuma magance rikice-rikicen banki yayin da muke shiga cikin ma'ajiyar matakin farko a cikin GPU? * Misali 9 — Bayyana tsarin gine-gine don aiwatar da SIMT tare da yanayin kowane zaren.

translation.en: MODULE - 1 Nature of Geography as a discipline The study of Geography as a discipline provided a more quantitative and analytical base to geographical questions, in contrast to the more qualitative tendencies of traditional geography. Regional Science comprises the body of knowledge in which like regional economics, resource Notes management, location theory, urban and regional planning, transportation and communication, human geography, population distribution, landscape ecology, and environmental quality are examined for regional development. 1.6 BRANCHES OF GEOGRAPHY Variable phenomena on the earth’s surface can be treated seperatehy or in association. They are classified and categorised into physical phenomena and human phenomena. Thus geography has three main branches : Physical Geography, Human Geography and Regional Geography. Geography Physical Human Regional Astronomical Climatology Soil Geography Geography Macro Meso Micro Region Region Region Geomorphology Oceanography Bio- geography Plant or Zoo or Human Flor Fauna Ecology Anthropogeography Population Political Social Cultural Economic Historical Settlement Geography Rural Urban Rural Urban Agricultural Trade & Transport Industrial Fig 1.1: Branches of Geography 8 GEOGRAPHY

translation.en: Smruti R. Sarangi 568 Consecutive pair of commands Time interval Column to column delay (same bank group) tCCD L Column to column delay (different bank group) tCCD S Relationships: tCCD ≥tCCD L S Table 10.7: Timing constraints for the column-to-column delay to two different columns across the same or different bank groups. It is faster to access a different bank group than the same bank group (tCCD ≥ tCCD ). This is a standard feature of DDR4. The L S reason is that the same bank group (one that is being currently used) has many resources allocated for the current transfer, whereas, a different bank group has more resources available and is thus faster to access. Additionally, we wish to limit localized power consumption. 10.3.4 Write Operation The write operation is similar to the read operation. It is initiated by sending a WRITE command. At the same time, we send the column address on the address bus and the address of the bank group. Let us discuss the specifics. Preamble and Postamble Similar to the READ command we also have a preamble and postamble (refer to Table 10.8) for the WRITE command. The reasons are similar – detecting the relative skews between the data, strobe, and the internal clock of the DRAM. Once we detect the skews, we can correctly latch the data. This process of training the circuit for correctly latching the data is known as write leveling. Operation Duration Write preamble tWPRE Write postamble tWPST Table 10.8: Timing constraints for the write preamble and postamble WRITE command The WRITE command is similar to that READ command in terms of the way it is issued. In this case, we define a term called the write latency (WL). It is the sum of the additive latency (AL), the parity latency (PL), and the CAS write latency (CWL). Refer to Table 10.9 for a description of the parameters that are relevant to the write operation. We have WL=AL+PL +CWL. Consecutive pair of commands Duration WRITE →(cid:104)First data bit on the bus(cid:105) WL WRITE →IntWRITE AL Time to compute the parity PL IntWRITE →(cid:104)First data bit on the bus(cid:105) CWL Relationships: WL=AL+PL+CWL Table 10.9: Timing constraints for the write operation
translation.ha: Smruti R. Sarangi 568 Umarni biyu a jere Tazara Lokaci Ginshiƙi zuwa ginshiƙi Jinkirin ginshiƙi (ƙungiyar banki ɗaya) tCCD L Ginshiƙi zuwa ginshiƙi Jinkirin ginshiƙi (ƙungiyar banki daban-daban) tCCD S Dangantaka: tCCD ≥tCCD L S Tebur 10.7: Takaitawar lokaci don jinkirin ginshiƙi zuwa ginshiƙi zuwa ginshiƙi biyu daban-daban a cikin ƙungiyoyin banki iri ɗaya ko daban-daban. Yana da sauri don samun damar rukunin banki daban-daban fiye da ƙungiyar banki ɗaya (tCCD ≥ tCCD). Wannan fasalin daidaitacce ne na DDR4. Dalilin L S shine cewa ƙungiyar banki ɗaya (wadda ake amfani da ita a halin yanzu) tana da albarkatu da yawa da aka ware don canja wurin yanzu, yayin da, ƙungiyar banki daban-daban tana da ƙarin albarkatu don haka tana da sauri don samun dama. Bugu da ƙari, muna son iyakance amfani da wutar lantarki na gida. 10.3.4 Aikin Rubuta Aikin rubutawa yayi kama da aikin karanta. Ana fara shi ta hanyar aika umarnin RUBUTA. A lokaci guda, muna aika adireshin shafi a kan bas ɗin adireshi da adireshin ƙungiyar banki. Bari mu tattauna takamaiman bayanai. Gabatarwa da Saƙo Kamar umarnin Karanta muna kuma da gabatarwa da saƙo (duba Tebur 10.8) don umarnin WRITE. Dalilan suna kama da juna - gano bambance-bambancen da ke tsakanin Bayanai, strobe, da agogon ciki na DRAM. Da zarar mun gano bambance-bambancen, za mu iya ɗaure Bayanai daidai. Wannan tsari na horar da da'irar don ɗaure bayanan  daidai ana kiransa matakin rubutu. Tsawon Lokaci Rubuta Gabatarwa tWPRE Rubuta Gabatarwa tWPST Tebur 10.8: Takamaiman lokaci don umarnin WRITE Gabatarwa da saƙo Umarnin WRITE yayi kama da umarnin <TECH>READ dangane da yadda ake bayarwa. A wannan yanayin, muna ayyana kalma da ake kira write latency (WL). Jimillar ƙarin latency (AL), da kuma latency latency (PL), da kuma CAS write latency (CWL). Duba Tebur 10.9 don bayanin sigogin da suka dace da aikin rubutu. Muna da WL=AL+PL +CWL. translation.en: Student grading system subsystem is responsible for a specific aspect of the system's functionality and can be designed, developed, tested, and maintained independently. In the context of a student grading management system, subsystem decomposition might involve breaking down the system into smaller subsystems, such as:  User management subsystem: This subsystem is responsible for managing user accounts, authentication, and authorization.  Course management subsystem: This subsystem is responsible for managing course information, including course schedules, assignments, and exams.  Grading management subsystem: This subsystem is responsible for managing the grading process, including entering and calculating grades, generating reports, and providing feedback to students.  Data management subsystem: This subsystem is responsible for managing the storage and retrieval of data within the system, including student data, course data, and grade data.  Reporting subsystem: This subsystem is responsible for generating reports on student performance, course completion, and other metrics. By breaking down the system into smaller subsystems, each subsystem can be developed and tested independently, making it easier to manage and maintain the system. Additionally, subsystem decomposition can make it easier to identify and fix problems within the system, since issues can be isolated to specific subsystems rather than the entire system.  Network: This component handles the communication between different parts of the system, such as transmitting data between the user interface, application logic, and database.  Security: This component ensures the security of the system, such as protecting sensitive data, preventing unauthorized access, and implementing user authentication and authorization. Overall, the current software architecture of a student grading management system is designed to provide a flexible, modular, and scalable system that can efficiently manage and process student grades and academic performance data. 3.5.2 Component Diagram A component diagram is a type of UML (Unified Modeling Language) diagram that shows the components of a system and their relationships. translation.ha: Tsarin tantance ɗalibai tsarin yana da alhakin wani ɓangare na aikin tsarin kuma ana iya tsara shi, haɓakawa, gwada shi, da kuma kula da shi daban-daban. A cikin mahallin tsarin tantance ɗalibai tsarin, rushewar tsarin na iya haɗawa da raba tsarin  zuwa ƙananan ƙananan tsarin, kamar:  Tsarin tantance masu amfani : Wannan tsarin yana da alhakin sarrafa asusun masu amfani <TECH>, tantancewa, da izini.  Tsarin tantance masu amfani: Wannan tsarin yana da alhakin sarrafa bayanan <TECH>tsarin, gami da jadawalin kwas, ayyuka, da jarrabawa.  Tsarin tantance masu amfani: Wannan tsarin yana da alhakin sarrafa tsarin tantancewa, gami da shigar da ƙididdige maki, samar da rahotanni, da kuma ba da ra'ayi ga ɗalibai.  Tsarin kula da Bayani: Wannan tsarin yana da alhakin kula da adanawa da dawo da bayanai a cikin tsarin , gami da bayanan ɗalibai <TECH>bayanai, kwas ɗin bayanai, da maki bayanai.  Tsarin bayar da rahoto: Wannan tsarin yana da alhakin samar da rahotanni kan aikin ɗalibai , kammala kwas, da sauran ma'auni. Ta hanyar rarraba tsarin <TECH>don ƙananan tsarin, ana iya haɓaka kowane tsarin kuma a gwada shi daban-daban, wanda hakan zai sauƙaƙa gudanarwa da kula da tsarin <TECH>. Bugu da ƙari, rushewar tsarin na iya sauƙaƙa gano da gyara matsaloli a cikin tsarin <TECH>, tunda ana iya ware matsaloli zuwa takamaiman tsarin maimakon tsarin <TECH> gaba ɗaya.  Cibiyar Sadarwa: Wannan ɓangaren <TECH>na'urar yana kula da sadarwa tsakanin sassa daban-daban na tsarin , kamar aika <TECH>bayanai tsakanin hanyar haɗin mai amfani, dabaru na aikace-aikacen, da kuma rumbun adana bayanai na .  <TECH>Tsaro: Wannan ɓangaren na'urar yana tabbatar da tsaro na tsarin , kamar kare bayanan <TECH>masu mahimmanci, hana shiga ba tare da izini ba, da kuma aiwatar da tantancewa da izini na mai amfani. Gabaɗaya, tsarin software na yanzu na tsarin kula da ƙimar ɗalibai na'urar an tsara shi ne don samar da tsarin mai sassauƙa, mai sassauƙa, kuma mai iya daidaitawa wanda zai iya sarrafa da sarrafa maki na ɗalibai da kuma aikin <TECH>na'urarna ilimi. 3.5.2 Sashe Zane Zane na sashe wani nau'in zane ne na UML (Haɗaɗɗen Tsarin Samfura) wanda ke nuna abubuwan da ke cikin tsarin  da alaƙarsu. translation.en: Smruti R. Sarangi 650 predicted at the nanosecond level. Nondeterminism in Buses Thisisamajorsourceofnondeterminismattheboardlevel. Forexample,thebusesconnectingdifferent chips on the motherboard, or the buses connecting a chip on the motherboard with main memory, can have nondeterministic delays for a variety of reasons. Because of ambient conditions we might see some degreeofjitterinthetransmission. Additionally,itispossiblethattheclockofthesenderandtheclock of the receiver might gradually drift (relatively). Because of such jitter and drift issues, it is possible that let’s say in one run we get a message in cycle 10, and in the next run we get a message in cycle 11. Nondeterminism due to Faults Lastly we can have nondeterminism due to faults in the circuit such as faults due to inductive noise or soft errors that lead to rollbacks and restarts. 12.3.2 Methods to Enforce Determinism Deterministic CPUs There should be a method to set a CPU’s internal state to a known state such that a given sequence of inputs will always lead to the same output state. Note that here we are differentiating between the outputs of a program, and the CPU’s internal state. Even if the program’s outputs are the same, the internal state might still be different for different inputs. Even though this will make no difference externally,itissignificantfromthepointofviewofverificationandvalidationengineers. Manyprocessors already have debugging instructions to reset the state of all flip-flops, flush the caches and clean the TLBs. In addition, if we wish to deterministically replay a set of inputs, then we need to also log the exact nature and timing of nondeterministic events such as interrupts, voltage-frequency changes, and clock gating. Events in the memory and the I/O subsystem can be handled similarly. We simply need to log the exact time of different events, and replay them in a CPU debug run if there is a need. Deterministic Buses Ensuring determinism in buses is a hard problem. This is because the sender and receiver might have different clocks that are loosely synchronized with each other and the transmission process itself might havesomejitter. Firstconsiderthecasewheretheirfrequenciesarethesame. Inthiscase, thestandard approach is that the sender sends its local cycle count to the receiver. Let us say that the sender’s time is t as per its local clock, and due to nondeterminism the time at which the receiver gets the message s (receiver’s local time) can be anywhere between t +θ and t +θ . Then the idea is to delay the s 1 s 2 message till t +θ (the absolute worst case delay) at the receiver. If the receiver reads the message at s 2 its own time t +θ , it is guaranteed to do so in all runs with the same inputs. Note that this approach s 2 does increase the latency of a message at the cost of ensuring determinism. It is indeed much easier for engineers to debug and perform post-silicon validation (validate the design after it has been fabricated) if determinism is ensured. There are however two problems with this scheme. The first is that the two clocks need not have the same frequency. In this case, there are various proposals [Sarangi et al., 2006a,Chen et al., 2012] that slightly modify the basic idea to factor in the effects of different frequencies as long as their ratio remainsmoreorlessthesame. Thesecondshortcomingisthatweneedtosendalargenumber(current cycle count) with every message. Note that given that the relative clock skew is a bounded quantity (betweenθ andθ )wecansignificantlyreducethenumberofbitsthataresent(referto[Sarangietal., 1 2 2006a]).
translation.ha: An annabta Smruti R. Sarangi 650 a matakin nanosecond. Rashin tantancewa a cikin Motocin Bas Wannan shine tushen rashin tantancewa a matakin allo. Misali, motocin bas suna haɗa kwakwalwan kwamfuta daban-daban akan motherboard, ko motocin bas ɗin da ke haɗa guntu akan motherboard tare da babban ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya, na iya samun jinkiri mara tabbas saboda dalilai daban-daban. Saboda yanayin yanayi, muna iya ganin wasu matakan jitter a cikin watsawa. Bugu da ƙari, yana yiwuwa agogon mai aikawa da agogon mai karɓa na iya yin yawo a hankali (a cikin ɗan lokaci). Saboda irin waɗannan matsalolin jitter da drift, yana yiwuwa a ce a cikin gudu ɗaya mun sami saƙo a zagaye na 10, kuma a zagaye na gaba za mu sami saƙo a zagaye na 11. Rashin tantancewa saboda Kurakurai A ƙarshe za mu iya samun rashin tantancewa saboda kurakuran da ke cikin da'irar kamar kurakuran saboda hayaniyar inductive ko kurakuran laushi waɗanda ke haifar da juyawa da sake kunnawa. 12.3.2 Hanyoyin Ƙarfafa Ƙarfin ... Kawai muna buƙatar yin rikodin ainihin lokacin abubuwan da suka faru daban-daban, sannan mu sake maimaita su a cikin aikin gyara CPU idan akwai buƙata. Motocin Bas Masu Tabbatar da ƙaddara a cikin bas matsala ce mai wahala. Wannan saboda mai aikawa da mai karɓa na iya samun agogo daban-daban waɗanda aka daidaita su da juna kuma tsarin watsawa da kansa yana iya samun matsala. Da farko la'akari da lamarin inda mitar su iri ɗaya ce. A wannan yanayin, hanyar da aka saba amfani da ita ita ce mai aikawa yana aika ƙidayar zagayowar gida ga mai karɓa. Bari mu ce lokacin mai aikawa t ne bisa ga agogon gida, kuma saboda rashin tabbas lokacin da mai karɓa ya sami saƙon s (lokacin gida na mai karɓa) na iya kasancewa ko'ina tsakanin t + θ da t + θ. To, ra'ayin shine a jinkirta saƙon s 1 s 2 har sai t + θ (mafi munin jinkiri) a wurin mai karɓa. Idan mai karɓa ya karanta saƙon a s 2 lokacinsa t + θ, ana tabbatar da yin hakan a duk gudu tare da shigarwa iri ɗaya. Lura cewa wannan hanyar s 2 tana ƙara latency na   na saƙo wanda ke nufin tabbatar da ƙaddara. Hakika ya fi sauƙi ga injiniyoyi su gyara kurakurai da kuma yin tantancewa bayan silicon (<TECH>tabbatar da ƙira bayan an ƙirƙira shi) idan an tabbatar da ƙaddara. Duk da haka, akwai matsaloli biyu tare da wannan tsarin. Na farko shine cewa agogo biyu ba sa buƙatar samun mita ɗaya. A wannan yanayin, akwai shawarwari daban-daban [Sarangi et al., 2006a, Chen et al., 2012] waɗanda suka ɗan canza ra'ayin asali don yin la'akari da tasirin mitoci daban-daban matuƙar rabonsu ya kasance ko ba shi da iri ɗaya. Na biyu gajeriyar hanya ita ce dole ne a sami babban lamba (ƙidayar zagayowar yanzu) tare da kowane saƙo. Lura cewa idan aka yi la'akari da cewa karkatar agogon dangi adadi ne mai iyaka (tsakanin θ da θ) za mu iya rage adadin bit ɗin da aka aika sosai (duba [Sarangietal., 1 2 2006a]).

translation.en: Data Collection, Processing and Analysis MODULE - 10-A Local Area Planning Longitudes are used to calculate local time, standard time of a nation and international time which is linked to Greenwich Mean Time (GMT). Indian 0 standard time is calculated keeping 82 30’E longitude as the base. The median 0 longitude for the country is 83 E which is close to the standard meridian used for Indian Standard Time calculation. Notes Merits of Median: 1. Being the middle most value, median remains unaffected by the extreme values in the distribution as in the case of arithmetic mean. 2. It is a partition value which divides the series into two nearly equal parts and remains the centre of gravity. 3. However, it cannot be worked out without putting data in an ascending or descending order. If data are large, it might be a time consuming and tedious job. The values of median will be erratic if one or two items are added or subtracted from the series. (c) Mode: It is one of the important measures of central tendency. The maximum concentration of items occurring in a distribution is considered to ascertain the mode. The value which occurs most frequently is identified as mode in case of ungrouped data. Similarly, for grouped data the mode can be calculated by identifying the class with the highest frequency. The mode denotes the centrality of the occurrence of an item in the distribution. The distribution of rural settlements in Uttar Pradesh is given below. Workout the mode for the data. Distribution of Rural settlements in Uttar Pradesh 2001 Size of Very small Small Medium Large Very Large Rural Settlements (Below 500 (500-999) (1500-1999) (2000-4999) (5000 and Population) above) Proportion of 16.69 23.46 47.97 10.59 1.29 distribution Solution: Arrange the data in a sequence (either from small to large or from large to small). Put up the frequency values against each. Now compare the frequencies. The distribution registering maximum frequency is identified as ‘mode’. Merits of the Mode: 1. It is the most typical value of a series. Mode can be located easily by the inspection and can be used by common people also. 2. The occurrence of a few extreme values does not affect the mode, since it is the most typical value of series. GEOGRAPHY 47

Matsakaicin tsayin 0 na ƙasar shine 83 E wanda yake kusa da matsakaicin <FASAHA>daidai</FASAHA> da ake amfani da shi don lissafin lokaci na Indiya <FASAHA>daidai</FASAHA. Bayanan kula: 1. Kasancewar matsakaicin ƙima, matsakaicin ya kasance ba ya shafar ƙimar da ke cikin rarrabawa kamar yadda yake a yanayin matsakaicin lissafi. 2. Ƙimar rabawa ce wadda ke raba jerin zuwa sassa biyu kusan daidai kuma ta kasance tsakiyar nauyi. 3. Duk da haka, ba za a iya sarrafa shi ba tare da sanya bayanan <FASAHA>daidai</FASAHA> a cikin tsari mai hawa ko saukowa ba. Idan bayanai sun yi yawa, zai iya zama aiki mai ɗaukar lokaci da wahala. Ƙimar matsakaici za ta kasance ba daidai ba idan aka ƙara ko cire abubuwa ɗaya ko biyu daga jerin. (c) Yanayi: Yana ɗaya daga cikin mahimman ma'auni na yanayin tsakiya. Ana la'akari da matsakaicin yawan abubuwan da ke faruwa a cikin rarrabawa don tabbatar da yanayin. Ana gano ƙimar da ke faruwa akai-akai a matsayin yanayi idan ba a haɗa bayanai ba. Hakazalika, ga bayanai da aka haɗa a rukuni ana iya ƙididdige yanayin ta hanyar gano ajin da ke da mafi girman mita. Yanayin yana nuna tsakiyar abin da ya faru a cikin rarrabawa. An ba da rarraba matsugunan karkara a Uttar Pradesh a ƙasa. Yi aikin yanayin don bayanai. translation.en: Population Density, Distribuion and Growth in India MODULE - 9 Human resource forested and snow bound areas of the country, mainly situated in the Himalayan development in India region, desert areas of Rajasthan specifically Jaisalmer districts and large expanse of uninhabited marshy lands of Kachchh districts of Gujarat. INTEXT QUESTIONS 26.1 Notes 1. Name three states having a high density of population (i) —————— (ii)———————— and (iii) ———————— 2. Name any three Union Territories in India which fall under the areas of high density of population (i) ——————— (ii) ——————— and (iii) ———————— 3. Name any three sates falling under the category of areas of low density of population (i) ——————— (ii) ——————— and (iii) ———————— 4. Name any one Union Territory having a low density of population ________________________________________________________ 5. Fill in the blanks with most appropriate words given in the brackets. (a) Areas receiving ample precipitation and having fertile soils are likely to have a ————— density of population. (high, moderate, low) (b) Areas suffering from droughts and having a rough terrain are likely to have a —————— density of population. (high, moderate, low) 26.6 GROWTH OF POPULATION The growth of population in a region depends upon fertility, mortality and migration. Fertility or the birth rate is measured in terms of total number of live births per thousand population per year. Generally, the fertility rate is affected by various social, economic and demographic factors. Mortality or the death rate is measured in terms of total number of deaths per thousand population per year. The difference between these two rates (i.e. fertility and mortality) is called the natural growth rate. The term migration refers to the movement of people from one area to the other or from one country to another. The rate of migration affects the growth of population of a region by increasing or decreasing the number of people living there. The growth rate of population may be positive or negative. A positive growth rate of population mean an increase in the number of people living in a region, whereas negative growth rate means declining population. A positive growth rate occurs when the number of births and in migration exceeds the number of deaths and out migration; the negative growth rate means just opposite to positive growth rate. GEOGRAPHY 247

Ana auna yawan haihuwa ko yawan haihuwa ta hanyar jimillar adadin haihuwa da rai ga kowace dubu a kowace shekara. Gabaɗaya, yawan haihuwa yana shafar dalilai daban-daban na zamantakewa, tattalin arziki da kuma al'umma. Ana auna yawan mace-mace ko adadin mace-mace ta hanyar jimillar adadin mace-mace ga kowace dubu a kowace shekara. Bambancin da ke tsakanin waɗannan matakan biyu (watau haihuwa da mace-mace) ana kiransa ƙimar girma ta halitta. Kalmar ƙaura tana nufin ƙaura daga wani yanki zuwa wani ko daga wata ƙasa zuwa wata. Yawan ƙaura yana shafar haɓakar yawan jama'a na wani yanki ta hanyar ƙara ko rage adadin mutanen da ke zaune a can. Yawan ƙaruwar yawan jama'a <TECH>na iya zama mai kyau ko mara kyau. Matsakaicin ƙaruwar yawan jama'a mai kyau yana nufin ƙaruwar adadin mutanen da ke zaune a wani yanki, yayin da ƙimar girma mara kyau yana nufin raguwar yawan jama'a. Adadin ci gaba mai kyau yana faruwa ne lokacin da adadin haihuwa da kuma ƙaura suka wuce adadin mace-mace da kuma ƙaura daga ƙaura; ƙimar ci gaba mara kyau yana nufin akasin ƙimar ci gaba mai kyau. translation.en: Software Requirements Specification for LIBRARY INFORMATION SYSTEM 17 4.1. LOGIN SYSTEM / ACCOUNTS 4.1.1. Description And Priority The LIS should have a login system through which the administrators and the members can sign-in and use the various available functionalities. Most of the modules are accessible only when the user is logged-in. A login-id, which the LMCN for the members and some Library Identity for the administrators, along with a password should be enough information required to log into an account. Accounts for new members can be registered only by the Librarian. Similarly, only the Librarian can deregister an existing member from the LIS. All users have the liberty to change their passwords (once they login with the password provided by the administration) and log-out of their accounts. Overall Priority Quotient : HIGH 4.1.2. Stimulus / Response Sequences - The user opens the log-in form by clicking on one of the buttons on the home screen. - The form asks for the user’s login-id and password. - In case the user is a member, she must enter her LMCN as the log-in id. Otherwise if she is an administrator (clerk or Librarian), she should enter her Library ID as the log-in id. - The user should enter the correct password. - Provided the details entered by the user are correct, she should be able to log into her account by clicking on a button and then see the first page where all the modules are provided. - The user can log out of the account by clicking a button on the first page. - The user can change the password of her account by visiting a module specifically meant for this functionality. 4.1.3. Functional Requirements - Requirement ID : R01.F01.01 - Title : Erroneous Inputs / Validate Inputs - Description : The software should check the correctness/validity of the input details by matching with the concerned records in the concerned tables of the database(s).

translation.en: When the ventilator is delivering VIMs during apnea ventilation, three consecutive PIMs would switch back to normal SIMV ventilation. The third consecutive PIM is the first breath of the next SIMV period. SFSYST10 PRES SIMV mode (valve) No text (title) SFSYST10.6 The software must deliver a VIM two seconds after the ventilation has started (starting at the end of the turbine test) if no inspiratory trigger is detected during this period. SFSYST10.7 The software must deliver a PIM if an inspiratory trigger is detected during two seconds after the ventilation has started (starting at the end of the turbine test). The SIMV period (60/rate) then starts from the beginning of this PIM. SFSYST10.8 The software must deliver a PS breath if an inspiratory trigger is detected before a period of INSP TIME from the end of the SIMV period. SFSYST10.9 The software must deliver a VIM after a period of 60/Rate since the beginning of the latest VIM excepted in the following cases: - if a PS inspiration is in progress - if an exhalation is in progress since less than 2xInsp time of the last breath See 10.14 and 10.16 for those exceptions cases SFSYST10.10 The software shall deliver a PIM if a trigger is detected during a period of INSP TIME before the end of the latest SIMV period. SFSYST10.11 If no breath (either VIM, PIM or PS) is delivered in a period equal to APNEA TIME (if Apnea alarm is equal to YES or OFF in preferences menu), the software must start an apnea ventilation with Pres AC breathes at Backup Rate. SFSYST10.12 The software must deliver PS (Pressure Support) breathes like in PSV mode breath with default settings defined in the setting section. SFSYST10.13 The software must deliver the PIM (Patient initiated Mandatory) and the VIM (Ventilator Initiated Mandatory) with pressure controlled breathes like in Pres AC mode. SFSYST10.14 If a VIM or a PIM is delivered after the SIMV period (60/rate) ends, the following period is delayed and starts from the beginning of this VIM or PIM. In case of a PIM triggered before the end of the SIMV period the following period is not delayed and starts at the end of the previous period. translation.ha: Lokacin da na'urar numfashi ke isar da VIMs yayin iskar numfashi ta apnea, PIMs guda uku a jere za su koma zuwa iskar numfashi ta SIMV ta yau da kullun. PIM na uku a jere shine numfashi na farko na lokacin SIMV na gaba. Yanayin SFSYST10 PRES SIMV (bawul) Babu rubutu (take) SFSYST10.6 Software ɗin dole ne ya isar da VIM daƙiƙa biyu bayan fara iska (yana farawa daga ƙarshen gwajin turbine) idan ba a gano abin da ke haifar da iskar numfashi a wannan lokacin ba. SFSYST10.7 Software ɗin dole ne ya isar da PIM idan an gano abin da ke haifar da iskar numfashi a cikin daƙiƙa biyu bayan fara iskar numfashi (yana farawa daga ƙarshen gwajin turbine). Lokacin SIMV (60/ƙimar) sannan ya fara daga farkon wannan PIM. SFSYST10.8 Software ɗin dole ne ya isar da numfashin PS idan an gano abin da ke haifar da iskar numfashi kafin lokacin INSP TIME daga ƙarshen lokacin SIMV. SFSYST10.9 Software ɗin dole ne ya isar da VIM bayan tsawon lokaci na 60/Rate tun farkon sabuwar VIM da aka ware a cikin waɗannan yanayi: - idan ana ci gaba da wahayi ga PS - idan ana ci gaba da fitar da numfashi tun ƙasa da lokacin 2xInsp na numfashi na ƙarshe Duba 10.14 da 10.16 ga waɗannan shari'o'in keɓancewa SFSYST10.10 Software ɗin zai isar da PIM idan an gano abin kunna a cikin lokacin INSP TIME kafin ƙarshen sabuwar lokacin SIMV. SFSYST10.11 Idan babu numfashi (ko dai VIM, PIM ko PS) an isar da shi a cikin lokacin da ya yi daidai da TIME na APNEA (idan ƙararrawar Apnea daidai take da EES ko KASHE a cikin menu na fifiko), software ɗin dole ne ya fara fitar da iska ta apnea tare da Pres AC yana numfashi a Matsakaicin Ajiyewa. SFSYST10.12 Manhajar dole ne ta isar da PS (Tallafin Matsi) tana numfashi kamar yadda take numfashi a yanayin PSV tare da saitunan tsoho da aka ayyana a cikin sashin saitin. SFSYST10.13 Manhajar dole ne ta isar da PIM (Majiyyaci ya fara Dole) da VIM (Ventilator ya fara Dole) tare da sarrafa matsin lamba suna numfashi kamar yadda take a yanayin Pres AC. SFSYST10.14 Idan an isar da VIM ko PIM bayan lokacin SIMV (60/ƙimar) ya ƙare, ana jinkirta lokacin mai zuwa kuma yana farawa daga farkon wannan VIM ko PIM. Idan PIM ya fara kafin ƙarshen lokacin SIMV, ba a jinkirta lokacin mai zuwa ba kuma yana farawa a ƙarshen lokacin da ya gabata. translation.en: • Receive information on collection through SADAD's payment system to update the status of invoices that have been paid. 5. Customer management: • The ability to define and manage clients dealing with the Ministry and provide their information through the system. 6. Dashboards and reports: • The ability to extract maps showing each geographical area. • The ability to extract reports on clients. • The ability to extract reports showing contract information for real estate and land (for example: the time period and the contractual value for each of them). 7. electronic archive: • Automatic electronic archiving of documents. 8. Land services: • Services that contribute to supporting Saudi agriculture in the allocation and leasing of suitable agricultural lands to investors in agricultural or animal projects. • Services aiming to achieve the desired justice with regard to agricultural land issues, with regard to the benefit in the requests for deeds of fortitude. - The second track: Violation Management System The procedure for controlling violations describes how to seize a violation against an individual or firm, as a result of its failure to comply with one of the controls and standards set by the Ministry. - The third track: Invoice Management System Responsible for the procedures of registering all types of invoices issued by the ministry for all revenues that the ministry collects. - The fourth track: Customer Relationship Management System The Ministry of Environment, Water and Agriculture seeks to implement an integrated platform for managing customer relations, complaints, issues and reports because of its interconnectedness on both sides of the business. The application of the platform aims to achieve the strategic objectives and operational efficiency that the Ministry of Environment, Water and Agriculture seeks to achieve, in order to improve its services provided internally to the Ministry’s employees and externally to the parties benefiting from Ministry services. Due to the importance of customer satisfaction, the Ministry of Environment, Water and Agriculture improves the level of service provided to customers, resolves complaints faster and more efficiently, and reduces the number of complaints to the maximum possible extent by carrying out the following tasks: • Receiving customer requests for services and providing full support for their implementation by providing the customer with communication channels such as call centers, social media, short messages, or the ministry’s branches, through which he can communicate complaints, inquiries or suggestions and follow them up. • The system provides receiving suggestions, recommendations and ideas from clients with the aim of improving the level of services for registration and study. • Monitor the quality of services provided to clients and the extent of customer satisfaction with these services by providing an evaluation feature on the service. • Reducing the number of complaints submitted by customers to the maximum extent possible. • Inform the customer that the complaint has been resolved through direct contact, text messages, e-mail, or social media. • The system provides a feature of linking with systems and fetching customer information with one screen. • Ease of registering a complaint in the system from any of the communication channels (call, mail, mobile application, social media platforms, applications, offices and branches). • The system must include the feature of working with the customer services team and the work team in the ministry to remove the causes of complaints. 4

Ayyukan ƙasa: • Ayyukan da ke ba da gudummawa ga tallafawa Saudiyya noma a cikin rarrabawa da hayar filayen noma masu dacewa ga masu zuba jari a ayyukan noma ko dabbobi. • Ayyukan da ke da nufin cimma adalcin da ake so dangane da batutuwan ƙasar noma, dangane da fa'idar da ke cikin buƙatun ayyukan ƙarfin gwiwa. - Hanya ta biyu: Gudanar da Keta Hakki Tsarin Hanya ta magance keta hakki ta bayyana yadda ake kama keta hakki ga mutum ko kamfani, sakamakon gazawarta na bin ɗaya daga cikin ƙa'idodi da ƙa'idodi da Ma'aikatar  ta gindaya. - Hanya ta uku: Gudanar da Takardar Kuɗi <TECH>Tsarin Mai alhakin hanyoyin yin rijistar duk nau'ikan takardar kuɗi da ma'aikatar ta bayar don duk kuɗin shiga da ma'aikatar ke karɓa. - Hanya ta huɗu: Gudanar da Hulɗar Abokan Ciniki Tsarin Ma'aikatar Muhalli, Ruwa da Noma tana neman aiwatar da wani dandamali mai haɗaka don sarrafa dangantakar abokan ciniki, koke-koke, batutuwa da rahotanni saboda haɗin kai a ɓangarorin biyu na kasuwanci. Aikace-aikacen  na dandamali yana da nufin cimma manufofin dabaru da ingancin aiki da Ma'aikatar Muhalli, Ruwa da Noma ke neman cimmawa, don inganta ayyukanta da ake bayarwa a cikin gida ga ma'aikatan Ma'aikatar da kuma a waje ga ɓangarorin da ke cin gajiyar ayyukan Ma'aikatar. Saboda muhimmancin gamsuwar abokan ciniki, Ma'aikatar Muhalli, Ruwa da Noma ta inganta matakin sabis ɗin da ake bayarwa ga abokan ciniki, tana warware koke-koke cikin sauri da inganci, kuma tana rage yawan koke-koke har zuwa iyakar iyawarta ta hanyar aiwatar da ayyuka masu zuwa: • Karɓar buƙatun abokan ciniki don ayyuka da kuma ba da cikakken goyon baya ga aiwatar da su ta hanyar samar wa abokin ciniki hanyoyin sadarwa kamar cibiyoyin kira, kafofin sada zumunta, gajerun saƙonni, ko rassan ma'aikatar, ta hanyar da zai iya isar da koke-koke, tambayoyi ko shawarwari da kuma bin diddigin su. • Tsarin  yana ba da shawarwari, shawarwari da ra'ayoyi daga abokan ciniki da nufin inganta matakin ayyuka don yin rijista da karatu. • Kula da ingancin ayyukan da ake bayarwa ga abokan ciniki da kuma girman gamsuwar abokan ciniki da waɗannan ayyuka ta hanyar samar da fasalin kimantawa akan sabis ɗin. • Rage adadin koke-koken da abokan ciniki suka gabatar har zuwa iyakar iyawa. • Sanar da abokin ciniki cewa an warware koke-koken ta hanyar tuntuɓar kai tsaye, saƙonnin rubutu, imel, ko kafofin sada zumunta. • Tsarin  yana ba da fasalin haɗawa da tsarin da kuma ɗaukar bayanan  na abokin ciniki tare da allo ɗaya. • Sauƙin yin rijistar ƙorafi a cikin tsarin  daga kowace hanyar sadarwa (kira, aika saƙo, aikace-aikacen wayar hannu , dandamalin kafofin sada zumunta, aikace-aikace, ofisoshi da rassan). • Dole ne tsarin  <TECH> ya haɗa da fasalin yin aiki tare da ƙungiyar kula da abokan ciniki da ƙungiyar aiki a ma'aikatar don kawar da abubuwan da ke haifar da ƙorafi. 4

translation.en: 427 Smruti R. Sarangi x and y are global variables in a multithreaded program; assume that all our variables are initialized to zero. Here, Thread 1 is setting both x and y to 1. Thread 2 is reading y into local variable t1, and then is reading x into local variable t2. Let us look at what is happening at the level of the NoC and cache banks. When we are updating global variables, we are essentially performing memory writes to their addresses in memory. A write to a memory address is a complex series of events. We need to create a write message and send it on the NoCtothecorrespondingcachebanksuchthatthevaluecanbewrittentothecorrectphysicallocation. It is like sending a letter by post from New Delhi to Moscow. The writes to x and y get converted to such letters that are sent through the NoC. The same is true for a read request to memory, where the basic operation is to inject a read message into the NoC. It needs to be routed to the correct physical location, and then we need to send the value that was read back to the requesting core or cache. Inthiscomplexsequenceofmessages, itisverywellpossiblethatthemessagetoupdatexmightget caught up in network congestion, and the message to update y might reach its destination earlier. This can happen for a myriad of reasons. Maybe the message to update y takes a different route that is less congested, or the cache bank that holds y is closer to the core that is issuing the write request. The net summary is that the updates to x and y need not be seen to be happening one after the other, or even in the same order by other cores. This can lead to pretty anomalous outcomes, which are clearly non- intuitive. Sadly, given the complex nature of interactions inside multicore processors, such occurrences are perfectly normal, and in fact many commercial processors allow many such behaviors. For example, it is possible for a thread running on another core to read y = t1 = 1, and then read x=t2=0. Recallthattheassumptionisthatallglobalvariablessuchasxandy areinitializedtozero. This observation would be very anomalous and non-intuitive indeed, because as per program order, we first update x and then y. The core that performs these updates sees them in that order. However, because of the non-deterministic nature of message delivery times in a realistic NoC such a situation is perfectly possible. Even though the outcome (t1,t2)=(1,0) (t1=1 and t2=0) for Thread 2 looks to be plausible, it somehowmanagestobotherusandtellusthattheoutcomeisnotintuitiveandhenceundesirable. This is simply not how we want programs to behave. It appears that different cores are seeing different views of memory operations, and their perception of the relative order of memory operations is different. This was not happening in a single-threaded system, and thus we are not used to such outcomes. Writing correctparallelprogramswithsuchoutcomesisgoingtobeverydifficult. Reasoningabouttheirbehavior andwritingoptimizingcompilersthatcanpossiblyreordermemoryaccessesbecomesevenmoredifficult. We thus need a theoretical framework that will allow us to reason about the possible and valid outcomes of multithreaded programs in large multicore processors with complex NoCs. We need to find ways to rein in the complexity of the behaviors of multithreaded programs on multicore systems and enforce certain policies. These policies are known as memory consistency models or simply memory models, which explicitly specify the rules for generating the valid outcomes of parallel programs. They preserve our notion of intuitiveness, provide a formal correctness framework, and simultaneously allow the programmer, compiler, and architecture to maximize performance. Definition 66 Let us informally define a memory consistency model as a policy that specifies the behavior of a parallel,multithreadedprogram. Ingeneral,amultithreadedprogramcanproducenumerousoutcomes depending on the relative order of scheduling of the threads, and the behavior of memory operations. Amemoryconsistencymodelrestrictsthesetofallowedoutcomesforagivenmultithreadedprogram. It is a set of rules that defines the interaction of memory instructions between each other. We shall take a detailed look at memory consistency models in Section 9.5 including their imple- mentation aspects.
translation.ha: 427 Smruti R. Sarangi x da y masu canjin duniya ne a cikin shirin da aka yi wa maɓalli da yawa; ɗauka cewa duk masu canjinmu an fara su zuwa sifili. A nan, Zaren 1 yana saita duka x da y zuwa 1. Zaren 2 yana karanta y zuwa mai canjin gida t1, sannan yana karanta x zuwa mai canjin gida t2. Bari mu kalli abin da ke faruwa a matakin bankunan NoC da cache. Lokacin da muke sabunta masu canjin duniya, ainihin muna yin rubuta ƙwaƙwalwa zuwa adiresoshinsu a cikin ƙwaƙwalwa. Rubutawa zuwa adireshin ƙwaƙwalwa jerin abubuwan da suka faru ne masu rikitarwa. Muna buƙatar ƙirƙiri saƙon rubutu kuma aika shi akan NoCtothecorrespondingcachebanksuchthatthevaluecanbewrittentothecorrectphysicallocation. Yana kama da aika wasiƙa ta wasiƙa daga New Delhi zuwa Moscow. Rubutawa zuwa x da y ana canza su zuwa irin waɗannan haruffa waɗanda aka aika ta NoC. Haka abin yake ga buƙatar karantawa ta ta karanta zuwa ƙwaƙwalwa, inda aikin asali shine a saka saƙon karantawa ta ta karanta a cikin NoC. Yana buƙatar a tura shi zuwa wurin da ya dace, sannan mu buƙaci mu aika ƙimar da aka karanta ta ta karanta zuwa ga zuciyar da ake buƙata ko cache. A cikin wannan tsari mai rikitarwa na saƙonni, yana yiwuwa saƙon zai iya kamawa cikin cunkoson hanyar sadarwa, kuma saƙon sabuntawa ta ta sabunta zai iya isa inda ake so da wuri. Wannan na iya faruwa saboda dalilai da yawa. Wataƙila saƙon sabuntawa ta ta sabunta y yana ɗaukar wata hanya daban wacce ba ta da cunkoso sosai, ko kuma bankin ajiya da ke riƙe da y ya fi kusa da zuciyar da ke bayar da buƙatar rubutu. Takaitaccen bayani shine cewa sabuntawa ga x da y ba lallai ne a ga suna faruwa ɗaya bayan ɗaya ba, ko ma a cikin tsari ɗaya ta wasu tsakiya. Wannan na iya haifar da sakamako mara kyau, waɗanda a bayyane yake ba su da ma'ana. Abin baƙin ciki, idan aka yi la'akari da yanayin mu'amala mai rikitarwa a cikin na'urori masu sarrafawa da yawa, irin waɗannan abubuwan sun zama ruwan dare, kuma a zahiri yawancin na'urori masu sarrafawa na kasuwanci suna ba da damar irin waɗannan halaye da yawa. Misali, yana yiwuwa zaren da ke gudana akan wani core ya karanta  y = t1 = 1, sannan <TECH>karanta x=t2=0. Ka tuna cewa zato shine cewa duk masu canzawa na duniya kamar xandy an fara su zuwa sifili. Wannan lura zai zama abin ban mamaki kuma ba shi da fahimta, saboda kamar yadda aka tsara tsarin shirin, da farko muna sabuntawa x sannan y. Tushen da ke yin waɗannan sabuntawa yana ganin su a cikin wannan tsari. Duk da haka, saboda yanayin rashin tabbas na lokutan isar da saƙo a cikin NoC na gaske, irin wannan yanayi yana yiwuwa sosai. Ko da yake sakamakon (t1,t2) = (1,0) (t1=1 da t2=0) na Zaren 2 yana kama da mai yiwuwa, ta wata hanya yana sarrafa kansa kuma yana gaya masa cewa sakamakon ba shi da tabbas kuma ba a so. Wannan ba yadda muke son shirye-shirye su yi aiki ba ne. Da alama akwai ra'ayoyi daban-daban game da ayyukan ƙwaƙwalwa, kuma fahimtarsu game da tsarin ayyukan ƙwaƙwalwa ya bambanta. Wannan ba ya faruwa a cikin tsarin mai zare ɗaya ba, don haka ba mu saba da irin waɗannan sakamakon ba. Rubuta daidai shirye-shirye masu kama da juna tare da sakamako mara wahala. Tunani game da halayensu da rubuce-rubucen inganta masu tattarawa waɗanda za su iya sake tsara tsari na damar ƙwaƙwalwa ya zama bakwai ya fi wahala. Don haka muna buƙatar tsarin ka'ida wanda zai ba mu damar yin tunani game da yiwuwar da inganci na shirye-shiryen da aka yi wa zare a cikin manyan masu sarrafawa da yawa tare da NoCs masu rikitarwa. Muna buƙatar nemo hanyoyin da za mu iya rage sarkakiyar halayen shirye-shiryen da aka yi wa zare a kan tsarin da yawa da kuma aiwatar da wasu manufofi. Waɗannan manufofi an san su da samfuran daidaiton ƙwaƙwalwa ko kawai samfuran ƙwaƙwalwa, waɗanda ke fayyace ƙa'idodi don samar da ingantattun sakamakon shirye-shiryen da ke daidai. Suna kiyaye ra'ayinmu na fahimta, suna samar da tsarin daidaito na yau da kullun, kuma a lokaci guda suna ba mai shirye-shirye, mai tarawa, da gine-gine damar haɓaka aikin <TECH>. Ma'ana 66 Bari mu bayyana tsarin daidaiton ƙwaƙwalwa ba bisa ƙa'ida ba a matsayin manufa wadda ke ƙayyade halayen shirin layi ɗaya, mai yawan zare. Gabaɗaya, shirin da aka haɗa da zare na iya samar da sakamako da yawa dangane da tsarin jadawalin zaren, da kuma halayen ayyukan ƙwaƙwalwa. Tsarin daidaiton Amemory yana ƙuntata waɗannan don ba da izini ga sakamakon da aka bayar don shirin da aka haɗa da zare. Tsarin dokoki ne da ke bayyana hulɗar umarnin ƙwaƙwalwa tsakanin juna. Za mu yi cikakken nazari kan samfuran daidaiton ƙwaƙwalwa a Sashe na 9.5 gami da fannonin aiwatar da su.

translation.en: MODULE - 6 India - Physical Features The physical setting of India (iii) Purvachal Purvachal is the name given to all the hills of north east India beyond Brahmaputra gorge. The average height of these hills from sea level is 500 to 3000 metres. These hills are located in Southern Arunachal Pradesh, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura and Meghalaya. Mishmi, Patkoi Bum, Notes Naga, Manipur, Mizo(Lushai) and Tripur are the major hilly ranges of this region. Meghalaya Plateau is also part of these hills of the north eastern region. This plateau includes the hills of Garo, Khasi, and Jaintia. Structur- ally, however, it is a part of Peninsular India.  The Himadri, the Himachal and the Siwalik are three major ranges of the Himalayas.  The Zaskar, the Ladakh and the Karakoram along with their eastern exten- sion, Kailash in Tibet are the trans Himalayan ranges.  Mishmi, Patkoi Bum, Naga, Manipur, Mizo, Tripur etc. are the hill ranges of Purvachal. INTEXT QUESTIONS 16.2 1. Select the correct alternative. (i) Which is the highest mountain peak of the world? (a) K2 (b) Kanchenjunga (c) Mt. Everest (d) Namcha Barva. __________________________________________________ (ii) Which is the highest peak in India? (a) Annapurna (b) Nanga Parbat (c) K2 (d) Nanda Devi __________________________________________________ 2. Name three mountain ranges of the Himalayas (1)________________(2)______________(3)__________________ 3. Which mountain is referred to as Krishnagiri in Sanskrit literature? _______________________________________________________ 4. Name the most important Trans-Himalayan mountain range in Jammu & Kashmir along with its eastern extension in Tibet. _______________________________________________________ 16.5 THE GREAT NORTHERN PLAINS This plain extends from west to east, between Himalayas in the north and Great Indian Plateau in the south. The plain extends from the arid and semi-arid areas of 8 GEOGRAPHY
translation.ha: MASU KYAU - 6 Indiya - Siffofin Jiki Yanayin zahiri na Indiya (iii) Purvachal Purvachal shine sunan da aka bai wa dukkan tsaunukan arewa maso gabashin Indiya bayan kwarin Brahmaputra. Matsakaicin tsayin waɗannan tuddai daga matakin teku shine mita 500 zuwa 3000. Waɗannan tuddai suna cikin Kudancin Arunachal Pradesh, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura da Meghalaya. Mishmi, Patkoi Bum, Notes Naga, Manipur, Mizo (Lushai) da Tripur sune manyan tsaunukan wannan yankin. Plateau Meghalaya shima wani ɓangare ne na waɗannan tuddai na yankin arewa maso gabas. Wannan fili ya haɗa da tuddai na Garo, Khasi, da Jaintia. Duk da haka, a tsarinsa, wani ɓangare ne na Peninsular India.  Himadri, Himachal da Siwalik manyan layuka uku ne na Himalayas.  Zaskar, Ladakh da Karakoram tare da faɗaɗarsu ta gabas, Kailash a Tibet sune tsaunukan trans Himalayan.  Mishmi, Patkoi Bum, Naga, Manipur, Mizo, Tripur da sauransu sune tsaunukan Purvachal. Faɗi jerin tsaunuka uku na Himalayas (1)______________(2)__________(3)__________________ 3. translation.en: State Diagrams The state diagrams take all of the functionality found in the previous diagrams and combines them together to demonstrate the possible changes in the state within BECS. These state diagrams contain all the possible scenarios shown in the sequence diagrams. Starting Point This is where the system starts at and it is represented with a filled circle that has an arrow that point towards the starting state. States These are represented in the diagram by the boxes that have the rounded edges. They are separated into two half’s the top half is the title of the state and the bottom half can have additional states encapsulated within but these state diagrams do not contain any encapsulated states within states. Transitions The arrows that connect the states to each other and have a label of the event that occurs which triggers the transition. These triggers are normally functions but they can also be a new call that is the event of creating a new object; this is represented simply with the word “new”. Some transitions do not have a label, these are returns from the current state to the previous state. Objects The larger boxes that can contain several states and transitions. They are classes within the state diagram. The text at the top of the box is the name of the class. Template based on IEEE Std 830-1998 for SRS. Modifications (content and ordering of information) have been made by Betty H.C. Cheng, Michigan State University (chengb at chengb.cse.msu.edu)
translation.ha: Zane-zanen Jiha Zane-zanen jiha suna ɗaukar duk ayyukan da aka samu a cikin zane-zanen da suka gabata kuma suna haɗa su tare don nuna yiwuwar canje-canje a cikin yanayin a cikin BECS. Waɗannan zane-zanen jiha suna ɗauke da duk yanayin da za a iya gani a cikin zane-zanen jeri. Wurin Farawa Wannan shine inda tsarin  ya fara kuma ana wakilta shi da da'ira mai cike da kibiya wacce ke nuna yanayin farawa. Jihohi Waɗannan ana wakilta su a cikin zane ta akwatunan da ke da gefuna masu zagaye. An raba su zuwa rabi biyu rabin sama shine taken yanayin kuma rabin ƙasa na iya samun ƙarin jihohi da aka lulluɓe a ciki amma waɗannan zane-zanen jiha ba su ƙunshi kowace jiha da aka lulluɓe a cikin jihohi ba. Canji Kibiyoyin da ke haɗa jihohi da juna kuma suna da lakabin abin da ya faru wanda ke haifar da canjin. Waɗannan abubuwan da ke haifar da su yawanci suna aiki amma kuma suna iya zama sabon kira wanda shine taron ƙirƙirar sabon abu; wannan ana wakilta shi kawai da kalmar "sabo". Wasu canje-canje ba su da lakabi, waɗannan dawowa ne daga yanayin yanzu zuwa yanayin da ya gabata. Abubuwa Manyan akwatunan da za su iya ƙunsar jihohi da yawa da canje-canje. Azuzuwa ne a cikin zane-zanen jiha. Rubutun da ke saman akwatin shine sunan ajin. Samfurin da ya dogara da IEEE Std 830-1998 don SRS. Betty H.C. Cheng, Jami'ar Jihar Michigan ne suka yi gyare-gyare (abun ciki da tsari na bayanai) (chengb a chengb.cse.msu.edu)

translation.en: NOV,3,2022 B.TECH E-Commerce Another portal is created for admin users that add item categories, items and receive orders to make the shipment for user. In Scope Items: User , item , cart , orders , payment management. Out of Scope : Payment Through Banking Methods Cross Reference : This section will keep growing to tackle all user stories and requirements for all project phases documentation which you can find below . B .te cm h T ra a trix c e .x als bx ility H L B N - B .te c h .x ls x S P ro je ta te m c t S e n c o p ts .p ed f 2-Overall Description Product Perspective B.TECH user will enter the website as a web site visitor first and if he is logged in he can access his account immediately. As a user or a website visitor , can check all the items in home page which is the page that includes main menu , search bar , important links to the account like cart , help and account . also will have the most selling items . User can select any item then check its details after clicking it from home page or main menu or direct search to define the quantity he needs to be added to his cart either to pay for them in the moment or paid later as the system will keep items reserved in user’s cart unless he removed them. Once the user decided to buy them , will check out after reviewing the financial summary which will include items price , quantity , VAT if fount and total amount to be paid. User will select to pay in COD or through bank cards which will have validations on the used card . After the payment , user will have the paid item delivered as he expected . Ba a Iyakancewa ba: Biyan Kuɗi Ta Hanyar Banki Bambance-bambance: Wannan sashe zai ci gaba da girma don magance duk labaran mai amfani da buƙatun duk takaddun matakan aiki waɗanda zaku iya samu a ƙasa. B .te cm h Tra a trix c e .x als bx ility H L B N - B .te c h .x ls x S Pro je ta temc t S en cops pts .p ed f 2-Bayani Gabaɗaya Bayani Ra'ayin Samfura B.TECH mai amfani zai shiga gidan yanar gizon a matsayin baƙon gidan yanar gizo da farko kuma idan ya shiga zai iya shiga asusunsa nan take. A matsayinka na mai amfani da  ko kuma mai ziyara a gidan yanar gizo, zai iya duba duk abubuwan da ke cikin shafin farko wanda shine shafin da ya haɗa da babban menu, sandar bincike, mahimman hanyoyin haɗi zuwa asusun kamar keken siyayya, taimako da asusu. Hakanan zai sami abubuwa mafi siyarwa. Mai amfani zai iya zaɓar kowane abu sannan ya duba bayanansa bayan ya danna shi daga shafin farko ko babban menu ko bincike kai tsaye don ƙayyade adadin da yake buƙatar ƙarawa a cikin keken siyayyarsa ko dai don biyan su a yanzu ko kuma a biya daga baya saboda tsarin  zai ajiye abubuwa a cikin keken siyayya na mai amfani sai dai idan ya cire su. Da zarar mai amfani da  ya yanke shawarar siyan su, zai duba bayan ya sake duba taƙaitaccen bayanin kuɗi wanda zai haɗa da farashin kayayyaki, adadi, VAT idan an samo shi da jimlar adadin da za a biya. Mai amfani zai zaɓi ya biya a cikin COD ko ta katunan banki waɗanda za su sami tabbaci akan katin da aka yi amfani da shi. Bayan biyan kuɗi, mai amfani da  zai sami kayan da aka biya kamar yadda ya zata. Admin clicks on invite new participants button 2. System shall ask the admin to enter participant email 3. Admin shall write the participant email 4. Admin clicks invite 5. System should add new participant to the room Alternative Flow In Case the participant email does not exist 6.1. System shows a message for the admin participant email is not correct 6.2. Admin can retype the email Business Rules • The system will check if the participant email is valid or not Post Conditions • Success: o The participants will be added to the room

translation.en: 4 Adjust the volume to a moderate level on the connected device. If the volume is adjusted by operations on the connected portable audio device, the (power) indicator on the speaker will not flash. 5 Press the –/+ (volume) buttons to adjust the volume. When you press the –/+ (volume) buttons to adjust the volume, the (power) indicator flashes once or 3 times. Hint When you cannot hear the sound, raise the volume on the connected device. As long as the speaker is connected with a smartphone or mobile phone via HFP (Hands-free Profile) BLUETOOTH connection, you can talk hands-free on the phone while listening to music from the device that is connected with the speaker by an audio cable as well. Note While an audio cable is plugged to the AUDIO IN jack, priority is given to the audio output through the AUDIO IN jack and audio output from the BLUETOOTH device is disabled. Depending on the state of the BLUETOOTH connection, the (BLUETOOTH) indicator on the speaker lights or flashes in blue. This, however, does not indicate a malfunction. While the speaker has an audio cable plugged, you can still listen to music from the BLUETOOTH device connected via a BLUETOOTH connection by selecting, for example, [My Library] on “Sony | Music Center.” While the Stereo Pair function or the Party Connect function is in use, the speaker is not capable of outputting the music playing on the device that is connected to the AUDIO IN jack by an audio cable. While the speaker is in AUDIO IN mode, you can set it up for the Stereo Pair function or the Party Connect function with “Sony | Music Center” as well. Upon completion of the setup, however, the speaker is automatically placed into BLUETOOTH mode. When connecting a portable audio device to the AUDIO IN jack and playing music, you cannot use the buttons on the speaker to perform operations such as pause, skip to the beginning of the next track, and skip to the beginning of the current track. Do not use the AUDIO IN jack in places where the speaker is likely to have water splashed on it. The supplied accessories as well as the jack and ports (USB/AUDIO IN) behind the cap are designed neither for waterproof nor for dustproof. Be sure to close the cap completely after disconnecting the audio cable from the speaker. The cap plays a very important role in maintenance of the waterproof and dustproof performance. Related Topic Auto Standby (power saving) function 5-039-104-11(3) Copyright 2022 Sony Corporation 51
translation.ha: 4 Daidaita ƙarar zuwa matsakaicin matakin na'urar da aka haɗa. Idan an daidaita ƙarar ta hanyar aiki akan na'urar sauti mai ɗaukuwa da aka haɗa, alamar (ƙarfi) akan lasifikar ba za ta yi walƙiya ba. 5 Danna maɓallin –/+ (ƙarfi) don daidaita ƙarar. Lokacin da ka danna maɓallin –/+ (ƙarfi) don daidaita ƙarar, alamar (ƙarfi) tana walƙiya sau ɗaya ko sau 3. Shawara Lokacin da ba za ka iya jin sautin ba, ƙara ƙarar akan na'urar da aka haɗa. Muddin an haɗa lasifikar da wayar salula ko wayar hannu ta hanyar haɗin HFP (Hands-free Profile) BLUETOOTH, zaka iya yin magana ba tare da hannu ba akan wayar yayin sauraron kiɗa daga na'urar da aka haɗa da lasifikar ta hanyar kebul na sauti. Lura Yayin da kebul na sauti ke haɗawa da jack ɗin AUDIO IN, ana ba da fifiko ga fitarwar sauti ta hanyar jack ɗin AUDIO IN da fitarwar sauti daga na'urar BLUETOOTH. Dangane da yanayin haɗin BLUETOOTH, alamar (BLUETOOTH) akan lasifikar tana haskakawa ko kuma tana walƙiya da shuɗi. Duk da haka, wannan ba ya nuna matsala. Yayin da lasifikar ke da kebul na sauti da aka haɗa, har yanzu kuna iya sauraron kiɗa daga na'urar BLUETOOTH da aka haɗa ta hanyar haɗin BLUETOOTH ta hanyar zaɓar, misali, [Laburare na] akan "Sony | Cibiyar Kiɗa." Yayin da ake amfani da aikin Stereo Pair ko aikin Party Connect, lasifikar ba ta da ikon fitar da kiɗan da ke kunnawa akan na'urar da aka haɗa zuwa jack ɗin AUDIO IN ta kebul na sauti. Yayin da lasifikar ke cikin yanayin AUDIO IN, zaku iya saita shi don aikin Stereo Pair ko aikin Party Connect tare da "Sony | Cibiyar Kiɗa". Duk da haka, bayan kammala saitin, ana sanya lasifikar ta atomatik cikin yanayin BLUETOOTH. Lokacin haɗa na'urar sauti mai ɗaukuwa zuwa jack ɗin AUDIO IN kuma kuna kunna kiɗa, ba za ku iya amfani da maɓallan da ke kan lasifikar don yin ayyuka kamar dakatarwa ba, tsallake zuwa farkon waƙar ta gaba, sannan ku tsallake zuwa farkon waƙar da ke yanzu. Kada ku yi amfani da jack ɗin AUDIO IN a wuraren da mai magana zai iya zubar da ruwa a kai. Kayan haɗin da aka bayar da kuma jack da tashoshin jiragen ruwa (USB/AUDIO IN) a bayan murfin ba a tsara su don hana ruwa shiga ko kuma don hana ƙura shiga ba. Tabbatar kun rufe murfin gaba ɗaya bayan cire kebul ɗin sauti daga lasifikar. Murfin yana taka muhimmiyar rawa wajen kula da aikin hana ruwa shiga da ƙura <TECH>. translation.en: 29 Smruti R. Sarangi Interconnection element Control unit Branch Memory unit unit Fetch Immediate Register unit and branch flags write unit unit Data ALU memory op2 Unit Instruction Register memory file op1 Instruction Operand fetch and Execute stage Memory access Register write-back fetch stage decode stage stage stage Figure2.2: AsimpleRISCprocessor(adaptedfrom [Sarangi, 2015]). Notethefivestagesinthedesign. The design has been purposefully simplified and a lot of the complex aspects of the processor have not been shown. Note the vertical rectangular boxes between stages. These are interconnection elements, where signals and values from the left stage move to components in the right stage. have been written to the register file. We shall refer to such a processor as a single-cycle processor henceforth. Let us summarize our discussion by taking a look at Figure 2.2. Figure2.2showsthedesignofasingle-cycleRISCprocessor. Thefetchstagereadsintheinstruction from the instruction memory. Subsequently, this is sent to the decode stage via an interconnection element, which in this case is essentially a set of copper wires and multiplexers that connects a set of sources in the left stage to a set of destinations in the right stage (vertical rectangle in the figure). In the second stage (decode and operand fetch), we compute the control signals, the values of immediates (constants) and branch offsets, and read the values of registers. For the second operand in a typical RISCinstruction, thereisachoicebetweenanimmediateandthevaluereadfromaregisterfile. Hence, we need to add a multiplexer in this stage. For a much more detailed discussion the reader can refer to [Sarangi, 2015]. Inthenextstage,whichistheexecutestage,weperformarithmeticandlogicalcomputations,andwe alsocomputetheoutcomeofbranchinstructions. Conditionalbranchinstructionsinmoderninstruction setsareoftenevaluatedonthebasisoftheoutcomeofthelastcompareinstruction. Theresultofthelast compareinstructionisstoredinadedicatedflagsregister. Inaddition,forprocessingreturninstructions, it is necessary to send the value of the return address read from the register file to the branch unit. Subsequently, we forward the instruction to the memory access stage, where we perform a load or a store (if required). The last stage is the register write-back stage where we write to the registers (if we have to). Here, we need to handle the special case of the function call instruction, where we write the value of the next PC (current PC + (cid:104)size of the instruction(cid:105)) to the return address register in the register file. Finally, note the presence of two backward paths: one from the branch unit to the instruction fetch unit, and the other from the register write-back unit to the register file.
translation.ha: 29 Smruti R. Sarangi ɓangaren haɗin kai na sashin sarrafawa na sashin ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya na reshen Samo nan take sashin rajista da tutocin reshe na rukunin rubuta Bayani ALU ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya op2 Umarnin Raka'a Yi rijista fayil ɗin ƙwaƙwalwar ajiya op1 Umarni Opyand deck da aiwatarwa matakin ƙwaƙwalwa Shiga wurin yin rijista rubuta-baya deck matakin matakin fassara Hoto na 2.2: AsimpleRISCprocessor (an daidaita daga [Sarangi, 2015]). Lura da matakai biyar a cikin zane. An sauƙaƙe ƙirar da gangan kuma ba a nuna yawancin ɓangarorin rikitarwa na processor ba. Lura da akwatunan murabba'i masu tsayi tsakanin matakai. Waɗannan abubuwan haɗin kai ne, inda sigina da ƙima daga matakin hagu ke motsawa zuwa abubuwan da ke cikin matakin dama. an rubuta su zuwa fayil ɗin rajista. Za mu kira irin wannan processor a matsayin mai sarrafawa mai zagaye ɗaya daga yanzu. Bari mu taƙaita tattaunawarmu ta hanyar duba Hoto na 2.2. Hoto na 2.2 yana nuna ƙirar tsarin da ke kan zagaye ɗaya na RISCprocessor. Ana ɗaukar mataki karantawa a cikin umarni daga ƙwaƙwalwar umarni. Daga baya, ana aika wannan zuwa matakin warwarewa ta hanyar wani abu na haɗin kai, wanda a wannan yanayin ainihin saitin wayoyi na tagulla ne da masu yawa waɗanda ke haɗa saitin tushe a matakin hagu zuwa saitin wurare a matakin dama (murabba'i mai kusurwa huɗu a cikin hoton). A mataki na biyu (fassarar da ɗaukar operand), muna ƙididdige siginar sarrafawa, ƙimar gaggawa (masu daidaito) da kuma rassa, kuma muna karanta ƙimar rajista. Don aiki na biyu a cikin umarni na RISCinstruction, akwai zaɓi tsakanin animmediateandthevaluereadfromaregisterfayil. Saboda haka, muna buƙatar ƙara multiplexer a wannan matakin. Don tattaunawa mai zurfi mai karatu zai iya komawa zuwa [Sarangi, 2015]. A cikin matakin, wanda shine matakin aiwatarwa, muna yin lissafin tsari da dabaru, kuma muna kuma ƙididdige sakamakon umarnin branchin. Umarnin da ke cikin umarni na zamani sau da yawa ana kimanta su a kan tushen sakamakon kwatancen ƙarshe. Sakamakon kwatancen ƙarshe shine adana alamun da aka ƙayyade. Bugu da ƙari, don sarrafa umarnin dawowa, yana da mahimmanci a aika ƙimar adireshin dawowa karanta daga fayil ɗin rajista zuwa sashin reshe. Daga baya, muna tura umarnin zuwa matakin samun damar ƙwaƙwalwa, inda muke yin kaya ko ajiya (idan ana buƙata). Mataki na ƙarshe shine matakin rubuta rajista inda muke rubutawa zuwa rajista (idan dole ne mu yi). A nan, muna buƙatar mu kula da shari'ar musamman ta umarnin kiran aiki, inda muke rubuta ƙimar PC na gaba (PC + na yanzu (cid:104) girman umarnin (cid:105)) zuwa rajistar adireshin dawowa a cikin fayil ɗin rajista. A ƙarshe, lura da kasancewar hanyoyi biyu na baya: ɗaya daga sashin reshe zuwa sashin ɗaukar umarni, ɗayan kuma daga sashin rubuta rajista zuwa fayil ɗin rajista.

translation.en: Smruti R. Sarangi 322 Software Approach We first start out by creating a call graph of a program. A call graph is created as follows. We run the program in profiling mode, which is defined as a test run of the program before the actual run, where we collect important statistics regarding the program’s execution. These statistics are known as the program’s profile, and this process is known as profiling. In the profiling phase, we create a graph (defined in Section 2.3.2) in which each node represents a function. If function A calls function B, then we add an edge between the nodes representing A and B respectively. Note that it is possible for node A to call different functions across its invocations. One option is to only consider the first invocation of function A; in this case, we do not collect any data for subsequent invocations. Based on this information, we can create a graph of function calls, which is referred to as the call graph. From the call graph, we can create a list of (cid:104)caller,callee(cid:105) function pairs, and write them to a file. Note that if function A calls function B, then A is the caller and B is the callee. Let us explain this process with an example. Consider the set of function invocations shown in Figure7.54(a). TheassociatedcallgraphisshowninFigure7.54(b). Inaddition,welabeltheedgesbased on the order in which the parent function invokes the child functions. For example, in Figure 7.54(a), foo2 is called after foo1, and thus we have labeled the edges to indicate this fact. foo1 1 void foo() { foo1(); 2 foo2 ... foo foo2(); 3 ... foo3 foo3(); ... 4 foo4(); } foo4 (a) (b) Figure 7.54: Example of a call graph Subsequently, we can use a binary instrumentation engine, or even a compiler to generate code that prefetches instructions. The algorithm to insert prefetch statements is as follows. Assume function A callsfunctionB andthenfunctionC. WeinsertprefetchcodeforfunctionB atthebeginningoffunction A. We assume that it will take some time to set up the arguments for B, and then we shall invoke the function. During this time, the memory system can fetch the instructions for function B. After the call instruction that calls function B, we insert prefetch code for function C. Again the logic is the same. We need some time to prepare the arguments for function C after B returns. During this time, the memory system can in parallel prefetch the instructions for C. If after C, we had invoked another function D, then we would have continued the same process. The software approach is effective and is generic. However, it necessitates a profiling run. This is an additional overhead. In addition, it is not necessary that the inputs remain the same for every run
translation.ha: Tsarin Manhajar Smruti R. Sarangi 322 Da farko muna farawa da ƙirƙirar jadawalin kira na wani shiri. An ƙirƙiri jadawalin kira kamar haka. Muna gudanar da shirin a yanayin bayanin martaba, wanda aka ayyana a matsayin gwajin gudanar da shirin kafin ainihin gudu, inda muke tattara mahimman ƙididdiga game da aiwatar da shirin. Waɗannan ƙididdiga an san su da bayanin martaba na shirin, kuma wannan tsari ana kiransa bayanin martaba. A cikin matakin bayanin martaba, muna ƙirƙirar jadawalin jadawali (wanda aka ayyana a Sashe na 2.3.2) wanda kowane kumburi ke wakiltar aiki. Idan aikin A yana kiran aiki B, to muna ƙara gefe tsakanin ƙwayoyin da ke wakiltar A da B bi da bi. Lura cewa yana yiwuwa ga ƙwayoyin A su kira ayyuka daban-daban a cikin kiransa. Zaɓi ɗaya shine kawai a yi la'akari da kiran farko na aikin A; a wannan yanayin, ba mu tattara duk wani bayanan  don kiran da ke gaba ba. Dangane da wannan bayanin , za mu iya ƙirƙirar jadawalin kiran aiki, wanda ake kira jadawalin kira. Daga jadawalin kira, za mu iya ƙirƙirar jerin (cid:104) mai kira, callee(cid:105) nau'ikan ayyuka, sannan mu rubuta su a fayil. Lura cewa idan aikin A yana kira B, to A shine mai kira kuma B shine mai kira. Bari mu bayyana wannan tsari da misali. Yi la'akari da saitin kiran ayyuka da aka nuna a Hoto na 7.54(a). TheassociatedcallgraphisshowninHoto na 7.54(b). Bugu da ƙari, labeltheedges bisa ga tsarin da aikin iyaye ke kira ayyukan yaro. Misali, a Hoto na 7.54(a), ana kiran foo2 bayan foo1, don haka mun yiwa gefuna alama don nuna wannan gaskiyar. foo1 1 void foo() { foo1(); 2 foo2 ... foo foo2(); 3 ... foo3 foo3(); ... 4 foo4(); } foo4 (a) (b) Hoto na 7.54: Misalin jadawalin kira Bayan haka, za mu iya amfani da injin kayan aiki na binary, ko ma mai tarawa don samar da lambar da ke ɗaukar umarni kafin lokaci. Tsarin da za a saka bayanan prefetch kamar haka ne. A ɗauka aikin A kira aikiB sannan aikiC. WeinsertprefetchcodeforfunctionB atthebeginningoffunction A. Muna ɗauka cewa zai ɗauki ɗan lokaci kafin a saita hujjojin B, sannan mu za kira aikin. A wannan lokacin, tsarin ƙwaƙwalwar tsarin zai iya ɗaukar umarnin aikin B. Bayan umarnin kira wanda ke kiran aiki B, za mu saka lambar prefetch don aiki C. Hakanan dabaru iri ɗaya ne. Muna buƙatar ɗan lokaci don shirya hujjojin aikin C bayan B ya dawo. A wannan lokacin, tsarin tsarinƙwaƙwalwa zai iya ɗaukar umarnin C a layi ɗaya. Idan bayan C, mun kira wani aiki D, to da mun ci gaba da wannan tsari. Tsarin software yana da tasiri kuma gabaɗaya ne. Duk da haka, yana buƙatar gudanar da bincike kan bayanan martaba. Wannan ƙarin kuɗi ne. Bugu da ƙari, ba lallai ba ne shigarwar ta kasance iri ɗaya ga kowane gudu

translation.en: 3. Assumptions and dependencies 4. Design and implementation constraints 5. User interfaces 6. Functional requirements 7. User Documentation 1.4 Product Scope ​ ​ This software is useful for tracking data usage and also helpful to users to decide which app is using how much data during a day,a month. It is also helpful to users if some of the apps use high data then it will notify users . Users can also set a data limit of daily usage. It is helpful to know the location of the tower from the user's devices. If towers are near the user’s device and still the speed of connection is not preferable then it will suggest the user to call the company with a number. It will also have a bedtime mode which automatically turns off data at night. It also has an emergency bank that is a data that is preserved from the daily data pack for emergency work . 1.5 References ​ ​ 1> Android material design Guide :- ​ 2> Android Documentation :- ​ 3>Developer Blog :- ​ 4>Android Studio installation :- ​ 2. Overall Description ​ ​ 2.1 Product Perspective ​ ​ Data Tracker application is an application based on android API and It will be implemented on top of the Android core libraries. It uses the android material design library for UI. 2.2 Product Functions ​ ​ ● Data tracker shows user’s data usage. ● Data tracker gives the information of download and upload speed. ● It shows the information of how much data all the apps are using and if one app uses more data then with user’s permission it will block the app. ● Here users can set data limits. ● If towers are near the user’s device and still the speed of connection is not preferable then it will suggest the user to call the company with a number. ● It will also have a bedtime mode which automatically turns off data at night.

Takardun Mai amfani 1.4 Iyakar Samfura ​ Wannan manhaja tana da amfani don bin diddigin amfani da Bayanai kuma tana da amfani ga masu amfani don yanke shawara kan wane app ne ke amfani da adadin Bayanai a rana, wata. Hakanan yana da amfani ga masu amfani idan wasu daga cikin manhajojin suna amfani da babban Bayanai to zai sanar da masu amfani. Masu amfani kuma za su iya saita iyakar Bayanai na amfani da yau da kullun. Yana da taimako a san wurin hasumiyar daga na'urorin mai amfani. Idan hasumiyai suna kusa da na'urar mai amfani kuma har yanzu saurin haɗi bai fi kyau ba to zai ba da shawarar mai amfani ya kira kamfanin da lamba. Hakanan zai sami yanayin lokacin kwanciya wanda ke kashe Bayanai ta atomatik da dare. Haka kuma yana da bankin gaggawa wanda yake da bayanan  wanda aka adana daga fakitin Bayanai na yau da kullun don aikin gaggawa. 1.5 Nassoshi ​ ​ 1> Jagorar ƙirar kayan Android:- ​ 2> Takardun Android:- ​ 3> Blog ɗin Mai Haɓakawa:- ​ 4> Shigar da Android Studio:- ​ 2. Bayani Gabaɗaya ​ 2.1 Ra'ayin Samfura ​ ​ Bayanai Mai Bin Diddigin Manhaja aikace-aikacen  ne bisa Android API kuma za a aiwatar da shi a saman ɗakunan karatu na Android. Yana amfani da ɗakin karatu na ƙirar kayan android don UI. 2.2 Ayyukan Samfura ​ ● Mai bin diddigin Bayanai yana nuna amfani da Bayanai na mai amfani. ● Mai bin diddigin <TECH>Data yana ba da bayanan  na saurin saukewa da lodawa. ● Yana nuna bayanan  na adadin bayanan <TECH> da duk manhajojin ke amfani da su kuma idan manhaja ɗaya ta yi amfani da ƙarin bayanan <TECH> da to da izinin mai amfani da  zai toshe manhajar. ● A nan masu amfani za su iya saita iyakokin <TECH> bayanai. ● Idan hasumiyai suna kusa da na'urar mai amfani da <TECH> kuma har yanzu saurin haɗin ba a fi so ba to zai ba da shawarar mai amfani da <TECH> ya kira kamfanin da lamba. ● Haka kuma zai sami yanayin lokacin kwanciya wanda ke kashe bayanan <TECH> da daddare ta atomatik.
