translation.en: Smruti R. Sarangi 516 • On similar lines, we have two kinds of version management: eager and lazy. – Eager version management implies that we write directly to the memory system. We maintain an undo log. We flush it if the transaction commits, and restore the state upon an abort. With this scheme commits are much faster than aborts. The main problem is maintaining the isolation property, where we need to ensure that other transactions are not able to read the temporary state of a transaction. – Lazy version management requires a redo log. While a transaction is active, all the writes are sent to the redo log. It acts as a temporary cache for the transaction, which the read operations need to check first. In this case, aborts are fast because we just need to discard the redo log; however, commits are slow because the entire contents of the redo log need to be written to the program’s permanent state. 9.7.2 Correctness Conditions Thesamewaywedefinedcorrectnessconditionsforparallelprograms,weneedtodefinesomecorrectness conditions for transactions. There are a few widely used models for transactional correctness. Let us discuss a few of them. Note that in the following subsections, we only discuss correctness models for transactions. We do not discuss the interactions of transactions with non-transactional instructions. These are known as mixed mode accesses, and will be discussed later. Serializability This is a direct import from the world of databases with the same meaning. It states that a parallel execution with transactions should be equivalent to a serial execution with the same set of transactions. In other words, it should be possible to order the transactions in some sequence such that the results of both the executions are the same. In general, it is assumed that the transactions issued by the thread take effect in program order, hence, we shall use this as a necessary property in the definition of serializability. This is like sequential consistency at the level of transactions. Furthermore, the property ofserializabilitydoesnotspecifythebehavioroftransactionalaccesseswithrespecttonon-transactional accesses. Strict Serializability This is an extension of serializability, where we consider the real-time order as well. If transaction TS A created by thread 1 completes before transaction TS (created by thread 2) starts, then the property B of serializability does not say anything about how they should be ordered in the equivalent sequential order. TS can be ordered before TS or vice versa. However, strict serializability says that if TS A B B beginsafterTS completes,thenTS hastobeorderedafterTS inthesequence. IfTS andTS are A B A A B concurrent, which means that they overlap in time, then they can appear in any order in the equivalent sequence. For non-concurrent transactions, this property effectively enforces a real-time order on the transactions. Opacity The main problem with strict serializability can be seen in the following example (see Figure 9.60). Here, we read from two variables x and y. Initially, both of them are initialized to 0. The transaction by thread 2 sets both of them to 5. Now, assume that we have lazy conflict detection (at commit time), and eager version management. If we take a look at the transactions, we can quickly conclude that t1
translation.ha: Smruti R. Sarangi 516 • A kan irin wannan layi, muna da nau'ikan sarrafa sigar guda biyu: himma da kasala. – Gudanar da sigar da ke sha'awar yana nufin cewa muna rubutu kai tsaye zuwa tsarin ƙwaƙwalwar . Muna kula da rajistar sokewa. Muna goge shi idan ciniki ya aikata, kuma muna dawo da yanayin bayan an soke shi. Tare da wannan tsarin aiwatarwa ya fi sauri fiye da sokewa. Babban matsalar ita ce kiyaye kadarar keɓewa, inda muke buƙatar tabbatar da cewa sauran ma'amaloli ba za su iya <TECH>karanta yanayin wucin gadi na ciniki ba. – Gudanar da sigar lalaci yana buƙatar rajistar sakewa. Yayin da ciniki ke aiki, duk rubuce-rubucen ana aika su zuwa rajistar sakewa. Yana aiki azaman ma'ajiyar wucin gadi don ciniki, wanda ayyukan karanta ke buƙatar farko su duba. A wannan yanayin, sokewa suna da sauri saboda kawai muna buƙatar jefar da rajistar sakewa; duk da haka, rajista suna da jinkiri saboda duk abubuwan da ke cikin rajistar sakewa suna buƙatar a rubuta su zuwa yanayin dindindin na shirin. 9.7.2 Sharuɗɗan DaidaitawaHaka kuma mun ayyana sharuɗɗan daidai ga shirye-shiryen da suka yi daidai, muna buƙatar fayyace wasu sharuɗɗan daidai ga ma'amaloli. Akwai wasu samfura da ake amfani da su sosai don daidaiton ma'amala. Bari mu tattauna kaɗan daga cikinsu. Lura cewa a cikin ƙananan sassan da ke ƙasa, muna tattauna samfuran daidaito kawai don ma'amaloli. Ba ma tattauna hulɗar ma'amaloli tare da umarnin da ba na ma'amala ba. Waɗannan an san su da hanyoyin shiga gauraye, kuma za a tattauna su daga baya. Daidaita Jeri Wannan shigo da bayanai ne kai tsaye daga duniyar bayanai masu ma'ana iri ɗaya. Ya bayyana cewa aiwatarwa mai layi ɗaya tare da ma'amaloli ya kamata ya zama daidai da aiwatarwa mai layi tare da saitin ma'amaloli iri ɗaya. A wata ma'anar, ya kamata ya zama mai yiwuwa a tsara ma'amaloli a cikin wani tsari ta yadda sakamakon aiwatarwa biyun suka kasance iri ɗaya. Gabaɗaya, ana ɗauka cewa ma'amaloli da zaren ya bayar za su yi aiki a cikin tsari na shiri, don haka, za mu za mu amfani da wannan a matsayin siffa mai mahimmanci a cikin ma'anar daidaiton jeri. Wannan kamar daidaiton jeri ne a matakin ma'amaloli. Bugu da ƙari, kadarar daidaiton jeri ba ta ƙayyade halayen damar shiga ma'amala tare da girmamawa ga damar shiga ma'amala. Tsananin Serializability Wannan ƙari ne na iya daidaitawa, inda muke la'akari da tsari na ainihin lokaci. Idan ma'amala TS A da aka ƙirƙira ta zare 1 ta kammala kafin ma'amala TS (wanda aka ƙirƙira ta zare 2) ta fara, to kadarar B na iya daidaitawa ba ta faɗi komai game da yadda ya kamata a yi odar su  a cikin tsari mai tsari iri ɗaya ba. Ana iya yin odar TS kafin TS ko akasin haka. Duk da haka, tsananin serializability yana cewa idan TS A B B ya fara bayan TS ya kammala, to TS ya yi sauri ya yi odar bayanTS a cikin waɗannan. Idan TS da TS suna A B A A B a lokaci guda, wanda ke nufin cewa suna haɗuwa a cikin lokaci, to suna iya bayyana a kowane tsari a cikin tsari iri ɗaya. Ga ma'amaloli marasa daidaituwa, wannan kadarar tana aiwatar da tsari na ainihin lokaci akan ma'amaloli yadda ya kamata. Haske Babban matsalar da tsananin serializability ana iya gani a cikin misali mai zuwa (duba Hoto na 9.60). A nan, muna karanta <TECH> daga masu canji guda biyu x da y. Da farko, duka biyun an fara su zuwa 0. Ma'amala ta zare 2 ta sanya duka biyun zuwa 5. Yanzu, ɗauka cewa muna da gano rikice-rikice marasa aiki (a lokacin alƙawari), da kuma kula da sigar da ke sha'awar. Idan muka duba ma'amaloli, za mu iya yanke hukunci da sauri cewa t1

translation.en: 369 Smruti R. Sarangi Important Point 15 If for a given routing protocol ,we can never construct a TG with a cycle, then we cannot have a path in the CDG that has a cycle – this means that the routing protocol is deadlock-free. Avoiding and Recovering from Deadlocks Let us look at methods to handle the issue of deadlocks. There are two important concepts in this field. Deadlock Avoidance or Prevention The first is that we avoid or prevent deadlocks by design3. Thismeansthatwedesigntheroutingprotocolinsuchawaythatdeadlocksdonothappen. Such approachesarealsoknownaspessimisticapproachesbecausewedeliberatelyconstraintherouting protocol to avoid deadlocks. This means that we somehow ensure that in all possible turn graphs that we can create for executions with a given routing protocol, there are no cycles. We sacrifice some performance in this process. Deadlock Recovery The other approach is an optimistic approach. Here we choose the most efficient method of routing and allow deadlocks to happen. If we detect a deadlock, then we initiate a process of recovery. The process of recovery involves either deallocating resources by aborting a packet transmission or allocating some additional temporary storage to deadlocked flits such that they can progress. Let us initially focus on deadlock avoidance mechanisms using specialized routing protocols. Sub- sequently, we shall look at deadlock recovery mechanisms. 8.3.3 Dimension-Ordered Routing Let us consider the simplest class of deadlock-free routing protocols called dimension-ordered routing, the simplest of which is X-Y routing. Consider a mesh of nodes as shown in Figure 8.30. Each node has an x coordinate and a y coordinate. Let us describe the algorithm for routing a message from node A (x ,y ) to node B (x ,y ). 1 1 2 2 Wefirsttraverseinthexdirectionfrom(x ,y )to(x ,y ). Thenwetraverseinthey directionfrom 1 1 2 1 (x ,y ) to (x ,y ). In other words, we always give preference to the x direction over the y direction. 2 1 2 2 Let us evaluate this routing protocol using the three metrics that we have learned: number of links traversed, livelocks, and deadlocks. This algorithm clearly yields the shortest path. We traverse the minimum number of links in both the axes. There is also no potential for a livelock because we never go round and round in circles. We move along the y direction only after we have completed all our moves in the x direction. In each axis, if we take the shortest route to the same row or same column as the destination, we are guaranteed to traverse through the shortest path. Now, let us prove that such a routing strategy is also deadlock-free. Let us prove by contradiction. Assume that there is a deadlock. This means that there must be a cycle in the channel dependence graph (CDG). Let us consider the smallest cycle in the CDG. Since packets are not allowed to make a U-turn, we need to have some channels along the x-axis in the cycle. Let the channels (physical or virtual) be C ...C , where the cycle is C → C → ...C → C . Without loss of generality, let us 1 n 1 2 n 1 assume that C is along the x-axis. Let us visualize the channels as a turn graph (see Figure 8.31). We 1 have annotated each channel node with the number of the channel. 3Sometextsseparatelydefinetheterms: deadlockavoidanceanddeadlockprevention. However,weshallcombinethe conceptsanduseasingleterm–deadlockavoidance.
translation.ha: 369 Smruti R. Sarangi Muhimmin Bayani 15 Idan ga wani tsari na hanya, ba za mu iya gina TG tare da zagayowar ba, to ba za mu iya samun hanya a cikin CDG wanda ke da zagayowar ba - wannan yana nufin cewa tsarin hanya ba shi da iyaka. Gujewa da Farfadowa daga Takaddun Shaida Bari mu dubi hanyoyin magance matsalar takaddun shaida. Akwai muhimman ra'ayoyi guda biyu a wannan fanni. Gujewa ko Rigakafi na Takaddun Shaida Na farko shine mu guji ko hana takaddun shaida ta hanyar ƙira3. Wannan yana nufin cewa mu tsara takaddun shaida na takaddun shaida na takaddun shaida na takaddun shaida. Irin waɗannan hanyoyin kuma ana san su da hanyoyin da ba su dace ba saboda muna danne yarjejeniyar takaddun shaida don guje wa takuddun shaida. Wannan yana nufin cewa muna tabbatar da cewa a cikin duk jadawalin juyawa da za mu iya ƙirƙira don aiwatarwa tare da tsarin hanya, babu takuddun shaida. Muna sadaukar da wasu ayyukan  a cikin wannan tsari. Murmurewa na Takaddun Shaida Ɗayan hanyar hanya ce mai kyau. A nan mun zaɓi hanyar da ta fi inganci ta hanyar amfani da hanyar sadarwa kuma muka bar makullan da ba su da inganci su faru. Idan muka gano makullan da ba su da iyaka, to za mu fara tsarin murmurewa. Tsarin murmurewa ya ƙunshi ko dai mu rarraba albarkatu ta hanyar dakatar da watsa fakiti ko kuma mu ware wasu ƙarin ajiya na ɗan lokaci ga makullan da ba su da iyaka ta yadda za su iya ci gaba. Bari mu fara mai da hankali kan hanyoyin gujewa makullan da ba su da iyaka ta amfani da hanyoyin sadarwa na musamman. Daga baya, za mu za mu duba hanyoyin dawo da makullan da ba su da iyaka. 8.3.3 Hanyar da aka Umarci Girma Bari mu yi la'akari da mafi sauƙi ajin ƙa'idodin hanyoyin sadarwa marasa iyaka waɗanda ake kira hanyar sadarwa mai tsari da girma, mafi sauƙi daga cikinsu shine hanyar sadarwa ta X-Y. Yi la'akari da raga na makullan kamar yadda aka nuna a Hoto na 8.30. Kowane makullan yana da hanyar sadarwa ta x da kuma hanyar sadarwa ta y. Bari mu bayyana tsarin murmurewa don amfani da saƙo daga makullan A (x,y) zuwa makullan B (x,y). 1 1 2 2 Wefirsttraverseinthexdirectionfrom(x,y)zuwa(x,y). Sai mu yi traverseinthey direction daga 1 1 2 1 (x ,y) zuwa (x ,y ). A wata ma'anar, koyaushe muna ba da fifiko ga alkiblar x fiye da alkiblar y. 2 1 2 2 Bari mu kimanta wannan tsarin hanya ta amfani da ma'auni uku da muka koya: adadin hanyoyin da aka ratsa, makullan rayuwa, da makullan mutuwa. Wannan tsarin yana ba da hanya mafi guntu. Muna ratsa mafi ƙarancin adadin hanyoyin haɗi a cikin gatari biyu. Haka kuma babu yuwuwar makullan rayuwa domin ba ma taɓa zagayawa da zagaye a cikin da'ira. Muna tafiya tare da alkiblar y ne kawai bayan mun kammala duk motsinmu a alkiblar x. A kowane axis, idan muka ɗauki hanya mafi guntu zuwa layi ɗaya ko ginshiƙi ɗaya da wurin da za mu je, an tabbatar mana za mu ratsa ta cikin hanya mafi guntu. Yanzu, bari mu tabbatar da cewa irin wannan dabarar hanya ita ma ba ta da makullan mutuwa. Bari mu tabbatar da sabani. A ɗauka cewa akwai makullan mutuwa. Wannan yana nufin cewa dole ne <TECH> ta kasance zagaye a cikin jadawalin dogaro da tashoshi (CDG). Bari mu yi la'akari da ƙaramin zagaye a cikin CDG. Tunda ba a yarda fakiti su yi U-turn ba, muna buƙatar samun wasu tashoshi tare da axis ɗin x a cikin zagayowar. Bari tashoshi (na zahiri ko na kama-da-wane) su zama C ...C, inda zagayowar shine C → C → ...C → C. Ba tare da asarar gabaɗaya ba, bari mu ɗauka cewa C yana kan axis ɗin x. Bari mu yi tunanin tashoshi a matsayin jadawalin juyawa (duba Hoto na 8.31). Mun yi bayanin kowace tashar tare da lambar tashar. 3 Wasu rubutu sun bambanta sharuɗɗan: hana kullewa da hana kullewa. Duk da haka, za mu haɗa ra'ayoyi da amfani azaman lokaci ɗaya - gujewa kullewa.

translation.en: One important component of Pepper Marketing’s business is it’s telemarketing services. Pepper has specialist skills in delivering telemarketing lead generation campaigns specifically in the Information technology industry. These campaign can vary in terms of size and duration. As an example one client in particular Aruba networks has invested continually in services over the many years since Pepper Marketing’s inception, over that time a complicated process has evolved to support all the activities involved in developing a campaign and supplying results to the customer. General sentiment in the organisation is this process could be improved, particularly in how call lists are handled, and the way in which the telemarketer enters data into the system. As Pepper continual aims to increase both quality of delivery and its capabilities, there has been a decision to at least try to drive efficiency around the process by developing further automation and investing in a software module that can support the telemarketing process end to end.
translation.ha: Wani muhimmin sashi na  a fannin kasuwancin <TECH>Pepper Marketing shine ayyukan tallan wayar tarho. Pepper yana da ƙwarewa ta musamman wajen isar da kamfen ɗin samar da tallan wayar tarho musamman a masana'antar fasahar Bayani. Waɗannan kamfen ɗin na iya bambanta dangane da girma da tsawon lokaci. Misali, wani abokin ciniki na musamman hanyoyin sadarwa na Aruba sun saka hannun jari akai-akai a cikin ayyuka tsawon shekaru da yawa tun lokacin da aka kafa <TECH>Pepper Marketing, a cikin wannan lokacin, wani tsari mai rikitarwa ya samo asali don tallafawa duk ayyukan da ke tattare da haɓaka kamfen da samar da sakamako ga abokin ciniki. Ra'ayin gabaɗaya a cikin ƙungiyar shine za a iya inganta wannan tsari, musamman a yadda ake sarrafa jerin kira, da kuma yadda mai tallan wayar ke shigar da bayanai cikin tsarin . Yayin da <TECH>Pepper ke ci gaba da nufin ƙara ingancin isar da kayayyaki da kuma ƙarfinsa, an yanke shawarar aƙalla ƙoƙarin haɓaka inganci a cikin tsarin ta hanyar haɓaka ƙarin sarrafa kansa da saka hannun jari a cikin wani tsarin software wanda zai iya tallafawa tsarin tallan waya daga ƙarshe zuwa ƙarshe.

translation.en: IF ((VEN_TARGET_FLOW - VEN_FLEAK_MEASURED) > 150) THEN VEN_COMMAND_FLOW = VEN_COMMAND_FLOW + (250*(VEN_TARGET_FLOW)/((PEEP setting)+10) * VALVE_COMMAND_COEFF) / 1000 IF ((VEN_TARGET_FLOW - VEN_FLEAK_MEASURED) > 70) THEN VEN_COMMAND_FLOW = VEN_COMMAND_FLOW + (75*(VEN_TARGET_FLOW)/((PEEP setting)+10) * VALVE_COMMAND_COEFF) / 1000 IF((VEN_TARGET_FLOW - VEN_FLEAK_MEASURED) > 0) THEN VEN_COMMAND_FLOW = VEN_COMMAND_FLOW + (15*(VEN_TARGET_FLOW)/((PEEP setting)+10) * VALVE_COMMAND_COEFF) / 1000 Pressure slope corrections: The VALVE_COMMAND_COEFF must be used to apply a correction factor to the breath to breath valve command steps with the following formula: VALVE_COMMAND_COEFF = (PWM_PRESSURE SLOPE / REFERENCE_PWM PRESSURE_SLOPE)*1000. Exhalation valve pressure calibration The valve pressure calibration will control the blower at 40 mb on the INTERNAL PRESSURE sensor and decrease the exhalation valve command from PWM 2672 to 0 with steps of 1 and memorize the PWM commands at 5 mb, 10 mb, 15 mb, 20 mb, 25 mb, 30 mb and 35 mb. The calibration will collect I_REF at PWM 0 for thermal correction. The 5 mb PWM_OFFSET + 200 must be used as the high saturation value (VALVE_COMMAND_MAX) for end exhalation VEN_COMMAND_FLOW. The 10 mb PWM_OFFSET is not used. The 15 mb PWM_OFFSET must be used as the low value for VALVE COMMAND COEFF calculation. The 20 mb PWM_OFFSET must be used as the initialization value (VALVE_COMMAND_INIT) for end exhalation valve command at peeps 2 and 3. The 25 mb PWM_OFFSET must be used as the initialization value (VALVE_COMMAND_INIT) for end exhalation valve command at peeps 4 to 20. The 30 mb PWM_OFFSET must be used as the low saturation value (VALVE_COMMAND_MIN) for end exhalation valve command at peeps 2 and 3. The 35 mb PWM_OFFSET must be used as the low saturation value (VALVE_COMMAND_MIN) for end exhalation valve command at peeps 4 to 20 and must be used for higher value of the VALVE COMMAND COEFF calculation. Thermal correction: VALVE_COMMAND_MIN, VALVE_COMMAND_MAX, VALVE_COMMAND_INIT and VALVE COMMAND COEFF must be thermally corrected with the following formula: THERMAL_CORRECTION_FACTOR = (MEAN_INSP_VALVE_CURRENT – TEMP_CORRECTION_FACTOR_OFFSET) / (I_REF– TEMP_CORRECTION_FACTOR_OFFSET) THERMAL_CORRECTION_FACTOR must be set to off (no impact) if MEAN_INSP_VALVE_CURRENT current is out of 350 to 550 (in mA*10) range. Example of exhalation valve command data during ventilation (valve command not refreshed but equals 0 during inspiration) COVIDIEN TITLE: DOCUMENT NUMBER REV 6135 Gunbarrel Avenue CPU Software Requirements 10037185 AB Boulder, CO 80301 Specification, PB560 SHEET 18 of 204 PROPRIETARY & FOR This document may not be copied, disclosed, or used in whole or in part without the consent of COVIDIEN. © 2014 COVIDIEN All Rights Reserved.

Ba a yi amfani da PWM_OFFSET mai girman 10 mb ba. Dole ne a yi amfani da PWM_OFFSET <TECH> mai girman 15 mb a matsayin ƙaramin ƙima don lissafin VALVE COMMAND COEFF. This may require additional training or hiring of new team members with specific skills or expertise. Moreover, it is important to establish clear communication channels and protocols among the project team members and stakeholders. This can help ensure that everyone is informed about the project status and any changes or updates that may affect the project. Additionally, it is important to consider the need for a change management plan. The student grading system may require changes or updates during the project lifecycle, and it is important to have a process in place to manage these changes effectively. Finally, it is important to establish a project review and evaluation process to ensure that the project is meeting its goals and objectives. This can help identify areas for improvement and can also provide useful insights for future projects. By considering the need for a project steering committee, ensuring that project team members have the necessary skills and expertise, establishing clear communication channels, implementing a change management plan, and establishing a project review and evaluation process, it is possible to develop an effective project organization for the student grading system in Ethiopia. Overall, the project organization for the student grading system should be carefully planned and executed to ensure that the system meets the needs of all stakeholders and complies with legal and regulatory requirements. By assigning clear roles and responsibilities, it is possible to develop a student grading system that is effective, efficient, and aligned with the needs of the educational institutions in Ethiopia. 1.10.3. Team Organization (Composition and Communication plan) Team Organization (Composition and Communication Plan) for Student Grading System: The team organization for a student grading system should be carefully planned to ensure that the project is completed on time, within budget, and meets the needs of all stakeholders. Here are some key considerations for team composition and communication plan:  Project Sponsor: The project sponsor is responsible for providing financial resources for the project and proposing a business case. They establish the project vision and set the project governance guidelines. The project sponsor is also responsible for the project's return on investment and the impact it has on the organization. translation.ha: Tsarin tantance ɗalibai tsarin tantancewa Bugu da ƙari, yana da mahimmanci a tabbatar da cewa membobin ƙungiyar aikin suna da ƙwarewa da ƙwarewa da ake buƙata don yin ayyukansu yadda ya kamata. Wannan na iya buƙatar ƙarin horo ko ɗaukar sabbin membobin ƙungiyar masu ƙwarewa ko ƙwarewa ta musamman. Bugu da ƙari, yana da mahimmanci a kafa hanyoyin sadarwa masu kyau da ƙa'idodi tsakanin membobin ƙungiyar aikin da masu ruwa da tsaki. Wannan zai iya taimakawa wajen tabbatar da cewa an sanar da kowa game da matsayin aikin da duk wani canji ko sabuntawa da na iya zai iya shafar aikin. Bugu da ƙari, yana da mahimmanci a yi la'akari da buƙatar tsarin gudanar da canji. Tsarin tantance ɗalibai tsarin tantancewa na iya buƙatar canje-canje ko sabuntawa yayin zagayowar rayuwar aikin, kuma yana da mahimmanci a sami tsari don sarrafa waɗannan canje-canje yadda ya kamata. A ƙarshe, yana da mahimmanci a kafa tsarin bita da kimantawa don tabbatar da cewa aikin yana cimma burinsa da manufofinsa. Wannan zai iya taimakawa wajen gano wuraren da za a inganta kuma yana iya samar da fahimta mai amfani ga ayyukan nan gaba. Ta hanyar la'akari da buƙatar kwamitin gudanarwa na ayyuka, tabbatar da cewa membobin ƙungiyar ayyuka suna da ƙwarewa da ƙwarewa da ake buƙata, kafa hanyoyin sadarwa masu haske, aiwatar da tsarin gudanar da canje-canje, da kuma kafa tsarin bita da kimantawa na aiki, yana yiwuwa a samar da ingantaccen tsarin aiki don tsarin tantancewa na ɗalibai na 'TECH' a Habasha. Gabaɗaya, ya kamata a tsara tsarin tantancewa na ɗalibai na 'TECH' a hankali kuma a aiwatar da shi don tabbatar da cewa tsarin tantancewa na ɗalibai na 'TECH' ya cika buƙatun duk masu ruwa da tsaki kuma ya bi ƙa'idodin doka da ƙa'idoji. Ta hanyar ba da ayyuka da nauyi bayyanannu, yana yiwuwa a haɓaka tsarin tantancewa na ɗalibai na 'TECH' wanda yake da tasiri, inganci, kuma ya dace da buƙatun cibiyoyin ilimi a Habasha. 1.10.3. Tsarin Ƙungiya (Tsarin Taro da Sadarwa) Tsarin Ƙungiya (Tsarin Taro da Sadarwa) don tantancewa na ɗalibai na 'TECH': Ya kamata a tsara tsarin tantancewa na ɗalibai na 'TECH' a hankali don tabbatar da cewa an kammala aikin akan lokaci, a cikin kasafin kuɗi, kuma ya cika buƙatun duk masu ruwa da tsaki. Ga wasu muhimman abubuwan da za a yi la'akari da su game da tsarin ƙungiya da kuma tsarin sadarwa:  Mai Tallafawa Aiki: Mai tallafawa aikin yana da alhakin samar da albarkatun kuɗi don aikin da kuma gabatar da shari'ar kasuwanci. Suna kafa hangen nesa na aikin kuma suna tsara jagororin gudanar da aikin. Mai tallafawa aikin kuma yana da alhakin dawo da jarin aikin da tasirin da yake da shi ga ƙungiyar. Mai tallafawa aikin ya kamataya yi magana akai-akai da manajan aikin don tabbatar da cewa aikin yana kan hanya kuma ya cika manufofin aikin  Manajan Aiki: Manajan aikin yana da alhakin kula da ayyukan aikin yau da kullun da kuma tabbatar da cewa an kammala aikin akan lokaci, a cikin kasafin kuɗi, kuma ya cika

translation.en: TutorFlow 3.2.3 Scheduling Subsystem FR# Name (Goal Use case) Role Player Description FR01 View available time slots All users The system should integrate the schedule of tutors and students to present the available time slots for them to choose tutorial sessions. FR02 Book a session Students, Students can book tutorial Parents, sessions based on available time Admin slots. FR03 Cancel a session All users After session confirmation, users can apply for session cancellation with explanations, and the system would notify the counter party for their acceptance. FR04 Reschedule a session All users Users can reschedule their sessions based on available time slots, and the system would notify the counter party. FR05 Set availability All users Users can update their available time slots, and the system will warn them of the possible changes on tutorial sessions required after that change. FR06 Send reminder All users Users can send reminder notifications notifications to each other in relation to session start time, tutorial exercise, etc. FR07 Add option to sync with All users Users can synchronize their external calendars schedule of the platform with their external calendars to avoid time conflicts. FR08 View session history All users Users can review the session history of each other, such as number of session reschedulings and session cancellations..

translation.en: Recommendations Through Case Studies MODULE - 10A Local Area Planning the city every year. The rapid growth of industries, trade and commerce worked as gravitational pull for the labour from neighbouring districts of Uttar Pradesh. According to an estimate about 76.27 percent population of the Kanpur City lived in the congested part of the city centre. Field survey of a slum locality (Kanpur metropolis) was undertaken at two Notes successive steps. The first step was based on total survey of slum dwellings (in Bansmandi, Darshanpurwa and Chamanganj area) with regard to sanitation, health conditions and provisions of public utilities. The second step related to sample survey of households (25) randomly selected from slum localities in inner, middle and outer zones of the city. This survey deals with population size, living space, employment and income of the households. Population Structure And Household Size On an average, a household in a slum area occupied a living space of about 10 to 15 square metres only. The density of population ranges between 3000 to 4000 persons per hectare in most of the slum localities in Kanpur. There is a contiguous belt of residential areas surrounded by central commercial core and industrial pockets of the city. Housing blocks are usually double or triple storeyed and are separated by narrow lanes or by lanes. The over all outlook of slum localities presents most unhygienic conditions for human habitat. According to 2001 census of India, Kanpur city recorded a total slum population of 3,68,808 persons. Slum localities are mostly segregated areas in terms of social composition. It is observed that a slum locality is predominantely occupied by one type of social group (Hindu or Muslim in this case). Further, within each social group a slum locality could be dominated by a caste group or people migrated from specific area. Functionally, a slum locality represents, by and large, the same economic profession and economic levels. Most of the slum dwellers are economically poor. The average household size is 6.1 However, one could notice small and medium, ranging between 1-5 persons; large ranging 6-11 persons and very large with 12 or more persons. The survey of households conducted in a slum locality revealed 38.4 percent as small and medium sized, 54.7 percent large sized and 6.9 percent very large families. Occupational Structure The study reveals that 46.4 percent households were employed in professional services plumbing, masonary works etc., 32.8 percent assistants in business and commerce, 18.12 percent were daily wage unskilled labour and 1.8 percent were unemployed job seekers. In terms of sectoral employment, about 46.9 percent workers are engaged in informal sector. GEOGRAPHY 67
translation.ha: Shawarwari Ta Hanyar Nazarin Shari'o'i MASU KARATU - 10A Yankin Gida Tsarin birnin kowace shekara. Saurin ci gaban masana'antu, kasuwanci da kasuwanci ya yi aiki a matsayin jan hankali ga ma'aikata daga gundumomin da ke makwabtaka da Uttar Pradesh. A cewar kiyasin kimanin kashi 76.27 cikin 100 na yawan jama'ar birnin Kanpur suna zaune ne a yankin da ke cike da cunkoso na tsakiyar birnin. An gudanar da binciken fili na yankin marasa galihu (birnin Kanpur) a matakai biyu a jere. Mataki na farko ya dogara ne akan jimillar binciken gidajen marasa galihu (a Bansmandi, Darshanpurwa da yankin Chamanganj) dangane da tsafta, yanayin lafiya da kuma tanade-tanaden kayayyakin more rayuwa na jama'a. Mataki na biyu ya shafi binciken samfur na gidaje (25) da aka zaɓa ba zato ba tsammani daga yankunan marasa galihu a yankuna na ciki, tsakiya da waje na birnin. Wannan binciken yana magana ne game da girman jama'a, sararin zama, aiki da kudin shiga na gidaje. Tsarin Jama'a da Girman Gidaje A matsakaici, gida a yankin marasa galihu yana zaune ne a wani yanki mai fadin murabba'in mita 10 zuwa 15 kawai. Yawan jama'a ya kama daga mutane 3000 zuwa 4000 a kowace kadada a mafi yawan yankunan talakawa a Kanpur. Akwai yankunan zama da ke kewaye da tsakiyar tsakiyar kasuwanci da yankunan masana'antu na birnin. Gidajen yawanci suna da hawa biyu ko uku kuma an raba su da ƙananan hanyoyi ko hanyoyi. Yanayin yankunan talakawa yana gabatar da mafi yawan yanayin rashin tsafta ga mazaunin ɗan adam. A cewar ƙidayar jama'a ta 2001 a Indiya, birnin Kanpur ya sami jimillar mutane 3,68,808. Yankunan talakawa galibi yankuna ne da aka ware dangane da tsarin zamantakewa. An lura cewa yankin talakawa galibi yana da rinjaye a cikin wani nau'in ƙungiyar zamantakewa (Hindu ko Musulmi a wannan yanayin). Bugu da ƙari, a cikin kowace ƙungiyar zamantakewa, yankin talakawa na iya mamaye ta hanyar ƙungiyar ƙabila ko mutanen da suka yi ƙaura daga wani yanki. A zahiri, yankin talakawa yana wakiltar, gabaɗaya, sana'ar tattalin arziki da matakan tattalin arziki iri ɗaya. Yawancin mazauna unguwannin talakawa matalauta ne. Matsakaicin girman gidaje shine 6.1 Duk da haka, ana iya lura da ƙanana da matsakaita, tsakanin mutane 1-5; manya tsakanin mutane 6-11 da manya sosai tare da mutane 12 ko fiye. Binciken gidaje da aka gudanar a unguwannin talakawa ya nuna kashi 38.4 cikin ɗari a matsayin ƙanana da matsakaitan gidaje, kashi 54.7 cikin ɗari manyan gidaje da kashi 6.9 cikin ɗari manyan gidaje. Tsarin Sana'o'i Binciken ya nuna cewa kashi 46.4 cikin ɗari gidaje suna aiki a fannin ayyukan famfo na ƙwararru, ayyukan gini da sauransu, kashi 32.8 cikin ɗari mataimaka a kasuwanci da kasuwanci, kashi 18.12 cikin ɗari ma'aikata ne marasa ƙwarewa a fannin albashi na yau da kullun, kuma kashi 1.8 cikin ɗari ba su da aikin yi. Dangane da aikin yi na sassa, kusan kashi 46.9 cikin ɗari ma'aikata suna aiki a ɓangaren da ba na yau da kullun ba. GEOGRAPHY 67

translation.en: SE-2002 Software Requirements & Design Specifications Version: 1.0 Use-Case The use case describes the event of an account holder depositing Description: money in his/her bank account. Primary Actor: Account-Holder Other Actors: • Gmail • Database Stakeholders: • Account-Holder • Bank • Gmail • Database Relationships: Preconditions: The user should have an account in the bank. Flow of Events: 1. The user will log-in in his/her account. 2. The system will validate the user account number and password and will give access to the account page. 3. The user will go the deposit page. 4. The user will enter his/her account number and the money to deposit. 5. The user will click on deposit button. 6. The system will verify details and update his/her balance. 7. An email is sent to the user about the money deposit and current balance. Alternative and Alt-2: If the user has not provided the correct ID or Password. The Exceptional user is notified of the discrepancy and prompted to re-enter (ID, Flow Password). Alt-4: If the user enters any wrong information, then he/she will be notified of the discrepancy and prompted to fill in all the fields or invalid information. Alt-6: If the details are not verified then, ask user to re-enter the details. Postconditions: T he account balance is updated in the database. 4.2.4. Withdraw Money P a g e 12 | 1

translation.en: E-Commerce Management System SRS January 2025 Actors • user: Represents a general customer interacting with the system. • Actor1 & Actor2: These are likely placeholders for more specific user roles or external systems that interact with the E-commerce system. Their exact nature isn’t defined in the diagram. • admin: Represents the administrator of the system, with elevated privileges. Use Cases (System Functionalities) User-Related Use Cases • login: Allows a user to log in to the system. • register: Allows a user to create a new account. • logout: Allows a user to log out of the system. • Browse products: Allows a user to browse the product catalog. • Add products to cart: Allows a user to add selected products to their shopping cart. • view cart: Allows a user to view the contents of their shopping cart. • checkoutandmakepayment: Allowsausertoproceedwiththecheckoutprocess and make a payment for their order. • set address: Allows a user to specify or update their shipping address. • Track orders: Allows a user to track the status of their orders. • cancel order: Allows a user to cancel an order (likely with certain restrictions). Admin-Related Use Cases • manage orders: Allows the administrator to manage and process orders (e.g., view, update, ship). • view reports: Allows the administrator to generate and view various reports related to sales, customers, etc. • manage customer accounts: Allows the administrator to manage customer ac- counts (e.g., create, update, delete). • manage product catalog: Allows the administrator to manage the product cat- alog (e.g., add, update, remove products). • update inventory levels: Allows the administrator to update the inventory levels of products. Page 11

translation.en: 63 Smruti R. Sarangi 1 2 3 31 32 Cache lines Figure 3.2: Accessing instruction bytes across two cache lines Hence, wehavetoaccountforthiscase. Ifthebranchisnottakenthenourproblemissolved. Abranch that is not taken is equivalent to a nop (instruction that does not do anything). The problem is that we do not know if a branch will be taken or not at the time of fetching the instruction. Assume that out of four instructions, the second instruction is a taken branch, and it is the only branch in this set of four instructions. In this case, the third and fourth instructions need to fetched from a different cache line. Figure 3.3 shows this situation. Instructions i Cache lines j Figure 3.3: A taken branch in the middle of a 4-instruction sequence In Figure 3.3, we see that we need to fetch the first and second instructions from cache line i, and the remaining two instructions from cache line j. Since we can fetch bytes only at the granularity of cachelines,weneedtofetchlineiandlinej fromthei-cacheandpicktheappropriateinstructionsfrom them. There are some timing issues here. At any point of time, we know the address stored in the PC. Thus, we know about cache line i. There are several things that we do not know. Let us list them out: 1. We do not know which instructions in cache line i are branches. We have not had a chance to decode them. 2. We do not know if branches in line i (if there are any) are taken or not. 3. We do not know anything about the targets of the taken branches. Given the fact that we do not know these important details before fetching the contents of cache line i, the processor would not know about line j, which contains the target instructions of a branch in line i. As a result with our current knowledge we can only design a processor that needs to work with only the instructions in line i. Since in the example we are considering, two instructions are there in line i, the maximum number of instructions that can be supplied to the remaining stages of the pipeline is two. We are thus not able to supply four instructions to the rest of the pipeline as we had originally intended to. The instruction throughput for this cycle is effectively reduced to 50% of the maximum value (4 instructions per cycle).
translation.ha: 63 Smruti R. Sarangi 1 2 3 31 32 Layukan Cache Hoto na 3.2: Samun damar shiga baiti na umarni a kan layukan cache guda biyu Saboda haka, dole ne mu yi la'akari da wannan lamarin. Idan ba a ɗauki rassan ba sannan aka warware matsalarmu. Reshe wanda ba a ɗauka ba daidai yake da nop (umarnin da ba ya yin komai). Matsalar ita ce ba mu san ko za a ɗauki reshe ko a'a a lokacin ɗaukar umarnin ba. A ɗauka cewa daga cikin umarni huɗu, umarni na biyu reshe ne da aka ɗauka, kuma shine reshe ɗaya tilo a cikin wannan saitin umarni huɗu. A wannan yanayin, umarni na uku da na huɗu suna buƙatar a ɗauko su daga layin cache daban. Hoto na 3.3 yana nuna wannan yanayin. Umarni i Layukan Cache j Hoto na 3.3: Reshe da aka ɗauka a tsakiyar jerin umarni 4 A cikin Hoto na 3.3, mun ga cewa muna buƙatar ɗaukar umarni na farko da na biyu daga layin cache i, da sauran umarni biyu daga layin cache j. Tunda za mu iya ɗaukar baiti ne kawai a kan girman layin cache, muna buƙatar ɗaukar layi da layi daga cache ɗin kuma mu zaɓi umarnin da ya dace daga gare su. Akwai wasu matsalolin lokaci a nan. A kowane lokaci, mun san adireshin da aka adana a cikin PC. Don haka, mun san game da layin cache i. Akwai abubuwa da yawa da ba mu sani ba. Bari mu lissafa su: 1. Ba mu san waɗanne umarni a layin cache i rassan ba ne. Ba mu sami damar fassara su ba. 2. Ba mu san ko an ɗauki rassan da ke layi i (idan akwai) ko a'a ba. 3. Ba mu san komai game da maƙasudin rassan da aka ɗauka ba. Ganin cewa ba mu san waɗannan muhimman bayanai ba kafin mu ɗauki abubuwan da ke cikin layin cache i, mai sarrafawa ba zai san game da layin j ba, wanda ya ƙunshi umarnin manufa na reshe a layi i. Sakamakon haka, tare da iliminmu na yanzu, za mu iya tsara mai sarrafawa ne kawai wanda ke buƙatar aiki da umarnin da ke layi i kawai. Tunda a cikin misalin da muke la'akari da shi, umarni guda biyu suna nan a layi na i, matsakaicin adadin umarni da za a iya bayarwa ga sauran matakan bututun shine biyu. Don haka ba za mu iya samar da umarni guda huɗu ga sauran bututun ba kamar yadda muka yi niyya a farko. An rage yawan umarnin wannan zagayen zuwa kashi 50% na matsakaicin ƙimar (umarni 4 a kowane zagaye).

translation.en: Requirements Functional requirements 1 Sales: 1.1 Selling Medicine: 1.1.1 The system should allow employees to record sales transactions, including details such as customer information, medicine name, quantity sold, and unit price. 1.1.2 Integration with a barcode scanner or manual entry should be supported for efficient sales processes. 1.2 Inventory Management: 1.2.1 The system should automatically update the available quantity of each medicine after a sale is completed ensuring real-time inventory tracking. 1.2.2 Notifications should be generated when the stock of a particular medicine falls below a predefined threshold. 1.3 Sales Performance Tracking: 1.3.1 The system should provide tools for tracking and analyzing sales performance, including metrics such as total sales, top-selling medicines, and sales trends over time. 2 Purchase: 2.1 Buying Medicine from Distributors: 2.1.1 Employees should be able to create purchase orders for medicines from authorized distributors, specifying details like quantity, and expiration dates. 2.2 Inventory increase: 2.2.1 The system should automatically update the available quantity of each purchased medicine, reflecting the increase in stock. 3 Reports: 3.1 Sales Reports: 3.1.1 The system should generate detailed reports on sales activities, including daily, weekly, and monthly summaries, as well as custom date ranges. 3.1.2 Reports should include information on total sales, and top-selling medicines. 3.2 Purchase Reports: 3.2.1 Detailed reports on purchases should be available, displaying information such as total expenditure, and quantities purchased. 2 | Pa ge
translation.ha: Bukatun Aiki 1 Tallace-tallace: 1.1 Sayar da Magunguna: 1.1.1 Tsarin   yakamata ya ba ma'aikata damar rikodin ma'amaloli na tallace-tallace, gami da cikakkun bayanai kamar bayanan abokin ciniki , sunan magani, adadin da aka sayar, da farashin naúrar. 1.1.2 Haɗawa da na'urar daukar hoto ta barcode ko shigar da hannu  yakamata don ingantaccen tsarin tallace-tallace. 1.2 Gudanar da Kayayyaki: 1.2.1 Tsarin   yakamata sabunta ta atomatik adadin da ake da shi na kowane magani bayan siyarwa yana kammala tabbatar da bin diddigin kaya a ainihin lokaci. 1.2.2 Ya kamata a samar da sanarwar  lokacin da hannun wani magani ya faɗi ƙasa da matakin  da aka riga aka ayyana. 1.3 Tallace-tallace Aiki Bin diddigi: 1.3.1 Tsarin   yakamata ya samar da kayan aiki don bin diddigin da kuma nazarin ayyukan tallace-tallace , gami da ma'auni kamar jimlar tallace-tallace, magunguna masu siyarwa mafi girma, da kuma yanayin tallace-tallace akan lokaci. 2 Saya: 2.1 Siyan Magunguna Daga Masu Rarrabawa: 2.1.1 Ma'aikata  yakamata su iya ƙirƙirar odar siyan magunguna daga masu rarrabawa da aka ba izini, suna ƙayyade cikakkun bayanai kamar adadi, da kwanakin ƙarewa. 2.2 Ƙara yawan kaya: 2.2.1 Tsarin   yakamata sabunta adadin da ake da shi na kowace magani da aka saya ta atomatik, yana nuna ƙaruwar hannun jari. 3 Rahotanni: 3.1 Rahotannin Tallace-tallace: 3.1.1 Tsarin   yakamata ya samar da cikakkun rahotanni kan ayyukan tallace-tallace, gami da taƙaitaccen bayani na yau da kullun, mako-mako, da na wata-wata, da kuma jadawalin kwanakin da aka keɓance. 3.1.2 Rahotannin ya kamata su haɗa da bayani kan jimillar tallace-tallace, da magunguna masu sayarwa sosai. 3.2 Rahotannin Siyayya: 3.2.1 Ya kamata rahotannin da ke kan sayayya su kasance a shirye, suna nuna <TECH>bayani kamar jimillar kashe kuɗi, da adadin da aka saya. 2 | Shafi na

translation.en: Student grading system Download button for assignment files. Upload button to submit completed assignments. Sample Code in Python using Tkinter: import tkinter as tk # Login Page def login(): username = username_entry.get() password = password_entry.get() # Perform login verification logic here login_window = tk.Tk() login_window.title("Student Grading System") username_label = tk.Label(login_window, text="Username:") username_label.pack() username_entry = tk.Entry(login_window) username_entry.pack() password_label = tk.Label(login_window, text="Password:") password_label.pack() password_entry = tk.Entry(login_window, show="*") password_entry.pack() login_button = tk.Button(login_window, text="Login", command=login) login_button.pack() # Dashboard dashboard_window = tk.Tk() dashboard_window.title("Dashboard") # Display important information, navigation buttons, etc. # Grades Page grades_window = tk.Tk() grades_window.title("Grades") # Display grades table or list, filter/sort options, etc. # Assignments Page assignments_window = tk.Tk() assignments_window.title("Assignments")

translation.en: Software Requirements Specification for E-Farm P a g e | 33 • Customer can submit feedback. • Customer can examine their previous orders and reorder goods from previous orders. • Customer can Track Order. • Customer can order in multiple address. • Customer can earn reward points for purchasing system. • Customer can give reviews and ratings for their product and delivery experience . Key Requirements: Based on the findings from the interviews, the following are the key requirements for E-Farm System : • User-friendly interface with easy navigation. • Ability to search for products. • Product recommendation system. • Filter Products based on category. • Track order • Submit Feedback • Transaction through multiple process. Assumptions: It was assumed during the survey process that the E-Farm system will be accessible via the web and we have to develop an android app for the system. Limitations: Responses were collected less than the expectation. Conclusion: The stakeholders’ questionnaires surveys are provided valuable insights into the requirements for the E-Farm system. The key findings and requirements will be used to develop a comprehensive set of requirements for the system. 5.2.2 Requirement collection -2 This report summarizes the results of the stakeholder interviews conducted to gather requirements for our system. The objective of the interviews was to identify the key needs and expectations of the stakeholders and to use this information to develop a comprehensive set of requirements for the system. Distribute Questionnaires Methodology : The Questionnaires were distributed to stakeholders from various cities and roles. It takes 3-4 minutes to complete the questionnaire. Participants : A total of 13-14 were interviewed, including: 10-12 farmers

translation.en: Land, Soil and Vegetation Resources in India MODULE - 7 Natural Resource and their to 142.4 million hectares in 1990-91. Only 14% of the net sown area or 41.7 development in India million hectares produced two or more crops in 90-91. Surprisingly, only 5% of the land is under permanent pastures and grazing in a country with the largest bovine population of the world. Land under non-agricultural use has increased with the accelerated growth in economy. The process of industrialisation and urbanisation demands more land under roads, railways, airports, human settlements and industries not excluding huge multi-purpose dams. Essentially, on the limited Notes total area all the cultural uses of land must be accommodated. Obviously, it can be realised mainly at the cost of land under agriculture. In 1950-51, the total area under non-agricultural use was 9.3 million hectares which increased to 21.2 million hectares in 1990-91. Contrary to general belief, the percentage of land under forest is one of the lowest in the world. Forests occupy not more than 22% of the total geographical area of the country, while the world average is 30%. According to land use statistics, area under forests has increased from 40 million hectares in 1950-51 to 68 million hectares in 1990-91. It is much below the desired national goal of one third of the total area. Thus, land use is a dynamic process. It changes over time due to a number of factors, including increasing population, changes in cropping system and technology. As the various sectors of the economy develop, there may be a shift in the pattern of land use. However, the bulk of the land continues to be used for raising crops. With unabated population growth, the pressure of population on arable land is bound to grow. Indeed, it should be a matter of great national concern. 20.3 LAND PROBLEMS Out of the total land area, as many as 175 million hectares suffer from degradation. Land degradation is caused largely by soil erosion, but also by water logging and excessive salinity. The most serious threat to the soil is posed by deforestation. Heavy railfall during monsoon damages the soils. Steep slopes encourage rapid runoff leading to soil erosion especially on the southern slopes of the Himalayas and the western slopes of the Western Ghats. Major portions of the Himalayas are prone to landslides and erosion. Wind erosion is prevalent in Rajasthan, gully erosion in Chambal Valley, Chotanagpur, Gujarat, Submontane Punjab Himalaya. Water logging and salinisation which constitute the second major threat to soil have already consumed 13 million hectares and threaten many more. The lands affected are mostly situated in canal irrigated areas. They have suffered because of the absence of adequate drainage. Land is also degraded due to mining operations in many parts of the country. The total land area affected is about 80 thousand hectares by mining. Urban encroachment on good quality agricultural land is another problem by which the amount of land used for agriculture is steadily declining. In other words, there is a tough competition between agriculture, urban and industrial development. There are social conflicts that are arising out of the rights to occupy and transfer of land. The tenant cultivators face major disincentives such as the fear of eviction, the insecurity of tenure, high rents and inadequate surplus to invest. Land ceiling laws have not been implemented with adequate strictness. GEOGRAPHY 91
translation.ha: Albarkatun Ƙasa, Ƙasa da Ganyayyaki a Indiya MUDULE - 7 Albarkatun Ƙasa da kuma hekta miliyan 142.4 a 1990-91. Kashi 14% ne kawai na yankin da aka shuka ko kuma ci gaban 41.7 a Indiya hekta miliyan ya samar da amfanin gona biyu ko fiye a cikin 90-91. Abin mamaki, kashi 5% ne kawai na ƙasar ke ƙarƙashin wuraren kiwo na dindindin a cikin ƙasar da ke da mafi yawan jama'ar dabbobi a duniya. Ƙasa da ba ta amfani da noma ba ta ƙaru tare da saurin ci gaban tattalin arziki. Tsarin masana'antu da birane yana buƙatar ƙarin filaye a ƙarƙashin hanyoyi, layin dogo, filayen jirgin sama, matsugunan mutane da masana'antu ba tare da ban da manyan madatsun ruwa masu amfani da yawa ba. Ainihin, a kan iyakataccen yanki, dole ne a ɗauki dukkan amfanin gona na al'adu  dole ne ya zama dole. Babu shakka, ana iya cimma shi galibi akan farashin ƙasa a ƙarƙashin noma. A cikin 1950-51, jimlar yankin da ba a amfani da shi ba shine hekta miliyan 9.3 wanda ya karu zuwa hekta miliyan 21.2 a 1990-91. Sabanin yadda aka saba gani, kaso na ƙasar da ke ƙarƙashin dazuzzuka yana ɗaya daga cikin mafi ƙasƙanci a duniya. Dazuzzuka suna mamaye ƙasa da kashi 22% na jimlar yankin ƙasar, yayin da matsakaicin duniya shine kashi 30%. A cewar ƙididdigar amfani da ƙasa, yankin da ke ƙarƙashin dazuzzuka ya ƙaru daga hekta miliyan 40 a 1950-51 zuwa hekta miliyan 68 a 1990-91. Ya yi ƙasa da burin ƙasa da ake so na kashi ɗaya bisa uku na jimlar yankin. Don haka, amfani da ƙasa tsari ne mai ƙarfi. Yana canzawa akan lokaci saboda dalilai da dama, ciki har da ƙaruwar yawan jama'a, canje-canje a tsarin amfanin gona na TECH da fasaha. Yayin da sassa daban-daban na tattalin arziki ke bunƙasa, akwai canjin yanayin amfani da ƙasa. Duk da haka, ana ci gaba da amfani da mafi yawan ƙasar don kiwon amfanin gona. Tare da ƙaruwar yawan jama'a ba tare da raguwa ba, matsin lambar jama'a kan ƙasar noma tabbas zai ƙaru. Hakika, ya kamata ya zama babban abin damuwa ga ƙasa. 20.3 MATSALOLIN ƘASA Daga cikin jimlar ƙasar, har zuwa hekta miliyan 175 suna fama da lalacewar ƙasa. Lalacewar ƙasa galibi tana faruwa ne sakamakon zaftarewar ƙasa, amma kuma ta hanyar sare ruwa da yawan gishiri. Babbar barazanar da ke tattare da ƙasa ita ce sare dazuzzuka. Ruwan dogo mai ƙarfi a lokacin damina yana lalata ƙasa. Tsaunukan gangare suna ƙarfafa kwararar ruwa cikin sauri wanda ke haifar da zaizayar ƙasa musamman a kan gangaren kudu na Himalayas da gangaren yamma na Yammacin Ghats. Manyan sassan Himalayas suna da saurin zaftarewar ƙasa da zaizayar ƙasa. Zaftarewar iska ta yi yawa a Rajasthan, zaftarewar ƙasa a kwarin Chambal, Chotanagpur, Gujarat, Submontane Punjab Himalaya. Sashen ruwa da gishiri waɗanda suka zama babbar barazana ta biyu ga ƙasa sun riga sun cinye hekta miliyan 13 kuma suna barazana ga wasu da yawa. Ƙasashen da abin ya shafa galibi suna cikin yankunan da ake ba da ruwa ga magudanar ruwa. Sun sha wahala saboda rashin isasshen magudanar ruwa. Ƙasa kuma ta lalace saboda ayyukan hakar ma'adinai a sassa da yawa na ƙasar. Jimillar ƙasar da abin ya shafa ya kai kusan hekta dubu 80 ta hanyar haƙar ma'adinai. Matsewar birane a kan filayen noma masu inganci wata matsala ce da ke haifar da raguwar yawan filayen da ake amfani da su don noma. A takaice dai, akwai gasa mai tsauri tsakanin noma, ci gaban birane da masana'antu. Akwai rikice-rikicen zamantakewa da ke tasowa sakamakon 'yancin mallaka da canja wurin filaye. Manoman haya suna fuskantar manyan abubuwan da ba su dace ba kamar tsoron korar jama'a, rashin tsaron mallakar gidaje, hauhawar haya da kuma rashin isasshen rarar jari. Ba a aiwatar da dokokin rufin filaye da tsauraran matakai ba. GEOGRAPHY 91

translation.en: API responses are defined in JSON, specified by [RFC 7159]. A JSON object will be the root of every API response. The response document will contain at least one of the following top-level members: Data: the documentÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Ã¢â‚¬Å“primary data,Ã¢â‚¬Â in this case, the response to the clientÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s query. Errors: an array of error objects stating what went wrong with the clientÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s request, should any issues arise. The top-level members specified in R4.1.3.3 will not coexist in the same JSON document. If data is present, errors will be absent and vice versa.
translation.ha: An bayyana amsoshin API a cikin JSON, wanda aka ƙayyade ta [RFC 7159]. Abu na JSON zai zama tushen kowace amsar API. Takardar amsar za ta ƙunshi aƙalla ɗaya daga cikin manyan membobin masu zuwa: Bayani: bayanin daftarin a wannan yanayin, amsar tambayar abokin ciniki. Kurakurai: jerin abubuwan kuskure da ke bayyana abin da ya faru da buƙatar abokin ciniki,  yakamata ya taso kowace matsala. Membobin babban matakin da aka ƙayyade a cikin R4.1.3.3 ba za su kasance tare a cikin takardar JSON ɗaya ba. Idan bayanan <TECH> suna nan, kurakurai ba za su kasance ba kuma akasin haka.

translation.en: - Adequate reactions to the questionnaire response should be developed, in coordination with the help of medical professionals. - The reaction to the questionnaire response should be adequately implemented onto the time management features of the application. - Dietary and fitness plans as they relate to specific responses should be prepared and stored in a database of the application to be readily available to students. - Adequate disclaimers of liability should be put in place given the medical nature of the recommendations under this feature. - Adequate data protection features should be implemented to avoid issues with medical secrecy. - Adequate accommodations should be made to this section of the application for students with disabilities. 3.4 High Level Academic Assistance 3.4.1 Description and Priority of the feature The SSA will be able to provide students with high level assistance with regard to their academic work. This functionality is developed by closely examining the UCD Plagiarism policy and it must be ensured that safeguards are put in place to avoid ethical risks. The idea is that students can use this feature of the application to receive pointers and feedback on their assignments and other academic commitments. Priority - High 3.4.2 Stimulus / Response sequence - In the academic assistance section of the SSA application, the input section will be made available for students to ask questions relating to their academic work. This input may be either written or vocal. - The system will initially process the input via NLP technology and will assess the request in light of constraints that will be set up to avoid ethical and plagiarism risks. - If the request is deemed unethical or risk of resulting in plagiarism, the system will first try to help the student through a generic answer or refuse the request if this is not possible. - If the request falls within the scope of appropriate requests, the system will make use of its integration with ChatGPT to provide the student with assistance in the form of pointers towards the correct solution or appropriate feedback. It must be noted that the design for the system’s assessment of ethical and plagiarism risks will be developed in close connection with UCD personnel to avoid potentially unwanted results. - The application will have access to all the courses and any other academic materials that are uploaded on UCD’s Brightspace, so as to ensure that its replies are as relevant as possible. 3.4.3 Functional Requirements - An input mechanism will have to be created in the relevant section of the application. - An NLP based processing mechanism will have to be put in place to allow the application to process student requests. - A comprehensive assessment system for ethics and plagiarism will have to be developed and implemented in the system, in coordination with UCD personnel. - A tailored ChatGPT integration will have to be set up for this functionality. - A response system will have to be set up, both in written and oral form.
translation.ha: - Ya kamata a samar da isassun martani ga amsar tambayoyin , tare da taimakon kwararrun likitoci. - Ya kamata a aiwatar da martanin martanin tambayoyin <TECH> yadda ya kamata a kan fasalulluka na sarrafa lokaci na aikace-aikacen <TECH>. - Tsarin abinci da motsa jiki kamar yadda suka shafi takamaiman martani  ya kamata a shirya kuma a adana a cikin bayanan <TECH> na aikace-aikacen  don ya kasance cikin sauƙi ga ɗalibai. - Ya kamata a sanya isassun bayanan da suka shafi alhaki  idan aka yi la'akari da yanayin likita na shawarwarin da ke ƙarƙashin wannan fasalin. - Ya kamata a aiwatar da isassun siffofin kariya na Bayanai  don guje wa matsalolin sirrin likita. - Ya kamata a yi isasshen daidaitawa <TECH> ga wannan ɓangaren aikace-aikacen  ga ɗaliban da ke da nakasa. 3.4 Taimakon Ilimi na Babban Mataki 3.4.1 Bayani da Fifikon fasalin SSA za ta iya ba wa ɗalibai taimako mai girma game da aikinsu na ilimi. Ana haɓaka wannan aikin ta hanyar yin nazari sosai kan manufofin UCD na satar fasaha kuma dole ne a tabbatar da cewa an sanya kariya don guje wa haɗarin ɗabi'a. Manufar ita ce ɗalibai za su iya amfani da wannan fasalin aikace-aikacen  don karɓar shawarwari da ra'ayoyi kan ayyukan da suka yi da sauran alƙawarin ilimi. Fifiko - Babban 3.4.2 Jerin abubuwan ƙarfafawa / Amsa - A cikin ɓangaren taimakon ilimi na aikace-aikacen SSA , za a samar da ɓangaren shigarwa ga ɗalibai don yin tambayoyi game da aikinsu na ilimi. Wannan shigarwar na iya ko dai a rubuce ko a murya. - Tsarin  zai fara aiwatar da shigarwar ta hanyar fasahar NLP kuma zai tantance buƙatar bisa la'akari da ƙuntatawa da za a saita don guje wa haɗarin ɗabi'a da satar fasaha. - Idan an ɗauki buƙatar a matsayin rashin ɗabi'a ko haɗarin haifar da satar fasaha, tsarin  zai fara ƙoƙarin taimaka wa ɗalibi ta hanyar amsar gabaɗaya ko ƙin buƙatar idan wannan ba zai yiwu ba. - Idan buƙatar ta kasance cikin iyakokin buƙatun da suka dace, tsarin  zai yi amfani da haɗinsa da ChatGPT don ba wa ɗalibi taimako ta hanyar nuna masa mafita ko ra'ayoyin da suka dace. Dole ne a lura cewa ƙirar kimantawar tsarin <TECH> na haɗarin ɗabi'a da satar bayanai za a haɓaka ta hanyar haɗin gwiwa da ma'aikatan UCD don guje wa sakamakon da ba a so. - Aikace-aikacen <TECH> zai sami damar shiga duk darussan da duk wasu kayan ilimi da aka ɗora a kan Brightspace na UCD, don tabbatar da cewa amsoshinsa sun dace gwargwadon iko. 3.4.3 Bukatun Aiki - Dole ne a ƙirƙiri tsarin shigarwa a cikin sashin da ya dace na aikace-aikacen . - Dole ne a sanya tsarin sarrafawa bisa ga NLP don ba da damar aikace-aikacen  don aiwatar da buƙatun ɗalibai. - Dole ne a haɓaka kuma a aiwatar da cikakken tsarin  don ɗabi'a da satar bayanai a cikin tsarin <TECH>, tare da haɗin gwiwa da ma'aikatan UCD. - Dole ne a saita haɗin ChatGPT da aka tsara don wannan aikin. - Dole ne a saita tsarin martani na <TECH>, duka a rubuce da kuma a baki.

translation.en: Smruti R. Sarangi 564 transitionthathappensbecauseweeitherreceiveacommandfromthememorycontrolleroracommand is generated internally. The dashed arrows indicate a state transition that happens automatically. We first power the device on, reset its state, initialize it, and then reach the Idle state. Along with commands for reading and writing, there are many commands for managing the device. Let us look at them first. Modern DRAMs support two kinds of refresh modes: external refresh and self refresh. An external refresh means that the memory controller sends the REF command to the device, and then it enters the Refreshing state. However, if the CPU is powered down, the DRAM can still maintain its values by using the self refresh mechanism. In this case, it has a built-in timer that generates two commands SRE (self refresh enter) and SRX (self refresh exit). These are used to enter and exit the Self refreshing state, respectively. If there is no activity, we can save power by entering the Power Down state. Before accessing any row, it is necessary to activate it first. The controller sends the ACT command tothedevice,thedeviceactivatesthecorrespondingrowandtransitionstotheBankactivestate. Inthis state, we can also power the device down and transition to the Active power down state upon receiving the PDE command and later exit this state after receiving the PDX command. Forreadingandwriting,therearetwokindsofcommands: onewithoutauto-prechargeandonewith auto-precharge. The former class of commands keep the row open, which means that it is possible for subsequent reads and writes to access columns in the same row. The contents of the row are buffered in the sense amplifiers. In this class, there are two commands: READ and WRITE. Upon receiving them, the state transitions to the Reading and Writing states respectively. After the operations are over, the deviceswitchesbacktotheBank active state. Therowremainsopenforfutureaccesses. IntheWriting state, if the device gets a READ command, it transitions to the Reading state and vice versa. The next set of commands automatically precharge the DRAM array after the commands finish executing. ThesecommandsareREADAandWRITEAforreadingandwriting,respectively. Whenever, the device receives a READA command, it executes the read and also transitions to the Reading-Pre state. It behaves similarly when it receives a WRITEA command: it transitions to the Writing-Pre state along with performing the write. From both of these states, an automatic transition is made to the Precharging state where all the bit lines are precharged, and made ready for a subsequent memory access to another row. From any state, it is possible to enter the Precharging state directly by issuing the PRE (precharge one bank) and PREA (precharge all banks) commands. This state diagram determines the operation of each DRAM device. The memory controller also keeps a copy of the state of each DRAM device and also tracks the transitions. This is done such that the memory controller can issue the right commands at the right instances of time. Next, let us look at the major commands used for controlling and operating DRAM devices, and their associated timing constraints. 10.3.2 Activate and Precharge Commands Activate Command The activate command ACT is used to activate a given row in a bank, read all the columns into the sense amplifiers, and wait for a subsequent read or write access. Note that each row (or page) can be fairly large: 1024 or 2048 bits. Whenever we activate a row, all of this data is brought into the sense amplifiers, and subsequently the column multiplexers choose a subset of the bits. This is thus an expensive operation. The timing parameters associated with the ACT command are shown in Table 10.2. The way to interpret this table is as follows. The first column indicates a pair of events, and the second column shows the minimum time interval between the first event and the second event. The events can either be external commands or internally generated commands. For example, the parameter tRAS refers to the minimum amount of time that needs to elapse between issuing an ACT command and subsequently
translation.ha: Smruti R. Sarangi 564 transitionthathappens domin ko dai muna karɓar umarni daga memorycontrollerora umarni ana samar da shi a ciki. Kibiyoyi masu lanƙwasa suna nuna canjin yanayi wanda ke faruwa ta atomatik. Da farko muna kunna na'urar, sake saita yanayinta, fara ta, sannan mu isa yanayin rashin aiki. Tare da umarni don karatu da rubutu, akwai umarni da yawa don sarrafa na'urar. Bari mu fara duba su. DRAMs na zamani suna tallafawa nau'ikan yanayi biyu na sabuntawa: sabuntawa na waje da sabuntawa na kai. Sabuntawa na waje yana nufin cewa mai sarrafa ƙwaƙwalwa yana aika umarnin REF zuwa na'urar, sannan ya shiga yanayin sabuntawa. Koyaya, idan an kashe CPU, DRAM har yanzu zai iya kiyaye ƙimarsa ta amfani da tsarin sabuntawa na kai. A wannan yanayin, yana da agogon da aka gina a ciki wanda ke samar da umarni biyu SRE (self refresh enter) da SRX (self refresh exit). Ana amfani da waɗannan don shiga da fita yanayin wartsakewa na kai, bi da bi. Idan babu aiki, za mu iya adana wuta ta hanyar shigar da yanayin Power Down. Kafin shiga kowane layi, ya zama dole a fara kunna shi. Mai sarrafawa yana aika umarnin ACT zuwa na'urar, na'urar tana kunna layin da ya dace da kuma canzawa zuwa yanayin Bankactive. A cikin wannan yanayin, za mu iya kunna na'urar kuma mu canza zuwa yanayin saukar da wutar lantarki mai aiki bayan karɓar umarnin PDE sannan daga baya mu fita daga wannan yanayin bayan karɓar umarnin PDX. Don karantawa da rubutu, akwai nau'ikan umarni guda biyu: ɗaya ba tare da caji ta atomatik ba kuma ɗaya tare da caji ta atomatik. Tsohon nau'in umarni yana kiyaye layin a buɗe, wanda ke nufin cewa yana yiwuwa don karantawa da rubutu na gaba don samun damar ginshiƙai a cikin layi ɗaya. Abubuwan da ke cikin layin suna cikin ma'anar amplifiers. A cikin wannan aji, akwai umarni guda biyu: KARA da RUBUTA. Bayan karɓar su, yanayin yana canzawa zuwa yanayin Karatu da Rubutu bi da bi. Bayan an gama ayyukan, na'urorin suna canzawa zuwa yanayin aiki na Bankin. Jerin yana ci gaba da buɗewa don samun damar gaba. A cikin yanayin Rubutu, idan na'urar ta sami umarnin KARA, yana canzawa zuwa yanayin Karatu da akasin haka. Saitin umarni na gaba yana ƙara caji ta atomatik bayan an gama aiwatar da umarnin. Waɗannan umarni sune READA da WRITEA don karantawa da rubutu, bi da bi. Duk lokacin da na'urar ta karɓi umarnin READA, tana aiwatar da karanta kuma tana canzawa zuwa yanayin Reading-Pre. Yana yin aiki iri ɗaya lokacin da ta karɓi umarnin WRITEA: yana canzawa zuwa yanayin Writing-Pre tare da yin rubutun. Daga waɗannan jihohin biyu, ana yin sauyawa ta atomatik zuwa yanayin Precharging inda duk layukan bit ɗin an riga an caji su, kuma an shirya su don samun damar ƙwaƙwalwa zuwa wani layi. Daga kowace jiha, yana yiwuwa a shiga yanayin Precharging kai tsaye ta hanyar bayar da umarnin PRE (precharge banki ɗaya) da PREA (precharge duk bankuna). Wannan zane na jihar yana ƙayyade aikin kowace na'urar DRAM. Mai sarrafa ƙwaƙwalwa kuma yana adana kwafin yanayin kowace na'urar DRAM kuma yana bin diddigin canje-canjen. Ana yin wannan ta yadda mai sarrafa ƙwaƙwalwa zai iya bayar da umarni masu dacewa a lokutan da suka dace. Na gaba, bari mu dubi manyan umarnin da ake amfani da su don sarrafawa da sarrafa na'urorin DRAM, da iyakokin lokaci da suka shafi su. 10.3.2 Kunnawa da Shigar da Umarni Kunna Umarni Ana amfani da umarnin kunnawa ACT don kunna layin da aka bayar a banki, karanta duk ginshiƙai zuwa cikin amplifiers na ji, kuma jira damar shiga karanta ko rubutu. Lura cewa kowane layi (ko shafi) na iya zama babba: rago 1024 ko 2048. Duk lokacin da muka kunna layi, duk waɗannan bayanan  ana shigar da su cikin amplifiers na ji, sannan masu yawan ginshiƙai suna zaɓar wani ɓangare na rago. Don haka wannan aiki ne mai tsada. An nuna sigogin lokaci da ke da alaƙa da umarnin ACT a cikin Tebur 10.2. Yadda ake fassara wannan tebur kamar haka. Ginshiƙi na farko yana nuna abubuwa biyu, kuma ginshiƙi na biyu yana nuna mafi ƙarancin tazara tsakanin taron farko da taron na biyu. Abubuwan da suka faru na iya zama umarni na waje ko umarni na ciki. Misali, sigar tRAS tana nufin mafi ƙarancin lokacin da ke buƙatar wucewa tsakanin bayar da umarnin ACT da kuma daga baya

translation.en: MODULE - 10A Local Area Planning Local Area Planning Constructing tanks, bunds, mini reservoirs for water harvesting, plantations along sloppy tracks and controlled pastoral activities are some of the local initiatives that have improved the quality of environment. 30.10 RESOURCE UTILISATION AND INTERRELATIONSHIPS Notes Resources are all the materials and objects that are ready for use or available as needed by people. Utilisation of resource is a situation in which a commodity in nature is used. These should be balanced utilization of reasources. Resources utilised beyond the critical limit or without replacement leads to imbalances in the ecosystems and ultimately in the environment. Thus the rationale use of resources is of utmost importance. It helps human progress in the long run. A. Types and Utilisation of Resources: Primarily, there are two kinds of resources : non renewable (mineral wealth) which exhaust after bearing utilized once and there is a certain fixed amount of such resources in the world; and renewable resources (fresh water in rivers, oxygen in the atmosphere, the forests and the biological mass), which come from natural processes taking place on the earth and are balanced between annual increase and annual consumption, including the utilisation by human beings. Let us see how the environment influences man and in turn what influence society exerts on the nature. Today there is hardly a place where human beings would not be able to live and work. The effect of human intervention is on the increase in nature. For example while extracting mineral wealth, burning fuel, or irrigating crops in arid lands, we extract certain substances from nature. Similarly, while discharging industrial and agricultural waste and other such by products into the atmosphere and hydrosphere, we introduce new components into the environment. By Farming marshlands or piping water for household and industrial needs, we alter some of the elements of the water balance. The fragile ecosystems like mountains and valley areas are threatened by Felling of trees, road constructions, blasting of rocks and constructing mega dam projects. These activities are responsible for changes in the structure of earth surface and imbalances in the ecological set up. The use of soil resources for crop production, commercial plantation and pastures are eco-friendly activities carried out by human beings. However, unscientific practices of high intensily or cropping or overgrazing leads to soil erosion and becomes a challenge to the ecosystem. Similarly, deforestation, slash and burn cultivation, polluting industries etc. cause ecological as well as environmental crisis. Hence, it is important to understand the local resources and their utilisation in a eco-friendly and sustainable manner failing which ecological crisis will be inevitable. B. Depletion of Resources People have drawn quite a lot through their activities from our natural resources both renewable and non renewable. Some of them are depleted to a large extent 18 GEOGRAPHY
translation.ha: MASU KYAU - Tsarin Yanki na 10A Tsarin Yanki Tsarin Yanki Gina tankuna, ma'adanai, ƙananan ma'adanai don girbin ruwa, gonaki a kan titunan da ba su da kyau da kuma ayyukan kiwo da aka sarrafa wasu daga cikin shirye-shiryen gida ne da suka inganta ingancin muhalli. 30.10 AMFANI DA ALBARKA DA ALAƘA ABINCI Bayani Albarkatu duk kayan aiki ne da abubuwan da aka shirya don amfani ko kuma ake samu kamar yadda mutane ke buƙata. Amfani da albarkatu yanayi ne da ake amfani da kayayyaki a yanayi. Ya kamata a daidaita waɗannan <FASAHA>don amfani da albarkatu. Albarkatun da aka yi amfani da su fiye da iyaka mai mahimmanci ko ba tare da maye gurbinsu ba suna haifar da rashin daidaito a cikin yanayin halittu da kuma a ƙarshe a cikin muhalli. Don haka amfani da albarkatu yana da matuƙar mahimmanci. Yana taimakawa ci gaban ɗan adam a cikin dogon lokaci. A. Nau'o'i da Amfani da Albarkatu: Da farko, akwai nau'ikan albarkatu guda biyu: waɗanda ba a iya sabuntawa ba (dukiyar ma'adinai) waɗanda ke shanyewa bayan an yi amfani da su sau ɗaya kuma akwai takamaiman adadin irin waɗannan albarkatu a duniya; da albarkatun da ake sabuntawa (ruwa mai kyau a cikin koguna, iskar oxygen a cikin sararin samaniya, dazuzzuka da kuma yawan halittu), waɗanda suka fito daga hanyoyin halitta da ke faruwa a duniya kuma suna daidaitawa tsakanin ƙaruwar shekara-shekara da amfani da shekara-shekara, gami da amfani da ɗan adam. Bari mu ga yadda muhalli ke shafar ɗan adam da kuma tasirin da al'umma ke yi a kan yanayi. A yau babu wani wuri da ɗan adam ba zai iya rayuwa da aiki ba. Tasirin shiga tsakani na ɗan adam yana kan ƙaruwar yanayi. Misali yayin da muke fitar da arzikin ma'adinai, ƙona mai, ko ban ruwa a ƙasashe busassu, muna fitar da wasu abubuwa daga yanayi. Hakazalika, yayin da muke fitar da sharar masana'antu da noma da sauran su ta hanyar samfura zuwa yanayi da ruwa, muna gabatar da sabbin abubuwa cikin muhalli. Ta hanyar noman fadama ko ruwan bututu don buƙatun gida da masana'antu, muna canza wasu abubuwan da ke cikin daidaiton ruwa. Tsarin halittu masu rauni kamar tsaunuka da yankunan kwari suna fuskantar barazanar sare bishiyoyi, gina hanyoyi, fashewar duwatsu da gina manyan ayyukan madatsun ruwa. Waɗannan ayyukan suna da alhakin canje-canje a cikin tsarin saman ƙasa da rashin daidaito a cikin tsarin muhalli. Amfani da albarkatun ƙasa don samar da amfanin gona, noma na kasuwanci da wuraren kiwo ayyuka ne masu kyau ga muhalli da ɗan adam ke gudanarwa. Duk da haka, ayyukan da ba na kimiyya ba na yawan noma ko kiwo ko wuce gona da iri suna haifar da zaizayar ƙasa kuma suna zama ƙalubale ga yanayin halittu. Hakazalika, sare dazuzzuka, noma da ƙonawa, gurɓata masana'antu da sauransu suna haifar da matsalar muhalli da muhalli. Saboda haka, yana da mahimmanci a fahimci albarkatun gida da amfani da su ta hanyar da ta dace da muhalli da dorewa, idan ba haka ba, wace matsalar muhalli za ta zama dole. B. Rage Albarkatu Mutane sun jawo hankali sosai ta hanyar ayyukansu daga albarkatun ƙasa, waɗanda ake sabuntawa da waɗanda ba a sabunta su ba. Wasu daga cikinsu sun lalace har zuwa wani lokaci 18 GEOGRAPHY

It ensures data consistency, integrity, and security throughout the application. 17g Persistent Data Management Persistent Data Management refers to the strategy and techniques used to store, retrieve, and manage data that needs to be saved across sessions in the Sports Facility Booking Management System. This ensures that key information, such as user details, booking records, and payment transactions, is consistently available even after the system is restarted. An samar da shi ta atomatik Hoto na 8: Zane na ER Wannan ƙamus na Bayani yana ba da cikakken ma'anar abubuwan bayanai a cikin Gudanar da Rajista a Wurin Wasanni Tsarin, yana tallafawa ƙungiyar fasaha da masu ruwa da tsaki tare da fahimtar buƙatun bayanai. translation.en: 13 ▪ User should be able to see and check the location of food. ▪ A delivery duration should be conducted to be ready as soon as possible and send out. 3.8 Pre-order: Description: This feature allows user to place a Pre-order if they want to pick up food from canteen later by selecting pickup timings. Functional Requirements: ▪ User should be able to Pre-order after logging into application. ▪ The Pre-order button should be provided at the first page of application, so it will be visible for all users. ▪ After selecting the Pre-order button, the user should follow the normal process of ordering foods. ▪ The only difference will be the Pre-order page which will contain different timetable to be selected by the user. ▪ System should provide different time options for pickup corresponding to the canteens availability during that moment. ▪ System should provide a digital receipt with full information of restaurant name, shop address, and order number to the user. ▪ Users can only Pre-order before the 10am for lunch and also before the 4pm for dinner ▪ After the deadline, timetable for the following meal should be closed. ▪ Pre-order process should follow an approval steps to be accepted in the system.
